title: Office Computer Desk Chair, Ergonomic Mid-Back Mesh Rolling Work Swivel Task Chairs with Wheels, Comfortable Lumbar Support, Comfy Arms for Home, Bedroom, Study, Dorm, Student, Adults, Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good quality chair for the price', 'author': 'Chris', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I like this chair.My old chair is one I rescued from a office park dumpster eight years ago and Ive been using it ever since. Well, it finally broke and I decided to give this one a try. I like it. It's easy to assemble and comes with the tools you need. The feet and wheels are metal, as is the hydraulic piston and the controls. The seat cushion is well padded and feels good to sit in for long office days. I was a little worried about the mesh seat back. I was a bit worried that it might be cheap or thin. Easily torn or ripped. I was wrong to worry. The mesh is sturdy and unless you really try to tear it, it should last a long time.Two things to note.Compared to my old chair, this one is very light. lighter than you would expect when looking at the pics. No real negative to this and can be a positive if you're an older person or have back problems. You won't have trouble lifting or moving this chair.Secondly, I replaced the stock wheels that this chair comes with, with a set of roller blade wheels they make for office chairs. Makes it easier to roll through carpets and they worked fine on my old chair. I'm five foot, ten inches tall and with the new wheels on this chair, my feet can't reach the floor at the chairs lowest setting. So if you are a shorter person, you wont be able to use the after market, roller blade type carpet wheels with this chair. Not the chairs fault, and its the correct height with the wheels the chair comes with.Over all, i'm very happy with this chair.Oh, and great lower back support. I have a very bad back.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Workspace Comfort with the SMUG Office Computer Desk Chair', 'author': 'Mark Melrose', 'rating': 5, 'content': "In the modern era of remote work and long hours spent at desks, finding the perfect chair becomes paramount. I got this for my 6 year old to sit at her desk and do homeschool work and it's exactly the right fit, we love it!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars WOW!! what a chair for the money !!', 'author': 'JoeC', 'rating': 5, 'content': "i needed to replace a high back leather office chair that my cat mistook for a scratching post. i didn't want to spend a lot of money so I figured I would give this a try.Assembly is a breeze with everything clearly marked. A very good office chair for the price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My daughter loves this', 'author': 'Hawaiian Tweety', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My kiddo has been spinning around on my bar stool and since it‚Äôs tall it‚Äôs a little dangerous. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing for the price', 'author': 'Cameron', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Given the cheap price, this chair definitely gets 5 stars. Lapides', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I don't usually write reviews, but I really wanted to for this chair (and a desk I purchased too!).I am building desks and chairs for a new office and I have always hated putting chairs together. Usually you have to balance something on something else just to get the screw holes to line up. The engineering usually seems like it was done by someone that's never actually put furniture together -- but not with this chair.It may not sound like a big deal but the ease of assembly made a big difference for me. They look nice and are comfortable, too. Especially for the price. They don't look or feel like a less-expensive chair. Thank you to the people who make these!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Stylish and functional office chair', 'author': 'Caley', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Found this quite easy to assemble and I love the look and feel of this chair. My only wish is that the arm rests were adjustable in height, they're not quite tall enough for my tall frame.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A great choice for a comfortable office chair!', 'author': 'Alfredo E. Gutierrez', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this chair for my wife; she needed one for her office/sewing room. She uses it for her computer as well as when she sews on her sewing machine. She loves it! This is what she said: "As soon as I sit down, I feel comfortable, well-supported both in my back and when I use the arm rests. It is easy to adjust the height, the arm rests can be flipped up so they are out of the way if you need them to be; it glides across the floor nicely when I want to switch between the computer, sewing machine, or the desk. It\'s pretty, and very comfortable. Now I want another one to match for my other desk!"', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great value', 'author': 'Kristin', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Got two of these and they were easy to out together, and are firm but very comfortable. They feel somewhat more expensive than they are. Now to see if they‚Äôll hold up!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Leg Broke Off After 3 Months Back Broke Off After 6 Months', 'author': 'Zak Keith', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'Ok, so I got this back in April. It\'s now July. That\'s three months right? Well that\'s how long it lasted. If you look closely at the product picture there\'s a seam on top of one of the legs. Well that\'s because for whatever reason that leg is the only one that comes detached. Why does it come detached? I couldn\'t tell you. The box it comes in is big enough for it to be a single structure base like it should be.Anyways, during that three months it was an ok chair. Once you get past how terrible the foam padding is. The arm rests are short and the foam is barely a quarter inch thick. The seat has about 2.5 inches of what I can only describe as that basic yellow spongey foam. You bottom out in it pretty fast.The "lumbar support" sits so far back in the chair that it doesn\'t actually do anything unless you force yourself all the way back. And at that point you kinda go past the cushion.The wheels are made out of rubber which is the only thing I\'m going to give them credit for (at least for the thought). They stay out pretty well and don\'t roll out from under you when you go to sit. However, they will pick up literally everything they roll on top of and it\'s pretty gross.Now, on to the leg. I\'m not rough on any of my furniture whatsoever. There\'s not really any good way of sitting in this where it feels stable unlessyou put two legs in like a tripod position in the back. This causes an issue because if the detachable leg ends up in the back it very very quickly becomes an issue. The plastic that the base is made out of is pretty soft and that\'s where the biggest flaw is. Any time you lean back you put pressure on that leg if it\'s in the back. The plastic that it goes into is rather thin but the actual wedge on the leg that slots into the base is solid. Lean back too many times and that plastic flexes, wears out, then splits. A couple days before the leg broke out of the base I was confused why it seemed like it was leaning back and to one side. That should\'ve been my first inkling that it was breaking. When it did break it dumped me backwards out of the chair and onto the floor.My recommendation for them is to make the base one solid base. Don\'t add more failure points than you have to. Literally one of the first rules of design. Adding a detachable leg overcomplicates things. I\'d also recommend that they add a sixth leg to it because really it could\'ve used it. Or at the very least switch the plastic that\'s used and give the detachable leg a little more to slot into. Less than a quarter of an inch for the walls is not enough when the wedge on the leg is solid plastic.Its been 6 months since I bought it. I just had to buy a new chair because the back broke off of it. DO NOT BUYTldr: don\'t buy this. Idk how or why this chair has so many high reviews. Wouldn\'t be surprised if they\'re paid for because while it\'s a cheap chair, it should\'ve lasted much more than 3 months.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Not sturdy - not lasts for 5 months', 'author': 'Luna', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I purchased the white/grey version back in June 2023 due to the good reviews. Although assembly was straightforward, the pieces did not align properly, making it challenging to put the chair together. The chair also was dirty out of the box, indicating it may have been used. I reached out to Neo Chair with images of the dirty sections and they responded very quickly and partially refunded me. Honestly, this chair is pretty good in terms of back support with the lumbar section. The arm and seat cushion are great and I can sit for for hours straight. The wheels and the chair was generally quite squeaky when I moved around, which annoyed me. However, this chair has recently, after 5 months, started to slowly disassemble itself. The chair does not stay at the height that I set it to; after a few hours of sitting on the chair, it would sink to the lowest level. But moreover, the screws are not staying put and three of the screws have fallen out in the last two days, and now the chair is wobbly. For context, I weigh 120 pounds. Honestly, good chair but does not last long.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Reliable and Comfortable', 'author': 'Lena Kahina', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The NEO CHAIR High Back Mesh Chair is a top-notch office chair that excels in comfort, ergonomics, and durability. Its sleek design, adjustable features, and excellent build quality make it a worthwhile investment for anyone seeking a reliable and comfortable seating solution. Whether you spend hours working at a desk or gaming, this chair will undoubtedly enhance your overall sitting experience.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Wonderfully Comfortable Chair', 'author': 'cvnativeinpa', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Suffering from scoliosis, it's difficult to find a chair that fully supports my curved back. When I saw this, I thought I'd give it a try, but I was hesitant. And I wasn't disappointed with the back support. However, there are a few drawbacks:1) The first three wheels were easy to install; the fourth a little difficult and the fifth was an absolute bear. Husband had to take a heat gun and heat the post and then push it in.2) Per the enclosed diagram, the lever to raise and lower the chair is inaccurate. In order to raise the seat, you need to push down on the lever, then stand up slightly.3) Installing the bolts can be tricky so do exactly what the directions say: Leave them loose until just about everything is installed. This way, you can make any adjustments easier. You might need a second person to help; I managed to do this on my own but I could have had another person helping.4) Yes, the chair back comes in a gray color, no matter what color you order (I ordered beige).Positive comments:The instruction booklet is well laid out with clear diagrams. I got a chuckle out of the reference to not get your hand caught when installing the fifth leg; it created a personal touch.The language is easy to understand.Would I buy another? Sure!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Comfy but can‚Äôt lean back', 'author': 'Shopaholic!', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'It took me less than an hour to put this chair together (and I was taking my sweet time). ;-). Definitely very easy to assemble. Although, I did need a second person to assist with installing the seat and back of the chair. This chair is so comfortable however the only drawback (for me) is ‚Ä¶ it does NOT allow me to make any kind of adjustments to be able to lean back (so, you‚Äôre always on an upright position which becomes uncomfortable ‚Äòfor me‚Äô at times). I wish they had mentioned this somewhere in the description (if they did, I totally missed it). Overall, I would give it a 4-star!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Furmax Office Chair Mid Back Swivel Lumbar Support Desk Chair, Computer Ergonomic Mesh Chair with Armrest (Black)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Office Chair for the Price!', 'author': 'Kassandra G.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Admittedly this chair was delivered not even two hours ago, so I can\'t speak much about its long-term comfort or durability but here is what I can tell you about it:1) The most effortless assembly ever! It took me about 30 minutes to put this chair together but I can\'t say for sure because I didn\'t actually time myself and my need for perfectly aligned holes may have lengthened the time significantly. I did it by myself and it was a real snap to do.2) The plastic portions of the chair seem very sturdy and not flimsy like some office chairs I\'ve had in the past. They seem like they will stand up to wear over time but that remains to be seen. The seat cushion is definitely comfier than I expected, it is firm and seems like it can easily snap back into shape after a long day of someone sitting in it.3) The backrest is perfect for me, I have a bad habit of hunching forward because my previous chair had no support or cushioning but then again, I was using a wooden chair. The lower lumbar support is very nice as it keeps me from hunching over at my desk by instead, encouraging me to lean back and give my spine a break. I have the reclining knob set to its furthest capability to help with this.4) This may not be the office chair for tall people or anyone seeking to be higher up but I find it suitable for me. At its highest position, the heels of my feet are less than an inch off the floor and I am only 5\'2" tall, so I guess it will depend on what you are looking for.5) The wheels seem like they will hold up great and while I know this is more of a pet peeve than an actual complaint about the product, I feel it is important people know that this chair DOES NOT move across low-pile carpeting very easily. If you are like me and you have wall-to-wall carpeting you may want to purchase one of those plastic floor mats or replacement wheels designed for carpeting to ensure maximum rolling capability. To me, it doesn\'t matter at this point because I have no real space or need to roll around in my chair except for pure amusement.6) My only REAL complaint about this office chair is the width. I honestly didn\'t think to pay attention to this when purchasing. I am a decently hippy woman, as in, I have some pretty damn wide hips and this chair is a little too narrow in the seat for what I would be comfortable with. This is not to say my booty doesn\'t fit in the chair because it does but oh boy, I can\'t get much wider than I am right now, or else this chair is going to charity. I measured the shortest distance between the front of the two armrests and they are 17-1/2" apart so please take that into consideration if you are a curvy woman like me.OVERALL (TLDR), this is a great chair for the price. Easy assembly, the materials appear durable and up to the task of keeping my butt comfortable on a daily basis. The lumbar support is excellent, the height adjustment is perfect as is the recline mechanism. The only two downsides are that the wheels don\'t glide effortlessly across my carpet and that the armrests are just a little too close for a curvy body type.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 12, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Chair', 'author': 'Bari', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love this chair. I still can't believe how inexpensive it was compared to the same ones in stores like Office Depot and Staples. I'm a 72 year old female with physical issues and I was able to assemble the chair within 40 minutes. Very easy instructions to follow. It's very sturdy and comfortable. I'm very happy with this product.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Comfort and Ergonomics Combined ‚Äì Furmax Mid Back Swivel Office Chair', 'author': 'World Traveler', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Certainly! Here's a sample product review for the Furmax Office Chair Mid Back Swivel Lumbar Support Desk Chair:Title: Comfort and Ergonomics Combined ‚Äì Furmax Mid Back Swivel Office ChairI recently upgraded my office chair to the Furmax Mid Back Swivel Lumbar Support Desk Chair, and I must say it has significantly improved my work-from-home experience. This chair seamlessly combines comfort, style, and ergonomic features.Ergonomic Design (5/5):The ergonomic design of the Furmax office chair is a game-changer for prolonged periods of sitting. The mid-back support and lumbar support provide excellent spine alignment, reducing fatigue and promoting a comfortable sitting posture. The chair is thoughtfully designed to minimize the risk of back strain during long work sessions.Breathable Mesh Material (5/5):The use of breathable mesh material enhances the overall comfort of the chair. It allows for adequate air circulation, preventing heat buildup during extended periods of sitting. The mesh backrest keeps me cool and comfortable, even during warmer days, making it an ideal choice for year-round use.Adjustability (4.5/5):The Furmax office chair offers a decent level of adjustability to cater to individual preferences. The swivel feature, adjustable height, and tilt mechanism provide flexibility for finding the optimal sitting position. While additional adjustments like adjustable armrests could enhance customization, the existing features are effective for most users.Sturdy Construction (5/5):The chair's construction is sturdy and durable. The metal base and quality materials used in its assembly give it a robust feel. The chair feels stable, and the wheels provide smooth mobility across various floor surfaces. The durability of the construction instills confidence in its long-term use.Modern Aesthetic (5/5):The Furmax office chair doesn't compromise on style. Its modern and sleek aesthetic adds a touch of sophistication to my home office. The clean lines and neutral color make it a versatile choice that complements various office decor styles.Easy Assembly (5/5):Putting the Furmax office chair together was a breeze. The assembly instructions were clear, and all the necessary tools were provided. Within a short time, I had a fully functional and stylish office chair ready for use.Lumbar Support (5/5):The lumbar support of this chair is a standout feature. It provides just the right amount of support to the lower back, reducing strain and promoting a healthy sitting posture. The lumbar support is adjustable, allowing me to customize it to my specific comfort needs.Affordability (5/5):Considering the comfort, features, and quality construction, the Furmax Mid Back Swivel Lumbar Support Desk Chair offers excellent value for money. It provides a budget-friendly option for those seeking a reliable and ergonomic office chair without breaking the bank.Conclusion:In conclusion, the Furmax Mid Back Swivel Lumbar Support Desk Chair has exceeded my expectations. Its ergonomic design, breathable mesh material, and sturdy construction make it a top-notch choice for anyone in need of a comfortable and stylish office chair. Whether for work or study, this chair provides the support and functionality necessary for long hours of seated tasks.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great deal', 'author': 'William', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Surprisingly good chair at a very reasonable price. Easy to assemble. Looks good. Sturdy design. A bit narrow but at 5\'10" 170 lbs. it fits me just fine. Will probably add a bit more cushioning but I have no problem recommending it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Not for plus size people‚Ä¶', 'author': 'Sisi Carrington', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I bought this chair for my 15 year old son. He says it‚Äôs ok. But as for me, I could not squeeze my hind parts anywhere near the cushion of this seat! Lol! I am a 250 lbs+ woman and my thighs are not able to fit between the handles. If you‚Äôre a plus size individual u will need to buy an office chair that does not have the arm rests attached to the bottom of the seat as this one does. A smaller individual might enjoy this one.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Customer Service from the Company', 'author': 'Chris', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought this chair and it arrived on time, put it together excitedly b/c I had been without a desk chair for a week or so since my old one had bit the dust and was happy to be back to normal. I had it about two days and one of the castors snapped somewhere on the inside so that the wheel stayed in place but you could no longer put any weight on that particular area or the wheel would not support the chair any longer and you would lean enough to fall out easily if you were not ready to catch yourself. I was well within my return period but did not want to go through the hassle of dismantling, repackaging and sending the chair back, and this was mandatory for both of my return options which were a replacement chair or a refund of my money. So, I reached out to the seller via Amazon with fingers crossed and explained the situation and provided them with some photos of the damage. They responded VERY quickly and agreed to my request to just send me a replacement castor so I could replace the broken one. As I had hoped, they did not just send one castor either but a sleeve of five just like you receive when you purchase a chair initially. They also shipped them out quickly and provided me with tracking information. So with minimal back and forth they were very helpful and efficient with correcting my issue, I appreciate their customer service very much. The chair itself is exactly what you would expect from a $40 chair, it could be more comfortable and ergonomic and this and that but it is now stable, provides decent back support and raises/lowers easily. Plus, I have four extra wheels now in case the overall quality of them proves to be an ongoing issues. I have had the chair over a month now though since I received the replacement wheels and have had no further issues whatsoever.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great product', 'author': 'betty moreno', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Great for the price! Great back support and pretty comfortable for a full work day. üëç", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars It may work well for many - Customer Service is very responsive and helpful!', 'author': 'Thomas J. Keller', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Updated Review:Pros: Easy to put together, rolls well, seems solid, not too heavy, customer service is very responsive.I ordered this based off the reviews as well as the dimensions listed on the picture.First off - the Dimensions on the Picture state the seat cushion is 20.5 inches wide. The chair I received is only 19 inches wide at the widest point any way I measure it. Update: I brought this up to the company and they are supposed to be working with the manufacturer to correct this.There is also a rip in the bottom of the fabric on the seat cushion upon opening the box. The chair was packed well and there was no way it was ripped when opening the box the way the seat cushion was packed. This was definitely a manufacturing defect. I have emailed the company, we will see what they say. - Update: They have fixed this without issue. Customer service was very good!As for comfort - the seat cushion is pretty hard and as NO contour. They emailed back within 24 hours.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars AMAZING', 'author': 'awesome', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I recently purchased this chair for my home office and I must say, I am very pleased with it. The assembly process was also very easy and straightforward, which is always a plus. Overall, I am very happy with my purchase and would highly recommend this chair to anyone in need of a comfortable and functional office chair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars GREAT CHAIR FOR THE PRICE', 'author': 'Vintage_NYer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "What a great chair. title: naspaluro Ergonomic Office Chair, Mid Back Desk Chair with Adjustable Height, Swivel Chair with Flip-Up Arms and Lumbar Support, Breathable Mesh Computer Chair for Home/Study/Working, Dark Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Naspaluro Ergonomic Office Chair: A Comfort Upgrade for My Home Workspace!', 'author': 'David', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently invested in the Naspaluro Ergonomic Office Chair for my home office, and let me tell you, it's been a total game-changer. As someone who spends long hours working at the desk, this chair has transformed my daily grind into a comfy and supportive experience.Pros:Ergonomic Bliss:This chair is a dream for my back. The ergonomic design gives me the right amount of lumbar support, making those long work sessions much more bearable. No more midday backaches ‚Äì hallelujah!Adjustable Heights Galore:I love how I can tweak the height to my liking. Whether I'm sitting at the desk or need a quick break at a slightly higher or lower level, this chair's got my back ‚Äì literally. It's like having a custom-made chair that fits me perfectly.Breathable Comfort:The mesh back is a game-changer, especially during the warmer months. It keeps me cool and comfy, preventing that dreaded sticky feeling you get with some chairs. It's the small details like this that make a big difference.Smooth Swivel Action:The 360-degree swivel is surprisingly satisfying. Need to grab something from the other side of the desk? No problem! The smooth rotation means no awkward stretching or shuffling around, and I can spin in my chair just for fun when I need a quick break.Sturdy and Stylish:This chair doesn‚Äôt just deliver on comfort; it looks good too. The sleek design adds a touch of modernity to my home office setup, and the sturdy build gives me confidence that it's not going to give out on me anytime soon.Cons:Assembly Challenge:Putting it together took a bit longer than expected. The instructions were clear, but it required a bit of patience. Once it was assembled, though, it was worth the effort.Armrests are Fixed:The armrests are fixed, so they don‚Äôt adjust up or down. While they're at a comfortable height for me, those who prefer customizable armrests might find this a bit limiting.In conclusion, the Naspaluro Ergonomic Office Chair is a gem for anyone looking to upgrade their home office comfort. It's not just a chair; it's a thoughtful investment in your well-being. The adjustable features, breathable design, and overall sturdiness make it a winner in my book. If you want to transform your workspace into a haven of comfort without breaking the bank, this chair is a fantastic choice. Highly recommended for anyone seeking an ergonomic chair that's both practical and stylish!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Surprisingly amazing chair!', 'author': 'James F Evans', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'tl;dr: If you need a chair that has the features of this one, then this one is a winner! Hits above its weight class for sure.My wife is 5‚Äô. She‚Äôs small. For whatever reason she ended up with a chair made for big people, like 6+ feet and up to 500lbs type of a chair. She‚Äôd often even sleep on it and chill on it. The chair was big enough to fit 2 of her to be honest. It was an expensive chair that I won at some raffle and didn‚Äôt like myself. Over the years it ripped (got a cover for it) and even started to get lopsided (from the sleeping) and finally a spring broke (hence the pillow on it in the pictures)She obviously lives pink. I also wanted to get a chair where she could work and not end ip asleep on. Not like we have a couch or a bed for that üòÇ.This chair is very obviously smaller than her previous chair, it‚Äôs also significantly cheaper in price and build, it‚Äôs also not as durable feeling or stable, and it‚Äôs just not as padded. Yet somehow it‚Äôs an amazing chair that we both like better than her previous chair???Like it‚Äôs crazy that this chair somehow works better in so many ways. Her desk is modified to be shorter than normal desks (again, she small lol) and her previous chair was just too big. The wheels are also like SUPER smooth, like you can run a chair race easily with it. It rolls over her rug and tucks into her desk (which is in our bedroom) easily. The amount of space this has save us when the chair isn‚Äôt being used is a lot. Previous chair was much bigger and didn‚Äôt tuck in at all.The color is nice and the padding is plenty for a small and much lighter than 500lbs woman. I‚Äôm 6 feet and 200 lbs and the chair is nice for me as well. My chair is bigger and more secure in the backing, which is similar to this one. The lowest tension setting on my chair is still too high for her to lean back on my chair. This chair has a lower tension minimum and she can easily lean back freely, as well as keep enough tension to work without sagging.This chair is surprisingly outstanding! I‚Äôm sure my wife will destroy it quicker than the last one, but it‚Äôs so cheap that even if it only lasts 1-3 years, I‚Äôll happily buy it ones or twice more ü§∑üèΩ\u200d‚ôÄÔ∏è. Maybe by then they‚Äôll invent a comfortable titanium chair that‚Äôs affordable that she won‚Äôt destroy üòÇ.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great customer service', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The first chair was delivered damaged, I contacted customer support and they had a replacement delivered the next day. Easy to work with and effective customer service.The chair itself is great, went together easily and comfy for typical work day usage.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great office chair', 'author': 'CHANGHOON LEE', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The main reason I bought this chair is that I saw this chair is air breathable.It's such a hardship for me sitting in the chair for hours, and I get sweated all over my back.After sitting for hours with this chair, it's really cool compared to the chairs I've been using. I love it!To assemble, it's got all the tools/screws, and comes with the instruction, and it didn't take me long to assemble it. Maybe 15mins?You can adjust the height of the chair very smoothly, and also you can move the side arm parts to the top! I love this, because sometimes the side arm parts bother me.It's pretty comfortable sitting all day, and the price is insane.You can't get any chair for this quality at this price!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars for the girl bosses! excellent chair', 'author': 'Kiana Gash', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I highly recommend buying this chair! I work from home (yktv) and it's pretty light weight, comfortable and easy to assemble chair. It is also decently affordable and delivered to the right address (rural).I enjoy the fact that when rolled, it doesn't make much noise either. the Arm rests are comfortable on the skin and the back support is superb. One of the main reasons I requested a new office chair was the lack of support I had from my previous chair but this one does the trick! Also beautiful pink color but does get dirty right away. Can be cleaned with the shout to-go wipes or with dish soap. I've had it for about 2 months now and my back pain has been alleviated.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good value', 'author': 'danielle', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The media could not be loaded. My husband uses this chair at his desk for work. His old one was too wide and couldn't scoot up close enough to his desk, so he had to lean forward. This one is a much better size; wide enough to sit in comfortably but not so big it doesn't fit at the desk space! It gives nice back support and the back is made of a nice, breathable material. He is able to sit much more ergonomically now.It came well packaged and with everything needed for assembly and well labeled. My 13 year old son put it together in a short time without assistance.It is easy to adjust the height of the chair and I really appreciate that you can swing the arms up or down, or even somewhere in between. There is enough tension that they don't just fall down, so if you needed to tilt them up a little to fit at the desk top, they could be tilted up to accommodate that. I would add a little more padding to the arm rest cushion but that is the only thing I would change.The wheels roll easily and the seat spins very smoothly as you can see in the video. Overall, this chair was a good value and I'm happy with the purchase!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars It is as advertised', 'author': 'Deirdre Davis', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Pros: super easy to put together and comes with all tools, rolls on thick carpet without issue, breathable, not super wideCons: If you are over 200 pounds, this seat is going to be hard! title: NEO CHAIR Office Chair Adjustable Desk Chair Mid Back Executive Comfortable PU Leather Ergonomic Gaming Back Support Home Computer with Flip-up Armrest Swivel Wheels (Ivory)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars love it, definitely best for a shorter to average height person', 'author': 'Kinny', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'A different height and back support from my old desk chair, so at first I kind of hated it. After using it a while, I love it. I am on the shorter and smaller side (5\'3"), so it fits me perfectly. If you\'re a taller person I can imagine this would not work well for you as your shoulders would likely rise above the back support.I bought this for two reasons: Aesthetic and material. I\'m extremely pleased with both.The aesthetic is gorgeous. I wanted the ivory one but was worried about staining and/or discoloration over time, so I settled for the brown-with-white and it\'s still a beautiful chair, I love the look of it. It suits my cottagecore/rustic room better than my old chair.My old chair was black plastic with mesh material as the seat/back, and it got crumbs and hair and all kinds of stuff stuck in it. I wanted a chair with a solid seat that would be easy to clean and that I could rest my legs up on without pressing little hole imprints all over my skin. This chair does that. I realize that\'s not the highest of standards, but despite my low and niche requirements, I do think this chair is WELL worth the money for most people. Despite the cost, the material looks and feels quality and the whole unit is well made and stitched beautifully together. The visible stitching adds to the look, in my opinion. While I wasn\'t expecting much quality for the price, this chair far exceeded my expectations.The back of this chair is not particularly ergonomically supportive, but I didn\'t absolutely need that, and for the price you can easily buy your own separate back-support cushion. The way the seat is designed I imagine most would fit well on it. Despite the lack of back support, it\'s a comfortable chair to sit on for hours. The seat remains cushy and comfortable all day, you don\'t start feeling lumps or hard spots like I have on some other chairs.It was easy to assemble (half hour at most?), instructions were clear. The tilt and height adjustments work perfectly for me. I love this chair and highly recommend for anyone average height or shorter.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great chair! Great company!', 'author': 'Eric Shoemaker', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is a very nice chair. Well built, very comfortable and easy to put together. I put it together during a halftime of a football game. I've been sitting in it for three days now and it's been quite comfortable. Very sturdy and adjustable. A great value!12/02/23Update: I had problems with the control mechanism plate that mounts to the bottom of the chair. Broken weld. I contacted Neo Chair and they were very quick to send replacement plate and adjustable shock after I sent them pics of the damaged part. They were great to work with and stand by their products. I was quite impressed with their concern and fast response on making things correct. A fantastic company to deal with and they have earned a customer for life. I will be buying all my chairs from them from now on and tell all my friends how great Neo Chair is. A welcome surprise for this day and age!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Worth the price', 'author': 'Moises F. Moreno', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I recently purchased the NEO CHAIR Office Chair, and overall, it's a solid addition to my home office. The adjustable features make it comfortable for long work sessions, and the mid-back design provides adequate support. The PU leather adds a touch of elegance, enhancing the overall aesthetic.However, I noticed a minor issue with the chair's stability. It tends to rock slightly when I shift my weight, which can be distracting during intense work moments. Additionally, the arm supports, while comfortable, could be sturdier. There is a noticeable give when pressure is applied, making me cautious about putting too much weight on them.Despite these concerns, the chair's ergonomic design and comfort level earn it a solid four stars. It assembles easily, looks great, and the adjustable features are a definite plus. With a bit of improvement in stability and arm support durability, this NEO CHAIR could easily reach five-star status.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Super easy to put together and very comfortable!', 'author': 'Lexie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This chair was super easy to put together, it took maybe 30 mins, and it looks so high end! The plush faux leather is soft and we have a dog with claws who still has not marred the seat! This is high quality faux leather! The chair itself is lightweight, nicely padded and comfortable, and rolls around with ease!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "3.0 out of 5 stars Decent for the price, but doesn't hold up well", 'author': 'Kaitlyn Arneson', 'rating': 3, 'content': "This chair is easy to assemble and looks high quality out of the box. I love that the armrests can swivel up - which makes it easy to push the chair in and gives more space in my small office. For the first week of use, I would have rated this 4-5 stars. However, I've now had this for almost 1 year and it has not age/worn well. For context, I sit in this chair for around 6 hours per day (every weekday) and am the only person who uses it.1. Out of the box, it's comfortable for around 4 hours of use but doesn't provide much back support. I have pretty decent posture so this didn't really bother me.2. Around 6 months in, I started to notice tears in the fabric. This chair doesn't leave my office and I'm not rough with it. But there are now 2 large tears on the armrests, 1 on the seat, and fraying around many of the seams. I've used a leather repair kit to make due.3. It's no longer very comfortable for more than ~45 min at a time. I find myself needing MANY stretch breaks (compared to when I first used it)Basically, this is great aesthetically but I'd recommend it for a guest room or an office where it's not used regularly.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very Nice Office Chair For A Reasonable Price - Easy To Assemble - Good Product Support', 'author': 'Michael L. Williams', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Very good Product Support - After having this chair for a few weeks, I noticed the top bolt cover on the right arm of the chair would become loose & pop off. I put it back on a few times and it popped off again, and I noticed the bolt it was covering would also become loose and have to be tightened and re-tightened.I contacted support and noticed they got back to me immediately and requested that I send them photos of the problem, so they could assist. After contacting them I noticed that the bolt cover was somehow causing the bolt to become loose when the cover was on, and resolved the problem of the bolt getting loose by leaving the bolt cover off. After leaving the cover off I've noticed the bolt stays tight without any further problem. Wanted to mention this here as a solution for anyone else that may have noticed the same problem.Very pleased with this chair that is a good office chair as well as comfortable to lounge in. For example you can loosen the tilt control which makes it like a rocking chair. Comes with good instructions, good-fitting parts and is quite easy to assemble.I'm not the most mechanically inclined person around but I do my best to put things together if I need to do so, and I will admit that most the time, if it's possible to put something together completely backwards I usually do just that, then curse a lot about how badly the item was made, but with this I found the instructions very straight forward and helpful, and was able to put the chair together correctly the first time without any problems.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Pretty and Comfortable l.', 'author': 'B.T.A.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Packaged very well, pretty easy to put together. Could have used an extra set of hands when attaching top/bottom cushion to arms but got it done.Great chair for the price.Would recommend.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable and easy to assemble! (With 5 month update)', 'author': 'Ceci McClurg', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I'm a 200+lb person and am pretty comfortable in this chair! The seat is wide enough to sit crisscross/tuck a foot under my leg as the feeling takes me, and the arms lifting up and down are wonderful for that purpose too. I got this chair specifically for the sitting versatility so the fact that it locks upright is nice as well. I wish there was a little more lower back support, but that's easily fixed with a pillow. Definitely recommend this chair for fidgety sitters like myself!Update 1/24/24:I'm about 5 months in using this chair daily and the wear is becoming very obvious. The chair now has a very obvious tilt to the left that's causing some back pain. I've taken it apart to look for broken pieces and tightened everything up, but the lean is still there. I love having the foldable arms and wide base to tuck my legs and maneuver around, but I'm a little bummed it didn't last longer. Took only one star off for it, though, since it still supports me and is still fairly comfortable, just wish I could figure out the leaning issue.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars It's perfect for a female who is 5 ft", 'author': 'Kari', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Finally a chair I can fit in that's really comfortable and I don't trip over the wheels because they're not sticking out way too far I thought that was going to do me in on my last chair so that was very important to me and I haven't yet run into the wheels walking around it in my office I thought I would push the chair in and use the arm feature which I tried once I guess I just haven't been pushing my chair in. I personally love it so far I've been using it for about two weeks. Okay this is an update since this review I probably had it for about 2 months now we'll have her as long since my last review but anyway I'm finding now that the chair doesn't go up or down I don't know if I installed the hydraulic part incorrectly so I think I have to do take them back apart and see if it I'm doing something wrong which there really was no directions other than you put the chair onto the thing and push it down it was pretty self-explanatory and that was all the directions stating but the fact that I'm pulling and pushing that lever and it's not doing anything back and forth as it states so I will investigate but like I said there was really only one way to do it including it together it wasn't like there was several options during that portion of the installation not sure if anyone else is running to this maybe I'm just not that good with this stuff worst case I'll get a hold of the company if it doesn't get figured out by my investigation. Bit still have these issues and the chair is bulky and not exactly light so I'm not looking forward to it but I will handle it.Fairly easy to put together it was just kind of a pain because I'm only about 6 weeks post hip replacement as well as I have frozen shoulder but I handled it like a boss a petite female without someone always available to put this stuff together and it can be fun until it's not...probably took me a little longer than it should have due to the above reasons but I would recommend it for me due to petite short leg status but again I don't know of anyone bigger size because if they have come over to my house I haven't had them sit on it I forgot. We will see in time if anything changes", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Wobbly', 'author': 'Anonymous reader', 'rating': 4, 'content': "UPDATE: The company answered me very quickly about my dilemma and sent me a free replacement, which I installed and it fixed my wobbly issue. Their customer service was awesome and friendly, so I do recommend reaching out to them if you have any issues with your chair. My only complaint now is that the chair isn't the most comfy so I got a gel cushion for it and a fabric chair cover, but otherwise I'm happy with it.I hope this review helps others.EDIT: I reached out to the company and they responded with timely and professional feedback and are sending me a replacement of the part of my chair that seems to be causing the issue. Brought my one star to the stars for that as I was pleasantly surprised, so will update again once I get my part and install it.I've had this chair for a few months and it's already very wobbly. It rocks back and forth but it also tilts to the right way more than it should and I've tightened every bolt as tight as I could. I had high hopes that this chair would last a while. Guess I was wrong.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: NEO CHAIR Ergonomic Office Chair PU Leather Executive Chair Padded Flip Up Armrest Computer Chair Adjustable Height High Back Lumbar Support Wheels Swivel for Gaming Desk Chair (White)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice chair at a reasonable price.', 'author': 'John D', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Packaging: The chair is well packaged. All the parts were in the box. All of the hardware is labeled including a small pack containing extra pieces of hardware just inn case they are needed. The allen wrench has a T handle and is a step up from what I typically see. The seat and back come covered in plastic.Assembly: Overall the assembly is easy. The steps are in logical order starting with attaching the spider legs (my term) being attached to the center piece. At step 4 of the assembly the instructions show putting a cosmetic cover piece that hides the bolts that attach the legs to the center piece. This cover was not in the box. I reached out to the seller & they promptly responded. The assembly instructions in the box was a first addition. There is a second addition that illuminates that step because the cover is no longer needed. They sent me an electronic version of the correct assembly instructions. I did notice during assembly that there didn‚Äôt seem to be a need for the cover because they design looks finished without the cover.Appearance: When assembled the chair looks nice. The feel of the material is nice. The finish of the back and seat were good. There were no issues with poor seams or sloppy sewing lines. It looks like they have a good level of quality control in place.Comfort: The chair feels nice with good lumbar support. I feel like it fits like a glove. However, I‚Äôm only 5‚Äô6‚Äù tall. I wouldn‚Äôt expect a taller person to have that kind of fit. The lumbar support is not adjustable. The chair will adjust in height and the recline function can be locked out.Overall I would recommend this chair as a good, no frills chair that‚Äôs comfortable. Time will tell if there are durability issues.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great so far', 'author': 'Ashley', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I got this chair as an upgrade for the one I had been using. The one I had I pulled out of someone's garbage on the side of the road 10 years ago, and it was still fully useful I just wanted something nicer. So far this chair is beautiful and comfortable. It took me less than 30 minutes to put together, but I do construct furniture rather frequently so I'm not sure if that was fast or average. title: Home Office Chair, High Back Ergonomic Desk Chair with 3D Armrests, Lumbar Support, Mesh Computer Chair with Adjustable Headrest, for Home, Office, Work, Student
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars "Easy Assembly and Superior Quality: A Breathable and Comfortable Chair I Adore"', 'author': 'feng', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This chair is a fantastic find for values convenience and quality. It's remarkably easy to assemble, with intuitive instructions that made the setup process a breeze. The build quality is impressive, feeling sturdy and durable. I particularly appreciate the breathable fabric, which keeps me cool and comfortable throughout the day. Overall, it's a chair I've grown to love for its seamless blend of functionality and comfort.This ergonomic chair boasts a vibrant pink hue that immediately brightens any space. Its contemporary design with a supportive headrest and adjustable armrests offers both style and comfort. The chair‚Äôs flexible lumbar support ensures proper posture, making long hours at the desk more comfortable. With its smooth-rolling casters and sturdy base, it combines mobility with stability for a dynamic work experience. Perfect for anyone looking to add a pop of color and comfort to their office or home workspace.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Ergonomic chair at a good price', 'author': 'xxx', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I am very satisfied with my new computer chair, which perfectly meets my needs! It looks beautiful and has complete functions. It is very comfortable to sit on and allows me to keep working for a long time without feeling tired. The chair's headrest and armrests have adjustable space and can be adjusted according to different heights and needs, making it very user-friendly. The chair's base and wheels are very stable, ensuring that it won't rock or tilt during long-term use.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Unique', 'author': 'Jeff B.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This Kensaker office chair is a very good office chair and has some unique features. Not everyone will want them, but the features make this stand out as an option.First of all it is a high back rolling office chair with an adjustable headrest. The headrest is made of a quality mesh like the back. The frame of the chair back, arms and headrest is a strong, dense plastic that will hold up over time. The headrest is adjustable in height. I\'m 5\' 9", but I have short legs and a very long torso. My torso length is probably equivalent to a 5\' 11" person. I can comfortably use the headrest, but I had to put it all the way up. A tall person may not be able to use the headrest.The seat and back I find quite comfortable. The material feels like nylon and is easily cleaned, which is important to me because I eat a lot of meals in this chair.Along with the high back, headrest and mesh material, it has another unique feature: the arms adjust in multiple ways. Many office chairs can raise or lower the arms, but these can slide back and forth, be angled inward or outward and be raised and lowered. I find I like the arm rests moved forward and angled inward, but that is a personal preference. This chair gives me the option.I love the pink color. It\'s bright and juxtaposes awesomely with my husband decor!Kensaker was very thoughtful in how this chair is assembled. I included a picture of the inserts that are in each leg where it meets the center base. The plastic inserts act as a cushion and hide the weld marks to give it a finished look. They also spread out the force of the screws, acting as a washer. This makes the chair quieter and helps prevent overtightening of the screws.I also appreciate that the arms wrap under the seat and around the back. This provides excellent strength and helps hide the hardware. The arms have a guide so the left and right arms have to be put on correctly. Also, the included hex wrench is a T-handle, which is much easier to use than a regular Allen wrench. I like that the hardware packet is well marked and all the screws are one size for the wrench. Only the length is different. They also included one extra screw for each type.The instructions are clear. The casters included are typical hard plastic, but are double wheeled and look nice, but they are a little noisy and will eventually wear off the finish on my hardwood floor, unless I use a mat. The chair rolls well.Overall, this is a very good office chair with unique features.This is one of the few times I\'ve felt compelled to make an addition to a review. After a few weeks the mesh cover would come loose on the back. Now I can\'t reattach it at all. It is sewn onto a flexible strip and fits into a groove. It is twisted or warped.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy and comfortable upgrade', 'author': 'alex goodfellow', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It is easy to assemble, durable, supportive, comfortable and looks great in my office! I am impressed with the quality of the components, the adjustability and the look of it. Its quality also far exceeds its price, and I consider this chair a great upgrade to my workspace!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Nice chair, but headrest hits shoulders', 'author': 'Mike', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'This appears to be a nice chair. It has good supports, and it feels sturdy. Assembly takes a bit of time, but that\'s to be expected (it comes with all the tools needed). It looks good. The seat cushion is thick, but it\'s a bit firm for my taste to start. I expect that it would soften up and end up being a good thing.However, the major fail of this chair is the headrest. It is far too low for me. It is adjustable, but at its highest setting, it hits me right in the shoulders. I am 6\'0", so while tall, I\'m not exceptionally tall. There is no way for me to sit in the chair comfortably at all. It would work for someone shorter (my wife sits comfortably in it), but if you are even close to 6\', this chair flat out won\'t work for you. The headrest could have been mounted higher, or have a greater range of adjustment, but there\'s no way around it as is, except for removing the headrest.So, it\'s a good chair if you are under 5\'6", but not for someone taller. At the time of this review, there\'s nothing that says that in the description, which is why I gave it 3 stars instead of 5.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best value office chair ever!', 'author': 'Deborah Quarterman', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I recently purchased this chair and I am very impressed with it! It is very comfortable for extended use. The design is sleek and perfect for my home office decor. I was pleasantly surprised by the sturdy build quality, which gives me confidence in its durability. Assembly was very easy and overall, it was a perfect purchase that exceeded my expectations. Highly recommended to anyone who needs a reliable and comfortable chair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Pleasantly Surprised', 'author': 'Steve', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We had some friends that recommended this chair after they had purchased one at Christmas. My wife had been trying to get me to purchase a new office chair because the on that I had was getting pretty worn down. I have never been a fan (or so I thought) of the mesh backed office chair because they seemed cheaply made. After trying out our friends chair we decided to take their advice and purchase the same model. The chair itself was easy to put together (about a half hour) and the directions were also easy to understand. The chair pad is thick and very firm, but I can tell that it will get softer over time. The back of the chair is very supportive and sturdy. The feature that I really like is the adjustable head rest that can be moved up or down for different heights and it tilts for support. The arm rests also slide forward and backwards for different lengths and move side to side as well. I thought I would miss my old office chair, but after a couple of days I realize my wife was right.....AGAIN! The price for the chair was a little more than what I paid for my old one, but I bought the previous chair 15 years ago. Also was able to get a $30.00 clipped coupon to bring down the price as well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good purchase', 'author': 'shellhu', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'happy with my purchase of this office chair. it looks cool and fit my workplace well, great addition!comfort and modern design as expected. the adjustable features and sturdy support make me easily customize it to my liking, ensuring optimal comfort. The high backrest offers excellent lumbar support, promoting good posture and preventing fatigue. the wheels moving is quite smooth and easy, I can move to anywhere quickly without any noise. that is the feature I do recognize and like. the chair feels sturdy and well-built. The quality materials used feel good and seems reliable for years to come.It has significantly improved my workspace experience. Good purchase.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good purchase', 'author': 'Jen', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I am pleased by my decision of this purchase with a $20 coupon. Time to say goodbye to my last 10-yr old chair with a faux leather surface. This one has mesh type surface that makes it more comfortable. The assembling process went well even without the manual (I found it in a bag after I was 50% finished). The hardest part is to put the back and the seat together, but it is handleable by myself; and it would be great if with an additional hand. The chair looks sturdy to me, also good looking, and so far I am feeling good sitting on it. Btw, the manual is well written, not like some others which could be very confusing.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfort and style unite', 'author': 'Chloe G', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Can‚Äôt deny first of all,like it white although there‚Äôs some light great touch.in the realm of home office furniture,the white ergonomic office chair stands out as beacon of comfort and style.The ergonomic design of the chair is a true game-changer for those spending long hours at their desks,me one of them lol,Assembling the chair is straightforward process,not to brag,my 7 year old son did that by following the instructions lil book,and he did it!that really impressed me!(well he assisted his had to assemble other furnitures couple times).So far,it is sturdy,I‚Äôd say it is a decent chair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice chair :)', 'author': '(‚úø¬¥‚Äø`)', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It is comfortable, easy to assemble, and looks great nothing more to ask for. The price was nice as well especially the sale going for it. üòÑ', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great chair / great price', 'author': 'Need All the help I can get', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Like that it swivels, has air lift to adjust height, wide seat, modern design, love it in white.A little firm for me but a guest said it was comfortable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great WIDE chair', 'author': 'Kellyanne Ford', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Assembly: 5/5 I was able to assemble by myself with just a little maneuvering, adding the back of the chair took 2 tried since the first the screws were not alighted right and THIS created a creaking sound when I sat. After adjusting and taking more care the sound is gone and screws are flush in place.Feel of chair: 4/5 the height is higher than expected which is great for my desk. It is really wide but I would say if you are over 5‚Äô7 and plus size you might not be able to fully cross cross your legs but you can wrap one leg under you (my preferred seating). People note the back rest is low, I find it to still be very comfortable and provide support. But yes it hits mid back not full back.Functions: 4/5 it rises falls and swivels great! However, I am not sure if my tension is broken but it does not work and there is barely a tilt in the chair. After many tries and some stronger friends help the tension cannot be adjusted. This losses a star because I would have preferred a fully functional chair. And it‚Äôs nice to be able to lean back.A note: this chair has no creaking noises as others have noted. Perhaps it‚Äôs because my tilt function is not working that I do not have the creaking noise but I find it a very smooth and quiet chair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable, spacious, adjustable', 'author': 'Alyssa', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This chair was way bigger than expected! It is very comfortable and you can lean back in it quite far. You also can adjust the height easily to your desk size. The color is beautiful and it is very comfortable. Perfect chair for working from home if you like to adjust positions throughout the day or sit cross legged.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Smallish if you're plus size, but a cute chair!", 'author': 'Tay Nugget', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Im still giving 5 stars cause the product is easy to assemble, comfortable and cute! however I should have known by the pictures, but I'm a bigger lady (245-260lbs?) and sitting cross legged is doable! it's just not very comfortable for too long. it falls a bit short in the front since my legs are thicker and occupy more space when cossed. my feet hang off the front a little. But that is not the manufacturers fault. it's a great chair!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great product for a great price', 'author': 'Ashli', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This chair was SUPER easy to put together, took only myself about about 15 minutes to unpack and place the parts together. So far it is comfy and functional in my office space. I wanted this particular chair so that I could sit cross legged in it, and with the wide seat and no arms, I am able to do just that and be comfortable while I work!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars SOOOOO comfy!!!', 'author': 'Sandra Parent-Dugmore', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'GREAT desk chair! I always have my feet up and this chair is perfect for that. Slides under the desk great, was easy to assemble and looks adorable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love it!', 'author': 'Crystal', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Affordable, good quality and easy to put together. The seat is as described- I often sit with one leg tucked under the other leg on the chair, and so this seat is perfect‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs super comfortable! Would definitely recommend!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Oh boy, I like the chair but the assembly is ROUGH', 'author': 'Christine Garam', 'rating': 4, 'content': "TL;DR - I really like the chair, it's VERY comfortable and exactly what I was looking for, but assembly was a nightmare, no wheels, no permanent leg attachment.1. The base does not in any way permanently* attach to the upper part of the chair. I expect with weight and time it will essentially embed itself via pressure, but in the interim, lifting the chair from the seat will not take the legs with it.1.5 - This chair has no wheels, which is odd for an office chair. I see now in hindsight the pictures show this, but I honestly just wasn't looking for that because I've never seen an office chair sans wheels. Just highlighting in case you care. I don't really.2. OMG the assembly. When I saw all the ratings for simple assembly I was not expecting this. It's a little gaslighty, yes the assembly is simple in terms of there being few parts and only one included tool necessary. But it's not simple at all in terms of effort. I would have had another person available to help if I knew, it's physically very difficult to get the seat and seat back together, like that took up 90% of the time of assembly.Also, the pre-threaded screw holes on my instance were really poorly angled such that not cross-threading the screws was a monumental effort, and they aren't strongly embedded in the seat. The result of this is that when you're tightening, rather than getting the expected effect of the back bar moving ever closer to flush-with-the-screw hole as you turn the wrench, closing the gap, what happens instead is the pre-threaded hole starts to get yanked out of the seat. There is no good way I could find to apply the necessary pressure to combat this because of the L shape of the object you're dealing with. 1 of 4 of the screws I received is now screwed about halfway in but unable to proceed to completion because doing so is ripping the screw hole from the chair.Final thought: Had the assembly not been such a huge PITA, I'd have given this chair 5 stars in a heartbeat, it's so very comfy and pretty.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great chair', 'author': 'Am', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Very happy with my purchase. I was worried it would be uncomfortable with the lack of support but I am happy using it a few times a week when I wfh with an extra cushion for support. I love how wide it is and I am able to sit cross legged as I work which I find so comfortable! I am 5ft 7 and there is plenty of room for me, it is wider than I thought it was going to be! I recommend buying some pads for the legs if you're putting it anywhere with hard floors as it felt like it might scratch the floor without them.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Homall Office Chair High Back Computer Desk Chair, PU Leather Adjustable Height Modern Executive Swivel Task Chair with Padded Armrests and Lumbar Support (Black)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A Very Comfortable High Back Chair At A Great Price & Value', 'author': 'michael a barbera', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very Nice Chair ~ Comfortable ~ Easy To Understand Instructions ~ I Plan On Buying More In The Near Future ~', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good value for this price range', 'author': 'Michael S.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My chair came well packaged and all parts were in great shape. I was expecting to spend a little time putting it together based on some reviews saying it was a difficult assembly. I can assure you it is very easy to assemble, and took about 15 minutes. The casters pop right on and then there are a handful of screws that attach the base and arms to the seating.The chair looks very nice and is quite comfortable. As far as quality it is bonded leather and some hard plastic parts. So this chair will not last 15-20 years. If you are looking for something that will last that long you will have to spend much more then $100. You don't want to clean bonded leather with chemical based cleaners because it will eventually eat away at it. Use mild soap & water and the material will last much longer. From my experience chairs made of these materials usually last 4-5 years if used daily and not abused.I am very happy with the chair and my personal opinion is you would be hard pressed to find something better in the $100 price range.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Takes some time and patience to put together', 'author': 'Mindy', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Only complaint is that it was missing a washer and it took quite a while for me and my daughter to get it put together. It was difficult to line up the arm rests and seat back. Bought this as a Christmas gift for my husband‚Äôs home office. He loves it so far. He‚Äôs had multiple back surgeries and appreciates the lumbar support. He is also happy with the fact that it is a wider seat. He doesn‚Äôt feel ‚Äúconfined‚Äù when sitting in it. My teenagers also enjoy sitting in it when homeschooling or watching television. Overall, we‚Äôre very happy with it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cats LUUUURVE the box!', 'author': 'Charlieluke', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'First the box it comes in is super duper! Its been two days and our cats havent made a dent in it. This company is SERIOUS about protecting your product during shipping! Re use the box. 2nd OMGOSH this chair is amazing! I was the only human present to put it together and I did it in about 30/40 minutes. It might take you longer because I did have help--LOTS of help--from our felines. With a little forethought it was manageable. Theres room to wiggle in the seat and my husband could finally fall asleep at his computer in a better position than "slumped". Its so comfortable I had to fetch and carry all night (till he fell asleep, as usual) because my hubby didnt want to leave the chair. Well... he couldnt really. The chair fits about four cats fyi. Maybe five. Ours are a bit big. If he\'d gotten up, the chair would have sucked the cats onto it and he wanted to enjoy it. Really well made chair. Highly recommend! Smooth action on the spin and lots of sprawling ability. You\'re gonna love it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars quick shipping...super nice', 'author': 'Jimmy Foskey', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'shipped quick...super easy to assemble!! very comfortable!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Okay..', 'author': 'StarB', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Received this chair today. The chair was packaged really well and all parts were present. I've been sitting in it for just over an hour and honestly, my bottom hurts already. The seat is not super cushioned so it's not very comfortable. The rocking function is nice but could be dangerous, the base of the chair is not super heavy nor does it have any type of added weight to it so if your rocking back far, I could see someone tipping over. The stationary lumbar is comfortable for me and the tall chair back is nice. The padded arms are comfortable and fit nicely under my desk. I am only 5'1 so the chair is at it's lowest setting. If you are taller, and have the chair set higher, the arms may not fit under your desk. It'll be interesting to see how long the material on the chair lasts. It was easy to put together, my son-in-law managed to put it together in under 30 minutes. For the price, it's not bad but I'll definitely be investing in something more comfortable in the near future. If you are looking for an inexpensive chair that is somewhat comfortable but pleasing to the eye, I would recommend it. But if you are going to be sitting at your desk 8-10 hours a day like I do, I'd shop around a bit more.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars OMG - Great chair for a great price!!! Great chair even if it cost a lot more - love it!!!', 'author': 'C. Stever', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I purchased the gray leather version and it looks *really good*. Assembled everything in about 10 minutes (super easy).Just a reminder to not tighten down the arms before adding the chair back; it squeezes in tight then feels super-secure when you finish everything up (just follow the instructions).Best thing of all, the chair is very, very comfortable for me. I\'m 5\'8" and about 180lbs; feels like it was made for me. Feels rather robust and decently constructed.I bought it because of the price but am soooo happy that I did. This is a HUGE UPGRADE over my old office store chair (that was twice the price...on sale). I\'ve only had it a few days now but I do have to spend a lot of time planted into while working. Obviously, much better than the old chair. Surprisingly, much more comfortable than the \'high end\' La-Z-Boy \'leather executive\' chair that I have in the main office (also a nice chair just 5 times more expensive).My experience, so far, has been very favorable and I don\'t see any reason for that not to continue.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars 1 year review from a teleworker', 'author': 'Bulldoggy', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'I purchased the Homall Office Chair in March of 2022, with high expectations of comfort and functionality. I liked how the chair looked, its price point, and it received positive reviews. Unfortunately, my experience with this chair has been underwhelming, to say the least. Several issues, ranging from poor quality to difficult assembly, have left me deeply dissatisfied with my purchase.Let\'s start with the assembly process, which was an absolute nightmare. The instructions provided were not terrible, but not great either. It took me significantly longer than anticipated to assemble this chair, and I consider myself fairly handy. If you\'re not well-versed in putting together furniture, you may find yourself extremely frustrated.Another significant issue I encountered was with the chair\'s hydraulic cylinder. It has already started failing, causing the chair to slowly sink, regardless of the adjustment settings. This rendered the height adjustment feature useless and made for an uncomfortable seating position. I expected a durable and reliable chair, but sadly, this was not the case.The armrests were also a major disappointment. They started to deform and indent where my elbows and arms sit. The rest of the chair is fine. I can sit it in all day, so that is a positive. I mainly lean a bit forward and don\'t have time to lounge backward.On top of all these issues, the Homall Office Chair proved to be quite noisy. Whenever I shifted my weight or made any slight movements, the chair emitted creaking and squeaking sounds. Not only was it an annoyance, but it also disrupted my concentration while working and is embarrassing on conference calls. Having such a distracting and low-quality chair in a professional environment is disappointing.If I read this review I would have a couple of questions about the reviewer. I am 6\'3" but well below the recommended weight. I review plans and specs as part of my job, so I am good with instructions. My hobby is woodworking which requires skill and a calm demeanor. Yes, I did retighten any connectors that became loose through normal wear and tear.I should have spent more money on a quality chair since I am now looking to purchase a different chair 1 year later. I would advise others to take that into consideration. Spend a little more and keep less junk out of our landfills.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Comfy, but stains!', 'author': 'Audrey Arroyo', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Super comfy chair with a high back which was a necessity for me being 6‚Äô tall.
