title: OFIKA Home Office Chair, 400LBS Big and Tall Heavy Duty Design, Ergonomic High Back Cushion Lumbar Back Support, Computer Desk, Adjustable Executive Leather Chair with Armrest
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars New office chairs again?', 'author': 'john r langone', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Always good to have history. It\'s 2009. New computer desks, file cabinets and office chairs. Today August 2022, same computer desks and file cabinets for home office.We use the 5th bedroom as an office. In 2009 we purchased low end $99.00 each (foolisly) office chairs. Try as we did, could not destroy those inexpensive vinyl chairs. In late 2017 the chairs were getting tired. Maybe we were also. We purchased on sale (2) La-Z-Boy leather computer chairs in January 2018 at $199.99. Thought they would last for many, many years. Hate to say the leather was so worn out when using these chairs max 2 hours per day in 4 1/2 years was very disheartning. What to do? Purchase 2 leather computer chairs however inexpensively. We came across these chairs however the reviews were terrible. What to do? Purchase them and if the reviewers are correct, send them back. Well the following may be of value to folks looking for good looking, easy to assemble, leather chairs. These may fit the need. About 75 minutes to assemble both chairs. The rolling of the chairs, we have plexiglass runners under the chairs over an area rug on wood floors, no problems rolling. Pistons no issues, chairs hold position. We are probably average heights and weights. She 5\'9" 170 lbs, me 5\'11" 205 lbs. Only issue may be the installation tool provided. Gets the job done however we dropped it at least a 1/2 dozen times. Lastly, we chose brown to match desks and file cabinets. Various colors available. So far these are a tad harder than the La-Z Boys however we think with our use they will probably outlast the La-Z-Boys.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 16, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great desk chair', 'author': 'Everyday Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Perfect desk chair. I work from home and my children our home schooled. This chair is very comfortable for long sit times and a great price point. Pretty easy to put together. Instructions were clear and easy to read. Mine is currently on hard wood flooring and I have no issues with scratching or denting the floor from the wheels.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Adequate, inexpensive chair', 'author': 'J C', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This chair is an OK buy, if not looking for really top of the line. First, it\'s sold as 400 lb rated, but I really don\'t think its any different than the 250 lb rated chair that it\'s replacing. Seat and back padding is relatively thin but OK. The lift and tilt mechanism works smoothly. Not a very "high" back. Rolls nicely. Easy to assemble and packaged fine. Overall, just doesn\'t seem very heavy duty, when it\'s sold as being so. I searched significantly and really couldn\'t find anything better for the same money. It\'s an OK average chair and so far, so good.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars A Disappointing Purchase', 'author': 'ARoppo', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'My old office chair was literally falling apart so I needed a replacement. After reading reviews I decided on this one. My daughter is a large gal and I needed something that was a bit sturdier. This chair was advertised as being "heavy duty" and accommodating up to 400 lbs. I highly doubt someone 400 lbs. could use this chair and it far too narrow for a heavier person. I have had the chair for about a month and here are some of my thoughts:Pros: Stylish good looks: The leather is attractive and it looks like a much more expensive chair. Easy Assembly: It took me only a short time to assemble it and the instructions were easy to follow. Comfort: The seat and back are reasonably comfortable.Cons: The wheels are awful. They lock up and I end up just scooting the chair across the floor mat. It would be impossible to maneuver the chair on even the lowest pile carpeting. It does not recline to 110¬∞ in rocking mode as advertised. It is very tightly sprung and takes a lot of effort to tilt back. This may loosen up with time.In all fairness, I have not yet contacted the company regarding the wheels, but do plan to do so. It is too much of a pain to return the chair after having assembled it, so I plan to keep it, but if I had tried it in a store I would never have purchased it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars not what expected, and slight damage.... cushion torn !!', 'author': 'mike', 'rating': 2, 'content': "first off, fast FED GROUND delivery... also height of seat to 21 3/4 is excellent for longer leg users, two great observations in the purchase. fed ex ground delivered a dusty box and other items to farm on dusty hot road... was expected .... not a normal day... smaller box, chair is in there...opened box in center of room and ready for assembly... i have put chairs together before for the various computer tables.. assembled with viewing picture instructions... inventory was on par with one extra screw lag for short and long grommets...Allen wrench is big L shaped and quite handy .. assembled in 15 minutes..wheels went on the best ... must be firm with seat screws as one seamed stripped and then gripped... one chair rest is lose , but with some lock tight, will grip... for a rated Big and tall chair, seat height is there, actuator is easily controlled, arm rest are nicely padded, but short... 34 inch arms here, so rests need to be 3 to 4 inches longer..seat is hard and with 24 hrs seating, already depressing.... so you will lose your leg height to floor from seat...i am 220 clothes on ..chair rated to 400 pounds.... it can make chair less stable, so no rough housing in chair .... for a foam, the seat is quite hard.... not an 8 hr chair, although i thought was rated for longer seating... this is a smaller chair for a Big and Tall executive, not really a Big Tall man's chair... i am over 6 ' 2 and shoulders or at top of back.. high back seems 46 inches though..no real head rest.. shoulder rest there though, but don't snap your neck back stretching.... repeating good things... great Allen wrench, SOFT ARM RESTS, excellent HARD BASE with WHEELS, and seat height will equal 21 inches give or take seat depression, incredible fast fed ex ground shipping......now the BAD, not so comfortable, tiny tall executive chair, screws can easily strip so be positive on the attaching to grommet and aligning up, and the worse for last, THERE WAS A TEAR IN THE BACK CUSHION ON TOP EDGE OF CHAIR.. probably happened in packing or on assembly line... very thin material... after assembly, so tough to return in boxing up again.... i am thinking lock tight on my screw and gorilla tape on my tear.. i would return if easy to box up !!! it was only a 130 purchase with the coupon discount.. be well , be safe... UPDATE: company refunded price of chair. AMAZING....", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 26, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Feels good quality for the price and went together quickly.', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Received today and put together. The chair felt like it was a good quality for the price. Faux leather is thin, but that is part of buying an inexpensive chair. The chair felt comfortable and study. It was easy to put together. Wheels popped on. Four Allen screws for the seat bottom, eight Allen bolts to attach the arms, bottom, and seatback. I will update if it does not stand up to use.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Updated 3/26/03 Company CS Team Reached Out | It's An Ok Chair", 'author': 'BG Tech Guy', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Updated as of 3/26/03: 5 StarsThe companys customer service department who builds/sell the chair here on AMZN reached out to me. The listened to me, they were extremely professional and prompt and resolved my issue with the chair satisfactorily. I was again impressed that they reached out and spoke to me about it...made it right. Because of that, I'm changing the rating from three stars to five stars. Being that they resolved my concerns FAST, I'd highley recommend this chair and I will be buying another in the next 90 days asFirst Review: 3 StarsIt's an Ok Chair to buy for an office or general usage. I'm disappointed because two of the bolt holes in the chair weren't drilled corrected..wouldn't grab and tighten. Both were on the back of the chair. Yes it's a cheap chair but even in this day and age, these companies lack of quality is amazing.Foam padding is decent - expectation - nothing over the top - normal characteristics. It was easy to put together and hey supplied all the parts needed. Instructions were easy to read and understand. That's a huge plus.It says it'll take 400lbs but I doubt it - sitting on it was a little nerve racking at first and I made all the adjustments prior to sitting in it. Those two screws and the alignment are what keep me from giving this 5 stars even for a cheapy. I hope it last 6 months. I'll update in that time frame.Good luck all.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Mediocre Chair', 'author': 'Christina', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I love the look of the chair but the bottom cushion is so thin and I have to get up a lot. It was easy to put together but the arms aren‚Äôt strong. Makes a lot of noise when getting up and sitting down. But a good price point for what it is.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Mostly easy to assemble but low arm rests', 'author': 'Tucker', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Not much else to say from the title other than the screws on one side didn't quite line up properly and had to force it into the correct position and by the time I did that it got cross threaded. Other than that it's pretty comfortable. You do wanna swap the wheels though but that's every chair", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Will it Last', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Seat was not as wide as I would have like but deeper than I expected.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

Assembled alone.', 'author': 'Cindy', 'rating': 4, 'content': "If you want a truly white office chair, keep looking. This is definitely not white. I'd say a creamy light neutral off white. I decided I could live with the color and put it together by myself-a little out of order.Took me less than an hour. A second set of hands would make it easier but not necessary. I assembled the legs with wheels as instructed. Attached the lift to the legs. Then I attached the black metal base to the bottom of the seat. I did not put the seat on the legs yet. Sitting on the floor, scooting around to finish was not an option! I attached the arms to the back and seat while standing using the top of my kitchen counter, pull out cutting board and the box it came in for lift and support. I attached both arms to the seat first. It is vital to attach the screws 50% or less until you get every screw in the arms, seat and back. It took me a few tries to get everything lined up correctly. That would be the only part where another set of hands is helpful. I screwed everything in 100% and put the cover buttons on. Put the lift with legs attached in the black metal base and gently put the assembled chair on the floor.Chair is sturdy, wide and rolls nicely on my lvp floors. Initial reaction is very positive. Removed a star for color description. I may update later on longevity of parts.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great chair for the price', 'author': 'Lisa', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I like this chair. It is perfect for my home office. I love the price and it arrived sooner than I expected. My husband had it put together before I got home from work so I'm not sure about the assembly but he had no complaints so I'm guessing it was easy. Very pleased.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

The adjustable features allow him to customize the chair to his liking, ensuring optimal comfort during different gaming activities.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good - for the price', 'author': 'Leo J', 'rating': 4, 'content': "A lot of my review of this chair really is in relation to the cost, especially in comparison to a lot of chairs in this price range.Arrived with pieces in-tact and everything separated and labeled clearly.The pieces themselves all seem of solid construction. Wipes clean easily and resists staining.Instructions included were clear and fairly easy to follow. It's not just pictures either, it's clear step by step instructions as well as images to guide you through the whole process.Chair feels solid when sitting in it. I'm a grown man who weighs over 200lbs and it holds me just fine.Lumbar and back support really could be better but is passable for the cost.I do like the fact that the arm rests lift up if you want, so that's a nice option.The piston for raising the height of the chair works well. No issues.My main complaint about this chair is that the resistance knob that adjusts the tension when leaning back does not seem to work well. It does not seem to want to turn in either direction and I have a strong grip. I've tried adjusting while sitting on the chair or while holding the chair and sitting on floor next to it. I do not feel as confident leaning all the way back in this chair like I have in the past.We shall see how long this thing lasts. ü§û", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

It gives it a unique look that I like while still providing a lot of comfort.It also comes in with a lumbar support that is inside the mesh and a nice amount of cushion.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fancy chair at an affordable price', 'author': 'Brian', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This chair is a perfect chair for my home office environment. title: DUMOS Cross Legged Office Chair, Armless Wide Desk Chair No Wheels, Modern Home Office Desk Chair Swivel Adjustable Fabric Vanity Chair
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 10/10 Highly Recommend! So Comfy!!', 'author': 'felix', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This was the perfect upgrade I needed. If someone really needed a lot of back support, I'm not sure this would do it for them. For me it's perfect. For the top part, if the screws don't align, just wiggle the back on the chair until it slides in place (you'll know what I mean when you see it).I order on Amazon constantly and this is my first review, so I definitely love it!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Comfy, but smells of chemicals', 'author': 'shannon sullivan', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The chair is pretty and super comfortable. I love that it swivels! I was nervous that it doesn‚Äôt have wheels, but I barely notice. Easy to put together. The smell is extremely overbearing, though. Even with a window open to circulate the air, I have a headache from the fumes, which can‚Äôt be healthy. The smell is also on my clothes now from sitting in the chair. Hoping it goes away soon‚Ä¶ the only drawback that would make me reconsider.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cozy seat, smooth spins & easy to build', 'author': 'sea chel', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I received my package earlier than expected- it did arrive in its original box and not in an amazon box, so beware if thieves are common where you are; everyone knew what I purchased because the box had an image of the chair and in big letters "office chair."Set up took maybe 30-35 minutes and assembly was easy. I read some reviews from people who had a hard time installing the seat, so maybe that expectation softened the blow, but it was simple for myself.The seat itself is wide and has decent back support for what I am looking for. I can sit comfortably with my legs crossed and still have some room. The height adjustment is incredibly smooth. My only concern over time is the base and wheels. The chair has the option to use the wheels or go without, which I do appreciate.I will give an update if something does go awry, but fresh out of the box, I would recommend anyone to purchase this chair. It shipped quicker than expected, simple to assemble and turned out to be very comfy.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I love the chair, but wish I would have chosen with wheels.', 'author': 'Sierra', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this chair partially for gaming, but more importantly for my nightly at home dialysis hookup. I was using a plastic foldaway chair before, that was so uncomfortable to sit in. So this chair is absolutely much more comfortable, it is just too heavy for me if I want to move it around, which of course I didn‚Äôt think about. If I were to buy it again, I would absolutely choose the wheel option. I can‚Äôt really return it for a different model anyway, since that‚Äôs just too much work for me. Great chair otherwise.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice office chair', 'author': 'Anderson', 'rating': 5, 'content': "For the price I'm very happy with this chair. Very easy to assemble and the instructions were clear and short. I find it very comfortable to sit on. For those having trouble lining up the holes, you really have to shove the two pieces together. The grey is super pretty and cloth is comfortable, you don‚Äôt slide on it at all and it‚Äôs sturdy!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Criss Cross Apple Sauce All Day!', 'author': 'Kimberley Nicole', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Calling all lazy, cozy gamer girls out there, this wide base desk chair is about to become your new best friend! üéÆ‚ú®Let me start by saying that this chair is a functional dream. The smell was much better, and the new chair rocks as it is supposed to. I\'m grateful for their generosity! Hopefully the first chair was just a "bad batch."I was excited to get this chair after all of the TikTok raves about it. A nice big seat to sit cross legged, and the ability to rock back but not wobble around on wheels was all very appealing to me.Unfortunately the minute I took the cushions out of the bags they smelled AWFUL. It\'s 5* outside and I had to open my windows to air out the house. I feel like I\'m breathing in chemicals. But, If I needed to purchase again, I\'d get a different brand.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Homall Gaming Chair, Office Chair High Back Computer Chair Leather Desk Chair Racing Executive Ergonomic Adjustable Swivel Task Chair with Headrest and Lumbar Support (White)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable Chair, slightly hard to put together', 'author': 'Ryan Williams', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This chair is quite soft and very comfortable.Positives *Cushion is soft, leathery feel. Adjustable height, and you can add the lumbar/head pillow rest if you desire. *Colours are AMAZING. I ordered the Green and Black, absolutely loving how they pop and add to the set up I have.Negatives *Quite heavy (around 60 lbs?) when it is in the box, I live alone and even though I chose to have it delivered to my back porch (for safety, and also to make it easier for me to slide into the house) FedEx still disregarded my delivery instructions and put it on my front porch. I had to struggle getting it from the front to the back of the house but I managed. Just be cautious if you don't have anyone to help you move the box to begin, it is cumbersome. * I'm not the smartest person but I assumed I could put together a chair. I was -wrong-. Please, please, please find the instructions faster than I did. They are put in with the cushions, so make sure to open everything and lay it out. My biggest complaint was how hard everything was to put together but that is just me not being handy and thinking I can do things myself. I ended up getting it all put together (and correctly it seems!) but it did take about two hours. The instructions are clear up until a point, and the QR Code for the Video in the instructions doesn't take you to the video, just to the companies YouTube where you have to actually find the video instructions you're looking for. All said, I wish it was the instructions had been in their own individual package or just placed in the box instead of in a random area not knowing they are there. If you're handy, you'll be able to build this thing no problem, but if you're not make sure you just read through everything slowly and you'll be able to get it built. It might take two hours like me but you got this!!Overall, I love the chair and I am so glad I bought it. If you're looking for a soft, comfortable chair that you can adjust to your needs, I don't think you can do much better than this.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great buy', 'author': 'Alex roman', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This one review where the part of the chair snapped. You must weigh a lot and/or throwing yourself into it because it‚Äôs very sturdy and the padding is just right. Perfect for relaxing.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Not for all. Not wide enough seat for hips and thighs for some and may cause discomfort.', 'author': 'dpiffy', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'While there were some shipping issues and complaints and issues, the seller was more than willing to get me taken care of despite all the issues just to receive it. That being said, when I got it, shipping box and contents inside were all nicely packaged and protected inside and individually wrapped or boxed. The quality of the chair does seem very nice for the price you are paying. I did not get this chair necessarily as a gaming chair as the title of the product states it as. I just liked the look of it and the features it includes. I also wanted a tall back chair for head and neck support. I am 6‚Äô3‚Äù tall and my last office chair was only a mid level back and old and falling apart. The installation of the chair was actually fairly easy in my opinion. The included paper instructions provided more than enough detail and instruction to get me through it. I did create a customer how to/installation and setup video which should be showing up any day now once approved. Made understanding how to install it a much more fun way to watch it being built from ground up. I‚Äôve had the chair now and have used it for a few days now. The very first full day I had it (I installed it the night before after work), I actually came home super tired and sat down in it. I give the comfortable rating a 7/10. It was comfortable enough especially when reclining the chair back, I actually fell fast asleep it in. Wasn‚Äôt a LazyBoy comfort sleeping chair but it was good enough especially for an office chair. I rate it a 7 for a reason though, something I am honestly very disappointed in and debating on rather I can keep it or not. If one tiny issue was fixed, I would likely give this chair and comfort a 9 or 10 rating. My problem is this: the seat itself, is not wide enough. I am of a fairly average build. However with the raised angled ends on the seat itself where it feels like sturdy metal support bars inside, it keeps my hips and thighs so tight together with no room for much of a relaxed open leg seating position. It almost gives a slight bruising feeling on the side of my upper thighs and hips after prolonged time in it and possibly even pushing on veins and arteries in my legs just enough to slightly cut off blood circulation which in turn gives me a slight dead leg with tingle sensation. I have to keep adjusting my legs and move them from keeping this from happening. Also, I feel the seat could had used some sort of opening or circulation to circulate air. It gets to be a pretty warm seat after awhile. If the seat itself was maybe 6 inches wider or else didn‚Äôt have the lifted angled sides on the ends of the seat, I‚Äôd say this chair is perfect. Back and head and neck support are all great in my opinion. My butt is by no means a wide big butt (haha) so for my wife with wider hips, naturally as a woman, she was uncomfortable in it instantly and didn‚Äôt like it whatsoever. If they ever modify this seat I would be willing to update the review. For now, as I said, I would take caution on seeing how the seat feels for you. I would almost pull the seat out and maybe just install the armrests and sit on it on the ground before putting it all together to see what may be an issue for you as well. I will upload a photo of the seat with me in it to show an example once Amazon turns photo uploads for reviews back on, apparently they have turned the option off temporarily citing the COVID as some sort of reason.Update: I added photos as promised now that it gave me the ability to add them. The photos are to show the narrow seat conditions as I say in the chair and my outer thighs and hips and tight up against the elevated sides of the seat.I did purchase another item here on Amazon, a high rated seat cushion pillow which elevated me up a bit off the seat and has tremendously increased the comfort now where my thighs are not being squashed together. Grant it I shouldn‚Äôt have to buy something else to make this seat work better and more comfortable but I really didn‚Äôt want to have to deal with the time and pain in disassembling the chair and trying to send it back. I made it work. The seat cushion set me back another $30 but it‚Äôs worth it and I can technically take it with me elsewhere if I want to use it and it does really major sitting in this office chair a lot more comfortable and cooler temperature as well. Here is link to recommended seat cushion:Everlasting Comfort Seat Cushion... https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01EBDV9BU?ref=ppx_pop_mob_ap_share', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 2, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars same as the picture', 'author': 'cadence', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'nicer in real life, and super nice for the price. the material is comfortable and its super easy to put together', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great value', 'author': 'RJ Nunnally', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is my second one of these. The first I've had for five or six years and it's pretty rough. The fabric is now coming apart on the seat cushion and more worryingly, the bolts that hold the armrests on have broken. Yes, that's right, broken. The heads break off. I'm not a heavy guy either. Speaking of which, the cushioning in this is fairly firm but good and the seat fits me we well as a smaller person. The cushions provided do help with support and in the end, I find this chair to be very comfortable especially considering the price.Back to the bolts; this has to be the worst part of the chair. They were coming loose on the armrests on my prior chair, then eventually failed at the bolt head. I see there is loctite applied from the factory on this new one; I don't remember if the old one had that and if not, it will help. However, while I was putting together the new chair using an impact driver on the lowest setting (~15 lb/ft), I managed to break one of the bolts at the head. These are clearly weak bolts and they should never snap this way, especially considering their size. In fact, the small Phillips head screws used to secure the plastic trim seem more stout. If you're careful with the bolts and expect to replace the chair in 3 years or so, I think this is a good buy.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good chair and decent price', 'author': 'Massimiliano Milizia', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this chair with my desk because I also wanted something that would work for doing work, playing games, and lounging. It was pretty easy to assemble however I would reccomend having a second person as it makes the process much easier. It reclines super far and raises nicely. It isn‚Äôt that expensive compared to other chairs so I would recommend it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Good chair but will break after a while!', 'author': 'Ryan Beckford', 'rating': 3, 'content': "This is a buyer be aware. I purchased this chair in 2021. Unfortunately, I will not re-purchase again. When I first purchased this chair and received it, the chair was quite easy to assemble. Instructions were clear. Packing was neat. If you had any questions for support, they were quick to respond with an answer.Unfortunately, after months go by, you start to realize the small issues that pop-up, like, the backrest is loose, the armrest starting to damage, or the cylinder pump needs replacement.I use this gaming chair for my work-from-home office chair. The chair is comfortable. Unfortunately, its durability is very low. I've had to contact support various times, and they've helped in trying to resolve the issues by sending replacement parts. However, as soon as the warranty period was up, support was no longer helpful. All issues with the chair would now be an issue that I'd have to resolve on my own.When I purchased this chair, I purchased it with the insurance. And I'm happy I did that. The insurance company refunded me the full amount I paid for this chair after submitting all the images that proved manufacture defect, wear and tear and replacements sent by the seller.To all those looking to buy a gaming chair, there are way more options on the market. I'd advised to add a few more bucks to your purchasing budget and buy a chair that is stronger and will last longer.Unfortunately, I would not recommend buyers to purchase this chair because the flaws outweigh the comfort. If you do buy this chair, please buy the insurance. Once your insurance for this chair is up, support is not helpful anymore and you'll be on your own.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Top starter gaming racing chair', 'author': 'ZH', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I consider this the best starter racing style gaming chair you can get. They are all about the same size, so if you're on the fence and want to try it out before dumping a lot of money on a chair, I think this is a 5 star chair for that.Overall I think these are also a bit better than the Amazon Basics mid-back or high back chairs, and I consider leather, even PU leather, much better to sit on than the mesh chairs that are popular. The problem with PU is it will always peel, there's no way around that, and it's only going to really last a few years. Mesh will last a bit longer maybe but isn't really that comfortable.The super expensive office chairs that I've had at work I don't think are at all worth it. But even if you think they are, they are just a lot more expensive.This chair is easy to put together, it takes about 20-30 minutes max and everything is easy to tighten with the included allen wrench. The covers you have to screw in, and I might recommend a regular screwdriver, especially for the deeper holes. There is no hole on the seat cushion for those cover screws, but you don't really need any since the screws are shallow and will screw into the brackets anyway.The chair does smell. Some of it is probably polyurethane and some of it is probably the off-gassing. I'm sure it will go away after a bit, but be prepared for that. Some of the surfaces are also a little dusty, but I used a simple multi-purpose cleaner spray and it came right off.Chair tilts a little backwards, but when you sit on it, it feels straight so I guess that's just how it's supposed to be. The back rest has a tilt/recline feature, which you activate with a lever on the right side almost exactly like a car seat does.The included lumbar and neck pillows are filled with some cheap cushion material and covered also in PU leather. The higher end chairs will give you velour covered memory foam. You can also buy those for $30-50 if you really want to as well.I would say if you like this style of chair, the next real upgrades are real grain leather and Napa leather options. That will set you back $500+ and $700+ and you can really only get them from Noble Chairs or Secretlab. I plan to do this for the Napa at some point, albeit they are out of stock, and chances are the price will get closer to $1k. I am not fully sure if those will last longer either, you might just be better off buying this chair every few years instead.As I wrote above, PU chairs are all pretty much the same. The material really doesn't change. They all seemingly use a nylon base, PU leather, steel frame and foam for the cushions. This chair says it uses a shaping sponge, while the others say they use cold cured foam. The cold cured foam maybe is a step above, and the velour with memory foam pillows probably are too, but I'm not sure that it's worth the $300+ most of the gaming racing chairs charge. I seriously think once you start going above this price point at $100-120 or so, the next upgrade has got to be in the upholstery, and nothing else really will matter as much.Overall I'd give this chair a solid 3 or 4, but for the right person it's a 5. That's the problem with the rating system, I don't know exactly what you personally are looking for. An inexpensive chair that will last a couple of years or more and is in this style, it's a 5 easily. If you're looking for really high quality, and it's just a step for you, maybe it's a 3 or 4. But at this price point I can't justify anything below 5 stars, so I give it a 5, and I urge people that want to try this style out to seriously consider grabbing this one first, if they can't test out a higher priced chair for awhile and don't feel comfortable just dropping a higher price amount without testing something.Edit 1 Week: Smell was really terrible for the first 2-3 days, but then faded and is fine/gone now. Might not be a bad idea to let this air out a few days somewhere.The arms got wobbly and I had to re-tighten the bolts. I had to do this two times. Not sure if this will be a continuing issue or not.I'm still undecided whether I will stick with this or go for a better leather version. I really don't want to get another PU version, so for that I'll probably stick with this. But if I see a good deal on the real leather and napa leather options I'm leaning towards getting that, and giving this one to someone else as a gift.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 7, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars We, as a society, need to rethink chairs like this', 'author': 'Keegs', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Look, whoever started the trend of leather gaming chairs needs a stern talking-to.This might apply to all gaming chairs (I play games but wouldn't consider myself a serious gamer si IDK), but there are some serious problems with a chair like this:1. SupportLook, I've sat in a million offices with $1,000 chairs designed by the world's leading back-support engineers and even those hurt your back after a while. Sitting fully upright like Queen Elizabeth for 8 straight hours will do that. That being said, I haven't had any issues with this chair in that regard. Except for the pillow. The freaking pillow.This chair comes with this weird strap-on leather pillow that goes... somewhere?! It can go behind your back, but then your spine is forced to make an inverted C-shape that no human being can possibly enjoy. You can also strap it around the top like the headrest of a cheap dental seat but it literally does nothing for comfort or your neck.2. FartingOkay, okay, HEAR ME OUT ON THIS. This chair features a flat leather seat. Think that through. There's no mesh. No cloth. Your ass is literally suction-cupped to this leather panel. Where do you think that fart is going the second you feel the urge? If you're a gamer and are spending multiple hours in front of a screen, there's a big chance, you're gonna have to fart at some point. Do you peel your sweaty butt from the synthetic leather surface to let one rip? Or do you take your chances of a full-on backfire while seated?And that's only the start of it.This seat is made of a material that, smell-wise, remembers EVERYTHING. I kid you not, I clean this seat every day because of how bad it can smell. If my cat jumps up on it, it smells like kitty litter (bad girl!). If I fart on it, it smells like farts. If I drop a cheeto between my legs IT SMELLS LIKE CHEETOS. And these smells linger indefinitely. If you don't regularly clean this chair, it will start to smell like everything you've ever sat on.3. HeatIf you're a human being and sweat when you're hot, ohhh boy, are you in for a treat. The adhesive properties of this faux-leather seat are honestly impressive. I haven't done this but I 100% believe if you sat on this chair naked for 20 seconds, you could pick it up with you and walk away with it stuck to your back.In the winter it was fine, honestly. But once summer hit and I stared wearing shorts again and, Gods forbid, I didn't wear a shirt?! Game. Over. I was sitting upright like Queen Elizabeth all on my own in a desperate attempt to keep my back away from my own chair. And, without a comfortable black, you're sitting on a freaking stool. So be ready to crank the AC lest you become part of the chair like old Boostrap Bill stuck on the side of The Flying DutchmanIN CONCLUSION: It's fine. Do I miss my old chair that completely broke? Yeah. Does this one look good? Yeah! Does it support my back and keep me 100% comfortable? NOPE. Should we, as a society, rethink chairs like this? Yes, I think so.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 24, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Experience Comfort and Style with the Homall Gaming Chair', 'author': 'Phil Salvo', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I recently purchased the Homall Gaming Chair, and I must say that it has exceeded my expectations in terms of comfort, style, and functionality. This high-back computer chair not only provides excellent support for long hours of sitting but also adds a touch of gaming-inspired aesthetics to my workspace.One of the standout features of the Homall Gaming Chair is its ergonomic design. The chair is designed to support proper posture and reduce strain on the back, neck, and shoulders. The high backrest provides ample support for the entire spine, while the adjustable headrest and lumbar cushions offer additional support and comfort where needed. The chair's ergonomic features have made a noticeable difference in alleviating discomfort during long gaming or work sessions.In addition to its ergonomic design, the Homall Gaming Chair offers customizable adjustability. The chair features a 360-degree swivel, allowing for easy movement and adjustment. The seat height is adjustable, offering versatility for users of different heights. The tilt and recline function enable me to find the perfect angle for optimum comfort during gaming or working, further enhanced by the adjustable armrests.The build quality and materials of the Homall Gaming Chair are impressive. The chair is made with high-quality leather and cushioning, giving it a premium look and feel. The leather is durable and easy to clean, ensuring longevity. The chair's sturdy construction ensures stability, and it can support weights of up to 300 pounds, making it suitable for a wide range of users.Another standout feature of the Homall Gaming Chair is its racing-inspired design. The chair features bold and vibrant color combinations, creating an eye-catching focal point in any gaming or office setup. The sleek lines and aggressive styling add an element of excitement to my workspace, making it more visually appealing.Assembly of the Homall Gaming Chair was straightforward, thanks to the included instructions and labeled parts. It took only a short amount of time to put together, and the necessary tools were included in the package. The chair's clear instructions made the process hassle-free, allowing me to start using it in no time.Overall, I highly recommend the Homall Gaming Chair to gamers, professionals, and anyone seeking a comfortable and stylish seating solution. Its ergonomic design, adjustable features, premium build quality, and striking aesthetics make it a top choice for those spending long hours at their desk. Elevate your gaming or work experience with the Homall Gaming Chair and enjoy hours of comfortable seating in style.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: NEO CHAIR Office Chair Computer Desk Chair Gaming - Ergonomic High Back Cushion Lumbar Support with Wheels Comfortable Black Leather Racing Seat Adjustable Swivel Rolling Home Executive
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars GOOD QUALITY AND VERY BEAUTIFUL. WORTH BUYING.', 'author': 'loulou Snyder', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The order came in a very timely manner. BUT, You won\'t see it and specifically look for it when you sit here, right? It is unnoticable if you do not specifically look and put your hands in smooth test for it. The leather stitching is a little too tight when I inspected it though, as if the fabric was extended a little too much. But it is okay after everything was assembled. It was just perfect and soft looking afterwards. Just do not pull the fabric or rub on it.The seat and cushion though are SO SOFT AND COMFORTABLE! The chair itself was the perfect size for me. I am 4\'11 and 122 lbs. It is firm and cushy for me. The back support was very "pocky" for my neck and spine. After working for an hour or so my back, neck and spine gets intense and I lean back to a very pocky chair that eases my neck and back of my shoulders. The spin is stable too and the roll is easy and smooth, even with my 2" carpet.But I always recommend everyone to wipe the whole thing up. Just to make sure the leather and the whole chair itself is clean. I think this will last a long time for me. :DIt is pretty. It is comfortable. And it serves it\'s purpose. I think for the price I got it for, IT IS 100% SATISFACTORY.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Definity Worth the Price', 'author': 'Terri', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Needed a new office chair so I tried this one. Overalll very happy with this purchase and I would highly recommend it - especially at this price!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Some minor cosmetic issues out the box but not bad at all', 'author': 'M. Mason', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Needed an office desk chair to work from home in. Since I would be working 8 plus hours a day, I wanted a comfortable chair. I also wanted a chair that was sturdy and had a metal wheelbase. This chair was one of the few in the range I wanted to work within that has a metal wheelbase. It‚Äôs an attractive piece. Also, the weigh capacity for this chair is approximately 300 lbs. I‚Äôm around 225 lbs, which was another reason, I went with this chair, I wanted something I knew would support my weight. I just finished assembling the chair and have only sat in it for a few minutes. Here is my early review. I would have given a higher rating if it weren‚Äôt for some minor blemishes in the appearance I spotted immediately out of the box. First, the paint had several scratch marks on one of the arms. There was a dark mark on the bottom seat cushion that did not easily rub off with a spit rub. I‚Äôm not sure if it is a mark or tiny tear, but I decided not to mess with it too much and potentially make it worse. The other arm of the chair, which the arms are made of a hard plastic (for some reason not metal), had a gouge in it and was split about a half of an inch or so. Probably damaged in shipping, though package looked undamaged. As far as the assembly of the chair, I did not find it very difficult. I completely assembled in approximately 20 minutes by myself. Assembly tip: Screw in screws prior to assembling arms and back cushion. Some of the material from the cushions slightly cover holes. Also, do not tighten screws before arms and back cushion are all attached. I would advise to lifting arms up (if laying cushion on its side, so screws go all the way down into the holes straight. Tighten screws while lifting up on the arms to ensure they go in straight. If you have put together a desk, bookcase or chair before, you should not have a problem with this chair. My final point of this review is in regards to the comfort of this chair. Again, I have only sat in it for a few minutes and I will update this review later if it becomes necessary. However, as of this writing, I am fairly pleased with the comfort of this chair. It also feels pretty darn sturdy! At my size, it doesn‚Äôt feel overwhelmed and appears to be able to support someone much larger. While sitting, there‚Äôs at least 3 to 4 inches of room on both sides of me. I do not feel restricted at all. Furthermore, with the back of the chair in locked position, in my opinion, there is very good support. Nothing feels uncomfortable. My only being picky issue would be the cushioning on the arm rests could be thicker and softer; but it‚Äôs nothing major. Quite frankly, this chair feels better than my office chair where I work (which I‚Äôm sure is a more expensive chair). In conclusion, in an early review, I‚Äôd like to give a glowing report, but the minor blemishes immediately out the box, annoyed me pretty quickly. However, the relatively easy assembly, combined with the sturdiness and comfort allows me to recommend this product at this time.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 27, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A Great Chair', 'author': 'Rick', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Had a few problem's at first but their support team is the best I've had the pleasure to work with. This is a great company support team.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Initial/immediate review (to-be-udpated)', 'author': 'Carl', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'So I put this chair together about an hour ago and I\'ve got to say...I\'m impressed for the price. I read the reviews and was hesitant, but went through with the purchase.Assembly was easy and took me about 30 minutes from cutting the box open. ---The legs seam solid and sturdy; When assembling them the legs were tight and stiff before screwing in, so it seems like a solid base. ---Decent quality wheels (I\'m on low-mid height carpet, can\'t comment on wood/vinyl/tile noise). --- the plastic arms do seem thick and solid enough, but I could see how, over time, outwards pressure could make them snap. That\'s not how I sit, so no issue for me. --- I saw a few pictures of the metal under the seat breaking, but it seams thick enough for me. If you\'re pushing that 300 lb limit, maybe it\'ll go over time. I\'m only 160 lb. --- no squeaking or any sort of noise when moving around. --- Initial thoughts on comfort: the chair feels and is shaped comfortably. I\'m 6\'2" and did not expect to be able to rest my head back. I can\'t, as expected. Cushions are somewhat stiff (expected when new), but still very comfortable. I know it will break in some over time. Arm padding is nice, but I think it could be a tad bit thicker. Mine don\'t look as this as they do in the photos.overall, very happy right off the bat. Besides one indentation in the leather (which will come out in a little time), no damage or broken pieces at all. I will update this review in the future, once I\'ve actually put some use into the chair. -Would recommend for this price range, based off my initial thoughts.(2 MONTHS OF USE) - I\'ve had the chair for just over 2 months. After 1 month, I could see the imprints of the springs coming through the padding of the seat. Still can\'t really feel the springs, so it\'s not an issue "yet". Nothing has broken, chair is still silent and I\'m still happy with it. The padding could be better, but I\'ll probably just get a new seat pad eventually (if I start feeling the springs)...... Still happy with the price I paid for it, but padding needs improved. for long-term usage.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice comfy chair', 'author': 'Robert Hamby', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Chair goes together very easily, manufacture includes extra pieces in case you loose one or if one of the originals is bad. I\'m able to recline back and prop my feet up when I\'m just relaxing or reading, and I\'ve even power napped in this chair once so far. For simple purposes, I like it, despite it arriving a little banged up, and the pastel pink, paired with the white framing, is aesthetically nice. 4 out of 5.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars amazing chair for the price', 'author': 'Braden', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I felt obligated to write a review since literally none of the reviews here were helpful / had pictures. The wheels do not just ‚Äúpop in‚Äù; I spent maybe 30 minutes trying to figure out what I was doing wrong before someone came to help me and they decided to hammer in the wheels.WITH THAT BEING SAID - this chair is amazing for the price. It‚Äôs comfortable (not SUPER comfortable but I went from sitting on a wood-and-metal accent chair for a year to this so obviously this feels amazing to me) and offers great back support! Plus it‚Äôs bright neon pink - I thought the colors would end up being duller than the picture but I was very wrong. I‚Äôm happy to say that the pink chair looks EXACTLY the same as the stock photo. It also has adjustable height and tilts back, if you‚Äôre interested in that.The only real downside is that the white plastic gets scratched / nicked easily, but honestly for a cute hot pink $80 chair I can live with that.If anything changes I‚Äôll update; I only just got this chair yesterday so I can‚Äôt be sure how long it will hold up.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Okay Chair', 'author': 'Michelle', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. I mainly got the chair for its looks and price value. The design and color are really nice, but I can\'t say the same for the design in terms of assemblage. The instructions were very clear, no issues there, but the actual assembling was pretty painful. Make sure to have another set of hands and something to hammer with. I managed to put 3/5 of the wheels in with my bare hands, but the last 2 were actually impossible, had to hammer them in so be prepared. The hammering wasn\'t so bad, make sure you hit the black part and not the wheels or it\'ll get destroyed. The painful part was the screwing. None of the screw holes lined up and I needed an extra pair of hands to push and hold them together to line up.As per the picture, the design of the holes is terrible. Why put a thinner oval shape to put the screw through when the hole is a circle. The screw didn\'t fit and if you force it, it\'ll destroy the plastic handle. That\'s why they gave a washer I guess, but when the holes already don\'t line up, putting a washer that prevents vision of where you\'re screwing made the process extremely difficult. You can assemble it given some time, but it was really unnecessarily difficult for no reason. I have assembled more complicated office chairs in less time.In terms of comfort, the chair is okay. The cushion isn\'t super plush, but it does offer support and you can easily put a cushion on top. The seat itself isn\'t too big if you like to sit criss-cross, but it still works somewhat for me with my knees protruding (5\'3", 120lb) Other than that, the office chair works well.Update: I have come back a year later of using this chair to just say it\'s not a comfortable chair and I wish I have invested in a better chair for comfort. title: Amazon Basics Ergonomic Executive Office Desk Chair with Flip-up Armrests and Adjustable Height, Tilt and Lumbar Support, Cream Bonded Leather, 29.5"D x 28"W x 43"H (Previously AmazonCommercial brand)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The most comfortable office chair and easy to put together', 'author': 'SincerelyFromMe', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The color and style of this office chair is what originally caught my eye. The very reasonable price was also a perk. When it arrived earlier than expected, I was thrilled. Instructions to put it together are pictures mostly. This is not a problem because the pictures were pretty simple. It didn‚Äôt take much time to put it together. The best part was sitting in it and being completely comfortable and confident that it is sturdy and stylish at the same time. This chair is very attractive and something that I have no problem using in my home office which other people will see.SincerelyFromMe', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Mostly comfortable but seems well made', 'author': 'Ron in Palm Springs', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Having had to sit in a chair (from a major manufacturer) that had its flaws but lasted about 6 years, this chair was a change for me. The biggest change was the lumbar support as I never had one before and I'm still getting used to it. As a reference, I am 6' tall and weigh about 200 pounds, so chair size was a concern for me when I did my shopping for a replacement. This chair seems a little small for a larger person BUT I sat in only one other chair for years so this may be an issue I just need to get used to. New shoes can feel odd at first too. I do agree the lumbar support seems to push a person forward and does somewhat restrict the length of the chair seat - about 3 inches of my legs, at my knees, do hang over without support but so far I have not experienced any discomfort. I have learned to sit flush against the seat back (VS slouching) which also maximizes use of the lumbar support which feels good but also odd as I never had the support before. Assembly was pretty easy - always a challenge to add the arms when doing it alone, but I managed. Everything else was VERY easy, and the instructions were helpful and provided enough information. The leather also seems of good quality but only time will tell. I do use the chair every day but never for more than about an hour at a time, but several times a day. The color is also nice - pleasant and nicer than bright white. I would suggest to Amazon however, that they increase the height of the seat back for us taller folk - right now it only comes to about my shoulders because I do not slouch, so resting my head against the back is impossible unless I slide my butt forward, which then offsets the use of the lumbar support. Overall, I am satisfied with my purchase and have no regrets.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So comfortable and supportive!', 'author': 'A User', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a great chair to sit in for my work all day. It is extremely comfortable and I feel supported by its sturdy structure. Good height, nice color, and it took about an hour to put together. Good deal for the price and I hope it lasts a long time!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars SO FAR, PRETTY GOOD!', 'author': 'Mike Lewis', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I just received this chair yesterday. The star ratings are based on my first impressions and I'll update this review after I've had a chance to live with this chair for a while.So far, it's fairly impressive. It was boxed well and the unpacking simple. The instructions were clear (assuming a person is able to follow pictures that show how to assemble a thing). The necessary hardware was easily identified. The only bump in the road for me was that the instructions show a screwdriver-type tool to tighten the screws but the actual tool provided was an Allen wrench. I have arthritis in my hands so I would have preferred the tool that was shown. Not a reason to prevent someone from purchasing this chair, just my personal preference. It took me about 15 minutes to assemble the chair.It looks great! The floor in my office is ceramic tile and the wheels roll effortlessly over that surface. I also tried it over tight pile carpet. Rolled easily on that service as well. The seat is well padded as is the seatback. I'm 6', 220 lbs. The lumbar support feels very good and hits my lower back in the perfect spot for me. The arms swing up and down very smoothly. The controls for positioning the chair up and down and tilting the back takes some getting used to but once mastered (took about 30 seconds) work well.I sit at my desk several hours throughout the day. I'll be looking to see how well everything holds up in the coming weeks and will revisit this initial review. So far, it's yet another Amazon Essential item that appears to be an excellent value.UPDATE OCTOBER 14, 2020: Three weeks in and I'm very happy with this chair. The seat has now conformed to my butt and the back support continues to be excellent. I actually spend a lot more time watching TV in this chair than I did with my previous office chair. The only thing that will remain uncertain for a while is how long the bonded leather lasts. Not expecting a problem though as Amazon Essential stuff is pretty good.UPDATE: FEBRUARY 8, 2021 - Recent events have me sitting at my computer for 6-8 hours a day. THIS IS THE MOST COMFORTABLE OFFICE CHAIR I HAVE EVER HAD! If you happen to buy this chair I'm willing to bet that you won't be disappointed.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 22, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Major low back support - maybe too much for some', 'author': 'BornForTech', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Start by saying I really like this chair. Needed something for the bedroom desk, so did a lot of looking on Amazon before picking the AmazonCommercial Ergonomic High-Back chair. Liked the color, liked the look, like the way the arms can get out of the way. All important for where the chair was going to be placed. As I read all the reviews I noticed many folks either loved it, or seemed to hate it. Thought I\'d give it a shot. I\'m about 5\' 8" and about 150lbs. Currently using a Lazy Boy Big and Tall chair at the upstairs desk, so figured it may not work. 275 pound weight limit keeps one of the family members out of this one. The chair came a couple of days late (USPS), but no big deal. The box was in good shape and the contents were clean and perfect. Read in the reviews it was easy to put together, and it really is super easy. One person job, just needed wife for a few minutes to help line up the back of the chair in the last step. You just have to keep in mind what is in the manual, DO NOT TIGHTEN ALL THE SCREWS UNTIL IT IS PUT TOGETHER. Getting the holes lined up, with the arms loose was not a problem at all. Solid chair since it is metal and not cheap plastic. Think it will last awhile. Another reviewer noted she got a couple of greasy spots on the material from the hardware, so I kept that in mind while putting it together and it stayed clean. Used plastic disposable gloves to handle the bottom parts and screws.The only other thing to note is probably why some folks don\'t like the chair. It has big time low back support, almost too much support. For me it\'s fine, for some it might be a bit much. Otherwise, it is a really comfortable chair for sitting long periods of time. And, it really looks great. Again, perfect for the bedroom desk. Would buy it again. (might order one for a brother-in-law who needs really good low back support!) Thanks for reading the review, hope it helps you.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 31, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awsome chair', 'author': 'Don Page', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This chair was easy to assemble and very comfortable. I really like the lumbar support because I can occasionally sit in the chair to watch a movie without getting up. Everything works as described.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Not high enough and too much side-to-side wobble', 'author': 'Daniel Taylor', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'My last office chair was a gaming chair which was fine at first. But in just a couple of years the padding wore out, the "leather" started to flake off, and the gas cylinder started to fail.I decided to spend a little more money this time and bought this chair based on reviews about the padding. Naturally when it was delivered I got super busy with some other life events and didn\'t even assemble it until the return window had closed. That\'s on me. But I wasn\'t too worried about it given the reviews and the higher price tier.Assembled it tonight and the cushioning is quite good and seems like it will last. Just two problems. One is that it has a short gas cylinder which sits very low in the wheel assembly, and it simply cannot be adjusted tall enough. Two is that it has a disturbing side-to-side wobble.I had a spare replacement cylinder I originally bought for the gaming chair, then decided the other parts were failing too so I never used it. I tried that one but it doesn\'t fit correctly, i.e. the lever mechanism won\'t make it go up and down. So the cylinder on this chair is not only short, it\'s non-standard and cannot be replaced should it fail.I hate buying office chairs because there are a million models all competing and all cutting corners to compete. No one buying chairs has any hope of picking out better models, so better models never have a chance in the market. My old one used cheap padding, cheap leather, and a cheap cylinder. This one seems to use better padding and leather, but literally short changed me with a short, non-standard cylinder. How do companies mess up this badly? Literally another inch of travel would be fine. Heck, from what I can see of the wheel assembly, a better hole would keep the cylinder sitting higher and fix the wobble.I am very disappointed and wish I could return it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful Chair but Not High Enough', 'author': 'stuchols', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I ordered this chair as a deal of the day. Great price and delivered in 2 days. The chair is beautiful, a soft ivory leather with excellent stitching. No flaws whatsoever. I can only give this 3 stars, however, because at its highest setting the chair is too low for me. I am 5‚Äô 4‚Äù tall, so I‚Äôm not super short. But when I sit behind my desk in this chair, I am not at a comfortable height to perform most everyday duties. I am using a 2‚Äù cushion to adjust the height to a comfortable position. The chair height from floor to the highest seat setting was not given in the description. My bad. I should have looked! After my husband put the chair together for me (very easy), I thought I could make it work. However, after a couple weeks, I knew it wasn‚Äôt possible. Disassembling and returning would be a hassle, so I am keeping the chair. In hindsight, I should have looked for the seat height (although not there at the time) and compared to other chairs. I since have found one that is 24‚Äù high, which would have been perfect! I‚Äôm writing this review so you can learn from my mistake. If you are taller, by all means buy this beautiful chair! you will love it!! If you are my height or shorter, look elsewhere.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love this chair immensely.', 'author': 'joni crane', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Honestly was not expecting much. It always looks nice online and the price was less than half of what I have paid for office chairs - especially since I have back problems‚ù§Ô∏è it took 5 minutes to put together, is beautiful to look at, it matches my entire office set and is extremely comfortable to sit inü•≤Love this chair and would buy again.!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best chair ever!', 'author': 'Melissa N.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have arthritis in my lower back so it‚Äôs tricky to find a chair that doesn‚Äôt cause pain after a bit. I‚Äôve only had this for a few days but it‚Äôs amazing! I do wish the price was a little lower, though I did get it on sale. I also love the gray color - my last two chairs were brown and black so it‚Äôs a nice change. Classy looking!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Office Desk Computer Chair, Ergonomic High Back Comfy Swivel Gaming Home Mesh Chairs with Wheels, Lumbar Support, Adjustable Headrest, Comfortable Pillow,Soft Arms,120¬∞tilt for Bedroom,Study,Grey
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good quality', 'author': 'Josi', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bougth this chair for gaming to replace my old gaming chair. Aesthetic wise gaming chairs are better but this chair is super comfortable and has relieved my back pain a lot. The headrest is awesome and i can spend many hours sitting on it with 0 issue. It was easy to assemble with clear instructions and its super affordable. Many other chairs 2-3x the price of this one that offer the same or worse quality. Would recommended for both gaming and office work.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable and easy to build', 'author': 'Peter Surette', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This chair saved my back after years of using a basic desk chair. Took less than 10 mins to unbox and put together, and it looks fantastic. Great desk chair for a great price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Affordable but Uncomfortable', 'author': 'Carson M.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The SMUG Ergonomic Mesh Office Chair, touted as a budget-friendly option, offers various adjustable features but falls short in providing adequate comfort and durability. While it may appeal to those on a tight budget, my experience with this chair has left me unsatisfied with its overall quality.On the positive side, the chair boasts an ergonomic design with adjustable headrest, lumbar support, tilt function, and swivel rolling features. These adjustable elements offer flexibility for finding a comfortable sitting position and provide essential support during long hours of work.However, the main issue lies in the comfort level, particularly for users over 150lbs. The seat cushion bottoms out too quickly, leading to discomfort and inadequate support for heavier individuals. This limitation significantly impacts the overall comfort and usability of the chair, making it unsuitable for extended periods of use.Furthermore, despite its budget-friendly price, the chair\'s build quality and durability leave much to be desired. It did not withstand regular use for an extended period and showed signs of wear and tear sooner than expected. The overall construction felt flimsy and lacking in robustness.While the low cost may be appealing, it\'s important to consider the trade-offs in terms of comfort and longevity. As the saying goes, "You get what you pay for," and the SMUG Ergonomic Mesh Office Chair is a prime example of a budget option that sacrifices comfort and durability for affordability.In conclusion, the SMUG Ergonomic Mesh Office Chair may be an economical choice, but its lack of comfort, particularly for users over 150lbs, and its subpar durability make it a less-than-ideal option for daily use. If you prioritize comfort and long-lasting support, investing in a higher-quality chair may be a better choice in the long run.Edit: After initially writing my review, their customer support team reached out to me in an effort to provide a solution to my issue, I am very pleased with the solution I received and this level of customer service is commendable. I‚Äôm updating my review to 4 stars (from 2 stars) because of this!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Third time is a charm', 'author': 'pma', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is the third different chair I have ordered and the only one I am keeping. This one is comfortable,, was easy to assemble (33 minutes) and finally I am a happy camper. Interestingly, this one was the least expensive. My recommendation.... buy this one first and forget about the others!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great office chair!', 'author': 'Melanie Sweeney', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This was easy to put together, sturdy & quite comfortable. The lower lumbar padding & neck rest is supportive. I highly recommend this chair!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for the price', 'author': 'Manny flores', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I‚Äôm a 5‚Äô11 220lb (gym type not just fat lol) and it holds me solid for the price. Took my expensive ergonomic chair to work and have this one as a home desk one and couldn‚Äôt have made a better choice. The quality is surprising for the price and it leans back comfortably', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Seat cushion is not comfortable', 'author': 'Erica', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I work from home and decided to get this chair because of neck pain. The seat cushion isn‚Äôt comfortable and kinda flat.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly yow it looks', 'author': 'alexandra castillo', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It was easy to assemble by my self and very comfortable. It also came earlier then expected which is a plus.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great chair for the price', 'author': 'Anth', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I upgraded from a cheap $30 chair and this was a big upgrade.
