The only con I'd say is if you want to sit straight up there is no adjustment forward to the back of the chair.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very stable and well built.', 'author': 'Lee M', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was amazed at the quality of this chair.The parts are very organized by step.I would recommend this chair to most all adults up to slightly above average size. I am about 5\'9" and about 280lbs. I fit comfortably, but someone not much larger than I would have issues.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Sweetcrispy Office Computer Desk Chair, Ergonomic Mid-Back Mesh Rolling Work Swivel Task Chairs with Wheels, Comfortable Lumbar Support, Comfy Flip-up Arms for Home, Bedroom, Study, Student, Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Don‚Äôt Spend $100+ on a Chair, Get This One!', 'author': 'Corinne Norman', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'So I was super torn about buying that viral office chair on TikTok that you can cross your legs in, but I did NOT wanna buy into the TikTok shop. This is the perfect office chair for the price that isn‚Äôt ugly and super comfortable. I can cross my legs in it and sit at my desk comfortably at any height, and the fact that you can raise or lower the armrests adds to being able to sit crisscross applesauce. It was actually stupid easy to put together‚Äîthe directions were maybe 7-8 steps max, and it took me maybe 30 minutes to assemble the chair with only the tools they provided. No drill necessary.I wanted a chair that wasn‚Äôt going to kill my back but was still cushiony and this one is it. The back support isn‚Äôt so stiff that you can‚Äôt slouch, and the cushioning is breathable and soft. I weigh 185 and this chair is definitely sturdy, including with the adjustable tilt function. I thought this chair reclined like A LOT but you really only get 5¬∞-10¬∞ of tilt, which is still nice.10/10 would recommend for WFH. Got this chair for $60 and can‚Äôt believe I was looking at chairs over $100.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great chair for the price', 'author': 'Natalie', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The Sweetcrispy Office Computer Desk Chair has proven to be a game-changer in my quest for the perfect blend of comfort and functionality. As someone spending long hours at a desk, the ergonomic design, and user-friendly features of this chair have truly stood out.The comfort level is unparalleled, making it a standout choice for extended work sessions. The mid-back mesh provides just the right amount of support, ensuring that even after a full 8-hour day, my back feels well-cushioned and fatigue-free. The ergonomic design is particularly beneficial for those with unique body shapes, like myself‚Äîa woman with a bigger-than-normal rear end. The chair molds to the contours of the body, providing a customized and supportive experience that caters to individual needs.The ease of mobility is another noteworthy feature. The ability to effortlessly wheel around the office adds a level of convenience that enhances productivity. The smooth swivel and rolling mechanism make it a breeze to transition between tasks without the need for awkward readjustments.The chair's construction is robust and durable, assuring me that it's built to withstand the rigors of daily use. The mesh material not only contributes to the overall modern aesthetic but also promotes ventilation, preventing discomfort during warmer days.Assembly was a straightforward process, and the chair's adjustable features, such as height and tilt, make it adaptable to different workstations and personal preferences. The inclusion of armrests adds an extra layer of comfort, making it a well-rounded choice for those in search of a chair that ticks all the ergonomic boxes.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great deal', 'author': 'Abbi Hammons', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This chair is a pretty good deal for the price. Are there better chairs out there? Probably. Are they going to cost 2-3 times the price? Absolutely. For $60, this is a great chair and I don\'t intend to return it.Good:Support - normally my back and neck hurt after an hour or so of sitting in my "nice" chair, but this chair has helped reduce the pain significantly. The seat is pretty cushiony and the back is firm but a little flexible.Size - much smaller than my previous chair which means it fits under my desk, even with my legs crossed, and is much more maneuverable in general.Sturdy - I feel like I can lean back and it isn\'t going to fall apart.Easy to assemble - very easy to assemble, probably took me about 25-30 minutes and I didn\'t have any questions along the way.Not bad just "eh":Wheels - the wheels aren\'t the best, they kind of drag the ground when you slide and I do have a silicone mat to help with that. I may get new, nicer wheels.Fabric - while the seat and back fabric are soft and comfortable, the mesh collects any and everything very easily and it doesn\'t just come off with a swipe of your hand. So if you have long hair, dog hair, crumbs, etc it will all cling to the fabric and you\'ll need to lint roll it a couple of time to get everything out.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Loving it. Best value for the price', 'author': 'Myra', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'For the price, I am absolutely loving this chair. I‚Äôve had it for about a month now and find it to be comfortable. I don‚Äôt like having really heavy bulky chairs, but with that usually comes a sacrifice in padding and comfort. While this chair is not overly plush, I like that the back frame isn‚Äôt covered in hard plastic, but a kind of flexible(ish) mesh that is tight and offers a decent amount of support. I also like that the arm rests can move up and down as I frequently find myself wishing I did and didn‚Äôt have them. LolThere is room in the back of the chair for storage as it suggests. I haven‚Äôt used it much, but when I have it‚Äôs been ok. I could see where trying to overfill it would lead the chair to be lumpy in the back. Definitely better for slimmer storage like a folder or notebook.Overall Id say that for the price, it has a lot of value. It was easy to put together and supplies were provided. Packaging was minimal, but still enough to protect the contents.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic Value For A Quality Product', 'author': 'ShopSearchBuy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'First of all, I was not compensated or given any incentive to write this review; this is my own honest opinion and experience with the chair. When I first removed everything from the box, I was a bit dismayed because there were more pieces to assemble than I expected. However, the process was easy and took less than 30 minutes. Assembly was facilitated by perfectly written instructions (see photo) and excellent compartmentalization and labeling (see photo) of the included hardware. There was a compartment with extra bolts, which I did not need, and the package includes the only tool needed for assembly. I am using the chair as I type this and the seat padding feels very comfy. I love that the chair has moveable arms so that I can raise them to push it fully into the chair space of my desk. I also love the adjustable tension backrest and built in lower back support. I am completely satisfied with this comfortable desk chair and for the price it is an outstanding value.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing chair!', 'author': 'Tamlyn', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was looking on amazon for a cheap alternative to all those nice gaming chairs, and found this one! so comfortable, easy to put together, and all around so amazing for the price! my brother saw mine and said he was getting one too! very worth it :) \U0001fa77', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome chair!', 'author': 'WSOP_50', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Similar chairs are going for $100+ at the local office supply stores. This chair is a bargain and worth every penny - easy to assemble and very comfortable. The best feature is the fold-up armrests.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very comfy chair', 'author': 'Vail Teal', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very easy to assemble. Comes with everything needed. It‚Äôs sturdy, comfortable, and cheaper than buying locally. I‚Äôm overall impressed.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good looking chair', 'author': 'K. Lin', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The item came very well packaged. There were instructions and the different types of screws/bolts were clearly labeled and identified for each step.The hand rests are held in place at the sides of the seat back and the underside of the seat cushion. Assembling the cushion to the hand rests was the only tricky part since you have to put the entire thing upside down. I used another chair to hold the cushion in place while I screwed in the bolts on the underside of the cushion.Once assembled, I noticed a slight unevenness of the hand rests which leads to unevenness of the seat back in relation to the seat cushion. The hand rests don't appear to be aligned/parallel. The unevenness appears to be due to the location of the screw hole positions under the seat cushion. The 2 sets of screw hole positions are not aligned for both hand rests.It's very slight but is noticeable when you look at the chair carefully. Thankfully, I don't think I feel the unevenness when I sit on it.The plastic casters don't move very smoothly. I notice they don't respond to a change in direction fast enough so I can feel the slight tug when trying to move the chair from one location to another. These casters appear to be exactly the same size and shape of another chair I bought from the same vendor though a different style chair but on that other chair, the wheels glide so smoothly.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars a good chair at this price point', 'author': 'shopgirl', 'rating': 4, 'content': "this chair was relatively easy to assemble. it took about an hour working alone. one tip is to keep the box handy so you will have a place to set the seat when attaching parts to the bottom side of the chair. I have a plush behind, so I do wish the chair was deeper, but with that said the cushion is pretty comfortable. for a thinner person, the dimension would probably be perfect. I like that the arm rests can be moved up and out of the way. I would have preferred adjustable height arm rests, but these are low enough they don't hinder working up close to the desk. the seat does feel like it tilts a bit forward. I am thinking that is something I will adapt to and not even notice within a weeks time. I am using this chair in a carpeted office and it does not roll very smoothly across the carpet but it works. I do wish the feet were longer. I liked being able to rest my feet up on the legs of my last offie chair and that is not possible in this chair. all in all this seems like a fairly decent chair. Is it perfect? No, but the price, under $60.00? You can't beat that.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: NEO CHAIR Office Chair Computer High Back Adjustable Flip-up Armrests Ergonomic Desk Chair Executive Diamond-Stitched PU Leather Swivel Task Chair with Armrests Lumbar Support (Black)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This chair is awsome!!!', 'author': 'Rachel', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was in the market for a comfortable desk chair for my home office. I had a slightly higher budget but decided to go with this one due to the overall look, reviews, and functionality. I also needed something sturdy as I spend almost all of my day in my chair. Here is my review:Assembly: Comes with all the necessary tools and an easy instruction. I was a bit worried, but everything lined up perfectly and I finished within 30 minutes if not less, by myself. I kept the wrench tool to tighten the bolts every so often so I can use it longer - perhaps the reason why the chair feels really solid even with such heavy use.Comfort: The seat itself is super comfortable. It seems to be a mix of spring and foam, kind of like a sofa or a mattress. The back and arm is also cushioned well. I sit in it for hours without breaks and it is much more comfortable than my last chair which was supposed to be super ‚Äúergonomic‚Äù. The armrest is great for my elbows but sometimes I do need to put it up to kind of lean closely into my desk/monitor to focus. Lastly, the wheels have been pretty smooth, both on my floor and floor mat.Quality: The leather is surprisingly higher quality than expected. It‚Äôs durable and soft, definitely not the kind that would start disintegrating and flaking away. The overall craftmanship is quite great at this price point. The construction seems more than reasonable. I haven‚Äôt had any issues with squeaking or wobbliness so far, which is great because I am on the bigger side and use this chair quite a lot.Overall a super comfortable chair at a very reasonable and fair price point. I would highly recommend this chair to anyone looking for a reliable office chair. I was in the market for a comfortable desk chair for my home office. Bought these for comfortable chairs for the kitchen table. The color is a pretty cream, they are comfortable and we love that they swivel and rock a little.They can rip easily, plastic not leather so we are trying to be careful with them, but we think the chairs are a great price, look and offer comfort for the money.Easy enough to put together. We are very happy thus far.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Foam in some parts is bad.', 'author': 'Sidd', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This is a good looking chair and comfortable. The foam inside seems very less and of low quality.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Arrived two days early, had easy to follow instructions, assembled in about 45 minutes', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Unlike most of the negative reviews I've read about this chair:1. We'll just have to see.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 19, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "1.0 out of 5 stars Wasn't originally anything to write home about, but...", 'author': 'Willow Lewis', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'Booooooy howdy. While the shipping was quick, I ordered it originally with Amazon Prime, so I can\'t even give it brownie points for that.When it showed up, manufacturing glue had clogged some of the bolt/screw holes, but that was easily cleaned out. What wasn\'t so easy to deal with, however, was that the holes *barely* lined up, and every one was crooked, so getting the thing assembled was a nightmare and a half. Solidly would have had an easier time assembling Ikea furniture, it was *that* sort of project, with generally poor instructions and the like. While this was a source of frustration unending for about four hours the night it showed up, as well as four hours where even a sailor would blush if they walked in my front door, it eventually got there. Now, I excused this as "bulk manufactured goods" issues and "only $150 on Amazon for something \'nice\' that landed on the cheaper end of the category" issues, and was just going to leave it at that. Nothing to write home about. And then it was just one thing after the other with this thing.Leaned to the left a bit when it was sitting there, but not enough to notice unless you were looking at it from the back and really looking, which got accentuated of you sat in it but, again, it was only really noticeable when you looked at the back.The instructions say to tighten the bolts/screws every six(6) months. It didn\'t last last that long. It doesn\'t matter though, as we had to bust out the her key and tighten them every *two weeks*. The arm rests and the wheels were the primary culprits here, but it was basically universal.The lock for the reclining function kept slipping, and it was like it didn\'t even exist. Want to get flung backwards randomly when you have the audacity to lean just a little back? This chair can do that for you.And then the straw that broke the camel\'s (as well as nearly my husband\'s) back. Like you can see in the picture attached, even giving up on using the recliner lock won\'t stop you from getting flung backwards by surprise with this chair apparently. Wasn\'t the bolts or anything like that. No, of course not. It was the plastic (which, might I add, isn\'t as solid as it looks in the first picture. It\'s partially hollow, as shown in the second.) that decided to give way, 0 warning, with pretty obvious results. My husband got flung flat and had to catch himself to avoid worse injury, and there could have been other collateral damage as well, doubly so if he hadn\'t caught himself. Which, honestly, *is* something to write home about, thus the review.Was it easy to put together? Absolutely not. Was/is it supportive? About as much as it was easy to put together. Was/is it ergonomic? Not really? Honestly, ergonomics don\'t matter here though. All around, the whole experience? -15573893483726/10 would NOT recommend.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 29, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars ok chair, but pretty cheap construction', 'author': 'Ramsarius Hennisuis', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'So, I went into this purchase knowing the chair was going to be on the lower end of quality, given the price point of the item. I wasn\'t disappointed. The chair was very easy to assemble, even by myself. I didn\'t have any issues with assembly, and I didn\'t look at the instructions once until after I had finished to confirm I had assembled it correctly. I just followed what seemed reasonable given the number of bolts for a given portion of the assembly. Take this with a bit of a grain of salt, as I have a degree in mechanical engineering and am no stranger to the nuances of product design and development. The overall construction of the chair is well designed from a visual standpoint. The chair is relatively comfortable, albeit a little stiff on the cushioning. I\'m a little on the leaner side, so I find the space between the arm rests to be adequate, but the arm rests are a little high for me (but I do have longer arms than average). I\'m somewhat tall (6\'4") but the chair\'s height accommodates my dimensions rather well. The construction of the chair is a little lacking in the hidden regions, though. The stitching in the cushioning seems adequate and moderately well done, but the staples holding the underside together is a bit less than desirable and shows the build quality. The biggest gripe I have about the chair is the lack of stiffness in the mechanical components of the chair, beneath the seat. They\'ve been engineered to be on the less expensive side so they provide more flexure than I would have liked, or what I would have personally specified if I had designed it up. The chair wobbles from side to side with very little leaning in the chair. It also clunks a little bit when I lean to the left, just putting my weight on the arm rest as I would normally do when reading something while resting my head on my hand. It doesn\'t do this when I lean to the right. I\'ve been very cautious to ensure that all the fasters were adequately torqued to ensure proper tension on the bolts without stripping, so I\'m confident its not loose fasteners that are slipping, but there\'s somewhere else in the tilt assembly that its not very tight. The high flexure area could also stem from the wood they used for the seat core, rather than stiffening it with a piece of metal, but without knowing I\'m only guessing. I can see they\'ve engineered this to barely meet the minimum requirements of tolerance and meet the regime of acceptability where those looking for a cheap chair will tolerate it, but those looking for more stiffness and build quality will opt for a more expensive chair. The single pin that holds the two tilt brackets together is a bit thin and ideally would have been a bit larger in diameter, with a minimal impact to the end item price. Another thing that would have stiffened things up quite a bit would have been using 14ga steel for the tilt brackets, rather than the 16ga that they used. it would have cost an extra dollar or two in material cost, but would have meant a very different end user experience I think. Additionally, the cost of the extra hardware in the hardware kit would have been much more aptly put toward some lock washers rather than relying on the locking features on the underface of the button head socket head screws provided. The chair does ok, it just shows that it could have reached a little higher for minimal cost. I would have gladly paid an extra $50 for a more sturdy tilt bracket assembly or upgraded piston, if it meant it felt a lot stiffer than it does now. As it stands, it feels super loose and wobbly when I sit in the chair (and I\'m not that big, I\'m tall, but I\'m barely 200 lbs soaking wet). Brand new, it feels like I\'ve had it for something like 5 years with the amount of wobble that\'s in it. But, I can\'t complain much, I did go for a budget chair after all.3-month update: still moderately comfortable, still clunking when I lean, still super wobbly (most of the the wobble comes from the gas cylinder). The arm rest foam (inside the fabric) has largely lost it\'s resilience. I would have put twice the padding on the arm rests I think or just made it more dense. As it is my elbows feel bruised from them when I spend any substantial amount of time resting my elbows on them from how hard they feel. All in all, still an inexpensive, lower-quality chair with a lot of corners cut in manufacturing.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 6, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to assemble', 'author': 'HALL15', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Super comfortable and easy to assemble !! It looks stylish, high end and is super comfy', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Poor structure, uncomfortable after an hour or two.', 'author': 'Amanda', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'First, the good:Looks good. The upholstery is apparently decent, and well constructed.Arm-rests were solid, and relatively comfortable. It was nice you could flip them up and get them completely out of the way for holding things or putting the chair completely under the desk.The shock never failed - and indeed has been put on another chair.The wheeled base was solid, and never presented a problem.Now, the bad:The chair was uncomfortable from day one. A large part of this was due to the fact that the bottom frame was weak and would develop a lean, so you would be sitting cock-eyed. But, you could lean "up-hill", and it would bend the other way. It got more uncomfortable with time.All this with a 200 lb person. The chair was rated for 300 lbs.The cushion, in fairly short order, crushed flat. That made the chair much harder on the bum than it was originally. This happened within the first month of very light usage.Screws would require re-tightening at least once a week. The chair was only used 2-4 hours a day, 4 days a week, in a home office setting.Finally, after about 6 months of the base bending and screws backing out, the wooden structure of the seat (that attaches to the base) began to splinter. That ended the chair\'s usefulness, and it was replaced before someone was injured.Overall, I feel a chair that doesn\'t last a year with light adult use should get 0 stars.However, the material, stitching, and aesthetics were really top notch.So, it lookes really good - you just can\'t actually use it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Easy to assemble, but hard to stay comfortable.', 'author': 'Thomas C.', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'This review is written after about one (1) year of regular daily use for my work-from-home job (approx. 8-12 hrs/day). To help with context, I\'m an average height-weight (5\'10", 130-ish lbs).Overall: A decent product for the price point. It doesn\'t make noise when you shift your weight, and the parts haven\'t fallen off yet. You can sit in, recline, and raise the height; it performs its chair-ly duties.Buy this if you need a good general-use chair to match the price point, but not if you sit for long periods and don\'t want to sit on a cushion, or you\'re on the slim side and want to sit up straight while also supporting your back.Arms: You can lift/lower the arms to get them out of the way, like airplane seats, but that\'s it. You cannot adjust their height when lowered, nor how wide they are (i.e., horizontally, how close/far from your body). I didn\'t realize how helpful this was until I didn\'t have it anymore. The padding is very thin -- if you lean heavily on your forearm or elbow, I recommend getting some additional cushioning or wrap to cover it.Height adjustment: The chair height itself adjusts fine. After >1 year of use, the piston doesn\'t show signs of wear or make noise, and the chair stays raised instead of slowly lowering itself throughout the day.Seat: This thing is perfect for Texas-sized butts, even with the arms down! It\'s large enough to sit in cross-legged (think yogi-style). That\'s where the pros stop. The cushion wore out fast, and it could have been more cushiony to begin with. Luckily I don\'t feel screws, plastic, sharp parts, etc., poking up, and cosmetically, it still looks fine. But MAN, will your tailbone hurt after a while (especially if, like me, you were not blessed with a big ol\' dump trunk). Also, the seat is pretty deep and cannot be adjusted. To sit up straight/ergonomically correct, I need to put a pillow behind my back to keep my knees forward of the seat edge. If you\'re of small stature and want to sit up straight but also have your back supported, look for a chair with a smaller seat and/or one that you can adjust here.Chairback: The chair does recline back and forth, but you cannot lock it into a reclined position. The only adjustment is for how much force is needed to make it recline. The curvature doesn\'t do much for lumbar support, but I\'m also a skinny guy and can\'t sit in it properly due to the seat size issue (above), so I\'m sure that plays into my comfort.Durability: No broken parts yet. The wheels still work fine (I have a plank wood floor and use a chair mat to avoid floor damage and wear and tear to the wheels). The pleather-like covering has held up and doesn\'t have permanent folds or creases. Although, I\'m only 130 lbs I\'m careful not to bump it with anything sharp, and I keep my cat\'s nails trimmed, so take that with a grain of salt.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Initial review vs once I had it for a year', 'author': 'Alicia', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'When I first got the chair it was so cute. I loved it. No issues. two weeks in, kind of squeaky but again no big deal, still love the chair.Two months ‚Äî I very much regretted my purchase. It was so loud and so squeaky when I would have work meetings, everyone could hear my chair and I was barely even moving. It was ridiculous. I am now one year in and I hundred percent hate this chair. It is so uncomfortable it makes noises no matter what I am doing. It is very cheap but hey for the price I guess it is what it is. I can sit down and work but I should have paid a little bit more and got a better quality chair. So if you are looking for a chair that is cheap and cute that you don‚Äôt sit in often this is awesome but if you are like me and work from home, I don‚Äôt suggest this chair. Btw I am not large at all so this chair or just not durable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Ergonomic Mesh Office Chair with Footrest, High Back Computer Executive Desk Chair with Headrest and 4D Flip-up Armrests, Adjustable Tilt Lock and Lumbar Support-Grey
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing Chair For the Price', 'author': 'Croff Bo', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Super breathable, comfy and ergonomic. This is the best chair and fits the price range perfectly. It takes about 30-40 mins to assemble super clear instructions and in the end it‚Äôs worth it. Sitting feels amazing, no more back discomfort or neck discomfort with the built in ergonomic back and head rest, everything is adjustable and it‚Äôs very sturdy and made of high quality plastic and mesh. Would buy again!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Supports my workday', 'author': 'Daniel Storm', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the Ink Grey version when it was on sale https://amzn.to/3UFF7gC for my home office, and it's been great. The chair has a comfortable mesh back, adjustable 4D armrests, and features like a slide seat and tilt lock that help me find a good sitting position. The lumbar support is especially helpful for my back during long hours of work. For anyone in need of a better office chair, this one is worth considering. It's comfortable, supports good posture, and has several adjustable features to fit your needs. A good buy for anyone looking to improve their office setup.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars I made my bed and now I'm sitting in it", 'author': '3loops', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Like everything I buy that I plan on keeping a long time, I researched the blank out of office chairs under $200. I would have gone over budget if I thought there was one better based on reviews and video reviews, features and price. I don\'t have very much experience with office chairs, so I let others with supposed experience and knowledge help me make a choice. Also, I think spending over $399 on a home office chair is quite possibly the definition of foolishness. So, with that out of the way, I find this chair to have mostly quality components. The most notable exception are the wheels which are a hard plastic which are horrible on our brick floors, so I replaced them with the "original rollerblade style office chair casters from Oasis". Those wheels are great and they fixed the wheel complaint for an additional thirty bucks. The seat is firm, which is great, but it isn\'t really ergonomic i.e. it lacks form, but it is wide and comfortable - I\'m 6\' and 210 pounds and over sixty. The multiple adjustments were a big selling point for me. They all work fine and feel like they will last. I especially wanted the adjustment that allows the seat to slide forward and back which isn\'t available on most office chairs in this price range, and it works fine. I was also hesitant to purchase a chair without at least a 300 pound rating because I would assume anything less would be cheaply made, and this chair feels solid and supportive. Assembly instructions are great, but it isn\'t real easy to accomplish without an extra set of hands, so keep that in mind. Given my lack of experience with office chairs, how can I give it an accurate rating? I think four stars is fair, but if it came with rollerblade style wheels (come on Colamy, better wheels wouldn\'t add much to the cost) and the seat was more ergonomic, I\'m sure it would be a five star chair in all reviews. I made my choice, and now I\'ll live (not too unhappily) with it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent office chair', 'author': 'NJ', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This chair is well worth the price. It's well made, easy to put together and very comfortable. The various adjustments you can make satisfy all needs.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great chair for good price', 'author': 'SouthernChick', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I replaced a 6 year old Staples chair that began failing with this model. I was looking for adjustable lumbar, harms, swivel, tilt and height change. The foot and head rests were a bonus. It game quicker than first communicated. It was packed well. Directions for assembly were sufficient and the online video was also very good. The marking to note the front of the seat control attachment was hard to ready, but with some more lighting we figured out which end was the \'front\' . The word front is on one end, but there is a small arrow pointed to the other end of the control, which is the real front. Easy to assemble. 10 nuts. At first I could not adjust the lumbar. I search through the other reviews and found that using an Allen wrench not supplied, I loosened the screws on the inside of the lumbar handle mechanism and it works great. The directions failed to mention lumbar support movement at all in the three page booklet that came in the box. The provided Allen wrench tool worked well, but could be used for the lumbar adjustment. I can now move the lumbar up and down without tools and it locks into place fine. I\'m 5\' 8", a large gal, and this chair is comfortable. I\'ve only used it for 2 10 hours days so far, but really like it at the moment. I love the tilt up arms, never had this on a desk chair before, but I think it will be a space saver when not using the chair. Great for a small home office.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exceptional customer service', 'author': 'Dawson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'When I first received the chair it was slightly damaged from shipping. I reached out to Colamy support about it and they were very prompt at getting this issue resolved. They sent me a replacement part as well as altered their packing process so the damage didn‚Äôt occur again in the future. The chair is also very comfortable and sturdy.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Decent but flawed in a couple of ways', 'author': 'Mastiff Mike', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'I just got the chair today, so can\'t speak to how well it\'ll hold up over time, but here are my initial impressions:Pros: - Packaged very well. Even though the outside of the box looked a tad rough, everything inside was perfectly protected. - Super easy to put together (I did it by myself in less than 15 minutes) - Comfortable to sit upright in - Rolls smoothly (on chair mat and smooth surfaces) - Armrests offer plenty of adjustability. One of my "must haves" were armrest that could be rotated up and out of the way when not needed and most of the chairs I looked at (with headrest and footrest) don\'t allow that. It\'s really the main reason I ordered this chair over other even more expensive options. If you don\'t need that feature, then you have a lot more choices than I was limited to. The armrest can be swiveled to angle in, out, or just aligned straight ahead. They have a tactile click and seem to stay in place nicely (on day 1). They also have 4 lockable height positions that slide up and away. this means that the higher they are the further forward they are (the opposite of ideally how they\'d be). This is an understandable issue with the design and in my experience is the same for every chair design that allows for the armrests to swivel up and out of the way (the support is angled, thus the raising/lower of the height follows that same angle). Not a huge issue, and one I\'m used to from my older chairs, but be aware if you have short/long arms the armrest height impacts how far forward/backward it is (I end up with it at one of the middle heights and the armrest supports from about the middle of my forearm to my elbow, which leaves the rear half the armrest untouched). I wish someone would come up with a better design that allowed for the rotate out of the way I like but also allowed for more of the armrest to be used by more of my arm. Oh well, it\'s super common to have this issue, so i don\'t fault this chair.Indifferent: - The chair is quite heavy, which is a good thing most of the time (it\'s only bad when carrying it up/down stairs or such) - The footrest could use a tad more padding (it\'s not mesh like the rest of the chair). It\'s 1/4" of foam over plastic, covered in black fabric, and so it\'s not uber comfortable. It does tuck away wonderfully when not in use, which is why the user can\'t add more padding and it would require a design tweak by the manufacturer to allow for more padding height. The footrest does have a slight curve to it which helps slightly with comfort and is appreciated. - There\'s a lack of contour (curve) to the seat and back compared to my old $99 mesh chair. Over time maybe the fabric will stretch or loosen allowing more curve (my 5 year old chair\'s mesh never stretched, so the built-in curve remained the same from day one), but if it does that\'ll lead to problems in other ways. Just know that it feels much more flat across the seat and back than most other chairs (mesh or not) so there\'s no sense of cradling or hugging like a lot of other chairs provide. - The headrest isn\'t really adjustable in a meaningful way. It does move a little up/down and it rotates, however at 5\'-10" tall I have to have it fully extended to work right so anyone taller is going to be disappointed. My wife at 5-6" found it was OK at it\'s lowest setting, but we both agree anyone shorter would probably be better off not even installing it since it\'d just be uncomfortably in the way. Also, the rotation doesn\'t do anything, it\'s only comfortable in one position so that "adjustment" isn\'t really useful.Cons: - I wish the footrest could be extended 2"-3" inches further (I\'m 5\'-10" and it\'s uncomfortably short after more than 30 minutes or so of use because of where the edge cuts into the back of my calves). Also, it wobbles a fair amount and therefore seems cheap/flimsy, but time will tell how/if it holds up. - There\'s a surprising amount of bounce to everything. The seat when sitting down or standing up ins\'t bothersome, however the armrest and back wiggles and bounces annoyingly even when locked into position. Overall it just doesn\'t feel very solid and rather feels cheaper than ideal. That said, it\'s not a case of "you get what you pay for" since I have 2 different other office chairs (one $99 mesh mid-back, and one $149 cloth high-back) and both of those feel much more solid and don\'t feel as bouncy/cheap. - The lumbar is adjustable up/down but because it\'s so far away from the fabric I only feel it when it\'s at the highest position (and then it\'s too high to be at my "lumbar") where the fabric is closest. - The back only locks in 3 positions. It\'d be nice if it also locked in a very modestly reclined position (not straight upright, but less reclined than what\'s currently offered, since that\'s the most comfortable. - The tension is WAY too light! REALLY DISAPPOINTED in this and the tensioner barely adds any tension at all! If it was easy to return, I probably would just because of this issue alone. You can\'t really lean back a little because it just keeps going back until you reach the limit (which is looking up at the ceiling reclined). And I can\'t keep it locked in a slightly reclined position, because it only locks in 3 non-user selected positions. So you\'re left with either locking it in the upright position, or just never leaning back a little, unless you want to end up staring at the ceiling. Overall it makes the chair basically only usable in the 3 positions that the user has no control over.SUMMARY: A chair that out of the box looks good and is comfortable to sit upright in, in 3 positions predetermined by the manufacturer, NOT the user. I wouldn\'t recommend it to anyone outside the height range of 5\'-6" to 5\'-10" (5\'-9" if the footrest is really important to you). As for comfort when not sitting upright or when shifting position, it lacks any sort of functional tensioner and therefore is pretty subpar and most other chairs would be better choices. I just got it so can\'t speak to longevity and how well it does/doesn\'t hold up over time.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Pretty decent, but far from perfect.', 'author': 'Eric Sellers', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Overall, I do like the chair, but it has its issues.Likes:- Quite comfortable, even for long periods of time.- Looks nice.- 3 locking back rest positions.- Arm rests can be positioned in many ways or moved out of the way completely.Dislikes:- Headrest support isn\'t strong enough so it doesn\'t stay at the angles I\'d prefer and you can\'t tighten it. Needs a way to tighten to stay in place.- Arms are too easy to adjust, causing them to move when I go to get up or reposition, which is a bit annoying. Took some getting used to but now it\'s not a big deal but these adjustment features should be lockable or more secure.- Adjustable lumbar support is an absolute joke. It doesn\'t stay in place at all. I move it all the way up and it just goes back down after applying pressure to the support. Yet another feature that requires a way of locking to work properly.- Wheels are decent and look quite nice, but are nothing compared to nicer wheels. I purchased silent rubber wheels on Amazon and they\'re leaps and bounds better in functionality.- This chair seems to be made for taller people. I\'m 5\'8" and when I have the seat at max height, my feet don\'t touch the ground when I sit all the way back. If you set the chair to recline, the seat angles up more, making it even harder to place your feet on the ground. I have a sit/stand desk so I just keep the chair and desk as low as possible when working.- The leg rest is nice to have but I only wish, AGAIN, that it was lockable. It slides in and out with ease, making repositioning in any way an annoying chore.Overall, I do think this is a really nice chair for the money. I don\'t hate it at all, but it comes with many design flaws.I\'d say research chairs of the same price point and take these pros and cons into consideration. Could be the perfect chair for you or you may want to keep searching. Good luck.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good for the price', 'author': 'D Murray', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This is my first colamy chair purchase (being the Ergonomic Mesh Office Chair), you can color me impressed :) Packing was outstanding, Part build appears to be excellent (time will tell) Now since these are made in china I can almost say their design engineers are mostly likely going with Asian sized average people, I'm 6'1 easy 250lbs the seat is ok sized could be a wee-bit larger for american market. You basiclly have to slide your body all the way back which i guess is good cause it forces the back lumbar so you have correct posture (little weird to get use to but it does feel good) old chair did not do that and you would slouch. Does have semi-strong chemical odor which should good away hopefully. Instructions were lacking a little they had these depth offset washers/standoffs no mention of them in the manual do you need them, dont you need them? I'd suggest picking up some washers for the seat mounting holes they appear drilled a little to large so the screw head is basically only holding 30% when it should be 50% or more surface area that and the manual is only short fall I see so far. Note: I am not using the included casters I purchased the inline rollers which have worked the best for any surface shag, hard, berber, etc..", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Step above normal office chair no question.', 'author': 'Rick Barchers', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Super comfy for a big guy. I am on the upper limit of the weight rating. Love the foot rest, helps my back when sitting all day.Wish arms came up further.Wish there were more locked positions for tilting.Overall I like the chair and don‚Äôt regrets the purchase. I use it to work in all day.Would I purchase again? Not sure. I think it is going to be around for a while. Years at least. Seems very well made.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: FDW Office Chair Computer High Back Adjustable Ergonomic Desk Chair Executive PU Leather Swivel Task Chair with Armrests Lumbar Support (Black)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing chair', 'author': 'Wissmaah', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought white leather chair. Couldn‚Äôt be more impressed with it. Beautiful, comfortable, solid construction, adjustable height and recline. ‚ÄúLeather‚Äù is lovely and all looks well constructed. BONUS- a breeze to put together. The instructions were easy to understand. The screws were CLEARLY labeled and the tool to put everything together was included and nice!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Reasonably Priced Chair', 'author': 'Doreen mcmahon', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very happy with this chair so far. Was easy to put together by myself, I suggest watching a YouTube video. Big, comfy chair with a nice high back. My spouse is 6‚Äô2 and 225 lbs and has been using the chair for about 3 months and very pleased with it. Better quality and comfort than chairs almost twice the price. I highly recommend', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars A Solid Support Chair (Pun Intended) that is Obnoxious to Assemble', 'author': 'A. Lee', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The chair isn‚Äôt quite the greatest thing since sliced bread (as the reviews make it out to be), but then, it‚Äôs not an awful chair. While it passes the eye candy test, the illustrated instructions may as well have been in Chinese, assembly definitely does not take 20 minutes (more like 1.5 hours after swapping pieces around over and over to figure out how the chair was supposed to be put together), and the chair is not nearly as cushy as one would hope for. That said, it is decently comfortable and has some cool features.The number one thing going for it is that it actually does provide excellent lower back support, and the massage function is a little gaudy and isn‚Äôt a trip to a spa house with a massage , but then it‚Äôs a nice little bonus. This is good for the lower back and it will make your chiropractor proud and your pain receptors quiet.Of course, with that lower back support, it feels a bit unusual, especially if one has not used a chair of this type before, as it feels as though there‚Äôs something sticking out and into your lower back. And as plush as the chair appears in the picture, it doesn‚Äôt quite translate into the soft squishy feeling that allows your lazy bum to rest. The faux leather is not really the most comfortable material, and is rather firm instead of malleable, though rest assured that you will not be sitting on aluminum or concrete. You will feel somewhat comfortable, maybe even fairly comfortable.A couple of additional features that are pretty neat are the gas pump that adjusts the height, and the ability for the chair to tilt back. In the reclined position, the chair most definitely multiplies its comfort level, and will be good for someone who wants to lean back when they‚Äôre reading, but seeks to avoid a situation where lying down on the couch would put you to sleep. Though the wheels on the chair were not at all as mobile as I had hoped, making it somewhat difficult to move the chair across my laminate floor.Now for the bad news. The illustrations have no words, the parts are not labeled (though they have code letters in the illustrated instructions), and they occasionally do not make any sense. For example, the left and right handles can easily be attached incorrectly because the instructions do not distinguish which side of the handle should be attached to the base. The wheels that attach to the bottom do not easily snap in, so it can fool you into wondering if there are other parts that should be holding the wheels into place. I tried pounding the wheel into the leg with a hammer and it still failed to go in, but eventually got them connected with the assistance of the strength in my biceps. Then, attaching the back part of the seat is a nightmare. The instructions have you squeeze it in between the handles, partially screw in the screws, then rotate the chair upwards to screw in the remaining screws, then finishing the project by tightening all the screws. The problem is that if you‚Äôre unlucky, the screws will fall out, the back part of the chair will fall, and then you might have to start all over again. Breaking one of these screws is probably a real possibility, though fortunately they seem tough, and the package comes with spares.If you‚Äôre a mechanical engineer or maybe even a carpenter, then assembling this thing will probably not be that hard. But then not everyone is an engineer or a carpenter. That being said, the final product is effective, and the value for what you get is acceptable, though it may come with an additional price in the form of putting the darn thing together.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 10, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful chair, horrible assembly', 'author': 'kenz', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I am very impressed by the quality and comfort of this chair. I am so happy to finally receive a high-quality product from Amazon that actually looks and feels as high-quality as advertised. The chair is supportive, with great lumbar support, armrests, and an easy to use height adjusting feature. The only thing I don't like about this chair is how absolutely INFURIATING the assembly was. The screws meant to attach the upper part of the chair to the armrests are all just a hair inch shorter than they should be for no logical reason, meaning you have to precisely, loosely put each screw in the absolutely perfect position while the chair part is also held in the perfect position if you want to be able to actually screw the screws in. My boyfriend ended up using longer screws from a different tool set that worked so much better and stopped our screaming and cursing. I truly do not know why they could not have just made those screws slightly longer. Also, the reclining feature is basically just a rocking chair feature.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Better than I Expected', 'author': 'nick c', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Well worth the price waited a little longer than usual for it. But i wasn't in a rush. Easy assembly, detailed illustrations, easy instructions, comfortable, and professional appearance", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars ***UPDATE*** Bogus Manufacturer Warranty', 'author': 'RP2', 'rating': 1, 'content': "UPDATE 11/21/23***REFUSAL TO HONOR WARRANTY***I immediately contacted FDW Store (selling this chair on Amazon) re: manufacturer defect in this new chair (see photos and original review below).Natalie @ FDW Store (Factory Direct Warehouse, LLC) refused my warranty claim, instead saying it was Amazon's responsibility.Amazon has no responsibility for a manufacturers poor quality, product defect, or Warranty.The printed Warranty Form (see photo) enclosed with the instructions for the assembly of this chair plainly explain the 90 day warranty on the chair re: upholstery;'Factory Direct Wholesale products are warranted against manufacturing defects in material and workmanship'. Interesting......Nothing in the Warranty says it's Amazon's responsibility.This chair was made, boxed and shipped with the defective armrest from Factory Direct Warehouse , LLC/The FDW Store, who SHOULD HONOR the Warranty.CUSTOMER BEWARE. DO NOT BUY FROM FDW STORE OR FACTORY DIRECT WAREHOUSE. Chair shipped with an wrinkle upholstery defect in Right armrest. (See attached photo) It's supposed to be smooth. The left armrest was done correctly. No idea why the manufacturer would consider this OK to ship to a customer.Seat back on this chair was nearly impossible to attach to the chair armrests. The holes for the Allen screws did not line up like they should. It took two of us to forcefully position the chair back into position where the Allen screws could attach the armrests to the chairback.Construction of the chair and upholstery quality is OK, not great. Not sure how long the upholstery will last with daily use.I have emailed the manufacturer for a replacement of the defective armrest. Hopefully they will correct the issue.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars BUY IT', 'author': 'Neke', 'rating': 5, 'content': '5 stars hands down. I love my chair. I work remote for 8 hours a day and it is soooooooo cozy. I put it together by myself and I am a female. The chair arms were a little confusing, but it was super easy to assemble. It‚Äôs so sturdy and comfy. Also it doesn‚Äôt seem like the material will rip or wear anytime soon. I‚Äôve had the chair for 3 months so far and it‚Äôs a great purchase. I‚Äôm glad I listened to the reviews.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "3.0 out of 5 stars Really comfortable but doesn't hold up", 'author': 'ER', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I'm really disappointed in this chair. From the reviews I expected this chair to last a reasonable amount of time. I haven't even had it one year and the leather is peeling. I'm careful with my furniture and I misuse it by putting shoes or sharp objects on it. The leather is cracking and flaking off in several areas in the chair. I also noticed that some of the leather pieces are turning from white to a cream color which looks really weird. If you wear jeans a lot, the blue will transfer to the white leather, it will clean off though with multipurpose cleaner. Also, for you cat owners, the leather might as well be butter, their nails poke holes into it very very easily. The one good thing I can mention is that it's very comfortable. I plan on keeping it for now, probably will have to get a chair cover for it so it won't be such an eye sore.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Super comfy!', 'author': 'Scott&Tamara', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Bought this chair as a gift for my boyfriend after his old one broke and it‚Äôs definitely an upgrade! The chair itself is really comfortable, especially since it has the ability to lean back a bit and can be lowered to the desired height. The leaning feature is great because it doesn‚Äôt go too far or make you feel like you‚Äôre going to fall backwards out of the chair as soon as you push back. We also put his cat on it and he immediately laid down, so clearly it‚Äôs kitty approved for comfort! üòÇI took 1 star off just because the arms were kinda difficult to put on. The rest of the chair was fairly easy and didn‚Äôt take long, but the arms gave us a bit of a challenge. I think it was just hard to keep the holes on the chair back lined up with the holes on the arms to put the screw in. But overall, it wasn‚Äôt too big of a deal since we eventually figured it out.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Assembly is fairly simple', 'author': 'Bruce B.', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Assembly instructions were straightforward with the illustrations, the size and number of fasteners at each location. It took me 40 unhurried minutes to get it unboxed and fully assembled. I like the T-handled wrench for this type of assembly. The steel stampings seem pretty thick, so I think that mechanically it should last a good while. Getting the back on was quite simple; I left all the fasteners loose as per the instructions, and just laid the chair on first one side and then the other.I give it four stars overall, simply because I don't know yet how well the faux leather is going to hold up and continue to look good. Fit and finish of the upholstery is quite good for this price point, no pooched seams or the like.It's quite comfortable, reasonably firm. The back is high enough that I can lean my head back and my neck remains straight. The lumbar support feels good. The arms are just the right height for me to rest my elbows on them and type. I'm 195 lbs. and the seat is plenty wide, arms well spaced. I would easily recommend it to a friend.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars All the comfort and beauty of a high end office chair for a GREAT price.', 'author': 'Tiff', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. Here is what he says about this new chair:This is a good looking chair. I particularly like how the contrasting orange accent gives it a unique look. It is also comfortable. The seat is well padded and the back has great lumbar support along with a headrest. The chair is adjustable as you would expect. Another thing that I liked is how easy it was to assemble. The instructions are well written and all parts are clearly marked. Took me about 10 to 15 minutes to put it together. All in all, this is a great home office chair. Hoping to get many years of use out of it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars so comfortable', 'author': 'David', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have purchased a few office chairs and I can honestly say that this one was the easiest one to put together ever! It took me just 20 minutes to put together and the instructions were so easy to understand. The parts and hardware involved were very limited and that was such a nice surprise to see. The chair bottom support with the rolling wheels is metal so it is super sturdy and the casters are extremely smooth. I am very pleased with that. The mesh material that is on the seat, the back, and the headrest has so much bounce and strength at the same time that it gives an incredible and pleasurable sitting experience. The headrest is adjustable to go up and down and also to go forward and backward and I love that. The armrests are also adjustable to go straight forward or side to side and this is also great when I work with my mouse and my computer and I get arm fatigue. And needless to say, the seat is also fully adjustable going up and down for your height. I could not be more pleased with this chair, and the price was on point as well!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easiest Assembly Ever', 'author': 'Carlos J Molina', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Over the years I've bought 7-8 office chairs. I have bought them from office supply stores because I always wanted to sit in them and try them first. This time, I took a chance and ordered online. The package came promptly and I proceeded to put it together. I have to say, I have never had such an easy time assembling a chair. The instructions had great graphics and instructions. The instructions were obviously designed by a native English speaker who knew what they were doing. I'm so tired of instructions put together by someone outside the country where you have to guess what to do next. The chair went together easily and quickly. I loved that all the parts and the holes actually aligned. I have had bad experiences in the past where I had to try and jury-rig things to fit right. Once it was complete I sat in it and it fit like a glove. I especially loved the lumbar support. A couple of the reasons why I chose this chair was because of the mesh back which allows for air circulation and the seat wasn't covered with fake leather which disintegrates after a couple of years. It is covered with a sturdy cloth material. When I first sat on it the seat felt rather stiff and hard, but now after having used it for several hours I find it to be comfortable and that it provides plenty of support. Overall it is a vary good ergonomic chair. I was pleasantly surprised to find that it comes with a hanger that you can put on the back to hang your sports coat or jacket if you work in an office where you have to dress up.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable though the lumbar support is placed too low and can't be adjusted.", 'author': 'Mark T.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Assembly was okay, took a while though, instructions were clear. Satisfied with the cost, given we tried multiple chairs, this was best, just wish it had the lumbar support adjustable or set appropriately for an adult.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exceptional Comfort and Quality', 'author': 'David Morris', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the Winrise Office Chair and it's been a fantastic addition to my home office. The additional coat hanger feature is a clever touch for keeping my space tidy. In terms of aesthetics, its sleek design fits seamlessly into my office decor.Assembling the chair was straightforward, aided by clear instructions. The durability and quality of materials, especially the sturdy base and soft, durable mesh, assure me of its longevity.Overall, the Winrise Office Chair is an excellent investment for anyone seeking comfort, functionality, and style in an office chair. Highly recommended!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Ergonomic and Aesthetical', 'author': 'Kdam', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Took around 30min to build by myself. Instructions were clear and liked the fact the screws & bolts were already separated into it's own sections, so I didn't have to search and figure out if was the right one or not.Overall I and happy and glad I finally found this chair, specifically for its design and functionality. I upgraded from a gaming chair when I soon realized it was over hyped and if anything worse. this supports your lower back, has a better seat cushion, able to recline, and has breathable mesh.I unfortunately sit long hows a day working from home, but also play games so it's worth the investment to support your posture. you don't need a crazy expensive chair, this will do.there is also others very similar design to this, I liked that it had a dedicated rod to hang a jacket.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Addition to any Office or Gaming Setup', 'author': 'Great Addition to any Office or Gaming Setup', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the Winrise Office Chair, and I must say, it has exceeded all my expectations. From the moment I unboxed it, I was impressed with the straightforward assembly process. The instructions were clear and concise, making installation a breeze. Within minutes, I had a sleek, ergonomic chair ready for use.The comfort level of this chair is noticeable right away. As someone who spends long hours at a desk, both for work and during gaming sessions, the Winrise Chair has been a game changer. The high back design and lumbar support cradle my spine perfectly, providing relief and support where it's needed most. The breathable mesh back is a standout feature, ensuring I stay cool and comfortable even during intense, long-lasting use.The adjustable armrests are a thoughtful addition, allowing me to customize the chair to my body's needs, further enhancing the comfort and ergonomic benefits. The chair's ability to recline is also a huge plus, offering me the flexibility to lean back and relax between tasks or during game breaks.In summary, the Winrise Office Chair is a top-tier choice for anyone in need of a comfortable, ergonomic chair that is not only easy to install but also provides substantial support for both office work and gaming. It's a worthy investment for the wellbeing of your back and overall posture. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a big and tall reclining comfy home office chair that truly delivers on its promises. Five stars all the way!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Not the Ideal Chair', 'author': 'Arboreal Marsupial', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'OVERALL RATINGThis chair was on sale and looked to be quite a bargain. But had I seen it at a store I would have quickly passed on it. But I\'ve decided to keep it rather than going through the effort to pack it all back up again and return it. I do predict that I\'ll have to replace it again after the 1-year Warranty expires.HERE‚ÄôS MY ASSESSMENTS‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.FIRST IMPRESSIONSThe moment I opened the box there was a VERY strong chemical smell with the contents. I still proceeded with the assembly but then started getting a headache from the smell. Since it was almost completed, I went ahead and finished the setup. Then I worked with the chair a little but then put it aside for the evening. I also treated it with air freshener overnight. The next day the smell was greatly reduced but still noticeable after using one day. I do think it will eventually go away. And there was no headache on the second day. Adding this to provide you with a heads-up.HEADRESTThe Headrest swivels but I haven\'t found that to be useful in all Reclining options (Work & Learn, Relaxation, and Rest.) A design change is needed to provide the option to move the Headrest closer to the head and then allow it to swivel.For example, when in the Work & Learn setting it would be very nice to move the Headrest against your head without having to move your head backwards. Then you could be in that position while working or participating in an online meeting (on camera) without looking like you\'re napping. :)And it would be great when you\'re using either the Relaxation or Rest option because you could move the Headrest close enough toward your head to still watch a presentation on your computer monitor, watch TV, reading, etc. while you are in one of these reclining options.The work-around I found is to use a small pillow to fill the gap between the Headrest and your head. That is useful with the Relaxation or Rest options of the chair back. Not something I would ever use in the Work & Learn option when I\'m in a Video Call.LUMBAR SUPPORTA design change is needed to adjust the tension on the Lumbar Support. Without that adjustment it is only going to work with lighter-weight users.ARMRESTSIt is convenient to have the option to set the height of the user. But it would be very helpful if they were longer. When you are in the Relaxation or Rest option there is quite a gap between the Armrest and the back of the chair. That gap causes your arms to slide off the back of the armrest.HEIGHT OF CHAIRI\'m 6\'4" and feel that the chair is too short. I searched for chairs for taller users and this one was included. And there were several other buyers who rated it as being a fit for my height. The manufacturer doesn\'t claim it is for taller users.CHAIR STRENGTHThe manufacturer does state the "star base is sturdy and durable, with a weight capacity of up to 300 pounds." Before purchasing this chair, I never caught that the manufacturer was isolating the weight capacity to just the "star base". After receiving the chair, I don\'t think other parts of the chair can handle that much weight over a long period of time. Overall, the chair just feels light-weight. The warranty is just 1 year and I haven\'t fully examined the fine print yet.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Panana Ergonomic Office Chair High Back Mesh Back Adjustable Headrest Flip-up Padded Armrest Swivel Rolling Desk Chair (Grey)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy, reasonably comfortable.', 'author': 'Alyx Knight', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Comes with every tool and bolt you need including several extras. Very easy to put together, with parts that slide into place where you bolt them. I assembled the chair alone in about 15-25 minutes.The cushion is medium-firm, neither rock nor cloudy Abyss, which I find perfect for gaming.
