title: Furmax Office Executive Chair High Back Adjustable Managerial Home Desk Chair, Swivel Computer PU Leather Chair with Lumbar Support (Black)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So far, so good', 'author': 'michele', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'When Covid hit early 2020, I was sent home to work remotely for the first time in my working life. However, my old chair that is pictured on the right is about 25 years old and no longer has any butt cushion. It quickly became painful to work in that chair all day. I have since moved to a new state and found a remote job I will be starting soon so I decided it was time to upgrade the chair. This is a decent chair if you are on a budget like I am and you are not hard on your stuff adding premature wear and tear. For me, it has good lumbar support which I needed, and more cush for the tush! I am a proportionate 5\'2" female and about 125 to 130 pounds. The seat has just enough room for my butt but I don\'t think I would recommend this for larger people. I would look into sizing up to the big and tall chair. Take note of the seat and back size to know what would work best for you but this chair feels small yet good sized for me only because I was able to go by the measurements of my old chair. Might even be best for you to go into an office supply store to test out chair sizes for comfort before making a purchase. Sometimes I like to sit criss-cross applesauce and this chair has a very nice and smooth rocking motion after loosening the tight/loose knob for reclining and is so comfortable for me that I may fall asleep on the job and get fired. The back of the chair hits just above my neck so I am able to tilt my head back a bit to let it rest since my upper back and neck sometimes go numb after sitting for too long. Ugh, it\'s just so much fun getting older!!Assembling the chair was easy until I got to step 4 to put the back of the chair on. If you have another person to hold the chair back for you to align with the chair arm holes and screw in, then you should be OK, but since I had no one to help, I had to take the seat off and lay it down. I still struggled to align the back while the arms were attached to the seat so I removed the arms from the seat and attached them to the chair back and then aligned the seat with the arms and screwed them in. Once done, I inserted the completed assembled seat, chair back, and arm attachments back onto the wheels. The wheels glide very easily and will take you across the room after one push.I am writing this review the same day I got the chair so will update if I run into any issues. Otherwise, I recommend this chair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good Product', 'author': 'Partechglobal FZE', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very easy to assemble, comfortable and worth money', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Looks bigger in the picture', 'author': 'Kramer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I should have taken it upon myself to compare the measurements of this chair with my old chair, But I didn\'t. The chair is very easy to assemble and seems strong and worthy of its 300lb rating. Over all comfort is good but, at 6\'1" 287lbs the chair is just too small and the back is too low for my taste.The chair is very attractive seems to be well made and the seat is comfortably padded, its just not big enough for me. My youngest son is the benefactor as I have passed the chair on to him and purchased myself a larger chair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good economy office chair', 'author': 'Nonprofit Business', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We purchased two of these chairs for a new office. They will be available to staff who have been assigned to standing desks. Since we have not yet hired staff, we are hoping they adapt to the healthier option of standing, but these are available. Assembly is really easy. They took me about 15 minutes each to assemble alone. If I had had help, it could have been done faster. Attaching the arms and back really needs an extra pair of hands. The weight rating is low enough that it may be a problem, depending on who is hired in the next few days. All that said, I find the chairs comfortable. The seat size is average, not oversized. The back provides plenty of support, and both are cushioned well for longer-term work. For someone who is larger, it may be uncomfortable; the chair is somewhat narrow and would be more comfortable for someone of smaller stature.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So far so good', 'author': 'Jenni', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Been using this chair for a few weeks. The seat is quite firm at first. I figured this might be a good thing as it's less likely to wear down to the chair base. Within a few days of use the seat became softer and more comfortable. Everything else is great, comfortable. What I hoped for given the price.I'm the only person in the office with a brown chair. üí©", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Not impressed', 'author': 'Erica', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Firstly, it's worth mentioning that without a second person to help squeeze the back and seat together during assembly, it would have been difficult to fully attach and tighten the arms to this chair. In my opinion it's definitely a two person job.But mainly, I will say that after having this chair for barely over a month, the seat is already quite flattened and as a result is not all that comfy. I'm well under 150 lbs so it's not like the cushion is under a higher amount of weight either. The middle of the chair, where the two main sections meet, is the worst area, and at this point it feels like there is basically no cushioning there at all. It looks like it will be plush but this is definitely low quality padding that will compress quickly. In fact my last cheap chair from Ikea lasted me well over 5 years before it got as uncomfortable as this one already is. The back feels supportive and I like the it's also got a fairly high back. If the chair will only get very occasional light use I'm sure it's good enough, but if you plan to sit in this daily I would not recommend.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Computer desk chair of my dreams', 'author': 'Patricia Greene', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I had recently moved and had to leave my beat-up computer chair behind. I researched several different websites and the chairs that were offered but I finally decided on this Furmax Office Executive chair. I got the chair and it needed to be assembled, and I (a disabled female) did the assembly and just needed a little help holding parts together which I wasn't able to do by myself due to physical disabilities. I absolutely love this chair, no more pressure on the back of my thighs, the back is comfortable and I have even taken little cat naps in it because it is so firm but easy to relax in. We will be buying my husband one as soon as we move into our new home. You won't be disappointed buying this chair, I recommend it for anyone who has a physical problem sitting in hard chairs as I do. I was also amazed at the price, I worked in government offices for years, and similar (but not as good quality) cost the departments $300 to $400 each chair and this one was not near that price.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Not bad until it breaks!', 'author': 'Mike L', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I work from home and used this chair 6 to 8 hours per day 5 days a week. Cosmetically the material held up well and the chair still looks new. No complaints with appearance. However the function of the chair failed. First, the gas piston started to fail. Have to readjust every few hours. Then one day I leaned back and the seat snapped under me. The back of the chair is secured to the seat by two screws on each side. I'm 5'9 and weigh 220 lbs. I had expected the chair to last longer. Even though the chair gets alot of use, it is not abused in any way. I removed the material on the bottom of the chair and noticed that the wood used to make the seat appears to be some sort of laminated balsa wood. Same type they use to make those old toy airplanes. If they had used a solid piece of wood or plastic vs a laminated piece of heavy paper to make the seat, I probably wouldn't be back on Amazon searching for a new office chair.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great price for a good chair (slightly crooked)', 'author': '00xuser', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This is a real bargain to get such a comfortable chair for under a hundred dollars. The seatback went on just a bit crooked relative to the front of the chair but not by much and I'll live with it. The method the seatback uses to fasten to the chair uses the plastic armrests to bolt it on and it just sits on the back at the bottom. This is not the best method to anchor the seatback and it usually inserts into a fixture or bracket on the seat bottom for a firm connection. Therefore I would not ride back in the chair too hard if you sit down and have a tendency to rare back a lot. Those armrests are only made of plastic that the bolts fit the seatback to. On the plus side the armrests are low enough to allow me easy typing without interfering at the factory adjusted position that it came with. Very comfortable and I have not adjusted it yet for individual setting. I like the cream or white as it brightens up things.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Seat not as comfortable as t looked', 'author': 'Christina Barnes', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This chair was easy to put together and looks nice but the seat of the chair is NOT very comfortable!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

In this case, I was pleasantly surprised. The chair was very easy to assemble thanks to a YouTube video. To my surprise, I put it together entirely on my own in around half an hour. As importantly, the chair is very comfortable, providing in particular the lower back I desperately need. Before I bought the office chair, I used one of the chairs that came with a dining room seat I've had for 20 years. No arrangement of pillows ever made that chair comfortable to work in for six or seven hours a day, five days a week. The office chair, however, is a game-changer both in terms of my physical comfort and my disposition (a physically comfortable worker is a happier worker). What's more, because the arms are collapsible, the chair slides right under the kitchen table that doubles as my desk. I have only one complaint about the chair: It's not leather, as advertised. It's a cheaper, less durable fabric. This means you have to be very careful about scratching it, puncturing it, even cleaning it (the instructions that come with it say this, too). reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I‚Äôm impressed', 'author': 'Bre C.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was looking for a temporary office chair and had trouble finding one that was budget friendly.Everything I was seeing was $150 for any decent quality chairs.I am so glad I found this one. title: Ergonomic Office Chair, High Back Mesh Desk Chair with Thick Molded Foam Cushion, Coat Hanger, Adjustable Headrest, Lumbar Support, Tilt & Lock Function - Computer Chair (Light Grey)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Life Saver for Teacher with Back and Neck Pain', 'author': 'Klaviergoddess', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is the third chair I\'ve purchased from this manufacturer. It is obvious that they listen to feedback from customers and make every effort to improve form and function. Apart from the cheerful colors, the big upgrades on this chair are the fully adjustable headrest, the thicker cushion, and the wider back. The coat rack will also be a useful feature for many people at the office. I am a piano teacher who sits for long periods of time, working with students. When I\'m not teaching, I sit in my craft room for long periods. I have pinched nerves in my neck and lower back. I cannot overstate the importance of my chairs being as ergonomic as possible. This chair is ideal for me at 5\'5", with the seat in the lowest position. The S curve fits my back perfectly, and the mesh is extremely comfortable. If needed, I can tweak the position of the padded/cushioned lumbar support with the built-in adjustment slider. The adjustable headrest makes such a difference to me. I can easily shift it if I need to relieve pressure on my neck. This is the chair you won\'t mind sitting in ALL day. I LOVE the color combinations, which are perfect for my little craft room. I can easily roll the chair from one workstation to another. The chair feels sturdy, and the quality is all top-notch. I believe it will last a long time. It was easy to put together. They included the necessary tools and even provided white gloves for handling the hydraulic lift. This is a fantastic chair for the price. The quality and value make it stand out from the rest. You can\'t go wrong with this one.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice modern look ,Easy to Assemble Great Chair for a Great Price', 'author': 'CC', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Assembling it was a breeze ‚Äì no hassle or frustration involved. The design really nails the balance between support and comfort. The lumbar support is great, making long hours at the desk a breeze. This chair gets it right! It feels tailored to your body. I can't stress enough how comfortable it is. Overall, a solid choice if you're seeking a chair that's easy to set up, supports your back, and makes sitting for hours a pleasure, to add great looking chair.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The Perfect Gift...', 'author': 'Osman Ozakinci', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I got this chair for my wife as a gift. She's pretty picky about these kind of stuff, but this one really met our expectations. First off, it looks sleek and modern ‚Äì the wide backrest and cool design give it a professional vibe. Plus, they added a coat hanger at the back, which she found really handy. The chair is not just about looks, though. The flip-up armrests are a cool move ‚Äì you can easily slide it under the desk, saving space. The foam cushion is comfy without being too soft or too firm, perfect for long hours of sitting. My wife loved especially the adjustable lumbar support feature after the old one - it's great for back pain due to long work hours. Putting it together was pretty easy, took me around 20-25 minutes. And the 5-year warranty is a nice bonus for that extra peace of mind. In a nutshell, it's a mix of style, practicality, and comfort. My wife loved her new chair, and I'd definitely recommend it to anyone who wants a top-notch ergonomic chair without sacrificing style.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars FOKESUN Ergonomic Office Chair', 'author': 'Rochel Litzman', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The assembly took about 45 minutes - not too difficult. Instructions were OK, but no clear explanation of how to adjust the built in lumbar support although the existence of the lumbar support is mentioned on a picture. Chair seems sturdy and is very comfortable. There is some concern how the light colors will hold up in the long run. The spokes on the base are painted white, and sometimes I rest my feet there - already showing scuff marks - a rubber strip on top of the spokes would help.In sum it seems to be a sturdy and very comfortable chair at a reasonable price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Surprisingly good for the price', 'author': 'Yaniel Rivera', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Overall the chair is very sturdy and I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of the materials. title: Sweetcrispy Office Computer Desk Chair, Ergonomic High-Back Mesh Rolling Work Chairs with Wheels and Adjustable Headrests, Comfortable Lumbar Support, Comfy Flip-up Arms for Home, Bedroom, Study,Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice chair for the price.', 'author': 'S. A.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was a little nervous ordering this chair. All the reviews were Vine reviews which makes me nervous because of course you loved your free product. Another concern was the existing reviews appear to be for a different model chair that doesn‚Äôt have a headrest. The product description mentions a headrest and the product listing photos and video show a headrest so I took a chance and hoped it was accurately listed.Good news, it does come with the headrest! The chair is very comfortable and provides adequate support. I have a bad back and find it very comfortable even after hours of use. The assembly is simple and the chair feels very securely built when fully put together. For an affordable desk chair I would say this one is a winner.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Ease of assembly', 'author': 'Joseph Andronaco', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought 2 of these for my daughter. She picked it out and it will be ready when she returns home. But I ordered my chair pink, and it came in black.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great value', 'author': 'Janece', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Just what my new computer desk needed.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Sent me the WRONG color', 'author': 'Micahlynn Hollandsworth', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I just received my chair after being so excited it was coming early! When I opened the package, my heart dropped. I ordered the Pink and White to match my gaming space, and when I opened the box it was the Black variant. After contemplating keeping it or returning it, my sweet husband and I decided to keep it. If I like it, I will give the seller another chance and order again. If that\'s the case, my husband has agreed to use the Black variation. The other reviews were really good, I am just really bummed about receiving the wrong color. I am writing this as I assemble it.**ASSEMBLY**The assembly process was fairly easy and it was just me. The only part I "struggled" with was attaching the seat to the back rest. After a few attempts to get it lined up, it was easy. I imagine if my husband had been home and I had an extra set of hands it would have been done extra quick.The instructions were both in the box and available on the product page. There was only one little part of the base that had some damage, pictured in the first photo. Other than that it was perfect.**First Sit**At first sit, the chair is really comfortable. The headrest being adjustable is really nice. I am able to recline a bit. When I first tested the height adjustment it stuck a bit, but after that, like butter. I have already loaded the back pocket with all my essentials. I think that\'s a great feature and it clears up space on my desk which is nice.Overall, I would recommend this chair to others, I am just really disappointed that I was sent the wrong color. The color was the driving factor in my purchase.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars chair was at a great price n easy to assemble.', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Pros easy to assemble, sturdy, n looks good. no cons at this point', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good value office chair', 'author': 'JEX 7341', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I ordered this to replace my previous office chair. I purchased one on sale at Fry's a few years ago, and it didn't even last a year. I have to keep it backed against a wall because the seat back won't support *any* weight anymore. Nuts to that!This chair arrived efficiently packed in a compact box, which was nice. The directions were clear, and it was pretty easy to assemble. I had it together in maybe ten minutes.Visually, the chair is aesthetically pleasing. It's a good looking chair. Functionally, it doesn't have many frills, but it's very comfortable. I can sit in it for several hours at a time without discomfort. It adjusts up and down in a good range, you can swing the arms out of the way, and there is a pocket on the back. I'm not sure if it's for additional cushioning or storage, but I keep the installation instructions back there just in case. That's it for frills, and for the price, that's just fine. I don't regret this chair, and it's already outlasted my previous one.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 19, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars comfort/height', 'author': 'zapp', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I usually won't write a review this soon. When I bought this chair It was to replace my old chair and the old chair would be given to my wife. After putting it together I let her sit in it, didn't think my wife would like it so much. So I gave it to her since she had just gotten rid of her desk chair. That's my baby and best friend why not But believe me I will be reordering me another one.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The Mack-Daddy of Office Chairs! LOL', 'author': 'JenBcute', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The title describes this chair perfectly! It is definitely the mack-daddy of office chairs! LOLI've never actually seen an office chair with more features than this one! It's a high-back chair with breathable mesh material that's got an adjustable headrest & lumbar support. You can adjust the height of your seat as well as recline back in the seat! My most favorite feature is the retractable footrest! Actually, that's how it was described in the listing, but you actually pull it out, then you fold it out! When I saw it said retractable I somehow imagined it would snap out & back in! ??? (LOL...Just the image I saw in my head when I read that!) But the feature itself is wonderful! I've been having a lot of issues with swelling in my feet, but I sit all day for work so this is very useful to me! It's got a hanger on the back for if you want to hang your coat, or maybe a sweater!This chair is the sturdiest computer/office/gaming chair I've ever seen! It's pretty heavy but it rolls great! I have mine sitting half on, half off an area rug... My old chair used to get stuck when rolling back to stand up! So far, I haven't had that problem with this chair! The arm rests do not flip up, although you can adjust the height & turn the angle of the armrests! Most people desire that feature so they can push it in under the desk & that is still possible for this chair!Last but not least, the seat (the part you sit your butt on) is very nice! Much better than the last one I had! It's firm to provide support, but also soft enough to be super comfy! I work 50 hours a week sitting at a desk so when I tell you it's comfy, believe me, I've tested it out enough to give you an honest answer!Well, in case you haven't noticed, I am in love with my new chair! I hope my opinion helps someone to become amazed by this chair as I have! You won't regret getting this chair!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This is the best chair I have ever had!', 'author': 'Stella', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I got this chair for my combo desk/vanity space. I looked for a 6 months to find a good chair that I could spend a lot of time in that would not take up too much room as I need the space around creating things. It was easy to put together alone. I do think two people should put it together since it is a heavy quality chair I was able to balance the seat while I attached everything. This is the best chair I have ever had! It reclines so well and completely holds my 300lb+ weight with no issue. I have been using it every day for 2 months and it looks brand new. The blue cloth looks cool with my set up. At first the sliding arm rests threw me off a bit but now I see how useful they are if you are laying up and sitting down a lot they make me feel tucked in. I want to buy another chair for my husband in the future so hoping they come back soon!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 13, 2023', 'is_verified': False}]

title: Home Office Chair Mid Back PC Swivel Lumbar Support Adjustable Desk Task Computer Ergonomic Comfortable Mesh Chair with Armrest (Black)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfy Enough', 'author': 'Kenny Springs', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My old chair collapsed two weeks before I ordered this chair. Go figure, it was a spare dining set chair that I used because I was too cheap to buy an actual office chair. On a hot Saturday morning, right after breakfast, I decided to go into my office, log onto my computer and email some people I don't particularly like.So I go in, plop down onto the cushion of my trusty old wooden kitchen table chair. However, as soon as my bagels make with the chair, I hear a (POP) and down I go. I didn't get hurt, because I'm kinda tubby and have enough cushion of my own to break the fall. But, now, I needed a chair--a REAL chair... AN OFFICE CHAIR!(Damn... Now I gotta spend money)So, there I was, looking around for the most economically-reasonable (okay, cheapest) chair to buy. I searched around several sites when I came across this one on Amazon. It took me two hours to decide to pry open my wallet and buy it. I'm livid because my wife wouldn't let me use another dining chair, I can't play Solitaire on either of my dual monitors, and I can't email my friends and tell them that they are no longer welcome at ANY of my cookouts because THEY eat more than ME. But moreover, I was PO'ed because I have to wait for my chair...But not too long...The chair actually came about four days later. I was coming home from work when I saw the box on my porch (*OH, JOY*). I jumped out my truck, scooped it up before any bad-assed neighborhood kids could steal it, took it straight back to my office and unpackaged it. I was actually kinda disappointed: the chair was a mass of plastic and cloth. It looked weak; I gave it about a week before I'd be on the floor again.It was easy to assemble, and once it was up, I figured--hell, it looks kinda nice. However, the true test would come with actual use (here come the buns).For the money I paid for it, this is a nice chair. It's comfortable and very sturdy. It rolls and swivels easily. Unlike my old kitchen chair, this one doesn't cut the circulation in my legs; I can sit at my computer and work, email anbd play games for hours without any pain,numbness or lower leg swelling.While this is a nice comfy chair, I gave it four stars for ergonomics because it's not very comfortable to sleep in. But other than that, I'm glad I bought it", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 16, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars great chair!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This chair is exactly as pictured, it's easy to put together, and it's extremely comfortable. Great bang for your buck. I'm very pleased with it. I ordered the white with black trim.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Super comfy easy to assemble!!!!', 'author': 'Stand_Up_Seyar', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The media could not be loaded. This Home Office Chair with Mid Back PC Swivel Lumbar Support, adjustable height, and adjustable tension for the seat to lean back, offers Ergonomic Comfortable Mesh and Armrest. It is a fantastic addition to my home office. At first, I thought it would be difficult to assemble, but after opening the box and reading the directions, it was very simple. It took me about 10 minutes to put together; it's really straightforward. This chair offers remarkable comfort and functionality. Its ergonomic design provides excellent lumbar support, while the adjustable features allow for personalized comfort. The mesh material keeps me cool, and the swivel function allows for easy movement around my workspace. The chair feels sturdy and well-designed, and the sleek black color adds a professional touch. Overall, it's a top-notch chair that enhances both comfort and productivity in my home office. For the price, you seriously can't go wrong. It has a nice design, is easy to assemble, economical, and looks pretty cool. But most importantly, it's super comfortable. My only complaint is the smell; it has a weird odor to it which I hope goes away. I'm not really sure why it smells or what the smell is, but I'm leaving it outside for a day, hoping it goes away.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A Great Chair For Small People', 'author': 'Aaron', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I wasn\'t expecting much ordering this chair, and I\'m pleased that I didn\'t get much. It\'s a simple chair (which is all I wanted) and some spare nuts and bolts just in case I need them.Upon unboxing this chair, I grew worried at the size of the cushion. I thought it was going to be too small for me, but once it was fully assembled and I finally sat down in it, it fit me perfectly. I am 5\'1" (155cm) and 100~ lbs (45kg), for reference. I don\'t think this would be a good choice for people who are average-adult sized or larger, but for me it will be just fine.My only major complaint with this chair is the assembly. I do appreciate that it came with a guide, a wrench, and the screws were packaged neatly, but there is no way I was assembling this by myself. The bottom half was simple enough -- attach the 5th leg, pop the wheels in, pop the pressure-valve-lifty-thing in the base. It gets difficult when it comes time to attach the seat of the chair to the back of the chair. I had to get my sister to help me hold it in place, it was impossible for me to do it with only one set of hands without misaligning parts.Also, the metal bit underneath the seat that attaches to the base was....sandy? Or dusty or something, like it had been kept outside with no packaging. I don\'t really care, no one sees that part anyway and all the other components were pristine. But it was strange to feel sand (or whatever) on my hands when I took that part out of the cardboard.As for the experience of sitting in this chair itself, it\'s nice. It supports my back well, which is great considering I have horrible posture and need any help I can get. I haven\'t sat in it for too long, because my desk still hasn\'t arrived yet, but it\'s very comfortable. Looks just like the picture, nothing too fancy, you get what you paid for. It lifts up and down well so far, but have not tried reclining it yet. Don\'t think I will need to, but will update this if I do.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 1, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Expensive, but very fest shipping.', 'author': 'STON', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is a seller you want to do business with. The chair is fantastic, that's why I ordered this chair again. Easy to assemble by the instruction included. The second chair arrived with very small defect/damage which probably happened during shipping. Notify the seller and resolved the issue right away. 5 stars.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "3.0 out of 5 stars It's a decent chair", 'author': 'Cal', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'The chair was easy to assemble, felt good accomplishing that. The chair is comfortable and gives great back support. Unfortunately after a year of use (I am on my computer a lot), the chair would randomly change height positions, as if I would sink slowly and have to pull the lever and the chair height up again. Last night my chair would not lock in position and nearly hurt myself. I wondered why and took a look this morning and to my investigation, I found out why. This area is not very well made. I am not a heavy set person nor do I tilt back much. Great comfortability but not too sturdy or long lasting.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 11, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable', 'author': 'Mr.D', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Chair showed up a day early. It was packaged good. Real easy to put together. Even nicer to sit in.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good quality for an inexpensive chair.', 'author': 'Nate Logos', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I needed a new chair for my computer desk at home because the chair I had (not an office chair, more of a small lounging chair) was killing my back. I didn't see the weight limit on this chair before I bought it. That's unfortunate because I weigh more than the stated limit, but I've had the chair for a couple of weeks now. It doesn't look like it's going to break. For the most part the chair is quite comfortable, and my back has stopped hurting. The chair is easy to put together and easy to adjust. It offers a decent amount of support. My only real complaint is that when sitting in a straight, upright position, the chair kind of leans forward and downward rather than flat. That's annoying at times but not too bad. Something I like about this chair is that the fabric doesn't seem to collect much dog hair.This chair is not durable enough for a professional setting, but I highly recommend it for those who want a supportive chair for a home office that doesn't take a lot of space. If you weigh significantly over 200 pounds this chair won't work quite as well for you, but it should still work ok if you can't find something better in your price range.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 13, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars TEN MINUTES TO COMFORTABLE SEATING', 'author': 'Ken Bennett', 'rating': 4, 'content': "For the price, I'm absolutely delighted. Went together without hitch, and super-quick! Hex key included. Simple instructions‚Äîcould only have been simpler if but one type of screw had been used. Now, this isn't the sturdiest of chairs known to humanity; I mean, I won't be passing it down to future generations, but it is fine for the price. I'm happy.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars chair review', 'author': 'kevin patterson', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'armrest on the chair are to soft they have no support', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Yaheetech Ergonomic Office Chair, High Back Desk Chair with with flip-up Armrests, Adjustable Padded Headrest Mesh Computer Chair with Lumbar Support for Home Office Meeting Room, Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wow! Very Impressed.', 'author': 'Chelsea Faith', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The cushion is firm and comfortable. Very supportive. I am 5\'6" 130 lbs. The headrest is the Perfect height.Contrary to one of the reviews, it is very easy to assemble IF you follow the well presented instructions. The screw holes are absolutely well made. They even give you extra bits in case you lose a bolt or washer and everything is clearly marked so if you have trouble= you didn\'t follow the instructions.I moved to work from home over a month ago and come from using a $400.00 chair from a well known store. Albeit, I did just set this up and I have no reason to be sitting in this chair right now, but I can\'t help it, I am sitting in it nonetheless because it is comfortable and supportive. The instructions are the easiest I have ever encountered so don\'t be intimidated, just take your time and Follow The Instruction Manual.I am very pleased with this purchase. It arrived just 5 days after purchase, has adjustable lumbar support, the arms flip up, and it provides a generous range in height. I am so grateful. Since moving to work from home, I was sitting on an ottomon so you can best believe I am filled with relief. I am still going to purchase a back cushion because it does lean a little backward and I like to be perfectly upright... but I am one of those meticulously picky people. If you are approximately my height, you will love this chair. If you are larger than me... You might want to choose a different chair build for larger folks as again, the headrest is perfect for my height and I am 5\'6", any taller and your head will be higher than it and it does not adjust but screws securely into one place but the seat cushion feels firm enough to support a heavier person.Over all I am very please and so much looking forward to working 10 hour days with this chair. It is an huge improvement from the ottomon which was exhausting the daylight out of my back muscles to keep upright.Thank you to the maker of this chair. <3P.S. I said earlier that the headrest does not adjust: FALSE: It Does! Just 3 or so inches but still! NEAT. :)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Affordable, Sturdy, and Easy to Assemble', 'author': 'Joshua', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I needed a new office chair since I figured it was time to finally upgrade from my folding metal chair. This chair is much sturdier than I expected for the price, and it's very comfortable. The instructions for assembling it were relatively easy to follow.Customer support was also very easy to work with. I was initially sent the wrong item. When I messaged the seller, they contacted me on the next business day, asked me to send a couple of pictures, and sent me the correct item without asking me to return the one that was initially sent.My only complaint is that I'm a little tall for the head rest. I am 6'1 and the bottom of the head rest sits on my nape when it's raised up as far as it goes. It's not like I can't sit in the chair comfortably or anything like that. My head just doesn't rest in the exact right spot when I lean my head back. If it were a big issue, I could just remove the head rest and have a normal chair.Overall, it is an excellent chair. Before I was able to work from home, I had a nice chair in office that was very similar, but it was much more expensive. Comparing the two, I think this chair is on par with the one that cost over $200.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This chair is MASSIVE! 10/10!!', 'author': 'Vivian', 'rating': 5, 'content': "So far, all things are great! It was super easy to put together! Fabric is a bit scratchy, but it's certainly not uncomfortable! Theres a lot of good padding in the arms and the seat, with nice adjustable back support. My only thing, that I find more entertaining than anything really, is that this chair is HUGE!! The seat alone is half my body height, and sure, im only 5'3, but I was terrified when I took it out of the box! Haha! I was worried it wouldnt be able to fit my desk right, but it worked out nicely! Its also nice that its a big chair since me and my cat can now fit together!The chair is built taller than the standard chair, fully extended my feet no longer touch the ground. But It works perfectly! The folding arms make it easy to pack under my desk. And the all black design, combined with the height of it, makes it look like a really cool villain chair. Especially compared to my other desk chair, haha!I love it, worth the price. And it was a really good laugh between me and my girl friend at the ridiculous sizing of everything as i put it together. 10/10 Especially if you have a needy cat or you shift sitting positions a lot. This chair has plenty of room for you to sit in whatever unconventional way you want!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Extremely Functional Office Chair', 'author': 'Keith D', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I received this chair in early February 2023. Contrary to a couple of the reviews that I read prior to purchase, I found this chair to be very easy to assemble and once completed it feels quite sturdy. Parts are all labeled and directions are clear if you pay attention. The assembly took all of 10 minutes. Having spent $70 + $20 shipping on this chair, I was not expecting a luxury experience, but I am happy to say that it is comfortable and fully adjustable to suit a variety of shapes and sizes. I would just add that you should be cautious about chair size if you are over 6' tall since the headrest height adjustment is minimal. My criteria for selecting this specific chair out of the near endless choices included: cost, folding armrests, headrest, tilt/rocker and entirely black in color. It did not disappoint. (6 month update) Everything continues to function as described and there is absolutely no wear showing on the fabric.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars A bad quality chair and no customer service', 'author': 'Dan', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'I chose this chair because it look like it would be a perfect fit for my room. The arms recline up, allowing it to tuck in nicely to my desk but little did I know I was going to have issues with the chair that I could not foresee. Whether it was the arm falling off because the nylon locking nut was stripped before I could get it out of the box and going to a hardware store to find a replacement. Another issue I had was the material that‚Äôs wedged into the groove of the chair was slipping out on the top corners; allowing the fabric to lose its tension and making it very difficult to get it back into its place. I found the lumbar support adjustment is very little to none. When getting out and back in your chair, the lower lumbar resets itself, since it doesn‚Äôt look into place. The last straw was trying to get in contact with the company to get a warranty/replacement part for the chair backing that broke. I reached out multiple but no resolution was reached. Therefore I am putting it out on the curb as I write this review and thankful I didn‚Äôt double down and buy the chair again just to get my replacement part. Think twice before spending your money with a company with poor/no customer service.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Good chair. But not soft.', 'author': 'DN', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Assembly was simple. Solo took me less than 15min. Supportive back. I still have to sit on a pillow. Scouring the earth for a chair with a thick soft seat. This is not it. Very firm. Arms raise, head piece moves, lumbar adjustable, height adjustable, tilt- not so much, but a little maybe. I‚Äô sure I‚Äôll use it until it falls apart, but I‚Äôll keep looking for one with a thicker softer seat cushion.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great chair!!!', 'author': 'Juan C. Deliote Jr.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This chair is great, it supports the neck and back wonderfully, and it is very easy to move, also I made this with my kids and it was easy to assemble, and the chairs a little heavy , and the bottom cushion is firm but squishy. Overall fantastic chair, would recommemend for sure.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars One design flaw, but super comfy!', 'author': 'Kindle Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Overall, this is a really good chair. It sits high (it‚Äôs just a tad higher than the last chair I had, and is listed as higher than the other chairs I compared it to on Amazon). My desk sits just a little higher than most, so I felt like a kid at the dinner table with my last chair. This one gets me up so I feel like an adult again!My ONLY complaint on this chair is the arms. The right arm on mine is loose. The arms came preinstalled on the back of the chair and there does not seem to be an access panel to get to the bolt holding the arm to the back, so I have no way to tighten it. There is a circular piece over the middle of the arm where it would connect to the back of the chair, but there is no where I can see where that piece comes off. So, the right arm kind of rocks back and forth (left to right). Not what it is supposed to do.Otherwise, I have no complaints about this chair. It is solid, comfortable, and I love the headrest!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good for the price', 'author': 'Andrew', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This is a great chair nice ergonomic multiple head arm and lower back adjustments it's not a high end gaming chair but for me if will fit my needs vary well it's vary easy to set up and build honestly if your just getting into gaming or you want to dedicate a little bit of time to gaming I would use this chair", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Not bad choice for the price', 'author': 'Ezekiel', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The whole thing was quiet beautiful. I loved the color and I find it comfortable than leather chairs for computer desks. Although there has been some few downsides to it. Some parts were not cleaned thoroughly so I had to use a scissor to be able to assemble the arm. Also one of the arm was loose as the picture shows. The one with the wider gap freely slides up and down compared to the other which has more tension. Overall, it's not a bad choice for a chair. The wheels are not one of those extremely cheap ones it's a bit light but not completely hollowed. Therefore, it does not make a terrible annoying noise every roll on hard floors.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: GABRYLLY Ergonomic Mesh Office Chair, High Back Desk Chair - Adjustable Headrest with Flip-Up Arms, Tilt Function, Lumbar Support and PU Wheels, Swivel Computer Task Chair
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good chair, very comfortable, go ahead and get it', 'author': 'Terry G.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Review is for GABRYLLY Ergonomic Mesh Office Chair, High Back Desk ChairI was a little concerned about this chair being that I am only 5\'4" and according to the description, this chair is meant for a taller person.Don\'t worry, it fits fine, without issues. I can easily place both feet right on the ground, even being a "short" person. I use a foot rest anyway, so I see no issues if you are shorter using this chair.This chair is quite comfortable to sit in, with the back being very straight up. This is good and bad. You get lots of support like this, when you want to sit completely straight, but can easily lean back a bit for more comfort, when needed. You easily adjust the tension by the front knob that controls how hard you need to push back to adjust the back rest like most chairs that recline.Speaking of reclining, this chair reclines pretty far, and is very comfortable.The head rest you will need to fiddle with to make it custom fit for your head. This is the first time I have used a head rest of this type, and surprised at how comfortable it is. Putting the head rest on, while assembling the chair is the hardest part, and its quite easy to do.As some others have said, the seat mesh is a little "scratchy", but you get used to it.I have found that I like using a cushion on the seat for extended sitting sessions, but you may not need one. The mesh seat is quite comfortable, and sometimes I switch between using a cushion and sometimes not using one. You will have to see what works for you.One big reason I got this chair is the swing up arms. I prefer these type arms, since you can easily lift them up out of the way, where as other chairs you can\'t do this. This makes it easy to push in the chair very close to your desk, saving room.Customer Service. One word, OUTSTANDING!I have hard floors at home, and carpet at work. My work place bought me the same chair, so I bought one for home use. I emailed the company and asked about purchasing the roller type wheels for my home chair, and they offered me an additional set for the at work chair, which I didn\'t need. They were willing to ship me two sets for free! I declined the one for work, since its carpet and didn\'t need a set. Thats great customer service, which is rare now a days. Keep this in mind when shopping for a chair...there are lots out there, and this company stands behind their product.Assembly - standard for a chair like this, very easy to do, and they provide a simple video to watch. Maybe takes 10 minutes to put together, and you can do it yourself. If you have trouble lifting, you would need some assistance.Shipping - Chair comes very well packed in a sturdy box, no issues there.Quality - I did not have any issues with this chair. Very well put together.Chair options - It leans back pretty far, and with the included head rest, it is quite comfortable to lean back when you are tired for a quick rest, or even a quick, nap. (shhhh...don\'t tell the boss) You can lock the angle of the back to exactly where you want it, if you don\'t like having to push back to lean the back rest.So far I am quite happy with this chair. I have never had a full back mesh type chair, and think that this will last quite a while, even with daily use. I think you will be pleased with this purchase. While you may be able to find a similar chair for maybe a little less price, to me, the customer service you get with this purchase is really worth it. You know that they will stand behind your purchase and your being happy with your purchase of their product. I don\'t think you will be disappointed.*update*Its been 3 months since I purchased this chair and I can tell you 100% no issues with the chair at all. Its quite comfortable, and I would purchase another one, without hesitation. I can be sitting in this chair for long periods of time, with no issues. I do use a small seat cushion, just because I had it left from my previous chair, so might as well make use of it, but its not really needed for this chair. I am completely pleased with this purchase. No chair is perfect, but not being able to get into a chair and sit in it for yourself, shouldn\'t sway you from purchasing this. Its very comfortable, and even though I am 5\'4", its perfect in size, and the head rest is great too. Easy to lean back when you are tired and take a quick nap. WFH...shhhhhhhhh....!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great double-duty chair for office work and guitar playing!', 'author': 'C Curtiss', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently had my trusty office chair fall apart on me after many years of service. After considerable time researching a replacement, I pulled the trigger on the GABRYLLY Ergonomic Mesh Office Chair for my work-from-home setup. As someone who spends long hours at the desk, I was on the hunt for a high-quality chair that would prioritize comfort, support, and functionality, while also allowing me to play guitar from the same piece of furniture. Let me tell you, this chair has exceeded my expectations on all fronts!First and foremost, the ergonomic design of this chair is exceptional. The high back provides excellent support for my entire spine, promoting proper posture and alleviating strain. I'm not a small person, so having a chair that fits my tall frame and weight was clearly of paramount concern. This chair holds up and hasn't shown any signs of stretching or failure. The breathable mesh material keeps me cool and comfortable throughout the day, even during extended periods of sitting. You can actually feel the breeze from underneath, which is a change from my old cloth-bottom chair that would get pretty warm in the summer months.The chair's adjustability options are impressive. The height can be easily adjusted, as can the pitch of the backrest. The armrests are also adjustable, which allows me to flip them back and out of the way for when I play my guitars. The reclining function is very nice, but I opt to keep mine set more upright all the time. As for the headrest, it is kind of the only piece of the chair that I don't find much use for. Unless you lean your whole body back into the chair and lay your head back, the headrest doesn't even come into play.Durability is a standout feature of this chair. The sturdy construction and high-quality materials make it feel solid and long-lasting, but without sacrificing comfort. I initially had the regular casters in the chair, but saw that others were able to contact the company and get a set of rollerblade wheels as a free upgrade. I did that as I am working on a tile floor. And while the regular casters were workable, the roller wheels are much more suited to the solid, but bumpy flooring my workspace is located in.Assembly was a breeze, thanks to the clear instructions and the included tools. Within minutes, I had the chair ready for use. Everything was very straightforward.In terms of customer service, GABRYLLY has been exceptional. They promptly addressed my inquiries and provided support. When requesting the wheel upgrade, they reached back out to me very quickly and answered all of my questions. The wheels were here to me in a matter of days. Very responsive support.I wholeheartedly recommend this chair to anyone in need of an upgrade. It's an affordable chair with the quality of a much higher price tag.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome chair and excellent Customer Service', 'author': 'JoeyO', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Update 7-26-23Jennie and the after sales support from this company is bar none, one of the very best I\'ve ever come across since I\'ve been an Amazon Prime Member for over 15 years.Recently, the headrest broke by accident, so I emailed the company and they gladly accommodated my request for a replacement. Unfortunately, because of a new design in the chair itself, the headrest wouldn\'t work, as the backrest is different now.. I emailed Jennie and they very quickly are sending me a new backrest to make it all whole again.I couldn\'t be happier with the chair. It\'s made with great pride and the support team are always ready to make sure the customers are happy. I highly recommend this chair as it\'s both comfortable and well designed and if ever you need support, they are always ready to be of assistance in any way possible.Thank you Jennie and the rest of your staff for making things so easy to work with.++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++I\'ve spent the better part of two weeks in search of a good chair to replace a 10 year old dilapidated chair that\'s served me well over the years. I checked out so many chairs on Amazon, local stores and sites like Staples, Office Depot, and others. I even looked on Amazon for Gaming Chairs as they seemed like they would be comfortable. To my dismay didn\'t find one to my liking.Being an Amazon Prime Member for 14 years now, I continued my search on Amazon. That\'s when I stumbled upon this GABRYLLY Ergonomic Mesh Office Chair. I read all the reviews and at first was hesitant to purchase it online as was asking myself - \'Oh no! What if I don\'t like it, how will go about returning such a bulky chair?\'I took a leap of faith and went ahead and ordered it online, and was far less expensive than those I saw in local furniture stores and other websites. It arrived in two days as promised, and I was very excited to assemble it, and the first thing that I came to mind was: "Oh boy, I wonder how long this was going to take me to put it together!"To my surprise and amazement, it literally took me more time to unbox and take out all of meticulous wrapping which was done to perfection; and assembling the chair was a breeze, just following along the detailed instructions that came with it. I had it done and rolling to my study in about 15 to 20 minutes tops.Upon sitting on the chair for the first time, I knew there and then that I made the right decision in purchasing this office chair. It\'s super comfortable and the ergonomic design was really to my liking. The headrest was so nice and can easily be adjusted in so many ways. I also like that the armrests can be lifted up and placed out of the way, so that you can roll the chair closer to the table and be in a more comfortable position when typing on the on my various computers :-)The adjustments you can do on the chair was also well though of and such a breeze. For example, I adjusted the tension of how easy it would be to lean back and rock back and forth.Folks, look no further!! This chair fits me to a T!! I am 6"2\' about 155 lbs and the GABRYLLY Ergonomic Mesh Office Chair is super comfortable and the manufacturer went to great length to build this quality chair and paid so much to details, such as the legs where you can place your feet is also testament of how much went into its design. Rotating and rolling back the chair are also very quiet and smooth.In conclusion, as you can see in the photos I\'ve posted, my study/computer room, is my \'Man Cave\' as my wife would call it and this chair was a perfect addition, and couldn\'t be happier.Congrats to those behind the scenes who paid such close attention to details, and made this chair very easy to assemble and extremely comfortable to use.Hope you find this review useful and thanks to all those who have posted their own reviews which helped me in my search for the perfect chair.Thanks and God Bless to all.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 10, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Value', 'author': 'AW', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I recently got around to assembling my chair and it was incredibly simple -- everything necessary comes with the chair, as promised. The holes, hardware and heavy plastics were all correctly drilled / machined and went together without any issues. I didn\'t even need to oil the screws, like I have to with most home assembly furniture I order.As a Hawaii resident, I\'m used to boxes from the mainland arriving torn open and battered like they owed someone money. My chair box was, indeed, quite battered and showed signs of having been kicked or shoved by several different peoples footwear before arriving and there were gouges in the corners where I assume it had been roughly shoved into and out of vehicles.The box is made of \'double layer\' and incredibly stiff cardboard, enough so that the interior layer was not damaged at all. The box is currently being requisitioned by my wife to provide shelter to local strays when the weather inevitably turns, as it always does. The product was in perfect condition. Pristine.The chair, once assembled, sits high enough my daughter (5\'6) can barely touch the floor with her toes at it\'s highest setting. The arm rests are satisfactory, but not especially comfortable, so I\'ll likely leave them folded up going forward, or look for a cushioned sleeve for them.The mesh material is coarse and isn\'t especially comfortable to lean back on without a shirt, which is a serious issue for people in tropical climates. In board shorts or pants the seat is comfortable and springy, but once again, if you\'re keen to wear short shorts or want to lounge around in your underwear in the evenings (or during mercilessly hot tropical afternoons), it\'s going to get very uncomfortable, very quickly. I\'d imagine it will be intolerable for ladies in similar states of undress.The head rest is a nice idea, but the arch of the chair makes using it a bit problematic without some very fine tuning. If you\'re tall enough (I\'m 6\'1 and it works, barely), you can use a kind of "V" setup (you\'ll understand when you look at it) to get it far enough out you can make use of it.If you\'re shorter, say... 5\'7 or under? You\'re probably not going to need to bother connecting it to the chair at all, due to the arch of the backrest and the design of the headrest.That said, it\'s an excellent value, especially on sale. The instructions are in a proper booklet, well-written and easy to follow. The warranty is in it\'s own stiff envelope. I was able to re-package the spare hardware and key-tools in the package in came in, to store in my cabinet. The construction is solid (remember to re-tighten after two weeks of use!) and feels very much comparable to the $1,400 chairs we have at the office, save for the mesh not being nearly as luxurious (or luxurious at all, being coarse plastic).I\'d recommend it for anyone looking for a solid office or gaming chair, but not if you\'re planning to spend a lot of time lounging around in it to watch videos or similar. If you\'re in a tropical climate, be aware that it will not accommodate your being in any state but properly dressed. If you\'re like me and spend most of your time at home wearing board shorts and nothing else, you\'re gonna wanna find a nice cover to throw over the back seat.I\'ve got one of my wife\'s airy sarongs thrown over the back to take advantage of the trade winds, while avoiding the scratchy mesh.I\'m quite happy with my purchase.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Superior product and superior customer service', 'author': 'Mark mayo', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was expecting a lot when I ordered this chair. I was not disappointed!First, about the chair assembly:The assembly was quick and easy. Even for one with a very bad back, although I did have to be on the floor. I would have been on the floor no matter what chair I put together. I have assembled several office chairs over time. This one was, by far, the most enjoyable. The instructions were clear, and the illustrations were actually helpful. I have not been so fortunate with other chairs.Second, the chair itself:It is well made. Having been burned by other manufacturers, I inspected this as I was unpacking. I did not see any flaws. The parts are solid and well made. Some other chairs I have owned had to take some adjustments to be comfortable. This one was comfortable right out of the box. I weigh 220 (though I am planning on losing some weight), and it supported me without groaning. The headrest is incredibly adjustable about. I was able to find just the right position in no time. With most of the other chairs I have owned, the headrests were more ornamental than functional. One of the main reasons I bought this chair was for arms that swing up. That makes it extremely function for my guitar playing. I don‚Äôt have to purchase an extra chair: this one handles my office needs and my studio needs as well.Third is the customer service:I was skeptical of the other reviews that extolled the service. Trust the reviews. This customer service was responsive. Jennie was concise and helpful. It was a pleasure to work with her. Again, I have not had good experiences with other companies. I contacted them to inquire about the price of the roller blade wheels. Their reply was that the would send a set at no cost. As for the lumbar pillow that some reviews had mentioned, they were out of stock.If you can‚Äôt tell by now, I am an extremely satisfied customer.I would recommend this chair to anyone.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My favorite office chair!!!', 'author': 'Casey Payton', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I originally bought one of these around 2021 and it was incredible! So extremely comfy, quick to put together and sturdy!!! My husband started working from home a little over a year ago so i sacrificed my beloved office chair for his comfort while he worked. Cuz you know.. he pays the mortgage and i needed him to happily and comfortably do so lol. But I was stuck with an old wobbly, no back office chair for about a year. I was searching for another office chair to finally get for myself and looked through some slightly cheaper options other than Gabrylly. No matter what I found, I kept coming back to this chair in my cart. I couldn‚Äôt find anything that compared to this chair and I already knew the quality of it because I had one!! I was going to get one of their cheaper models but NOPE! I added the exact same one to my cart and purchased it! And I‚Äôm so happy with my decision. It‚Äôs so worth the price point and I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll ever buy another office chair other than this one! I love how the seat is mesh so it doesn‚Äôt get dusty and funky from years of farting in it. The arm rests adjust to slide up and down and you can fold them up if you have a slightly shorter desk. The mechanisms for reclining and rocking and locking are so sturdy, I never feel unsafe when I lean back. And above all else, they have amazing customer service!! I went to active my warranty with them and they activated it AND sent me the upgraded wheels that work better on wood flooring! They‚Äôre very kind and they have a great product. Those two combined will keep me coming back for these chairs when my kids get old enough to have their own computer desks and such! Thank you Gabrylly!!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This is an amazing chair for the money!', 'author': 'Shelby', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I took a big gamble on this chair as I desperately needed a new office chair early last year and had never heard of this brand. I‚Äôm a big guy, 260lbs, 6‚Äô3‚Äù, and this chair is quite comfortable and has held up very well. I didn‚Äôt want to review this chair too early as I wanted to have some time with it. To my surprise, this chair seems to punch up above its price range quite a bit. There‚Äôs a lot of value here when thinking of durability and comfort.I believe I‚Äôve owned it for almost a year now and it‚Äôs pretty much exactly like it was when I first bought it. The netting on the seat has sagged slightly, but it isn‚Äôt noticeable. I‚Äôm a guitar player and the fold back arms are SO convenient! The wheels still work like new, gas piston still goes up and down, and the recline adjuster works fine.The only issues I have with this chair are the recline adjustment isn‚Äôt that great. It seems like after some wear I can‚Äôt get the back to adjust completely forward anymore. The headrest is well made but I wish it angled forward a lot more so it would actually be useable without having to sit all the way back. These aren‚Äôt deal breakers at all though, just small nit picks.Overall, I‚Äôve been very pleased. I feel this chair is a great value. I use it ever single day for long hours, work and play, and it‚Äôs always comfortable. I never get tired of sitting in this chair, and for a large man that‚Äôs saying a lot. The fact that this chair can hold up to my weight and still look great and be comfortable after almost a year is a great sign for its overall longevity. It really does look just like it did when I bought it besides the slight sag in the netting.Highly recommended! This chair will last! Buy with confidence!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent chair, exactly what I was looking for', 'author': 'Rob Cain', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'No photos needed here; the chair looks exactly as pictured in the product page.I bought this chair to address issues I was having with circulation and leg pain. This chair has addressed both readily; in particular, the front of the seat slopes off instead of coming to a hard lip so it doesn\'t dig into my legs when sitting. The ergonomics are excellent as the chair has various ways to customize the sit; the seat back is adjustable, letting you tilt it to where you like and lock it in place there (I don\'t like to sit bolt-upright, so I leaned it back one level). The headrest is also adjustable in two directions, so you can put that right where you like it as well, and even the arms can be adjusted to put them where you like when they\'re swiveled down.The mesh is supportive but has give to it. It\'s no memory foam, but that\'s not what I was looking for. It breathes well and doesn\'t stick in humid environments. It\'s rubberized and lightly rough to run your fingers over, but that roughness keeps you from slipping around; unless you plan to use it naked, it\'s fine. If you really don\'t like the feel of it on your butt, however, they\'ll send you a cushion‚Äîmore on that in a sec. I also got the optional blade-style wheels (again more in a sec), which I ended up not using for now, because they don\'t play well with padded carpets, but which I think are perfect for shallow carpets, hard floors, or carpet protectors.The only issue I\'ve had with this chair is‚Äîand bear with me here‚Äîit absorbs farts like some sort of ass osmosis. It started to stink of butt real quick, and requires periodic maintenance; simple soap and water via rag works fine. I don\'t know what it is, but be aware that if you are a flatulent folk, you may need to address this. I brought this to their attention and they offered me a seat cushion, which brings me to the "in a sec":Probably the best thing about this chair is the customer service. When assembling the chair, I noticed in the instructions that they offer "blade" style wheels as an option (think rollerblades). Having never used such a thing on a chair, I decided to contact the provided email. Turns out I didn\'t have to‚Äîthey ended up reaching out to me on their own anyway to ask how the chair was. When I inquired about the wheels to find out how much they\'d cost, the answer was nothing; they shipped the wheels to me for free, shipping and all. When I mentioned the issue with the mesh smell, they offered me a seat cushion as well, although I didn\'t take that offer because I like the feel of the seat as is and I can address the smell easily enough. From other reviews I\'ve seen they offer other accessories, and I believe them.You, savvy shopper who reads reviews, may be asking why they don\'t just include all of these accessories from the get-go. I haven\'t asked, but the chair is worth the price as-is, and not everyone will want or need every accessory, so including them with every chair would not only be unnecessary (and probably raise the price), but wasteful as well. Since they reach out to customers to offer these accessories, and include contact info to ask yourself in the instructions, I think this method is a good call.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great chair and great customer service!', 'author': 'Michael DeMaria', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought this chair because my previous ones were hurting my back. I decided to splurge and spend the money on this. It had other great reviews and customer support so I figured why not. The box came with everything you need and the assembly instructions were easy to understand. I reached out to the customer support to inquire on getting the back support and additional cushion that was referenced in other reviews. Customer service got back to me and are shipping both. We'll see how the cushion seat is. A lot of others have said it's superior to the mesh. Personally, if this product didn't have great customer support willing to send that out, this chair would be a 3.5 star, maybe a 4. The mesh seat is firm, but nice when you first sit in it. But after awhile, it starts to hurt your butt. So again, if just the mesh seat, not a 5 start product. The willingness from the seller to work with you on that though brings me to the 5 star review. The reclining capability is nice too. It's a little stiff at first but you get used to it. It goes back pretty far too which is nice. The head rest is adjustable which I think is a great feature. If you don't like it, it's easy to remove too. The arm rests adjust which I use constantly. Didn't know that was on this chair but it's definitely a welcome addition. I don't know how long the mesh seat back will last, hopefully a long time. It seems good quality and allows a lot of air flow. I'm a fan. In summation, the chair is a pretty solid product. It is a bit pricey but ultimately worth it if you plan to work or game in it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good support and ergonomics, great customer service, kinda chilly', 'author': 'Matthew Newby', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've been wanting to get a mesh support office chair for a while, and when this one came up on sale I jumped on it. The packaging was adequate, consisting mostly of sheets of cardboard and components wrapped in thin bubble-wrap. Assembly instructions were clear, and I'm pretty handy with tools so not too difficult to put together. Keep in mind you will have some effort to get all the parts unwrapped, laid out, and assembled. I appreciate the T-handle Allen wrenches, vs the normal kit tools, and inclusion of extra screws in the package.After assembly, I found that the chair was a little difficult to roll on my floors, and sits a little too high for my legs. The assembly instructions said to contact the seller for support, and after letting them know my issues, they mailed me a set of rollerblade casters, and a shorter gas piston for the seat lift. They'd also mentioned that additional lumbar support is available and they mailed me a strap-on pillow for my back. It has a couple elastic bands to hold it on the chair.Installation of the casters was straightforward and I was able to swap them out by hand. The gas cylinder, on the other hand, gave me fits! The video clip included in the support email showed someone gently hitting the base with a mallet. I got my rubber mallet and after tipping the chair on its side, banged on the base for a while with no success. I eventually had to turn it upside down over a couple bins, then use some squeeze clamps and a wooden block to push against the bottom of the gas cylinder and was able to get that off. Separating the top of the gas cylinder piston from the bottom of the chair mechanism was a trial in patience. I hit the bottom of the chair with my mallet, I hit the piston on the sides to try to loosen it. I removed the seat mechanism from the seat, and hit that with the mallet. I put ice-packs around the junction, then hit it. I put the ice packs back, got everything cold, then took my heat gun to try to warm the seat steel and then hit it. I clamped the piston in my wood vise and tried to pry the bottom off with a crowbar (and blocks of wood to keep it from scratching). I tried a pipe wrench to twist the piston. Finally, I opened my vise jaws up, rested the seat mechanism across it and my bench, then took a hardwood stick, put it on the shoulder of the gas cylinder, and hit the top of the stick with a hammer. A few whacks on either side and it finally came loose.Reassembly was straightforward, and the chair now sits low enough that my legs are properly resting on the seat cushion with my feet on the floor. It's about an inch taller than my previous chair, but that's likely the result of the rollerblade wheels.The only other comment I'll make is that this is a MESH support chair, without the usual seat cushion/back. As the weather has started to cool down where I am, I'm finding that it's quite a bit more chilly to sit in than a traditional office chair. This would have been quite welcome in June, but now I'm thinking I'm gonna need something to keep my backside a little warmer as Fall and Winter pass!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Neo Chair Office Computer Desk Chair Gaming-Ergonomic Mid Back Cushion Lumbar Support with Wheels Comfortable Blue Mesh Racing Seat Adjustable Swivel Rolling Home Executive (Black)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Would recommend getting a more sturdier chair for those above 190 lbs', 'author': 'Taz', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great Chair for the price and the assembly was also straight forward but BEWARE because as a cheap product the quality is also pretty cheap. As someone whose 200 lbs and 6 feet, the chair feels somewhat small and the feeling that the chair may break if I completely let go of my body weight onto the chair is etched onto you as soon as you sit on it. Otherwise its a decent chair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Looks great at an affordable price', 'author': 'Rebecca A. Rose', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased this chair, and I'm thoroughly impressed with the quality and aesthetics it offers at such an affordable price point.The ivory fabric combined with the white frame gives it a modern and clean look that brightens up my space. Assembly was a breeze - the instructions were clear, and I had it set up in no time. The wheels roll super smoothly, making it easy to move around my desk area.Comfort hasn't been compromised for style; the soft fabric and breathable mesh back are perfect for long days, providing both support and comfort. It feels sturdy and durable - I think this will be a lasting addition to my space.This chair is truly a great value for money and has exceeded my expectations.
