Love it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good product for the price', 'author': 'Pool guy', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This is a great chair for the price, it's comfortable and easy to install. The only drawback was the bottom circular snap-on piece for the legs it does keep coming undone but is very easy to overlook. If price is a big thing for you then check this chair out.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Super easy to assemble - high quality office chair', 'author': 'Daniel Gothe', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I don't often write reviews (shame on me), but I felt compelled to do so for this chair. I recently moved into a new apartment and have bought a lot of furniture lately, all which required assembly. I've put together some complex stuff and some easy stuff, but I'll say this - they're never as easy as they should be.This chair could have been more complicated to assemble, it sure had enough components to take into consideration, and it's a high quality, sturdy chair.But I was very impressed by both the packaging size and the end quality, not to mention the actual packaging of the components required.All components except for one (the gas powered lift) were put in the back rest of the seat (easy zipper to open). They were neatly packaged and easy to identify with the help from the manual, and all tools required for the job were included.Even if the same type of screw was used for arm rests and attaching the seat to the stand, they were conveniently segmented in different sections of the packaging to help identify what screws were needed for what.As for the actually assembly, everything just fit. That sounds like an obvious requirement, but the lesson I've learned lately is that it doesn't always just do that.The finished product was up and in use within 30 minutes from unpacking, and the immediate impression is that it's really good quality for the price paid. I've seen and sat in chairs twice the price that felt plasticy and uncomfortable, but neither is the case with this chair.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Pleasantly surprised and very happy', 'author': 'karyn kudrna', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this chair for my wife\'s home office mainly because it "looked" to have good cushion support and the color was very close match to another chair. Because I obviously could not try the chair before I buy and I don\'t like returning items unless they are broken or just terrible, I decide to buy the "like new" option that "might" not come in original box. To my surprise I received the chair in the original box, no hardware or parts were previously opened and the chair was absolutely new! I assume this is not common and I assume that if it was a return then it was never opened. Related to the specifics of the chair, it in fact was very easy to assemble with just the one tool that was included. The chair is rock solid and has great support. It was not for me but I will keep a look out for another in like new condition and try my luck again. I saved $30 buying like new. My suggestion to anyone looking for a deal is to try the like new option. Note you can always return the item if you don\'t like it. Hope this review helps.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Serta Fairbanks Big and Tall High Back Executive Office Ergonomic Gaming Computer Chair with Layered Body Pillows, Contoured Lumbar Zone, Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Chair shopping is frustrating, this is a good chair', 'author': 'Household', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Prelude:I\'m a college student who got their first desk chair buying a room full of furniture from the last tenant of my house for a couple hundred bucks. I loved my chair cause I could sit criss-cross applesauce and lean back so far that I could sleep periodically while pulling all nighters. It had no butt support (I had a pillow and blanket layered under me) and the entire thing was basically held together with packing tape, but we spent many a night together and I appreciated it beyond rational thought. The final straw tho was when I was napping and one of the legs snapped, almost landing my head on the corner of my bookshelf. Even then, I loved this chair so much that I taped a tide pod box to the broken leg and kept it for another 8 months, playing russian roulette every time I leaned back, rolling the dice if I would fall over or not. After finally acquiring a student job I decided it was time for my Tide Pod Box Chair to go to the big office max in the sky. I tell you the legacy of TPBC to emphasize how reluctant I was to get a new chair, and how picky I was at selecting it. I searched for days before finally ordering this one out of defeat.Review:It seems that every frickin chair in the world has contradicting reviews online. One review says it\'s comfy, tall, and has great support, another says that this chair kicked their dog and embezzled money from their savings account. I\'m here to assure you that this chair is a good chair. It came in 2 days with prime shipping, and took me under a half hour to assemble. My poor butt had no idea what support felt like until I sat in this desk chair.I am a lanky 6\'5" basketball center with legs for days, and while I can\'t sit completely criss-cross applesauce like TPBC provided due to this chair\'s arms, I can twist my ridiculously long body into many comfortable positions with how wide the seat is. I don\'t think it would provide a comfortable amount of wiggle room for any of my heavier set friends out there, but my needs are met. The top of my head does go a couple inches above the back of the chair when it\'s straight up, but leaning back provides the perfect angle for me to tilt my head back and rest. The legs on this thing are sturdy. I am greatly enjoying leaning as far back as I please without the neverending threat of potential death looming over me, and I think after a good bit of use it will lean back as far as I\'d like. The lowest setting is a little high for my semi-low desk, but my criss-crossed legs still fit under comfortably.Appearance-wise this baby looks just like the picture. The cushions provide good back/spine alignment and while I was concerned that the cushy pad at the front of the seat would be annoying its not at all, it actually provides more support and prevents me from tipping forward. The twisty thing that sets how easily you can lean back does its job perfectly, as does the height adjustment.If you\'re not looking to spend a bajillion dollars on an executive chair with the most confusing reviews in the world and you don\'t have the ability to go find a chair you can test in a store cause your tuition keeps you tap dancing the poverty line, this is a really. great. chair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 4, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 6‚Äô1‚Äù 285lbs‚Ä¶', 'author': 'JATOAV8OR', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Here‚Äôs how & why I chose to purchase this chair. I am 6ft 1in. and 285lbs I'm also 63yrs with back & shoulder issues. I‚Äôm not going to tolerate an uncomfortable chair. This model is among the top 5 most comfortable chairs I tried in person out of more than 50 various models and by far the best price. They ranged in price from $79 to $1600The majority of big & tall chairs I tried were over stuffed especially the headrest, that forces me into an awkward uncomfortable position that hurts my neck. Many so called (ergonomic) style chairs are exactly the opposite for me, I feel like I‚Äôm not sitting back far enough and the mesh chairs that are all the rage had frame members that hurt after only a few minutes. I think mesh is okay if you‚Äôre of average size but I couldn‚Äôt find one that I could live with.Even some of the chairs claiming to be for big & tall folks were so narrow that no space existed between me and the arms!This was one of the few chairs at any price that didn‚Äôt exhibit these design flaws and also has a sufficient weight capacity, 350lbs.I‚Äôm using this at home mostly for gaming so I can‚Äôt say how my back & butt would feel after 8 hours in it but I have sat for 4 + hours with no discomfort.I‚Äôm wide and I don‚Äôt feel cramped by the armrests and the seat is deep enough and contoured so I don‚Äôt feel like I‚Äôm slipping off the front edge. I can actually lean back and feel fully supported.When I assembled it I noticed spacers where the base mounts to the seat that slightly angles the whole chair back so you don‚Äôt have the feeling the chair is trying to eject you.There was nothing under $300 that came close to matching the size, capacity and comfort but for an additional $150 the Serta Smart Layers Air series of big & tall chairs had a couple designs that had all the attributes of the Fairbanks and also has superior padding in the seat. I would look seriously at these if I had to spend an entire workday in a chair. I went to a local showroom that had all the popular brands with various price ranges and styles, I sat in every one.As an overweight large size person my advice is first to test in person I was surprising how many poorly designed products are on the market. Secondly if you must make a choice online focus your search only on big & tall series chairs with 350lbs capacity or higher and avoid standard size chairs of 275lb or less capacity, avoid TASK style chairs and WATERFALL seat designs.TASK chairs are tilted forward and WATERFALL seats taper down in front. Both make you feel like you‚Äôre slipping off the front edge of the seat. I‚Äôve only had this chair a month so I can‚Äôt attest to the durability but this chair checks the most boxes by far and I have no complaints especially at this price!I'm not associated with this product or any other product. I received nothing in return for my review.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good chair, kinda squeaky', 'author': 'Matthew Morrison', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The chair is easy to assemble and comfortable. The arm rests are a good height and comfortable to rest on. The only problem is that it squeaks and no matter where I apply oil I can't make it stop. Fortunately, it isn't a deal breaker, but it does lower my rating from 5 to 4 stars.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "1.0 out of 5 stars It's okay and.. WHAT IS THAT SMELL? Serta needs to sort their quality.", 'author': 'Cassandra', 'rating': 1, 'content': "I've been actively using this chair now for a few weeks and overall its pretty decent. But even from the get-go I noticed a weird smell on it. Figured that it was leather so it probably had an odor that would fade as it'd been wrapped in plastic and such. So I kept using it. But the smell still hasn't gone away. In fact I'd say it's gotten worse. I'd compare its likeness to a dirty cat box.I tried contacting support twice now. Once was for something that worked itself out so its not worth mentioning. The second was about the smell. Both times the email I got back was a very copy/pasted response telling me to call a different company because apparently Serta doesn't make the chairs. So -- why are you selling a product you're unwilling to support? If they had just responded with some simple tips on ways to get rid of that smell, we'd be golden. Instead I'm sitting here frustrated because they went the easy route and bounced me to a different company. One that I'd have to call to get any support since their automated message failed to list any other options.Is the chair comfortable? Yeah it's pretty nice. It does wobble more than I like. The feeling of it moving unsecured in the bottom (the part with the rollers attached) can get annoying and I hope it doesn't wear it prematurely. The smell is pretty bad though. Every time I sit when it pushes the air out of the cushion, it stinks. Glad I don't have this in an office setting or I'm sure I'd get complaints.EDIT: March 10, 2023This is really not worth the cost. The seat CONSTANTLY wobbles like it's not screwed in all the way or the base isn't seated right. It won't stay up. A couple sits and it slowly sinks back to the lowest setting. It feels like it's cheaply made. Sure the cushioning is comfortable, but when it feels like it's not stable, and you can't keep it at a comfortable height, that's obviously a big deal.I haven't even had this a year and its definitely less quality than the cheaper one I bought YEARS ago. One that lasted me a very long time, and I was able to comfortably use up until the seams were coming out, and the seat had tilted forward from daily use for many years. I'd say at least five years?And it was a Serta as well. That's pretty sad that the quality has declined that much when a seat that costs 100.00 MORE, can't even last a year.This is pretty ridiculous.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 1, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect fit', 'author': 'Larry T', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I am a big man (tall and heavyset) I needed something which supported my stature and my weight. The descriptions on Amazon and the accompanying diagram with measurements provided enough detail to understand what I was purchasing. I was not disappointed. The chair is wonderful. My back doesn't hurt from sitting at my desk. The only complaint I have is that now, I am working longer hours!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice size for price', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Nice size and comfortable chair without breaking bank! Easy assembly', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Great Chair with an Expiration Date', 'author': 'Joe D.', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I'm 6'4 and have been anywhere between 250-280 while using this chair. It is a little squeaky like that one review said but size and comfort for a great upgrade.9 months later, the arm rest is starting to crack and every now and then (at least twice a day) the chair will drop a bit. I'm tall, i need it all the way up so thats annoying but the leather cracking after only 9 months is crazy!! I bought this to replace a chair that was cracking and slipping so i guess i'm on the search again.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Big chair for big people.', 'author': 'Paul Smith', 'rating': 5, 'content': "When looking for reviews of this sort of item I always find it difficult to find people telling me what I NEED to know. This review is for people like me.You a big boi? A big grrl? Your hips wider than most? Do you lie about your weight when anyone asks? Perhaps you're not big boned and just long boned, tall as a tree. This chair is for you.I am not small, I weigh about 300 pounds and am just under 6 feet. On top of this I work as a CAD drafter and sometimes spend more than 40 hours per week sitting in this chair. My rear-end never hurts no matter how long I spend, I can lean all the way back without worry of tipping it over, both arms are more than wide enough apart that my thighs never touch them and boy is this thing comfy. After owning it for several months now nothing is wrong, broken, or feeling like it's about to go. Everything's still solid, the cushion is still fluffy. When I fully extend the seat's height, my feet just barely sit flat, so if you're particularly tall, this chair is awesome.This is the chair for us fat kids. I definitely recommend it. Better than any gaming chair I have ever used.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Hard to recline...', 'author': 'Kindle Customer', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I have had several Serta big and tall chairs, the first 4 were the same model. The last one I bought was different although supposedly the same model. It tilted more forward (waterfall?) and I always felt like I was going to fall out of it. AND, one of the main reasons I bought them was for the recline. The first three were great - very easy to recline. The last one was so incredibly stiff I never was able to recline in it even after two years of use - you'd think that might have loosened up... I decided to try a different model and liked the review on this model from the person that talked about the front of the seat not being waterfall. The chair itself is great, BUT, I have it turned all the way to easy and still the recline is so stiff I have to brace my feet on the floor or a wall to keep it reclined back. Since this is one of the major reasons I wanted the chair I am so disappointed and it's the reason for only three stars.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Bigger than other chairs, but not really for big & tall people.', 'author': 'Marty McFly', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'This chair is absolutely larger than your typical office chair, but only slightly. I\'m 6\'6" and if I try to lean back into just about any office chair, my head will flop back because I\'m taller than the chair. It\'s about 4" larger in every dimension than the chair it replaced so that\'s nice, and the cushions are VERY comfortable, but honestly I was hoping this would be a much larger chair. I once had a chair large enough to fold one of my legs under me and sit half-indian style, but this isn\'t that large. I don\'t know where such chairs are sold but I know they exist somewhere. In the meantime, this will suffice.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: DEVAISE Computer Office Chair, High Back Ergonomic Desk Chair with Adjustable Flip-up Armrests, Lumbar Support and Thick Headrest, Executive Suede Fabric Swivel Task Chair, Brown
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Chair and I‚Äôm glad I bought it.', 'author': 'Keith Ward', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Easy to assemble and well calibrated, everything fit together beautifully. Armrests are VERY comfy, lets see how it holds up over time, i like the color and its very soft to the touch. i like the lean back on it although i agree with someone else on the reviews its a little odd to have to reach that far back to "lock " it into place. my arms are barely long enough to reach it, if they weren\'t then i think i would return it. support could be better but its still good in my opinion.Last and most important thing that i want to note and let eveyone know is that it does made sounds, if this is something that will eventually go away but its pretty loud for me, if i lean back and then come back to type i hear a loud pop or snap at the base of the chair. i have looked for a while to try to find where the issue is but have had no luck. School, work, home.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable and great quality', 'author': 'Manny Cabral', 'rating': 5, 'content': "It's comfortable and good quality. If the desk is too low or if it has to be raised up arm rests rotate up making it easier to push the chair all the way forward.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Looks nice, cheap cushions', 'author': 'Steve Russell', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'Chair looks nice and was easy to put together but the seat cushion provides no support less than a year in.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars Great but doesn't tilt like photos", 'author': 'A_diva', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Love this chair. I still moved it down 1 star because I think that part in the image is deceiving.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Ok chair', 'author': 'Dianna Flyr', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'The chair is‚Ä¶..ok. The chair it‚Äôs self isn‚Äôt very comfortable. It makes you sit completely straight upright, which can be a good thing I guess, but after sitting in the chair for 2 hours my back and shoulders were hurting. The seat is a little on the hard side and my knees started to hurt after about 3 hours of sitting in the chair. Some reviewers said the chair didn‚Äôt tilt back very far or not at all, I didn‚Äôt have that problem, but it took A LOT of force to push back in the chair. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The Perfect small office space chair.', 'author': 'Ladonia Hill', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This chair is so comfortable and the permit fit for a small space. Very happy with my purchase!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great value', 'author': 'Carmie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Sturdy, nice looking and very comfortable', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars I cannot believe!!!', 'author': 'Al.x', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Now that i gots your attentionI was pretty bummed put once i opened the back rest to take the parts out so i could put it tpgether and realized the bacl rest doesnt come with a cushion...its just empty space there so get yourself a pillow or something too pr just buy a diffetent oneOther than that its a pretty good and comfy chair', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Definitely not white! Assembled alone.', 'author': 'Cindy', 'rating': 4, 'content': "If you want a truly white office chair, keep looking. This is definitely not white. I'd say a creamy light neutral off white. I decided I could live with the color and put it together by myself-a little out of order.Took me less than an hour. A second set of hands would make it easier but not necessary. I assembled the legs with wheels as instructed. Attached the lift to the legs. Then I attached the black metal base to the bottom of the seat. I did not put the seat on the legs yet. Sitting on the floor, scooting around to finish was not an option! I attached the arms to the back and seat while standing using the top of my kitchen counter, pull out cutting board and the box it came in for lift and support. I attached both arms to the seat first. It is vital to attach the screws 50% or less until you get every screw in the arms, seat and back. It took me a few tries to get everything lined up correctly. That would be the only part where another set of hands is helpful. I screwed everything in 100% and put the cover buttons on. Put the lift with legs attached in the black metal base and gently put the assembled chair on the floor.Chair is sturdy, wide and rolls nicely on my lvp floors. Initial reaction is very positive. Removed a star for color description. I may update later on longevity of parts.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great chair for the price', 'author': 'Lisa', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I like this chair. It is perfect for my home office. I love the price and it arrived sooner than I expected. My husband had it put together before I got home from work so I'm not sure about the assembly but he had no complaints so I'm guessing it was easy. Very pleased.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: NEO CHAIR Office Desk Computer Gaming Chair with Ergonomic Lumbar Back Support Flip-up Padded Armrest Adjustable Height and Wheels for Home or Office (Grey)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars comfortable and functional chair', 'author': 'Tim', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is the chair I have been looking for. It's comfortable and not expensive. It has a streamline-designed chair back, so it seems to be good for my back. When seated, I feel a little flexible, forth and back, and I like it. Height adjustment is also good. It wasn't too difficult to assemble it. And the armrests can be raised, the flip-up function is really convenient for me. When I sit down and play the guitar, I can raise one armrest so I can stay in a comfortable position for a long time. I took a picture because this function suits me. For those who need these features, this chair would be one of the best for you. It's not big but suits me. I can feel it wrapping around my waist. The quality is good compared to the price. I love the chair and highly recommend it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 15, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing!', 'author': 'Sam Sun', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This was one of the best purchases I‚Äôve made this year! My last chair was too bulky and it got really hot to use so I was in the market for a mesh chair like this. I really like that the arms go up because I like to keep my chair very high/tall and without the arms, it would not fit under my desk. It looks really neat! The arms kind of gently snap into place up and down, which is nice. The chair tilts back but I think also locks when you want it to be more still.The chair seems really well made, especially for its price. Huge plus is that the seat is much thicker than I thought, and very comfy. I also like that the seat isn‚Äôt like those scratchy mesh material that leaves marks when you wear shorts. It‚Äôs very comfy and I can sit cross legged or just prop one leg up. So far super comfy for sitting in it for hours. The chair holds my back well too.Assembly was pretty easy, everything fit smoothly. The bolts were just a teeny tight but once it‚Äôs all together it feels very sturdy. There is a cap on the gas cylinder thing you have to take out.Overall great value for the price. Feels very sturdy and it‚Äôs very comfortable. Goes great with my wooden desk.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 14, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Comfy but hard to assemble', 'author': 'Topher C', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This chair is cute, compact, and comfy. But holy heck was it hard to assemble! I ended up having to get help because the instructions were confusing. I order office chairs often and this is the hardest I have ever put together', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Good chair but not what I needed', 'author': 'Marie', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I really like the minimalist look of this chair and it feels very high quality. It is mostly plastic, but it's very heavy and solid feeling. The arm rests don't feel loose or fall when in the upright position. The wheels roll really well and super smoothly. The cushion is okay. It's pretty average. Not super soft, but not hard either. While I do think this is a good chair there are some aspects that make me regret this purchase. I thought there would be more back support, but honestly there isn't any. The curve of the chair is good for posture, but if your back is already not so great like mine, it doesn't really help. Putting it together was also not a great experience. The instructions were straightforward and easy to follow but , the screws were really finicky and hard to get in. Even after following the directions and not tightening them all the way until the end. Took me forever to put this chair together. On the upside they seemed to have fixed the mistake about the hydraulic thing in the instructions that others have commented on. I saw no mention of having to take any cap off.Overall it's a good quality chair, but the lack of back support basically makes this useless to me.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Simple to put together & good quality', 'author': 'Pam in TN', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The chair was super easy to put together and is of nice quality for the price. title: Ergonomic Office Chair, High Back Mesh Desk Chair with Thick Molded Foam Cushion, Coat Hanger, Adjustable Headrest, Lumbar Support, Tilt & Lock Function - Computer Chair (Light Grey)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Life Saver for Teacher with Back and Neck Pain', 'author': 'Klaviergoddess', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is the third chair I\'ve purchased from this manufacturer. It is obvious that they listen to feedback from customers and make every effort to improve form and function. Apart from the cheerful colors, the big upgrades on this chair are the fully adjustable headrest, the thicker cushion, and the wider back. The coat rack will also be a useful feature for many people at the office. I am a piano teacher who sits for long periods of time, working with students. When I\'m not teaching, I sit in my craft room for long periods. I have pinched nerves in my neck and lower back. I cannot overstate the importance of my chairs being as ergonomic as possible. This chair is ideal for me at 5\'5", with the seat in the lowest position. The S curve fits my back perfectly, and the mesh is extremely comfortable. If needed, I can tweak the position of the padded/cushioned lumbar support with the built-in adjustment slider. The adjustable headrest makes such a difference to me. I can easily shift it if I need to relieve pressure on my neck. This is the chair you won\'t mind sitting in ALL day. I LOVE the color combinations, which are perfect for my little craft room. I can easily roll the chair from one workstation to another. The chair feels sturdy, and the quality is all top-notch. I believe it will last a long time. It was easy to put together. They included the necessary tools and even provided white gloves for handling the hydraulic lift. This is a fantastic chair for the price. The quality and value make it stand out from the rest. You can\'t go wrong with this one.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice modern look ,Easy to Assemble Great Chair for a Great Price', 'author': 'CC', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Assembling it was a breeze ‚Äì no hassle or frustration involved. The design really nails the balance between support and comfort. The lumbar support is great, making long hours at the desk a breeze. This chair gets it right! It feels tailored to your body. I can't stress enough how comfortable it is. Overall, a solid choice if you're seeking a chair that's easy to set up, supports your back, and makes sitting for hours a pleasure, to add great looking chair.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The Perfect Gift...', 'author': 'Osman Ozakinci', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I got this chair for my wife as a gift. She's pretty picky about these kind of stuff, but this one really met our expectations. First off, it looks sleek and modern ‚Äì the wide backrest and cool design give it a professional vibe. Plus, they added a coat hanger at the back, which she found really handy. The chair is not just about looks, though. The flip-up armrests are a cool move ‚Äì you can easily slide it under the desk, saving space. The foam cushion is comfy without being too soft or too firm, perfect for long hours of sitting. My wife loved especially the adjustable lumbar support feature after the old one - it's great for back pain due to long work hours. Putting it together was pretty easy, took me around 20-25 minutes. And the 5-year warranty is a nice bonus for that extra peace of mind. In a nutshell, it's a mix of style, practicality, and comfort. My wife loved her new chair, and I'd definitely recommend it to anyone who wants a top-notch ergonomic chair without sacrificing style.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars FOKESUN Ergonomic Office Chair', 'author': 'Rochel Litzman', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The assembly took about 45 minutes - not too difficult. Instructions were OK, but no clear explanation of how to adjust the built in lumbar support although the existence of the lumbar support is mentioned on a picture. Chair seems sturdy and is very comfortable. There is some concern how the light colors will hold up in the long run. The spokes on the base are painted white, and sometimes I rest my feet there - already showing scuff marks - a rubber strip on top of the spokes would help.In sum it seems to be a sturdy and very comfortable chair at a reasonable price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Surprisingly good for the price', 'author': 'Yaniel Rivera', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Overall the chair is very sturdy and I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of the materials. It has a good height adjustability which was just what I needed and it's also quite comfortable. The colors are very nice and match my desk setup perfectly.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great chair!', 'author': 'JohnnyB', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Just assembled this product and so far it's very comfortable and was easy to put together. I'm 6'1 and the height seems perfect for me. Arm rests a little narrow for my body frame/build but it's not too narrow to still be comfortable.
