title: GABRYLLY Ergonomic Mesh Office Chair, High Back Desk Chair - Adjustable Headrest with Flip-Up Arms, Tilt Function, Lumbar Support and PU Wheels, Swivel Computer Task Chair
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good chair, very comfortable, go ahead and get it', 'author': 'Terry G.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Review is for GABRYLLY Ergonomic Mesh Office Chair, High Back Desk ChairI was a little concerned about this chair being that I am only 5\'4" and according to the description, this chair is meant for a taller person.Don\'t worry, it fits fine, without issues. I can easily place both feet right on the ground, even being a "short" person. I use a foot rest anyway, so I see no issues if you are shorter using this chair.This chair is quite comfortable to sit in, with the back being very straight up. This is good and bad. You get lots of support like this, when you want to sit completely straight, but can easily lean back a bit for more comfort, when needed. You easily adjust the tension by the front knob that controls how hard you need to push back to adjust the back rest like most chairs that recline.Speaking of reclining, this chair reclines pretty far, and is very comfortable.The head rest you will need to fiddle with to make it custom fit for your head. This is the first time I have used a head rest of this type, and surprised at how comfortable it is. Putting the head rest on, while assembling the chair is the hardest part, and its quite easy to do.As some others have said, the seat mesh is a little "scratchy", but you get used to it.I have found that I like using a cushion on the seat for extended sitting sessions, but you may not need one. The mesh seat is quite comfortable, and sometimes I switch between using a cushion and sometimes not using one. You will have to see what works for you.One big reason I got this chair is the swing up arms. I prefer these type arms, since you can easily lift them up out of the way, where as other chairs you can\'t do this. This makes it easy to push in the chair very close to your desk, saving room.Customer Service. One word, OUTSTANDING!I have hard floors at home, and carpet at work. My work place bought me the same chair, so I bought one for home use. I emailed the company and asked about purchasing the roller type wheels for my home chair, and they offered me an additional set for the at work chair, which I didn\'t need. They were willing to ship me two sets for free! I declined the one for work, since its carpet and didn\'t need a set. Thats great customer service, which is rare now a days. Keep this in mind when shopping for a chair...there are lots out there, and this company stands behind their product.Assembly - standard for a chair like this, very easy to do, and they provide a simple video to watch. Maybe takes 10 minutes to put together, and you can do it yourself. If you have trouble lifting, you would need some assistance.Shipping - Chair comes very well packed in a sturdy box, no issues there.Quality - I did not have any issues with this chair. Very well put together.Chair options - It leans back pretty far, and with the included head rest, it is quite comfortable to lean back when you are tired for a quick rest, or even a quick, nap. (shhhh...don\'t tell the boss) You can lock the angle of the back to exactly where you want it, if you don\'t like having to push back to lean the back rest.So far I am quite happy with this chair. I have never had a full back mesh type chair, and think that this will last quite a while, even with daily use. I think you will be pleased with this purchase. While you may be able to find a similar chair for maybe a little less price, to me, the customer service you get with this purchase is really worth it. You know that they will stand behind your purchase and your being happy with your purchase of their product. I don\'t think you will be disappointed.*update*Its been 3 months since I purchased this chair and I can tell you 100% no issues with the chair at all. Its quite comfortable, and I would purchase another one, without hesitation. I can be sitting in this chair for long periods of time, with no issues. I do use a small seat cushion, just because I had it left from my previous chair, so might as well make use of it, but its not really needed for this chair. I am completely pleased with this purchase. No chair is perfect, but not being able to get into a chair and sit in it for yourself, shouldn\'t sway you from purchasing this. Its very comfortable, and even though I am 5\'4", its perfect in size, and the head rest is great too. Easy to lean back when you are tired and take a quick nap. WFH...shhhhhhhhh....!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great double-duty chair for office work and guitar playing!', 'author': 'C Curtiss', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently had my trusty office chair fall apart on me after many years of service. After considerable time researching a replacement, I pulled the trigger on the GABRYLLY Ergonomic Mesh Office Chair for my work-from-home setup. As someone who spends long hours at the desk, I was on the hunt for a high-quality chair that would prioritize comfort, support, and functionality, while also allowing me to play guitar from the same piece of furniture. Let me tell you, this chair has exceeded my expectations on all fronts!First and foremost, the ergonomic design of this chair is exceptional. The high back provides excellent support for my entire spine, promoting proper posture and alleviating strain. I'm not a small person, so having a chair that fits my tall frame and weight was clearly of paramount concern. This chair holds up and hasn't shown any signs of stretching or failure. The breathable mesh material keeps me cool and comfortable throughout the day, even during extended periods of sitting. You can actually feel the breeze from underneath, which is a change from my old cloth-bottom chair that would get pretty warm in the summer months.The chair's adjustability options are impressive. The height can be easily adjusted, as can the pitch of the backrest. The armrests are also adjustable, which allows me to flip them back and out of the way for when I play my guitars. The reclining function is very nice, but I opt to keep mine set more upright all the time. As for the headrest, it is kind of the only piece of the chair that I don't find much use for. Unless you lean your whole body back into the chair and lay your head back, the headrest doesn't even come into play.Durability is a standout feature of this chair. The sturdy construction and high-quality materials make it feel solid and long-lasting, but without sacrificing comfort. I initially had the regular casters in the chair, but saw that others were able to contact the company and get a set of rollerblade wheels as a free upgrade. I did that as I am working on a tile floor. And while the regular casters were workable, the roller wheels are much more suited to the solid, but bumpy flooring my workspace is located in.Assembly was a breeze, thanks to the clear instructions and the included tools. Within minutes, I had the chair ready for use. Everything was very straightforward.In terms of customer service, GABRYLLY has been exceptional. They promptly addressed my inquiries and provided support. When requesting the wheel upgrade, they reached back out to me very quickly and answered all of my questions. The wheels were here to me in a matter of days. Very responsive support.I wholeheartedly recommend this chair to anyone in need of an upgrade. It's an affordable chair with the quality of a much higher price tag.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome chair and excellent Customer Service', 'author': 'JoeyO', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Update 7-26-23Jennie and the after sales support from this company is bar none, one of the very best I\'ve ever come across since I\'ve been an Amazon Prime Member for over 15 years.Recently, the headrest broke by accident, so I emailed the company and they gladly accommodated my request for a replacement. Unfortunately, because of a new design in the chair itself, the headrest wouldn\'t work, as the backrest is different now.. I emailed Jennie and they very quickly are sending me a new backrest to make it all whole again.I couldn\'t be happier with the chair. It\'s made with great pride and the support team are always ready to make sure the customers are happy. I highly recommend this chair as it\'s both comfortable and well designed and if ever you need support, they are always ready to be of assistance in any way possible.Thank you Jennie and the rest of your staff for making things so easy to work with.++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++I\'ve spent the better part of two weeks in search of a good chair to replace a 10 year old dilapidated chair that\'s served me well over the years. I checked out so many chairs on Amazon, local stores and sites like Staples, Office Depot, and others. I even looked on Amazon for Gaming Chairs as they seemed like they would be comfortable. To my dismay didn\'t find one to my liking.Being an Amazon Prime Member for 14 years now, I continued my search on Amazon. That\'s when I stumbled upon this GABRYLLY Ergonomic Mesh Office Chair. I read all the reviews and at first was hesitant to purchase it online as was asking myself - \'Oh no! What if I don\'t like it, how will go about returning such a bulky chair?\'I took a leap of faith and went ahead and ordered it online, and was far less expensive than those I saw in local furniture stores and other websites. It arrived in two days as promised, and I was very excited to assemble it, and the first thing that I came to mind was: "Oh boy, I wonder how long this was going to take me to put it together!"To my surprise and amazement, it literally took me more time to unbox and take out all of meticulous wrapping which was done to perfection; and assembling the chair was a breeze, just following along the detailed instructions that came with it. I had it done and rolling to my study in about 15 to 20 minutes tops.Upon sitting on the chair for the first time, I knew there and then that I made the right decision in purchasing this office chair. It\'s super comfortable and the ergonomic design was really to my liking. The headrest was so nice and can easily be adjusted in so many ways. I also like that the armrests can be lifted up and placed out of the way, so that you can roll the chair closer to the table and be in a more comfortable position when typing on the on my various computers :-)The adjustments you can do on the chair was also well though of and such a breeze. For example, I adjusted the tension of how easy it would be to lean back and rock back and forth.Folks, look no further!! This chair fits me to a T!! I am 6"2\' about 155 lbs and the GABRYLLY Ergonomic Mesh Office Chair is super comfortable and the manufacturer went to great length to build this quality chair and paid so much to details, such as the legs where you can place your feet is also testament of how much went into its design. Rotating and rolling back the chair are also very quiet and smooth.In conclusion, as you can see in the photos I\'ve posted, my study/computer room, is my \'Man Cave\' as my wife would call it and this chair was a perfect addition, and couldn\'t be happier.Congrats to those behind the scenes who paid such close attention to details, and made this chair very easy to assemble and extremely comfortable to use.Hope you find this review useful and thanks to all those who have posted their own reviews which helped me in my search for the perfect chair.Thanks and God Bless to all.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 10, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Value', 'author': 'AW', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I recently got around to assembling my chair and it was incredibly simple -- everything necessary comes with the chair, as promised. The holes, hardware and heavy plastics were all correctly drilled / machined and went together without any issues. I didn\'t even need to oil the screws, like I have to with most home assembly furniture I order.As a Hawaii resident, I\'m used to boxes from the mainland arriving torn open and battered like they owed someone money. My chair box was, indeed, quite battered and showed signs of having been kicked or shoved by several different peoples footwear before arriving and there were gouges in the corners where I assume it had been roughly shoved into and out of vehicles.The box is made of \'double layer\' and incredibly stiff cardboard, enough so that the interior layer was not damaged at all. The box is currently being requisitioned by my wife to provide shelter to local strays when the weather inevitably turns, as it always does. The product was in perfect condition. Pristine.The chair, once assembled, sits high enough my daughter (5\'6) can barely touch the floor with her toes at it\'s highest setting. The arm rests are satisfactory, but not especially comfortable, so I\'ll likely leave them folded up going forward, or look for a cushioned sleeve for them.The mesh material is coarse and isn\'t especially comfortable to lean back on without a shirt, which is a serious issue for people in tropical climates. In board shorts or pants the seat is comfortable and springy, but once again, if you\'re keen to wear short shorts or want to lounge around in your underwear in the evenings (or during mercilessly hot tropical afternoons), it\'s going to get very uncomfortable, very quickly. I\'d imagine it will be intolerable for ladies in similar states of undress.The head rest is a nice idea, but the arch of the chair makes using it a bit problematic without some very fine tuning. If you\'re tall enough (I\'m 6\'1 and it works, barely), you can use a kind of "V" setup (you\'ll understand when you look at it) to get it far enough out you can make use of it.If you\'re shorter, say... 5\'7 or under? You\'re probably not going to need to bother connecting it to the chair at all, due to the arch of the backrest and the design of the headrest.That said, it\'s an excellent value, especially on sale. The instructions are in a proper booklet, well-written and easy to follow. The warranty is in it\'s own stiff envelope. I was able to re-package the spare hardware and key-tools in the package in came in, to store in my cabinet. The construction is solid (remember to re-tighten after two weeks of use!) and feels very much comparable to the $1,400 chairs we have at the office, save for the mesh not being nearly as luxurious (or luxurious at all, being coarse plastic).I\'d recommend it for anyone looking for a solid office or gaming chair, but not if you\'re planning to spend a lot of time lounging around in it to watch videos or similar. If you\'re in a tropical climate, be aware that it will not accommodate your being in any state but properly dressed. If you\'re like me and spend most of your time at home wearing board shorts and nothing else, you\'re gonna wanna find a nice cover to throw over the back seat.I\'ve got one of my wife\'s airy sarongs thrown over the back to take advantage of the trade winds, while avoiding the scratchy mesh.I\'m quite happy with my purchase.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Superior product and superior customer service', 'author': 'Mark mayo', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was expecting a lot when I ordered this chair. I was not disappointed!First, about the chair assembly:The assembly was quick and easy. Even for one with a very bad back, although I did have to be on the floor. I would have been on the floor no matter what chair I put together. I have assembled several office chairs over time. This one was, by far, the most enjoyable. The instructions were clear, and the illustrations were actually helpful. I have not been so fortunate with other chairs.Second, the chair itself:It is well made. Having been burned by other manufacturers, I inspected this as I was unpacking. I did not see any flaws. The parts are solid and well made. Some other chairs I have owned had to take some adjustments to be comfortable. This one was comfortable right out of the box. I weigh 220 (though I am planning on losing some weight), and it supported me without groaning. The headrest is incredibly adjustable about. I was able to find just the right position in no time. With most of the other chairs I have owned, the headrests were more ornamental than functional. One of the main reasons I bought this chair was for arms that swing up. That makes it extremely function for my guitar playing. I don‚Äôt have to purchase an extra chair: this one handles my office needs and my studio needs as well.Third is the customer service:I was skeptical of the other reviews that extolled the service. Trust the reviews. This customer service was responsive. Jennie was concise and helpful. It was a pleasure to work with her. Again, I have not had good experiences with other companies. I contacted them to inquire about the price of the roller blade wheels. Their reply was that the would send a set at no cost. As for the lumbar pillow that some reviews had mentioned, they were out of stock.If you can‚Äôt tell by now, I am an extremely satisfied customer.I would recommend this chair to anyone.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My favorite office chair!!!', 'author': 'Casey Payton', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I originally bought one of these around 2021 and it was incredible! So extremely comfy, quick to put together and sturdy!!! My husband started working from home a little over a year ago so i sacrificed my beloved office chair for his comfort while he worked. Cuz you know.. he pays the mortgage and i needed him to happily and comfortably do so lol. But I was stuck with an old wobbly, no back office chair for about a year. I was searching for another office chair to finally get for myself and looked through some slightly cheaper options other than Gabrylly. No matter what I found, I kept coming back to this chair in my cart. I couldn‚Äôt find anything that compared to this chair and I already knew the quality of it because I had one!! I was going to get one of their cheaper models but NOPE! I added the exact same one to my cart and purchased it! And I‚Äôm so happy with my decision. It‚Äôs so worth the price point and I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll ever buy another office chair other than this one! I love how the seat is mesh so it doesn‚Äôt get dusty and funky from years of farting in it. The arm rests adjust to slide up and down and you can fold them up if you have a slightly shorter desk. The mechanisms for reclining and rocking and locking are so sturdy, I never feel unsafe when I lean back. And above all else, they have amazing customer service!! I went to active my warranty with them and they activated it AND sent me the upgraded wheels that work better on wood flooring! They‚Äôre very kind and they have a great product. Those two combined will keep me coming back for these chairs when my kids get old enough to have their own computer desks and such! Thank you Gabrylly!!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This is an amazing chair for the money!', 'author': 'Shelby', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I took a big gamble on this chair as I desperately needed a new office chair early last year and had never heard of this brand. I‚Äôm a big guy, 260lbs, 6‚Äô3‚Äù, and this chair is quite comfortable and has held up very well. I didn‚Äôt want to review this chair too early as I wanted to have some time with it. To my surprise, this chair seems to punch up above its price range quite a bit. There‚Äôs a lot of value here when thinking of durability and comfort.I believe I‚Äôve owned it for almost a year now and it‚Äôs pretty much exactly like it was when I first bought it. The netting on the seat has sagged slightly, but it isn‚Äôt noticeable. I‚Äôm a guitar player and the fold back arms are SO convenient! The wheels still work like new, gas piston still goes up and down, and the recline adjuster works fine.The only issues I have with this chair are the recline adjustment isn‚Äôt that great. It seems like after some wear I can‚Äôt get the back to adjust completely forward anymore. The headrest is well made but I wish it angled forward a lot more so it would actually be useable without having to sit all the way back. These aren‚Äôt deal breakers at all though, just small nit picks.Overall, I‚Äôve been very pleased. I feel this chair is a great value. I use it ever single day for long hours, work and play, and it‚Äôs always comfortable. I never get tired of sitting in this chair, and for a large man that‚Äôs saying a lot. The fact that this chair can hold up to my weight and still look great and be comfortable after almost a year is a great sign for its overall longevity. It really does look just like it did when I bought it besides the slight sag in the netting.Highly recommended! This chair will last! Buy with confidence!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent chair, exactly what I was looking for', 'author': 'Rob Cain', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'No photos needed here; the chair looks exactly as pictured in the product page.I bought this chair to address issues I was having with circulation and leg pain. This chair has addressed both readily; in particular, the front of the seat slopes off instead of coming to a hard lip so it doesn\'t dig into my legs when sitting. The ergonomics are excellent as the chair has various ways to customize the sit; the seat back is adjustable, letting you tilt it to where you like and lock it in place there (I don\'t like to sit bolt-upright, so I leaned it back one level). The headrest is also adjustable in two directions, so you can put that right where you like it as well, and even the arms can be adjusted to put them where you like when they\'re swiveled down.The mesh is supportive but has give to it. It\'s no memory foam, but that\'s not what I was looking for. It breathes well and doesn\'t stick in humid environments. It\'s rubberized and lightly rough to run your fingers over, but that roughness keeps you from slipping around; unless you plan to use it naked, it\'s fine. If you really don\'t like the feel of it on your butt, however, they\'ll send you a cushion‚Äîmore on that in a sec. I also got the optional blade-style wheels (again more in a sec), which I ended up not using for now, because they don\'t play well with padded carpets, but which I think are perfect for shallow carpets, hard floors, or carpet protectors.The only issue I\'ve had with this chair is‚Äîand bear with me here‚Äîit absorbs farts like some sort of ass osmosis. It started to stink of butt real quick, and requires periodic maintenance; simple soap and water via rag works fine. I don\'t know what it is, but be aware that if you are a flatulent folk, you may need to address this. I brought this to their attention and they offered me a seat cushion, which brings me to the "in a sec":Probably the best thing about this chair is the customer service. When assembling the chair, I noticed in the instructions that they offer "blade" style wheels as an option (think rollerblades). Having never used such a thing on a chair, I decided to contact the provided email. Turns out I didn\'t have to‚Äîthey ended up reaching out to me on their own anyway to ask how the chair was. When I inquired about the wheels to find out how much they\'d cost, the answer was nothing; they shipped the wheels to me for free, shipping and all. When I mentioned the issue with the mesh smell, they offered me a seat cushion as well, although I didn\'t take that offer because I like the feel of the seat as is and I can address the smell easily enough. From other reviews I\'ve seen they offer other accessories, and I believe them.You, savvy shopper who reads reviews, may be asking why they don\'t just include all of these accessories from the get-go. I haven\'t asked, but the chair is worth the price as-is, and not everyone will want or need every accessory, so including them with every chair would not only be unnecessary (and probably raise the price), but wasteful as well. Since they reach out to customers to offer these accessories, and include contact info to ask yourself in the instructions, I think this method is a good call.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great chair and great customer service!', 'author': 'Michael DeMaria', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought this chair because my previous ones were hurting my back. I decided to splurge and spend the money on this. It had other great reviews and customer support so I figured why not. The box came with everything you need and the assembly instructions were easy to understand. I reached out to the customer support to inquire on getting the back support and additional cushion that was referenced in other reviews. Customer service got back to me and are shipping both. We'll see how the cushion seat is. A lot of others have said it's superior to the mesh. Personally, if this product didn't have great customer support willing to send that out, this chair would be a 3.5 star, maybe a 4. The mesh seat is firm, but nice when you first sit in it. But after awhile, it starts to hurt your butt. So again, if just the mesh seat, not a 5 start product. The willingness from the seller to work with you on that though brings me to the 5 star review. The reclining capability is nice too. It's a little stiff at first but you get used to it. It goes back pretty far too which is nice. The head rest is adjustable which I think is a great feature. If you don't like it, it's easy to remove too. The arm rests adjust which I use constantly. Didn't know that was on this chair but it's definitely a welcome addition. I don't know how long the mesh seat back will last, hopefully a long time. It seems good quality and allows a lot of air flow. I'm a fan. In summation, the chair is a pretty solid product. It is a bit pricey but ultimately worth it if you plan to work or game in it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good support and ergonomics, great customer service, kinda chilly', 'author': 'Matthew Newby', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've been wanting to get a mesh support office chair for a while, and when this one came up on sale I jumped on it. The packaging was adequate, consisting mostly of sheets of cardboard and components wrapped in thin bubble-wrap. Assembly instructions were clear, and I'm pretty handy with tools so not too difficult to put together. Keep in mind you will have some effort to get all the parts unwrapped, laid out, and assembled. I appreciate the T-handle Allen wrenches, vs the normal kit tools, and inclusion of extra screws in the package.After assembly, I found that the chair was a little difficult to roll on my floors, and sits a little too high for my legs. The assembly instructions said to contact the seller for support, and after letting them know my issues, they mailed me a set of rollerblade casters, and a shorter gas piston for the seat lift. They'd also mentioned that additional lumbar support is available and they mailed me a strap-on pillow for my back. It has a couple elastic bands to hold it on the chair.Installation of the casters was straightforward and I was able to swap them out by hand. The gas cylinder, on the other hand, gave me fits! The video clip included in the support email showed someone gently hitting the base with a mallet. I got my rubber mallet and after tipping the chair on its side, banged on the base for a while with no success. I eventually had to turn it upside down over a couple bins, then use some squeeze clamps and a wooden block to push against the bottom of the gas cylinder and was able to get that off. Separating the top of the gas cylinder piston from the bottom of the chair mechanism was a trial in patience. I hit the bottom of the chair with my mallet, I hit the piston on the sides to try to loosen it. I removed the seat mechanism from the seat, and hit that with the mallet. I put ice-packs around the junction, then hit it. I put the ice packs back, got everything cold, then took my heat gun to try to warm the seat steel and then hit it. I clamped the piston in my wood vise and tried to pry the bottom off with a crowbar (and blocks of wood to keep it from scratching). I tried a pipe wrench to twist the piston. Finally, I opened my vise jaws up, rested the seat mechanism across it and my bench, then took a hardwood stick, put it on the shoulder of the gas cylinder, and hit the top of the stick with a hammer. A few whacks on either side and it finally came loose.Reassembly was straightforward, and the chair now sits low enough that my legs are properly resting on the seat cushion with my feet on the floor. It's about an inch taller than my previous chair, but that's likely the result of the rollerblade wheels.The only other comment I'll make is that this is a MESH support chair, without the usual seat cushion/back. As the weather has started to cool down where I am, I'm finding that it's quite a bit more chilly to sit in than a traditional office chair. This would have been quite welcome in June, but now I'm thinking I'm gonna need something to keep my backside a little warmer as Fall and Winter pass!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Yaheetech Ergonomic Office Chair Desk Chair High Back Mesh Computer Chair Study Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest, Backrest and Headrest for Home Office Working Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy and Comfortable', 'author': 'Bonmot', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I had ordered a different chair (model #YT592318) from the same seller which I wasn't happy with due to the limited adjustments it provided. But based on the ruggedness of that one, I was willing to try a different model that promised more options for positions. This one fit the bill. It took less than 15 minutes to assemble. It tilts back and can be locked in any position or left free to move around. The arms can adjust up and down for the right height, as does the seat and the headrest. The adjustable lumbar support seems to have minimal effect, but still much more than the other model.The only shortcoming with this one (as with the previous model) is that the headrest is set further back than I would like. In any position, I have to tilt my head WAY back just to touch the headrest. Despite this one complaint, I would still highly recommend this chair for comfort, adjustability and certainly for value.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Summary of Features', 'author': 'Kaleb', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I bought this chair because I liked the fancy one I had at work, but didn‚Äôt want to pay a premium. Here‚Äôs a summary of what I found when it arrived:Pros:- It is genuinely comfortable and sturdy. I am happy with the quality.- The basic adjustments are there as advertised.Cons:- When locking the chair‚Äôs back tilt in place, the chair does not move back and forth between reclining and straight. It will stay completely locked in place.- The arm rests do not reach far enough backwards. I like to lean back around 20 degrees. My arms do not naturally have anything to rest on. This is surprisingly uncomfortable and it bothers me a lot.Overall, I am happy with the chair. My biggest issue definitely lies with the last Con (arm rest). If you‚Äôre broke, like me, this is a good choice. If not, maybe consider one without the cons listed above.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Surprisingly well seated and comfortable', 'author': '25', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Two days ago the chair I've been sitting in for six years broke, so I've been looking online for an ergonomic chair for under $80.I'm six feet tall and weigh 246 lbs. So it was hard to find a chair that fit me better.That is until I found this chair for less than $80 that fit my budget and then there was a lot of adjustability.The only thing that made me hesitant was the fact that this chair had very few reviews and only two, and it looked like the kind of official free product that is sent out for free to get people to help review it. So that was something I was hesitant about.But in the end I decided to buy this one because the price/performance ratio seemed really good and there were a lot of reviews for other products in this store, so that reassured me.The delivery arrived at my doorstep very quickly and it took me, alone, about 35 minutes to put it together. I would say the assembly was not difficult, it was very easy.It's very comfortable to sit in, I can adjust a lot of places and the chair supports my weight perfectly!If there is a downside, I think it might be that this chair, if you smell it very close, has a weird new stuff smell.I highly recommend this chair, this chair is perfect for larger people!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Chair', 'author': 'MegK', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This a an awesome chair for the price. Easy to put together. Great adjustment options. Very comfortable. Easy to clean. And stylish to boot!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars My cat's chair üêà", 'author': 'Joe', 'rating': 5, 'content': "It's a pretty comfortable chair so comfortable that my cat uses it more than üòÖ, I just wish the headrest can move forward but it can be fixed with a pillow. Overall a good, Toast(cat) approved!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Very good for the price', 'author': 'Brqdford', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'So far I have had no issues with this chair, it has reclining, back support, ability to lower and raise arm rests. Its decently comfortable for the price, and pretty easy to put together.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very comfy and easy setup', 'author': 'Kira', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The chair did not come with assembly instructions, but I was able to quickly find them online. Assembly was EXTREMELY easy and only a few steps long. Took less than 10 minutes to complete. The chair so far is veeery comfortable to sit in and was the perfect height to reach my desk properly.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars A decent pick', 'author': 'Matthew', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Recently purchased this chair to replace my old desk chair, Arrived earlier than expected and was easy to put together.Being 6\'1" tall (185cm) does present a few issues, main issue is the head rest is positioned far lower than expected and pushes into my shoulders when sitting upright, and the lumbar support is right at the top of my hips and doesn\'t properly support my back. It works far better after tilting back slightly but when upright it does cause a bit of discomfort.Will be updating my review after a few weeks of using the chair, at current, I wouldn\'t recommend for taller people.Update: After using this chair for a while, the cushion does go flat after long use but isn\'t uncomfortable. With the headrest, I had to flip the mount upside down to get the headrest up higher and it works better then if installed the proper way as shown.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good Item for the price, found only one issue.', 'author': 'Diego', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This chair is good, its comfortable and the back is very breathable if you are a warm person. the only issue i have experienced with it is that the screws become loose over time. I have had the chair for 52days, I have used it daily an average of 4-6 hours, while adjusting it, I reached below and felt s screw loose. Flipped it over and saw all of the screws connecting the back of the chair were loose, the base and arm rest screws were not as loose but they required tightening as well. Although, a simple fix, I would recommend checking occasionally to avoid any issues/injuries.Overall, its a good product for the price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars great price', 'author': 'Robert Carey', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I gave this as a gift but the arms are a bit uncomfortable. To improve the comfort I suggest getting some chair arm pads, preferably, memory foam that you can find here on Amazon.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Homall Gaming Chair, Office Chair High Back Computer Chair Leather Desk Chair Racing Executive Ergonomic Adjustable Swivel Task Chair with Headrest and Lumbar Support (White)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable Chair, slightly hard to put together', 'author': 'Ryan Williams', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This chair is quite soft and very comfortable.Positives *Cushion is soft, leathery feel. Adjustable height, and you can add the lumbar/head pillow rest if you desire. *Colours are AMAZING. I ordered the Green and Black, absolutely loving how they pop and add to the set up I have.Negatives *Quite heavy (around 60 lbs?) when it is in the box, I live alone and even though I chose to have it delivered to my back porch (for safety, and also to make it easier for me to slide into the house) FedEx still disregarded my delivery instructions and put it on my front porch. I had to struggle getting it from the front to the back of the house but I managed. Just be cautious if you don't have anyone to help you move the box to begin, it is cumbersome. * I'm not the smartest person but I assumed I could put together a chair. I was -wrong-. Please, please, please find the instructions faster than I did. They are put in with the cushions, so make sure to open everything and lay it out. My biggest complaint was how hard everything was to put together but that is just me not being handy and thinking I can do things myself. I ended up getting it all put together (and correctly it seems!) but it did take about two hours. The instructions are clear up until a point, and the QR Code for the Video in the instructions doesn't take you to the video, just to the companies YouTube where you have to actually find the video instructions you're looking for. All said, I wish it was the instructions had been in their own individual package or just placed in the box instead of in a random area not knowing they are there. If you're handy, you'll be able to build this thing no problem, but if you're not make sure you just read through everything slowly and you'll be able to get it built. It might take two hours like me but you got this!!Overall, I love the chair and I am so glad I bought it. If you're looking for a soft, comfortable chair that you can adjust to your needs, I don't think you can do much better than this.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great buy', 'author': 'Alex roman', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This one review where the part of the chair snapped. You must weigh a lot and/or throwing yourself into it because it‚Äôs very sturdy and the padding is just right. Perfect for relaxing.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Not for all. Not wide enough seat for hips and thighs for some and may cause discomfort.', 'author': 'dpiffy', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'While there were some shipping issues and complaints and issues, the seller was more than willing to get me taken care of despite all the issues just to receive it. That being said, when I got it, shipping box and contents inside were all nicely packaged and protected inside and individually wrapped or boxed. The quality of the chair does seem very nice for the price you are paying. I did not get this chair necessarily as a gaming chair as the title of the product states it as. I just liked the look of it and the features it includes. I also wanted a tall back chair for head and neck support. I am 6‚Äô3‚Äù tall and my last office chair was only a mid level back and old and falling apart. The installation of the chair was actually fairly easy in my opinion. The included paper instructions provided more than enough detail and instruction to get me through it. I did create a customer how to/installation and setup video which should be showing up any day now once approved. Made understanding how to install it a much more fun way to watch it being built from ground up. I‚Äôve had the chair now and have used it for a few days now. The very first full day I had it (I installed it the night before after work), I actually came home super tired and sat down in it. I give the comfortable rating a 7/10. It was comfortable enough especially when reclining the chair back, I actually fell fast asleep it in. Wasn‚Äôt a LazyBoy comfort sleeping chair but it was good enough especially for an office chair. I rate it a 7 for a reason though, something I am honestly very disappointed in and debating on rather I can keep it or not. If one tiny issue was fixed, I would likely give this chair and comfort a 9 or 10 rating. My problem is this: the seat itself, is not wide enough. I am of a fairly average build. However with the raised angled ends on the seat itself where it feels like sturdy metal support bars inside, it keeps my hips and thighs so tight together with no room for much of a relaxed open leg seating position. It almost gives a slight bruising feeling on the side of my upper thighs and hips after prolonged time in it and possibly even pushing on veins and arteries in my legs just enough to slightly cut off blood circulation which in turn gives me a slight dead leg with tingle sensation. I have to keep adjusting my legs and move them from keeping this from happening. Also, I feel the seat could had used some sort of opening or circulation to circulate air. It gets to be a pretty warm seat after awhile. If the seat itself was maybe 6 inches wider or else didn‚Äôt have the lifted angled sides on the ends of the seat, I‚Äôd say this chair is perfect. Back and head and neck support are all great in my opinion. My butt is by no means a wide big butt (haha) so for my wife with wider hips, naturally as a woman, she was uncomfortable in it instantly and didn‚Äôt like it whatsoever. If they ever modify this seat I would be willing to update the review. For now, as I said, I would take caution on seeing how the seat feels for you. I would almost pull the seat out and maybe just install the armrests and sit on it on the ground before putting it all together to see what may be an issue for you as well. I will upload a photo of the seat with me in it to show an example once Amazon turns photo uploads for reviews back on, apparently they have turned the option off temporarily citing the COVID as some sort of reason.Update: I added photos as promised now that it gave me the ability to add them. The photos are to show the narrow seat conditions as I say in the chair and my outer thighs and hips and tight up against the elevated sides of the seat.I did purchase another item here on Amazon, a high rated seat cushion pillow which elevated me up a bit off the seat and has tremendously increased the comfort now where my thighs are not being squashed together. Grant it I shouldn‚Äôt have to buy something else to make this seat work better and more comfortable but I really didn‚Äôt want to have to deal with the time and pain in disassembling the chair and trying to send it back. I made it work. The seat cushion set me back another $30 but it‚Äôs worth it and I can technically take it with me elsewhere if I want to use it and it does really major sitting in this office chair a lot more comfortable and cooler temperature as well. Here is link to recommended seat cushion:Everlasting Comfort Seat Cushion... https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01EBDV9BU?ref=ppx_pop_mob_ap_share', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 2, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars same as the picture', 'author': 'cadence', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'nicer in real life, and super nice for the price. the material is comfortable and its super easy to put together', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great value', 'author': 'RJ Nunnally', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is my second one of these. The first I've had for five or six years and it's pretty rough. The fabric is now coming apart on the seat cushion and more worryingly, the bolts that hold the armrests on have broken. Yes, that's right, broken. The heads break off. I'm not a heavy guy either. Speaking of which, the cushioning in this is fairly firm but good and the seat fits me we well as a smaller person. The cushions provided do help with support and in the end, I find this chair to be very comfortable especially considering the price.Back to the bolts; this has to be the worst part of the chair. They were coming loose on the armrests on my prior chair, then eventually failed at the bolt head. I see there is loctite applied from the factory on this new one; I don't remember if the old one had that and if not, it will help. However, while I was putting together the new chair using an impact driver on the lowest setting (~15 lb/ft), I managed to break one of the bolts at the head. These are clearly weak bolts and they should never snap this way, especially considering their size. In fact, the small Phillips head screws used to secure the plastic trim seem more stout. If you're careful with the bolts and expect to replace the chair in 3 years or so, I think this is a good buy.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good chair and decent price', 'author': 'Massimiliano Milizia', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this chair with my desk because I also wanted something that would work for doing work, playing games, and lounging. It was pretty easy to assemble however I would reccomend having a second person as it makes the process much easier. It reclines super far and raises nicely. It isn‚Äôt that expensive compared to other chairs so I would recommend it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Good chair but will break after a while!', 'author': 'Ryan Beckford', 'rating': 3, 'content': "This is a buyer be aware. I purchased this chair in 2021. Unfortunately, I will not re-purchase again. When I first purchased this chair and received it, the chair was quite easy to assemble. Instructions were clear. Packing was neat. If you had any questions for support, they were quick to respond with an answer.Unfortunately, after months go by, you start to realize the small issues that pop-up, like, the backrest is loose, the armrest starting to damage, or the cylinder pump needs replacement.I use this gaming chair for my work-from-home office chair. The chair is comfortable. Unfortunately, its durability is very low. I've had to contact support various times, and they've helped in trying to resolve the issues by sending replacement parts. However, as soon as the warranty period was up, support was no longer helpful. All issues with the chair would now be an issue that I'd have to resolve on my own.When I purchased this chair, I purchased it with the insurance. And I'm happy I did that. The insurance company refunded me the full amount I paid for this chair after submitting all the images that proved manufacture defect, wear and tear and replacements sent by the seller.To all those looking to buy a gaming chair, there are way more options on the market. I'd advised to add a few more bucks to your purchasing budget and buy a chair that is stronger and will last longer.Unfortunately, I would not recommend buyers to purchase this chair because the flaws outweigh the comfort. If you do buy this chair, please buy the insurance. Once your insurance for this chair is up, support is not helpful anymore and you'll be on your own.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Top starter gaming racing chair', 'author': 'ZH', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I consider this the best starter racing style gaming chair you can get. They are all about the same size, so if you're on the fence and want to try it out before dumping a lot of money on a chair, I think this is a 5 star chair for that.Overall I think these are also a bit better than the Amazon Basics mid-back or high back chairs, and I consider leather, even PU leather, much better to sit on than the mesh chairs that are popular. The problem with PU is it will always peel, there's no way around that, and it's only going to really last a few years. Mesh will last a bit longer maybe but isn't really that comfortable.The super expensive office chairs that I've had at work I don't think are at all worth it. But even if you think they are, they are just a lot more expensive.This chair is easy to put together, it takes about 20-30 minutes max and everything is easy to tighten with the included allen wrench. The covers you have to screw in, and I might recommend a regular screwdriver, especially for the deeper holes. There is no hole on the seat cushion for those cover screws, but you don't really need any since the screws are shallow and will screw into the brackets anyway.The chair does smell. Some of it is probably polyurethane and some of it is probably the off-gassing. I'm sure it will go away after a bit, but be prepared for that. Some of the surfaces are also a little dusty, but I used a simple multi-purpose cleaner spray and it came right off.Chair tilts a little backwards, but when you sit on it, it feels straight so I guess that's just how it's supposed to be. The back rest has a tilt/recline feature, which you activate with a lever on the right side almost exactly like a car seat does.The included lumbar and neck pillows are filled with some cheap cushion material and covered also in PU leather. The higher end chairs will give you velour covered memory foam. You can also buy those for $30-50 if you really want to as well.I would say if you like this style of chair, the next real upgrades are real grain leather and Napa leather options. That will set you back $500+ and $700+ and you can really only get them from Noble Chairs or Secretlab. I plan to do this for the Napa at some point, albeit they are out of stock, and chances are the price will get closer to $1k. I am not fully sure if those will last longer either, you might just be better off buying this chair every few years instead.As I wrote above, PU chairs are all pretty much the same. The material really doesn't change. They all seemingly use a nylon base, PU leather, steel frame and foam for the cushions. This chair says it uses a shaping sponge, while the others say they use cold cured foam. The cold cured foam maybe is a step above, and the velour with memory foam pillows probably are too, but I'm not sure that it's worth the $300+ most of the gaming racing chairs charge. I seriously think once you start going above this price point at $100-120 or so, the next upgrade has got to be in the upholstery, and nothing else really will matter as much.Overall I'd give this chair a solid 3 or 4, but for the right person it's a 5. That's the problem with the rating system, I don't know exactly what you personally are looking for. An inexpensive chair that will last a couple of years or more and is in this style, it's a 5 easily. If you're looking for really high quality, and it's just a step for you, maybe it's a 3 or 4. But at this price point I can't justify anything below 5 stars, so I give it a 5, and I urge people that want to try this style out to seriously consider grabbing this one first, if they can't test out a higher priced chair for awhile and don't feel comfortable just dropping a higher price amount without testing something.Edit 1 Week: Smell was really terrible for the first 2-3 days, but then faded and is fine/gone now. Might not be a bad idea to let this air out a few days somewhere.The arms got wobbly and I had to re-tighten the bolts. I had to do this two times. Not sure if this will be a continuing issue or not.I'm still undecided whether I will stick with this or go for a better leather version. I really don't want to get another PU version, so for that I'll probably stick with this. But if I see a good deal on the real leather and napa leather options I'm leaning towards getting that, and giving this one to someone else as a gift.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 7, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars We, as a society, need to rethink chairs like this', 'author': 'Keegs', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Look, whoever started the trend of leather gaming chairs needs a stern talking-to.This might apply to all gaming chairs (I play games but wouldn't consider myself a serious gamer si IDK), but there are some serious problems with a chair like this:1. SupportLook, I've sat in a million offices with $1,000 chairs designed by the world's leading back-support engineers and even those hurt your back after a while. Sitting fully upright like Queen Elizabeth for 8 straight hours will do that. That being said, I haven't had any issues with this chair in that regard. Except for the pillow. The freaking pillow.This chair comes with this weird strap-on leather pillow that goes... somewhere?! It can go behind your back, but then your spine is forced to make an inverted C-shape that no human being can possibly enjoy. You can also strap it around the top like the headrest of a cheap dental seat but it literally does nothing for comfort or your neck.2. FartingOkay, okay, HEAR ME OUT ON THIS. This chair features a flat leather seat. Think that through. There's no mesh. No cloth. Your ass is literally suction-cupped to this leather panel. Where do you think that fart is going the second you feel the urge? If you're a gamer and are spending multiple hours in front of a screen, there's a big chance, you're gonna have to fart at some point. Do you peel your sweaty butt from the synthetic leather surface to let one rip? Or do you take your chances of a full-on backfire while seated?And that's only the start of it.This seat is made of a material that, smell-wise, remembers EVERYTHING. I kid you not, I clean this seat every day because of how bad it can smell. If my cat jumps up on it, it smells like kitty litter (bad girl!). If I fart on it, it smells like farts. If I drop a cheeto between my legs IT SMELLS LIKE CHEETOS. And these smells linger indefinitely. If you don't regularly clean this chair, it will start to smell like everything you've ever sat on.3. HeatIf you're a human being and sweat when you're hot, ohhh boy, are you in for a treat. The adhesive properties of this faux-leather seat are honestly impressive. I haven't done this but I 100% believe if you sat on this chair naked for 20 seconds, you could pick it up with you and walk away with it stuck to your back.In the winter it was fine, honestly. But once summer hit and I stared wearing shorts again and, Gods forbid, I didn't wear a shirt?! Game. Over. I was sitting upright like Queen Elizabeth all on my own in a desperate attempt to keep my back away from my own chair. And, without a comfortable black, you're sitting on a freaking stool. So be ready to crank the AC lest you become part of the chair like old Boostrap Bill stuck on the side of The Flying DutchmanIN CONCLUSION: It's fine. Do I miss my old chair that completely broke? Yeah. Does this one look good? Yeah! Does it support my back and keep me 100% comfortable? NOPE. Should we, as a society, rethink chairs like this? Yes, I think so.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 24, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Experience Comfort and Style with the Homall Gaming Chair', 'author': 'Phil Salvo', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I recently purchased the Homall Gaming Chair, and I must say that it has exceeded my expectations in terms of comfort, style, and functionality. This high-back computer chair not only provides excellent support for long hours of sitting but also adds a touch of gaming-inspired aesthetics to my workspace.One of the standout features of the Homall Gaming Chair is its ergonomic design. The chair is designed to support proper posture and reduce strain on the back, neck, and shoulders. The high backrest provides ample support for the entire spine, while the adjustable headrest and lumbar cushions offer additional support and comfort where needed. The chair's ergonomic features have made a noticeable difference in alleviating discomfort during long gaming or work sessions.In addition to its ergonomic design, the Homall Gaming Chair offers customizable adjustability. The chair features a 360-degree swivel, allowing for easy movement and adjustment. The seat height is adjustable, offering versatility for users of different heights. The tilt and recline function enable me to find the perfect angle for optimum comfort during gaming or working, further enhanced by the adjustable armrests.The build quality and materials of the Homall Gaming Chair are impressive. The chair is made with high-quality leather and cushioning, giving it a premium look and feel. The leather is durable and easy to clean, ensuring longevity. The chair's sturdy construction ensures stability, and it can support weights of up to 300 pounds, making it suitable for a wide range of users.Another standout feature of the Homall Gaming Chair is its racing-inspired design. The chair features bold and vibrant color combinations, creating an eye-catching focal point in any gaming or office setup. The sleek lines and aggressive styling add an element of excitement to my workspace, making it more visually appealing.Assembly of the Homall Gaming Chair was straightforward, thanks to the included instructions and labeled parts. It took only a short amount of time to put together, and the necessary tools were included in the package. The chair's clear instructions made the process hassle-free, allowing me to start using it in no time.Overall, I highly recommend the Homall Gaming Chair to gamers, professionals, and anyone seeking a comfortable and stylish seating solution. Its ergonomic design, adjustable features, premium build quality, and striking aesthetics make it a top choice for those spending long hours at their desk. Elevate your gaming or work experience with the Homall Gaming Chair and enjoy hours of comfortable seating in style.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: OFIKA Home Office Chair, 400LBS Big and Tall Heavy Duty Design, Ergonomic High Back Cushion Lumbar Back Support, Computer Desk, Adjustable Executive Leather Chair with Armrest
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars New office chairs again?', 'author': 'john r langone', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Always good to have history. It\'s 2009. New computer desks, file cabinets and office chairs. Today August 2022, same computer desks and file cabinets for home office.We use the 5th bedroom as an office. In 2009 we purchased low end $99.00 each (foolisly) office chairs. Try as we did, could not destroy those inexpensive vinyl chairs. In late 2017 the chairs were getting tired. Maybe we were also. We purchased on sale (2) La-Z-Boy leather computer chairs in January 2018 at $199.99. Thought they would last for many, many years. Hate to say the leather was so worn out when using these chairs max 2 hours per day in 4 1/2 years was very disheartning. What to do? Purchase 2 leather computer chairs however inexpensively. We came across these chairs however the reviews were terrible. What to do? Purchase them and if the reviewers are correct, send them back. Well the following may be of value to folks looking for good looking, easy to assemble, leather chairs. These may fit the need. About 75 minutes to assemble both chairs. The rolling of the chairs, we have plexiglass runners under the chairs over an area rug on wood floors, no problems rolling. Pistons no issues, chairs hold position. We are probably average heights and weights. She 5\'9" 170 lbs, me 5\'11" 205 lbs. Only issue may be the installation tool provided. Gets the job done however we dropped it at least a 1/2 dozen times. Lastly, we chose brown to match desks and file cabinets. Various colors available. So far these are a tad harder than the La-Z Boys however we think with our use they will probably outlast the La-Z-Boys.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 16, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great desk chair', 'author': 'Everyday Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Perfect desk chair. I work from home and my children our home schooled. This chair is very comfortable for long sit times and a great price point. Pretty easy to put together. Instructions were clear and easy to read. Mine is currently on hard wood flooring and I have no issues with scratching or denting the floor from the wheels.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Adequate, inexpensive chair', 'author': 'J C', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This chair is an OK buy, if not looking for really top of the line. First, it\'s sold as 400 lb rated, but I really don\'t think its any different than the 250 lb rated chair that it\'s replacing. Seat and back padding is relatively thin but OK. The lift and tilt mechanism works smoothly. Not a very "high" back. Rolls nicely. Easy to assemble and packaged fine. Overall, just doesn\'t seem very heavy duty, when it\'s sold as being so. I searched significantly and really couldn\'t find anything better for the same money. It\'s an OK average chair and so far, so good.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars A Disappointing Purchase', 'author': 'ARoppo', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'My old office chair was literally falling apart so I needed a replacement. After reading reviews I decided on this one. My daughter is a large gal and I needed something that was a bit sturdier. This chair was advertised as being "heavy duty" and accommodating up to 400 lbs. I highly doubt someone 400 lbs. could use this chair and it far too narrow for a heavier person. I have had the chair for about a month and here are some of my thoughts:Pros: Stylish good looks: The leather is attractive and it looks like a much more expensive chair. Easy Assembly: It took me only a short time to assemble it and the instructions were easy to follow. Comfort: The seat and back are reasonably comfortable.Cons: The wheels are awful. They lock up and I end up just scooting the chair across the floor mat. It would be impossible to maneuver the chair on even the lowest pile carpeting. It does not recline to 110¬∞ in rocking mode as advertised. It is very tightly sprung and takes a lot of effort to tilt back. This may loosen up with time.In all fairness, I have not yet contacted the company regarding the wheels, but do plan to do so. It is too much of a pain to return the chair after having assembled it, so I plan to keep it, but if I had tried it in a store I would never have purchased it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars not what expected, and slight damage.... cushion torn !!', 'author': 'mike', 'rating': 2, 'content': "first off, fast FED GROUND delivery... also height of seat to 21 3/4 is excellent for longer leg users, two great observations in the purchase. fed ex ground delivered a dusty box and other items to farm on dusty hot road... was expected .... not a normal day... smaller box, chair is in there...opened box in center of room and ready for assembly... i have put chairs together before for the various computer tables.. assembled with viewing picture instructions... inventory was on par with one extra screw lag for short and long grommets...Allen wrench is big L shaped and quite handy .. assembled in 15 minutes..wheels went on the best ... must be firm with seat screws as one seamed stripped and then gripped... one chair rest is lose , but with some lock tight, will grip... for a rated Big and tall chair, seat height is there, actuator is easily controlled, arm rest are nicely padded, but short... 34 inch arms here, so rests need to be 3 to 4 inches longer..seat is hard and with 24 hrs seating, already depressing.... so you will lose your leg height to floor from seat...i am 220 clothes on ..chair rated to 400 pounds.... it can make chair less stable, so no rough housing in chair .... for a foam, the seat is quite hard.... not an 8 hr chair, although i thought was rated for longer seating... this is a smaller chair for a Big and Tall executive, not really a Big Tall man's chair... i am over 6 ' 2 and shoulders or at top of back.. high back seems 46 inches though..no real head rest.. shoulder rest there though, but don't snap your neck back stretching.... repeating good things... great Allen wrench, SOFT ARM RESTS, excellent HARD BASE with WHEELS, and seat height will equal 21 inches give or take seat depression, incredible fast fed ex ground shipping......now the BAD, not so comfortable, tiny tall executive chair, screws can easily strip so be positive on the attaching to grommet and aligning up, and the worse for last, THERE WAS A TEAR IN THE BACK CUSHION ON TOP EDGE OF CHAIR.. probably happened in packing or on assembly line... very thin material... after assembly, so tough to return in boxing up again.... i am thinking lock tight on my screw and gorilla tape on my tear.. i would return if easy to box up !!! it was only a 130 purchase with the coupon discount.. be well , be safe... UPDATE: company refunded price of chair. AMAZING....", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 26, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Feels good quality for the price and went together quickly.', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Received today and put together. The chair felt like it was a good quality for the price. Faux leather is thin, but that is part of buying an inexpensive chair. The chair felt comfortable and study. It was easy to put together. Wheels popped on. Four Allen screws for the seat bottom, eight Allen bolts to attach the arms, bottom, and seatback. I will update if it does not stand up to use.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Updated 3/26/03 Company CS Team Reached Out | It's An Ok Chair", 'author': 'BG Tech Guy', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Updated as of 3/26/03: 5 StarsThe companys customer service department who builds/sell the chair here on AMZN reached out to me. The listened to me, they were extremely professional and prompt and resolved my issue with the chair satisfactorily. I was again impressed that they reached out and spoke to me about it...made it right. Because of that, I'm changing the rating from three stars to five stars. Being that they resolved my concerns FAST, I'd highley recommend this chair and I will be buying another in the next 90 days asFirst Review: 3 StarsIt's an Ok Chair to buy for an office or general usage. I'm disappointed because two of the bolt holes in the chair weren't drilled corrected..wouldn't grab and tighten. Both were on the back of the chair. Yes it's a cheap chair but even in this day and age, these companies lack of quality is amazing.Foam padding is decent - expectation - nothing over the top - normal characteristics. It was easy to put together and hey supplied all the parts needed. Instructions were easy to read and understand. That's a huge plus.It says it'll take 400lbs but I doubt it - sitting on it was a little nerve racking at first and I made all the adjustments prior to sitting in it. Those two screws and the alignment are what keep me from giving this 5 stars even for a cheapy. I hope it last 6 months. I'll update in that time frame.Good luck all.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Mediocre Chair', 'author': 'Christina', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I love the look of the chair but the bottom cushion is so thin and I have to get up a lot. But a good price point for what it is.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Mostly easy to assemble but low arm rests', 'author': 'Tucker', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Not much else to say from the title other than the screws on one side didn't quite line up properly and had to force it into the correct position and by the time I did that it got cross threaded. Other than that it's pretty comfortable. You do wanna swap the wheels though but that's every chair", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Will it Last', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Seat was not as wide as I would have like but deeper than I expected.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Sweetcrispy Executive Office Chair with Padded Armrests Mid Back Lumbar Support and Adjustable Height & Tilt Angle, PU Leather Swivel Rolling, Modern Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Chair', 'author': 'Cynthia', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Such an amazing price for this beautiful and comfortable chair. So easy to put together that I did it myself!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great chair.', 'author': 'Michelle Pell', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought this for my daughter's office and she asked me to write this review. I‚Äôm very happy with it', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very comfortable', 'author': 'debbie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have been searching for a desk chair that was good for my back, looked chic and matched my decor. You won‚Äôt be sorry!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Take your time and relax putting together', 'author': 't4k4n4m1', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. Sat down on the floor while watching TV to put it together.Took out the parts and spread them out around me.Noted one arm was packaged in a blue plastic bag differently, so I left it in the plastic until I got to that step.One thing I did differently from the instructions, I attached the arm rests to the chair back (loosely) and THEN attached the chair arms to the seat. Assembling it alone I found it worked better in this order. So if you are a pro at furniture that comes "you must assemble" this will be super easy.You can see from the photo/video that the product is quite plush. It doesn\'t have a high back, but I didn\'t want one. It\'s wide enough for me to sit in wierd positions, as I do figit about. Sadly it doesn\'t have a foot rest, but for this price point it is fabulous!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Firm and Great for Lower Back 10/10', 'author': 'hb', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I used to have a chair very similar to this design and build from ikea 10 years ago. Albeit, the ikea version had a taller backside where you can rest your head. I took a risk in hoping this would be similar and am so happy it's 99% similar.
