title: COLAMY Office Chair-Ergonomic Computer Desk Chair with Thick Seat for Comfort, High Back Executive Chair with Padded Flip-up Arms, Stylish Leather Chair with Upgraded Caster for Swivel (Black, 300lbs)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Absolutely Outstanding Chair - Smooth Wheels, Spacious & Cozy!', 'author': 'Clay Sheppard', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I am thoroughly impressed with this chair! The assembly process was incredibly straightforward - the included allen-wrench with a handle made it a hassle-free experience.Firstly, the wheels are a standout feature. They glide effortlessly, offering a level of smoothness that surpasses any other office chair I've used. It's clear that the construction of these wheels was a priority, and it shows in their performance.Another aspect I adore is the adjustable arms. They can easily be lifted, which is a huge space-saver in tighter work areas. This feature adds to the chair's overall practicality and ergonomic design.The backrest deserves a special mention too. It's thoughtfully padded, providing excellent support, and the integrated headrest is both comfortable and well-positioned. It's a relief to have a headrest that doesn't feel awkward or intrusive.Lastly, the seat cushion is impressively spacious and plush. It provides substantial comfort, even during prolonged periods of sitting. This is a significant upgrade in terms of comfort compared to other chairs.In summary, this chair is a remarkable blend of functionality, comfort, and sleek design. It's a game-changer for anyone who spends a lot of time at their desk. Highly recommend!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic chair!', 'author': 'Cindyann', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Husband had a fairly new desk chair, wasn't a cheapie either, but he was never comfortable in it, always shifting around in it. Started complaining about his back hurting. I am so glad that I found this COLAMY office chair on Amazon. I read so many good reviews about it, and ordered it as a surprise for my husband. It is VERY STURDY, and it was pretty easy to put it together. His back aches stopped right away, he says it is super comfortable, and the high back of it is great! He uses it at his desk while at his computer, and the way he can adjust the arm rests and easily move them out of the way, it is good for his guitar playing too! The price was really, really good for the quality and look of this chair. Really, really great purchase!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Not Comfortsble to me', 'author': 'PAUL BOLOGNESE', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This chair was great from a construction as well as fit and finish. The wheel system was remarkable for mobility, and it was easy to raise, lower and make tension adjustments for the seat. The leatherette material (it might even have been leather - I couldn't tell) was well done and superbly stitched. The padding for the seat and the back was at least 2 inches, however I could never feel comfortable in that seat. Perhaps it's my body mass or bone structure but I'm under the 300 pounds the posting indicated it would accommodate. There were other reviews which indicated they experienced all day comfort so I'm leaning towards my long-term experience using LazyBoy office chairs which are extremely comfortable. Customer service was great and I was afforded easy and free return shipping. I wish I could have felt comfortable in that chair. It was an incredible bargain too boot.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wheels move well, chair is roomy and comfortable', 'author': 'Lady T', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This chair was a breeze to assemble using the allen-wrench with handle that‚Äôs included!The wheels are well constructed and roll smoother than the typical caster wheels from previous office chairs I‚Äôve purchased.The arms can be lifted up out of the way which is helpful in tight spaces.The chair backing is padded and has a nice headrest that is not awkward to use.The cushion is wide and well padded for extra comfort.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I love it so far!', 'author': 'Baller3', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. I had an expensive gaming chair for a handful of years and I never really liked it. They are ‚Äúsupposed‚Äù to be more comfortable as they‚Äôre made to be occupied for long durations, but I feel like I will disagree with anyone who argues that‚Äôs truthful. I work from home and work 10 ish hour days on average and basically live in my chair. I also have a terrible back and neck and struggle to be comfortable in literally any seat. I‚Äôve only had this one for a few days but man is it a world of difference from my last.The seat padding is so welcoming from what I lacked in my last chair. The seat is also pretty wide which I appreciate because I tend to sit cross legged or perched like a bird sometimes, and small seats or fixed armrests just don‚Äôt accommodate (hence I love that the armrests lift up on this chair). It‚Äôs high back but not super high, which I like. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô4, 135lbs for reference. Someone taller would likely not have the same head/neck support that I do, but should still be quite comfy in it. My husband is 6‚Äô and finds it very comfortable as well.The wheels are a fantastic feature because they roll effortlessly. I suspect even with carpeted floors they would do well. Only downside is I‚Äôve stood up to adjust my clothes and go to sit back down only to find my chair has made its way across my room and I almost ate it on the floor instead. Clearly that‚Äôs a me thing though and I just have to be conscientious about it.Overall it was easy to put together, feels well made and durable, and most of all it‚Äôs honestly comfortable. I‚Äôm happy with the purchase, and wish I would have pulled the plug earlier. I only hope that it lasts, but time will tell.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars A mixed bag', 'author': 'Vinnie T', 'rating': 3, 'content': "The good: Arrived quickly, was easy to put together, and the materials are good for this price point. The available adjustments work well, but more adjustments are needed like lumbar. The cushioning is decent, but would not want to sit in this chair for more than an hour at a time without a break. While the flip up armrests can come in handy for storage, it does weaken the arms so that you get some bend when you use the arms to get out of the chair.The not so good: You can't adjust the tilt angle of the seat bottom which means the angle between the seat bottom and seat back is fixed. For me, the angle is too upright. If I could adjust the seat bottom tilt, I could add angle to make it far more comfortable. The other big issue is the front of the seat bottom is pretty flat unlike many executive chairs that have a front seat bottom that slopes downward. Being flat, it puts a lot of pressure underneath your thighs and almost cuts off your circulation. After about an hour of sitting, I have to get up for a while cuz I start to hurt. If it were easier to return, I probably would.Additional: There were many very positive reviews for this chair when I purchased it, and a big reason why I did. Now there are very few review almost like this is a new product. What happened? Product change, page reset? Very odd, and wondering if I really got the chair I ordered.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful chair', 'author': 'Adan P', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great video to put it together. So easy. And the final quality is so comfortable and sturdy for my weight. Love it. And I like the wheels the best on my wood floor. I am not worried about scratches at all.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good Affordable Chair', 'author': 'A Texas Two-Step', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Decent looking chair has comfortable cushioning. High back makes a nice head rest. Cost was reduced by replacing metal with plastic parts. Arms and legs are made of heavy-duty plastic. Gas lift has a plastic plunger which the seat is placed on top. Slight wobble when sitting on it, but chair seems sturdy when new.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars You will not regret purchasing this chair.', 'author': 'Brian', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I don't write a lot of reviews, although I should do more. In any case, I felt this chair was certainly worthy of a positive write-up.As with many, my workplace went into lockdown when Covid hit the US. Long story short, I went from an in-office every day employee to a full remote one. While I've had office chairs in the past for my personal use, I decided that if I'm going to be home most of the time, I should maybe look for something better after it became clear the lockdown was going to last longer than was anticipated.I purchased a gaming chair but I ended up not liking it. It was too thin. I like changing positions a lot, which includes tucking my left leg under me or sitting cross-legged at times. Something I had a hard time doing in the gaming chair. Plus only the back reclined, not the whole seat. Given this, I ordered a new standard office chair like I've had in the past and used it until now. I though I knew what a good chair felt like to sit in. I was wrong.The old chair has been showing it's age since I bought it a couple yrs ago and became uncomfortable to sit in all day. Given this, I was looking for a replacement when I came across this one. Looked like a better chair than I normally got and decided to go for it.It's not hard to put together. Especially if you have real tools on-hand to use than the cheap ones packages with the bolts that came with this chair. It also helps if you've put a few chairs together yourself in the past. The only hard part was trying to put the back on. I couldn't hold the chair steady while screwing in the back brace bolts and needed my wife to hold it for me. Outside that,only takes normal work to put it together. Maybe 20 minutes from start to finish.Now that I had for a few days, I can't state how much of an improvement this chair is over the one's I've had in the past. It glides so smoothly over the floor as it uses in-line skate wheels rather than the caster wheels common on the chairs I've had in the past. And you sink into comfort as you lower your butt into the seat.Over all, it's a great chair that I can't recommend enough!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This chair is terrific!', 'author': 'Catherine Kollin', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought this chair to replace a very sad old (1 1/2yr) desk chair that was very uncomfortable and falling apart. The difference is like day and night right out of the box! This chair has the paddig in the seat I was looking for! Not only is it comfortable to sit in, but it has lumbar support for your back that is great. I also like the padded arms. When you spend a many hours on-line as I do, this is the chair for you! It only took my son-in-law about 20 minutes to put it together. I would have done it myself, but I suffer from acute low back problems and can't lift the heavier parts!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Serta Executive Office Chair Ergonomic Computer Upholstered Layered Body Pillows, Contoured Lumbar Zone, Base, Fabric, Black/Grey
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cheaply made, plastic, uncomfortable seat - only made for tall people!', 'author': 'Jaye', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'UPDATE: 3/11/18I bought this chair 9/1/18. I had my doubts about it at first, but have raised my initial 3 star rating to a 5 star! Read my last update below for more info, but I am still using the chair to get around the house some of the time although I am beginning to walk a few steps here and there again since my severe injury back in November. I really thought that the wheels were going to give out since they aren\'t designed for how I\'ve been using the chair, but they are still fine! It\'s still very comfortable, and I\'ve had no problems with it.If you spend a lot of time in the chair, I\'d recommend after a few months going back and tightening the screws that hold the arms to the base and the back. I did that last month and they had loosened a bit from when I first put it together. I\'m keeping the allen wrench that came with the chair in my office close at hand so I can keep checking their tightness every couple of months or so. VERY happy with this, so well worth the money!UPDATE: 1/31/18 I\'ve now had this chair for nearly 5 months. I decided to keep it since I could not find one I liked better, and needed a chair ASAP. I\'m significantly more impressed with it now than I was when I first received it! My initial review was three stars, I\'ve now increased that to four stars.Over two months ago, I tore a ligament in my foot. Major issues with getting around! I ended up grabbing my office chair here, and using it to sit in, using my good foot to push myself around the house. I\'ve been doing this for two months, and it has been so extraordinarily helpful! I am a bit concerned that the wheels might be starting to give out, but then again the amount of wear and tear I\'ve put on them in the past two months is significantly more than one would normally rolling office chair around.I have adapted to the shape of the chair, and find it so much more comfortable now than I did at first. I love how soft the back is, I\'ve adjusted to the seat being harder and tilted a bit. The padding on the arms is an extra bonus. I would bring this up to five stars if I weren\'t so concerned still about how the arms attached to the seat and the back. Still concerned about longevity.-------------------------------------I received this chair yesterday (9/7/17). It was not nearly as easy to put together as the listing makes it seem, it would be much easier with two people. Finally have it together and using it.First off, most of the parts are plastic. Very poor quality. Not sure if I will keep this or send it back at this point. I purchased this because my very old previous desk chair fell apart recently, resulting in a frightening neck injury. The arms are held onto the seat by 2 screws each, and the back is only held onto the arms by another 2 screws on each side. The back does not directly attach to the seat at all. I\'m feeling very concerned about it breaking like my old one did (although that one had been used for several years first!).I\'m also very disappointed that the seat doesn\'t go any lower. I\'m a 5\'3" woman with short legs. I can\'t come close to touching the floor with my feet, even with this on the lowest setting. Seems ridiculous to me; I know many women who are much shorter than I am! Dangling my feet in the air like a child is not conducive to working at my desk or feeling remotely comfortable.There is also a lack of comfort in this chair. With padded upholstery, I expected to have a bit of a cushy feel in the seat, and it is quite hard. The fabric itself is soft, but you definitely don\'t sink down into the seat at all. I also greatly dislike how the front of the seat slopes downward, which is really uncomfortable in any seated position. Makes me feel like I\'m going to slide off of the chair, and if it were slick like leather instead of microfiber, I probably would! The seat is also not as large as I expected it to be based on the measurements given; plenty large enough for sitting regularly with feet on the floor (which I can\'t do with this), but I\'d wanted to be able to sit in it cross legged and it\'s definitely not wide enough for that.One more note: you cannot tilt back at all in this chair as most office chairs do. You can only sit up straight and swivel.About the only two positive things I can think of about this chair are that the fabric is super soft, I love that the arms are padded - the arms on my old chair were wood over metal and were very hard and uncomfortable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 8, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars At Last, THE perfect exec Office Chair! Completes my Office in comfort, design, & style!', 'author': 'Zeus My Rescue Red Nose Pittie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is THE perfect office chair. Executive meets stylish, gorgeous lines, design, excellent comfort, quality, MY Ultimate Dream Chair come true.I had two cervical surgeries a year ago, so recovering from spinal fusion is a loooongg process. This provides abundant support, and is comfortable, sturdy, and wheels glide effortlessly where you want the chair to roll. It is a beautiful color, and makes any office area Pop.No assembly, no issues, the arms are upholstered, too, and must say, I feel so good in this cozy chair. BTW I like reviews when the purchaser includes details about their height, weight, size for furniture pieces as there is, in my opinion, no OSFA (one size fits all) in executive office chairs. I spend hours a day in mine so I need to be completely comfortable all day long, day in, day out. This Serta? I believe the Serta Fairies took my measurements in my sleep, and custom designed this wonderful piece especially for me. I am a tall female, fit, 5\'9", legs for days, with long arms and the armrests are essential for me.I am in my 40\'s but an accident left me with severe, debilitating neck, lower back & thoracic injuries. I could not find an office chair that looked this good, that "fit" me. Then there is the comfort factor. This is THE best investment and I had a $900 chair that was inferior to this gem. I got rid of that one and this is perfect. This is really soothing my neck surgery residuals. For anyone with spinal problems, health issues, this may be helpful to you. My friend stayed here two weeks, said it helped calm her carpal tunnel syndrome nerve pain. She recovered from her left hand carpal tunnel surgery, and will be having her right hand surgery soon.The price is really low for the features, support, design, quality and am delighted after a long, frustrating year of trying out exec chairs, I found my perfect fit. I have it paired w my Hooker Grandover enormous two piece home office desk and my Serta is stunning accent at "Command Central".Hope you find some helpful information in my review. Best!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 27, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Decent Chair, But it has One Unique Setback', 'author': 'Penny', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I decided to wait a year until reviewing this product so I could give an accurate testament to it!On a budget, this is a pretty okay chair to go with! It's still held together after a year, so no complaints there. I wasn't expecting any kind of support on the cushion, so comfort is pretty okay too. I haven't had any pain issues on my back or otherwise since using it! I think my favorite feature of this chair are the soft armrests. They are very nice, and sit at just the right level, even if they aren't adjustable :>Okay now for the cons :'DAfter maybe three or so months, the chair started squeaking quite a bit. So just be aware that if you have a roomie or s/o who hates squeaky sounds, then maybe go with a different chair (luckily my s/o is totally fine with the noise haha). Its just the sort of thing that happens with cheaper chairs, which is alright if you're on that budget.Secondly, although the microfiber covering feels really nice you need to beware if you live in an area with dry air (like Southern California, for example). I didn't realize it at first, but if you live in a dry climate and have a carpet floor this chair becomes.... scary. Why? Because if you touch any metal surface when you stand to get up out of your chair, you will get a BIG electric shock. I'm 100% serious on this--and it really startled me when it started happening! Sometimes the shocks would get so big, I could actually see light coming from my fingertip. It can be a little painful if you don't remember to discharge the electricity somehow (i.e. I touch the wall to get rid of the static buildup after standing up). I wear socks all the time, so this also factors into the static buildup. I have metal parts in my desk that I use this chair with, so unfortunately shocks are frequent for me. Just something I gotta live with until I get a new chair or a cover I guess!That being said, I'm still fine with purchasing this chair. I really needed it at the time, so I appreciate the price it was going for.tl;dr- the major setback this chair has is static buildup it makes due to the microfiber cloth its made of", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 3, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Executive Chair', 'author': 'michiko', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Just received our Serta microfiber exec chair. Delivery from Amazon was super fast. Assembly was a snap - follow the directions and it took me less than 30 minutes. The great part is that all the tools needed to put it together are included. The chair is VERY COMFORTABLE with great padding on the seat and back. The chair height is adjustable with a gas cylinder lift. The chair arms are also well padded. The microfiber material is very soft to the touch unlike the hard leather covering we had on our chair before.The seat provides good support to the thighs. I'm 5 feet 7 inches and it is perfect for me; however, I feel that a bigger person over 6 feet may find this seat to be too small and would be better off looking for a seat that is larger.On the minus side:1. I would like to have with this chair would have been a bit more height on the back rest for head support.2. Chair does not tilt back.Over all, however, the construction, comfort and most of all, the great price from Amazon make up for the shortcomings noted. I'm not sure about the long term; but it is so much better than the chair we have been using. We spend a lot of time on our desk computer and this chair is just a perfect fit.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 12, 2013', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars A little too tall, and barely reclines (without modification)', 'author': 'Michael J. Cohen', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Needed a sturdier chair for my home office, and I personally like the feel of microfiber vs. leather (or fake leather). The chair has very stiff cushioning (which I like for prolonged periods of sitting) and the arm rests are at a reasonable height and width for me (I\'m 6\', 220lbs). The chair offers a decently ergonomic experience albeit it\'s a touch on the tall side even when fully lowered. My 5\'4" wife said it would be uncomfortable for her to sit in for very long since her legs dangle a bit. Not too much of a problem for me, but the real issue with this chair is that it leans back only a fraction of what it should.The reason for this is two metal tabs that make contact with the back side of the hinge mechanism. There\'s only about a 1/4" gap in there which doesn\'t allow for very much tilt at all, making the chair somewhat uncomfortable to lean back in. It\'s not even as good as an airline seat IMHO.Ideally, you\'d want your center of mass to be able to rotate to behind the hinge point so that the chair can stay reclined without you having to push back with your feet, and this is not the case in the original, stock form. The fix is to take an oscillating tool with a bi-metal blade (or maybe you could use a jig saw, not sure) and chop those tabs off by another 1/4". Now the chair leans back a proper amount, and there\'s still no risk of it tipping over (for me, at least). Obviously, this will void the warranty, so do it at your own risk. If you remove anything more than 1/4", it might induce a tipping over backwards hazard (especially if you\'re larger than me) so you have been warned.I have no idea why they thought the extremely minimal amount of tilt was a good thing, or maybe it has to do with how far back the base is mounted to the seat, since it seems like the tilt mechanism is a standard part used in many different chairs. It remains to be seen if the chair holds up over time, but for now, after modification, it\'s quite comfy and I\'m looking forward to using it for a long while.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful Office Chair', 'author': 'casey coil', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought for my child that sits in it everyday to play games with his friends. It‚Äôs comfortable and sturdy.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Okay chair. Used to be so much better.', 'author': 'M. Wolf', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'I had a chair like this ~10 years ago. Back then, it was also made by Serta, and it was like sitting on a cloud, on that awesome microfiber upholstery. Though... No longer.Several years back that chair was great. It felt like I was sitting on a Serta mattress. Sure, it had a problem with the lifter/cylinder, where it would not keep the height of the chair and would slowly deflate. But, I had already owned the chair for like 3 - 4 years already at that point, and I feel I got good use out of it. I tried replacing the cylinder, but it was nigh impossible to remove the cylinder from the wheel base, so in the trash it went.Little over a year ago, I bought this chair again, because I really loved how comfortable it was. But, something changed in the seat design that seriously reduced how comfy it is. It feels hard, and prolonged periods of sitting are not recommended in this chair.It then also reminded me, of the forward portion of the arm rest that attaches to the seat, how it would dig into my thighs. I\'m not a super big guy, sure I\'m 6\'2", and 235lbs, but it did make me remember how the arm rests weren\'t in the greatest positions for thick thighs.Fast forward to a couple of weeks ago... cylinder appears to leaking again, or just not staying where it\'s supposed to be. If I sit in the chair, I can expect the chair to slowly descend again... guess that part of the chair never got addressed either.Very sad... as I really used to think highly of this chair, and even with the thigh-issue, I thought it was still a super comfy chair... But, considering that the cylinder/lifter issue now seems like it\'s just a thing for this chair, and the fact that the upholstery just isn\'t the same anymore... very sad.I don\'t recommend getting this chair if you work from home, or sit in your office chair a lot. It used to be very comfortable, the seat... but with all these other chronic issues, I just can\'t recommend this chair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Serta office chair', 'author': 'Nancy White', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love it. Read reviews that it was difficult to put together. It was easy. Went together easy. Very comfortable', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars It's a good - but not great - office chair.", 'author': 'Aidin McLaurin', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Assembly took about 25 minutes.I\'m 6ft1, the chair is pretty comfortable, but the top of my shoulders sit above the "headrest pillow."The back rest is attached via arm rest, so no removing the armrest if you are a larger person or wanted to use this for a console gameroom chair.The seat can lock in at upright position or lean back a little bit, but not as far as I would hope.No lumbar support, definitely going to have to buy an attachment pillow for that.Overall - good, but not great. Chairs can get insanely expensive so it\'s nice to have a very viable option in this price range.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice but firm.', 'author': 'Ray Paquette', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I like the chair, My only complaint is that the seat is too firm for my taste. I hope it will soften up down the road. It would of been nice to have a darker grey color.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

I purchased it in blue, and it is true to the color shown on the Amazon web page. It is sturdy, the wheels roll easily, and it was surprisingly easy to put together, with few separate parts.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Finally a small chair!', 'author': 'E. B.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The quick review: If you\'re looking for a smaller chair, especially because you\'re a smaller person, buy this one and consider your search complete.The longer review: I\'m not quite 5\' 5" tall and about 125lbs on a heavy day. I bought a sit-stand desk that lowers to 24.5" which is about perfect for me but I could not find a chair that went low enough that allowed me to use that appropriate desk height, keep my feet on the floor, and my rear-end back in the seat so my back could be properly supported. THIS IS IT!!I just received the chair and it took about five minutes to put together. Finally, a chair that fits my body and isn\'t made for larger people. The shorter seat (from front edge to back rest) is perfect and allows me to fully sit back in the chair (versus standard sizes not allowing my knees to properly bend or I\'d be leaning back to use the backrest to keep my knees bent - neither option good for posture). The seat is narrow (side to side) but it fits me perfectly. The backrest comes to my mid back, which I prefer, allowing me to stretch backward and move around. The curve of the backrest is perfect and supportive.I like the removable seat cover (pets in the house AND easy to replace if the padding should wear out or I want to add extra padding or add some flair with a custom cover). It fits well and is snug.It doesn\'t roll great on carpet, but I didn\'t expect it to and don\'t really care.My request - the same version with ELBOW rests. Not full arm rests because the chair is too petite for that. However, some narrow, padded, foldable elbow rests could easily be added to the chair back and provide just a bit of support to arms when in a long typing session. My other request - make a more robust version that still goes this low but offers tilt back, a higher backrest, full size foldable arms, etc. and charge appropriately for it. I think the company would be surprised at consumers looking for that exact product. Tell me when it is ready and I\'d be happy to test it out!I don\'t know how long this chair will hold up, but I certainly expect I will get my money\'s worth out of it. I will be buying more for my other offices. Definitely worth the price. Exceeded my expectations.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Decent‚Ä¶', 'author': 'James Taylor, Jr.', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'This chair is a decent size‚Ä¶ and it‚Äôs decently comfortable. It‚Äôs small and narrow‚Ä¶ so not a lot of room to relax, lean back, slouch down‚Ä¶ all things you might do if having a Zoom watch party or something. It‚Äôs firm, which isn‚Äôt too bad. But the cushion is thin, and the cover and cushion slip a lot. Slip cover doesn‚Äôt seem to be designed for this chair at all.Working from home? I don‚Äôt recommend. Home office for shorter days or recreational use? Not sitting there for 4-10 hours at a time? This might work perfectly.All in all, the tldr of it all, it does the job, even if it‚Äôs not the most comfortable for long term use.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good value', 'author': 'Lewis P.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Just what I needed. I was pleasantly surprised by the beefiness of the frame pieces and it was super easy for this 61yo to put together.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fits short people', 'author': 'Barbara Ell', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I\'ll start off, I\'m not the tallest person in the world. At 5\'0.5" (and proud of that 1/2 inch!) I finally found a desk chair that fits me! The back hits right where it\'s supposed to and has a nice flexibility to it, so I don\'t worry about leaning back. When the seat is in the low position, it is actually too low for me, which is a first. title: BANTI Premium High-Back Office Chair, Suede Desk Chair with 3D Adjustable Armrest, Headrest, and Adjustable Height Tilt for Home Office and Executive Comfort, Brown
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars most comfortable chair ive ever owned', 'author': 'Staciamedusa', 'rating': 5, 'content': "i really love this chair. it really is the most comfortable chair I've ever had. it's not super big and bulky either, which is nice because I needed it to be able to sit under my table and sit flush against it. it does that. All my other chairs max position is barely enough to get to where my desk is so I figure that may be a make or break aspect.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy, comfy, and leans back far', 'author': 'Lisa', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Don‚Äôt mind that the photos are in our dirty garage, but we really like this chair. The back comes up really far which makes it comfy to sit in, and when you lean back it reclines so much you feel like you‚Äôre going to fall over. Has wheels so it can roll around. My dad wanted a ‚Äúfancy chair‚Äù for his garage table and has been happy with it, so much so that he‚Äôs even taken a nap in it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Magnificent chair with comfortable design and high and wide seat', 'author': 'Don Miller', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is the best-looking office chair I've ever had. The material is plush and sophisticated. The brown color perfectly complements the other wood features that I have in my office, making this a real winner.The wheels aren't too loose, so the chair stays in place while you're sitting in it but rolls around easily. This seat is a little wider than other office chairs I've had, and I think it's better if you have wide hips.It also sits a little taller than other chairs. I'm only 5'5 and to sit with feet flat on the floor, I need it at its lowest setting. Otherwise, I use footstool. However, if you're taller, I think this would be a great chair. My wife is a couple inches taller than me and has full hips, and she finds this chair comfortable.The seat is not too far back and is shaped ergonomically. It reclines easily and locks into place for when you want to lean back and think or close your eyes. The height is great, and the headrest is in a perfect spot. These types of highback chairs are a must if you work in an office all day long.I found the armrests to be a little high for me. My problem is I'm short with long arms, so it can be tricky to find a comfortable chair. I would opt for the adjustable armrests in this model, but it's still a premium chair that looks and feels great.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars RUN AND GET THIS', 'author': 'Milia', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This chair by far is the best computer chair ive had, and ever sat in. I wish it had the piece at the bottom to put your feet up, that would set this chair off !!! It took me about 1 hour to put this together by myself. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I love this chair! Most comfortable chair ever', 'author': 'CherDe', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is the absolute best chair I‚Äôve ever owned. I wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to purchase another and the price point is better than average.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable chair for smaller spaces', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a simple, minimalist, no-frills chair. It is not considered "executive," which does not matter to me. The main reason I selected it was for the flip-up armrests. My home office is small (a bedroom), and I have limited space between the desk and the bed. This chair has been great thus far. The seat is comfortable to sit on for several hours at a time, and the mesh on the back makes it breathable. The chair has an adjustable back that can be adjusted to rock back and forth. The flip-up armrests let me push well into the desk after I am done working, thus giving me more space. The chair\'s height can be adjusted to accommodate short and tall people (I am 5ft 2in, and my husband is 6ft). I am the primary user, and having a chair that allows my feet to rest on the floor is great. Although I got this as a vine product, I consider the price to be excellent for the quality and versatility you will get.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 24, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great home office chair!', 'author': 'MatthewC', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This office chair is surprisingly comfortable for such a light chair. This chair is not meant to be an executive chair. I have this concern with almost every office chair I have bought and assembled. Chairs start off well but over time, chairs start showing their weaknesses. And eventually, I have to discard the chair for one reason or another.I am 215lb. I tend to think that most chairs made today are not going to last super long if you are well over 200lb. It is just natural the chair will eventually weaken when you have a lot of weight on it vs. a smaller, lighter person sitting on it.It is a good chair and I am happy to have it. title: Office Chair Ergonomic Desk Chair, Computer PU Leather Home Office Chair, Swivel Mesh Back Adjustable Lumbar Support Flip-up Arms Executive Task Chair
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfectly affordable ergonomic chair', 'author': 'Jillian', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I had an inkling that my pervious chair was causing some back discomfort. While I don't work from home, I do sit at my desk for long period of time on the weekends. I specifically wanted a chair that had some adjustable lumbar support, mild padding, and had fold up arms to be able to tuck it away in our small space.The lumbar support is adjustable and what I was looking for! ‚úÖThe padding does leave something to be desired. üü®I wanted support, but not rock hard; which is honestly what I got when I first got it. After 7 months of frequent use, the padding has definitely lost its heft and it's not suuuper comfortable to sit on for long periods anymore. I'd blame this on the price point- a more expensive chair would likely have a higher quality, longer lasting seat cushion. This can also be remedied by buying an aftermarket cushion (I'm currently pricing some out because the chair is still great in all other aspects.)The arms fold up perfectly, they're not flimsy and they don't fall down on their own. ‚úÖOne of the other big things was I needed a chair that was on the shorter side at its lowest point. I'm short, my desk is short, and lots of chairs are just too tall at their lowest. So that's a plus ‚úÖOverall it gets 5 stars for the price point and what you're actually getting for the lower price. It gets the job done; it's relatively comfortable, easy to put together, lightweight, and it rolls nicely. ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable and Simple', 'author': 'P.B.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I\'ve WFH for a few years now and gone through a wide variety of seating arrangements (couch, bed, decorative display chair, dining room, "gamer" chair, and now this one). This one has been by far the best one, long-term.- Mid-range in price: Not cheap, but half the cost of most executive-style chairs.- Easy assembly: I put it together myself in under an hour and took my time doing so. You will need a good amount of open space and either a bed/table for comfortable assembly, but that feels like a "given" to me as opposed to a drawback.- Comfortable all day: I both WFH at my desk and most of my hobbies are done at a desk. I am in this chair 8+ hours a day (with plenty of breaks for stretching) and it\'s very comfortable. I have had chairs in the past that exacerbated my back pain, have cut off circulation in my legs, etc. but this one has never given me those problems.- Folding arms: The arms of the chair fold up and down at your will and will remain there. Not slippery at all, but not a chore to move. Great for tucking the chair away once you\'re done with it, if you need just one arm, or whatever.- Smooth rolling: The chair rolls around smoothly on hardwood but doesn\'t go sliding like the floor\'s been waxed. Feels like a good balance for mobility, both when seated and when standing and moving it around.- Breathable backing: Back of the chair has a soft mesh that\'s pulled taut. Provides breathability in the hotter months and decent support when you lean back against it.Overall, I really like this chair. Definitely great if you need a comfortable office chair but can\'t quite spring for a higher end one. I\'ve been using it for a few months now and I haven\'t regretted a single day with it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great chair', 'author': 'Jennifer Malooly', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very comfortable chair. Nice looking. Good support. Easy to put together. Sturdy. Very Happy!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Better than the cheap ones...not as good as the commercial ones', 'author': 'jtfourh', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Like many people who formerly worked in an office, I started working remotely in March 2020. My company was going through a merger at the time and we closed down an office so I was able to take home a VERY high-quality chair.I continued working for that company full-time until last summer but stayed in a part-time capacity in order to help with the transition. I recently ended that and offered to return the chair and my computer equipment. I didn't think they'd want it back since they had moved again in the meantime.I had to desperately find a replacement quickly. I had bought cheap office chairs before and knew those would not be an option. I spend all day in my office so it had to be as close to the commercial quality level as I could get without costing anything like the commercial ones do.This chair had better reviews than most and was reasonably priced so I gave it a shot. Delivery was fast. I was able to assemble it easily and have used it for a couple of weeks now.The seat is comfortable. I'm a fairly large dude (235 lb) so airline seats can be uncomfortable. This chair's seat is plenty wide. I also like that the arms fold up so I can push the chair under the desk when I'm not using it.It does lean back - but not as far as what I was used to with the commercial office chair.The biggest reason I didn't give it five stars - it doesn't seem possible to adjust it nearly as well as the higher-end chairs. It goes up and down and there's a manual sliding lumbar support. I always feel like I'm leaning forward a tad and can't find a way to adjust that.Overall - I'd recommend it compared to cheaper chairs but if you can afford it - buy a more expensive one to get more comfort and more adjustability.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Just the kind of chair I was looking for', 'author': 'Rainy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is the very nice office chair. It meets all of my criteria at an affordable price. I like that it has arms, but that they fold up so I don‚Äôt have to worry about them fitting under my desk. I‚Äôm also looking forward to the cooler mesh back in the summer. Plus, the faux leather seat is much more dog hair friendly than fabric. This chair with its white stitching around the seat is attractive, comfortable and totally adjustable. It was easy to assemble by myself. You will definitely want to watch to assembly video, though. The paper instructions aren‚Äôt terribly clear, but the video shows the assembly process step by step so no worries!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Affordable and practical', 'author': 'JY', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The seat cushion is soft and spacious, also the breathable mesh backrest is comfortable and generous. I like its 90¬∞ flip armrest and tilt shaking function. Installation is not as difficult as expected. It is recommended.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A game-changer for any workspace!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the Office Chair Ergonomic Desk Chair from X XISHE, and I must say, it has completely transformed my workspace experience. This chair is an absolute game-changer!The ergonomic design of this chair is truly impressive. The S-shaped curve provides fantastic support for the spine, promoting better posture and reducing strain on my back. I've noticed a significant improvement in my comfort level since switching to this chair. Space-saving features are another highlight. The 90¬∞ flip-up armrests and swivel function allow me to maneuver effortlessly in my workspace, and when it's time to pack up, I can easily slide the chair under my desk to save space.Lastly, the 5-year warranty speaks volumes about the manufacturer's confidence in their product. It's rare to find such a generous warranty period, and it gives me peace of mind knowing that X XISHE stands behind their chair.Overall, I couldn't be happier with my purchase. It's truly a game-changer for any workspace.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good value for the price', 'author': 'Brianna J', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The chair was affordable, lightweight, durable and comfortable. It was shipped quickly, packaged well and assembly was straight-forward. I wouldn't hesitate to buy this chair again.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good chair but a little small', 'author': 'Ben R', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Chair is fairly good in condition, overall satisfied with it. The instructions on assembly are extremely easy to follow, though the deign of how the back and seat connect is through the L piece that has the arm rests which is a little weird to get on there due to the shape of the parts it connects to but is easier then chairs that connect from back to bottom. Ergonomics wise the chair is a little firm for my taste in how much force it takes to lean back, since I use it for my personal PC I like to lean back in my chairs quite a bit, but with this one even on the lowest tension I'd have to push back on something with noticeable force to stayed lean back. This isn't the biggest issue as it was only ruining my posture doing that, and I would say it's much more suited to office spaces because of it. Only complaint I have is that the arm rests are a little to close together for me to use. I am a rather big man with wide shoulder, so to use them properly I have to scrunch up a little. They aren't so close as to touch my side, though if you happened to be a person of a weight that was larger on the spectrum, then you might encounter a problem there; however if you do have this problem you can also just lean up the arm rest as there is a pivot on them to lean them up and down if you don't want to use them. Overall, Great chair for an office, Ok chair for personal use.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent after sale support', 'author': 'Musubi', 'rating': 5, 'content': '8th month update: no problems with the chair; the seat cushion has fully "broken in" and feels really comfortable now.Before writing this review, I wanted the seat to "break in" for a couple of weeks since I know from my prior chairs, that the seat cushion would begin compressing a little (and initially, it felt "off" since my own body wasn\'t used to it yet). But let me back up a bit.I originally purchased this chair since the graphic (with the measurements) showed that it\'s lowest height from floor to seat top was 14.9" (and it\'s been getting more difficult to find chairs that go low; my prior chairs all went down to 14" as measured from floor to the top of the seat cushion). I\'m of average height (170cm or 5\'6") so I tend to like sitting lower. Additionally, my computer desk is 25" from the floor to the desk top (so I need a chair that has a seat that is no higher than 15" in order for me to be at a comfortable position to use my computer).As it turned out when I assembled the chair (which overall was pretty straightforward, except for the cumbersome part of securing the seat back with the arm rests to the seat bottom), the lowest position was 17" (the 14.9" is actually from floor to the bottom part under the cushion); it was a bit too high for my computer desk. That is when I reached out to XISHE (via their e-mail address included in the setup pamphlet since like many others, the product support link on Amazon takes you to a different company).The service representative went out of their way to find out what my problem was, and wanted to make it right (I explained how the seat at the lowest position, was way too high for my desk setup compared to my prior chair - I sent a photo comparing the two side by side). I didn\'t even mention to them I was considering returning the chair since I wanted to see how they would try to resolve this. XISHE offered to refund a portion of the chair so that I could purchase a suitable cylinder. This offer actually took me by surprise; I decided to give that a try since it would be easier than disassembling the chair, repacking everything, and then returning it (which I know something of this size is a pain since Amazon uses UPS for this type of return).After searching around (and reading up on cylinder stroke), I bought this 2.5" cylinder https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0B1M2NQZX which is one of the shortest ones available with the standard 1.2" sinking on the housing (some cylinders are 2.4" sinking where more of the cylinder drops through the base), and it did the trick where the lowest position has the top of the seat at 15" from the floor.Initially, the chair felt uncomfortable because my previous seat didn\'t actually have good support at the front (but my legs had gotten used to that). It took around a week to re-adjust, and then another week for the seat to break in. Now one month later, this chair is comfortable. I did buy a seat cover (I normally prefer fabric material versus leather/faux or real) to round out the personal comfort aspect. I keep the armrests up since most office chairs, I don\'t install them (the armrests for this chair however, are part of the seat back support that is then attached to the seat bottom).Overall, I am really happy with the chair (with the shorter cylinder lift). But more so, I am impressed with the after sale support and the lengths the company went to help me resolve my issue.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

Would recommend!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable and solid', 'author': 'John from LI', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Pretty good chair, bought for someone as a gift, they love it. Assembly was easier than most chairs of this style.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Decent comfort, easy assembly.', 'author': 'YankeeBob', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Handsome chair, goes together easily. Everything works. I'm 235lbs. and I feel the chair could use more padding in the seat and back. Flip-up armrests work fine. I purchased black and the entire chair is black, including the legs (not chrome). This chair will rock effortlessly and quietly in the rocking mode. For the price I would recommend.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Padding Bad', 'author': 'Kirk B.', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'I need something with extra padding and this company claimed it had "Double Padding" so I took a chance. Initially, it felt ok but within a couple days I noticed my tailbone was hurting after a few minutes in the chair and when I investigated, I found the padding was compressing, bottoming out and felt hard, which isn\'t my idea of comfortable. A chair is worthless, imo, if you can\'t sit in it for very long. Everything had to be assembled which sort of sucked, especially considering I paid good money for it and the padding wore out in a matter of a few days. If you do choose to buy this pos, remember to get the screws for the \'bottom back\' started before you do the sides, it will make installation of the back much easier. I fought with mine doing it "per instructions" until I woke up and did it my way. I highly suggest buying a better chair. My last one was a Serta, and the padding was excellent in that one. I still have it, it\'s still good after 7 years of use. I\'m using it at the office because the company won\'t buy a quality chair that\'s comfortable. I should\'ve paid a little more and bought another Serta. I gave this chair 1 star because my soar butt told me to do so. title: FelixKing Ergonomic Office Chair with Adjustable High Back, Breathable Mesh, Lumbar Support, Flip-up Armrests, Executive Rolling Swivel Comfy Task Computer Chair for Home Office (Black)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars UPDATED: Great price, great styling, great chair, we now own two!', 'author': 'joesid', 'rating': 5, 'content': "UPDATED: . My wife loves this chair had to buy a second one!After seeing the chair I bought a few weeks ago I had to buy a second one for my wife. She loves the chair it has a very sharp appearance and very comfortable. Assembly is very simple, it only takes about 20 minutes.**********************I needed a new chair for my home office. This chair is working out perfectly. The seat cushion has plenty of support and doesn't bottom out. The mesh back is more than comfortable and the chair is solid and stable, no wobble or creaking. Lastly the wheels roll around very smoothly on my chair pad while my old chair would not.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent value for the dollar.', 'author': 'Cook', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Comfort, versatility and value for the dollar in an office chair is most important to me. I've used many office chairs over the years and no two are alike. I need a chair that fits my body and this one does.The armrests are the right distance apart. They are padded and much easier on my elbows than hard plastic armrests are, though more padding would be nice. They flip up when I don't want them, like when I am playing my guitar.The lumbar support slides up and down which increases fit and comfort.I can lock the chair in the upright position or unlock it and lean backward, though the range is limited, probably for safety reasons. A tension adjustment lets you increase or decrease the amount of tilt resistance.The mostly flat seat and back works best for me. Heavily sculpted seats create pressure points on my legs and back. I would like a bit more padding on the seat but it's fine most of the time and I just add a seat cushion when I need more.The chair was easy to assemble, glides easily, feels solid and looks good. You can spend over a thousand dollars on an office chair but it would be highly unlikely to match the value per dollar of the FelixKing Ergonomic Office Chair.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Pretty nice chair!', 'author': 'Donna J Rudd', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Easy to put together. Very comfortable & good for the back. Love the price! Great office chair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars For the price, great chair', 'author': 'DJ', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This chair is very reasonably priced, and for that reason the quality is as expected. It's much more supportive than the chair I had and has armrests, which I was really needing. The seat is firm, probably just a foam pad, no shape to it. The height I've been unable to adjust. The armrests handily lift up, which is nice for pushing the chair all the way under my desk when I'm done. The back as a sliding lumbar support, which does put pressure where you need it, but the back does not have any recline or adjustment to it. It's a basic chair. The fabric is nice. It went together very quickly, you won't have any issues there.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great back support, comfortable, sturdy and beautiful', 'author': 'Cocotomato', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I shopped around Amazon for a light blue chair. After having bad experience with broken lumbar support from another seller/manufacturer, I‚Äôm so happy that I found this chair - easier to assemble, more sturdy with gaskets, lumbar support does great job!!! Highly recommended if you are still looking and comparing different models or sellers. This is the one to go!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good assembly instructions', 'author': "J. O'brien", 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Usually furniture assembly instructions are awful. These were quite clear and the bolts were packaged with each set in its own compartment and clearly labeled. Also stair parts were provided.I‚Äôm terrible at reading instructions and assembling furniture but this took me about 15-20 minutes.As far as the chair it‚Äôs pretty solid. No weird chemical smells. It‚Äôs comfortable. The raising and lowering work well. The arms only seem to be adjustable at an angle, not up or down. Only slight complaint is that the arms tilt back down if I put more than a minimum amount of weight but I am a big guy. But I mostly have my hands hovering over keyboard so that‚Äôs not an issue. And you can get them completely out of the way, which is nice.Sitting in the chair is quite comfortable. The mesh back provides the right amount of resistance. Leaning back or forward mechanism works well and is smooth, as is turning side to side. The rollers are solid and roll well.Overall one of the best values I‚Äôve gotten on Amazon.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Build quality is good not comfortable', 'author': 'POORNACHANDRA Rao Boddu', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'This chair is only for people height ranging from 5‚Äô3 to 5‚Äô5 with less boy weight, not comfortable for people who are more than that height, if you sit on the chair shoulder hurts', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable and looks good!', 'author': 'Andrea Hilton', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love how comfortable this chair is on my back and bottom!! So easy to assemble my son put it together for me!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars COMFORTABLE', 'author': 'Austin', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This chair really helps with my back especially when I don‚Äôt have the money to see the chiropractor my wife loves it as well this is a nice space saving chair the lumbar support in the back of the chair is much needed you don‚Äôt know how much you need it until you actually have the option I have not seen a more ergonomic price friendly chair anywhere thanks to the seller of this thank you so much', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Desk Chair', 'author': 'Carl Fischer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This was a Birthday gift to my wife, and she loves it! title: COLAMY Leather Executive Office Chair- High Back Home Computer Desk Chair with Padded Flip-up Arms, Adjustable Tilt Lock, Swivel Rolling Ergonomic Chair for Adult Working Study, Brown
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable and stylish', 'author': 'izabell derose', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is an excellent chair! Very comfortable and I love that arms can be pulled up and chair tucked under the desk. Some say hard to put the back rest on, I did it myself with no assistance by laying the chair on its side . Don‚Äôt tighten arm rests all the way until you can position the back rest.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good price for a nice chair', 'author': 'ED', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Good instructions and comfortable, real nice chair. We are really pleassd with the chair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars For the money it's a solid purchase, not fantastic but it works.", 'author': 'Alexander Langella', 'rating': 4, 'content': "So the chair was actually kind of difficult to put together when it came to getting the bolts into the back. It's definitely designed for 2 people to make it a bit easier, as I had to wrap my hand around both the back rest and the bottom to squeeze the two together to get the bolts in. Two bolts felt like they had stripped, but upon further twisting, they eventually locked into their final position (I'm guessing this is where some of the complaints about stripping come from, they just didn't twist far enough in...it's really surprising how deep the actual bolts go in, and how many turns it takes to finally settle them in).I will say the instructions were on a similar level to what La-Z-Boy provides, which is a nice touch. Easy to read, lots of solid details. They also came with a fair amount of extra parts, and the quality of the parts seemed decent. My only gripe is the plastic nubs to fit into the holes where the bolts go in, are not properly fitted, and most pop out on their own. It was very difficult to get them into place for the lower two sockets, and in attempting to force them into the upper holes where the moving armrest is ended up forcing me to use a small hammer, and I still couldn't get them to fit properly. Even swapping them out. I stopped trying as I ended up nicking the exterior slightly and did not feel like doing any extra exterior damage in a vain attempt. That said, they aren't really necessary. It looks fine with the holes around the movable armrest and the two bolts into the seat sealed off.The build quality is fairly decent. The exception seems to be the seat area. The sides and back of the seat have ample and adequate cushion and foam. However the center has almost nothing. I suppose this was a way to cut corners, and most large sized individuals tend to be thicker on the edges of their bums, rather than have more weight around the center, and most people will sit further back into the chair (were again, there is adequate cushioning). However once I move a little further into the center, as I tend to sit forward, that center cushion deflates really fast, and it's like sitting on a rock.The back support took some time to get used to. It's very thick foam in the lower back region, and it leans a bit backwards for what I'm used to (most of the chairs I buy are more straight backed). So it took a little time to get used to. It's not bad, but feels a bit off. I'm guessing this is designed to alleviate lower back pain, though it's a bit much, and pushes me forward, where when I lean forward into the seat, and given the angle of the seat's rear cushion, really pushes me into that center with limited cushioning. So I have to be very mindful of how I sit in this chair.I haven't had it long, so I'm not sure how well the foam will hold up. I had to replace a rather nice faux leather high back, but metal frame chair where the joint where the arm bolt is connected into the back is where some corners were cut (it's the width of the bolt itself, and of a lower grade material, not steel, so it broke with just a slight force application). This chair seems to be a bit more durable. However, it's plastic, with the only metal being the bolts and the screw holds meant to hold the thing together. So I'm not positive on longevity.The company that makes this chair is American, but its made in China. Though the quality is decent, and the thickness of the faux leather seems fairly solid, and difficult to rip or tear, though I'm not about to take a knife to it to properly test but some tugging and pulling indicates it will last awhile, even in dry weather.The rating itself is based on the price to quality. For what I paid, for what it is, it seems like a good purchase.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This Rocks', 'author': 'Sarah', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This chair was the easiest thing I have ever put together, and I did it alone, which is great since I had no one willing to help at the time!This chair is perfect for when I choose to game for a little bit of time, or a lot of time, for when I have a lot of typing to do, or even writing. The squishiness is just right, and I can lift the arms so they don't crash into my desk. I have accidentally spent close to seven hours in this chair and only struggled with my neck (because I do not look at my monitor properly, not because of this chair). Every time I use it, I am completely comfortable without feeling aches, stiffness, or numb butt/feet on the longer uses. Great buy! Worth the price, although I got it on sale at the time.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome chair', 'author': 'Sue', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is truly the most comfortable place to sit in my house! And it rocks back and forth real easily so I just put a ottoman at the bottom of it and I can lean back far enough to sleep in it if I want and it is certainly comfortable enough to sleep in! LOL it rolls really well and doesn't leave marks on the floor and I just don't think you can go wrong buying this chair or your office or for any other use that you want it for", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Well made, sturdy', 'author': 'W. Conner', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Comfortable office chair, seems sturdy. It came with extra screws (in case you lose one) and a handy hex wrench - nice touch! I would buy this chair again.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good comfortable chair', 'author': 'Chesslamb', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This chair is very comfortable. I like the appearance of it. I wanted a chair for my elderly mother to use at her computer desk that was easy to move or roll. This one does that. It was easily assembled for the most part. The only issue I had in putting it together was that it rolled too easily. I had to brace it against the box it came in while I was putting the arms on it. But that wasn't the chairs fault. The floor on which I was on while putting it together was a laminate floor that was very smooth which made the chair want to roll whenever I put the slightest pressure against it. Other than that it went together very smoothly. Very pleased with it so far.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 22, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Chair is good; quality control and customer service is NOT', 'author': 'ShauntK', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'For $140 the chair is decent, but a bit expensive considering the cushion and padding feel soft and will wear out sooner than later Otherwise it feels good and provides support for extended periods of time (few hours of work)...CONS:the assembly was very easy, i think a total of 8-10 bolts... after assembling the chair, I sat on it, and I was leaning to the right... mind you, there is only one way and 4 bolts to attach the base to the mounting plate... so I reached out to customer service, who responded a couple of days later with a instructions on how to fix it... it appears this is a problem they have been facing and have diagrams and instructions on how the customer can fix it at home :) ... I asked for a replacement, they could not as the chair was out of stock... they offered to send me a new back, even though the base is the problem... they just dont really read or understand what the customer is saying. I asked for a discount, if I will be fixing the "new" chair I purchased... they said they cannot. So, quality control and customer service not so good...', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Its okay.', 'author': 'Jeffrey Michael Thornton', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'its not a bad chair. i got this one to play guitar in. it doesnt provide the best back support and can be uncomforable at times. but i have had worse chairs.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars New Chair', 'author': 'kenneth u.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Cushions are firmer and deeper than most China made chairs...but this feels pretty good !!Wish it was USA made !!!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

I purchased a previous one two years ago for my home in Kentucky and it's holding up great. I decided I needed a similar work-at-home chair in my Florida condo so I bought the same Colomy model 2181 chair I already had, offered at a good price and Prime free shipping. To me this is a huge issue and I don't recall it mentioning this in the description and if it did I must've missed it. It kind of gives me this sensation of just leaning/falling forward a bit too much. I also worry about the long term wear and tear it will have with this kind of tilt.I originally rated this 5 Stars but I'm lowering it to 1. One star because the chair gets kind of uncomfortable after a while. Uncomfortable to the point where my lower back starts killing me and I have to get up every 30 minutes. I tried a lot of different things to fix it including talking with support who reached out to me and mailed me a few new pieces no questions asked which was nice of them. However trying to fix this chair just became a second job and wasn't worth the amount of time I was putting into it. Between the 20ish emails I sent back and forth with support (only 1 email a day they don't seem to respond back on the same day), and then replacing two pieces of the chair which required me to remove the cylinder twice (not sure if you've ever removed a cylinder but it's not the easiest task). I probably spent more of my time than what this chair was even worth. I threw it away and ordered a new one because I'm not wasting anymore time trying to get a refund.I'd like it to just sit perfectly flat. If it wasn't for this annoying tilt I'd probably rate this chair 5* if you don't mind a forward angle on your chair it is probably great for you.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My main chair', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I sit in this chair all day doing my Diamond art.Was getting sores on the back of my legs with my other chairs, and this chair helped me heal.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Big yes. IT WAS 250 MAX ....THIS CAME WITH AMAZING PARTS AND TOOL FOR ASSEMBLE AND VERY CLEAR INSTRUCTIONS SEEMS LIKE IT WILL LAST IF THE SHOCK THAT ISNT RATED FOR 400 LBS BUT 350LB PER INSTRUCTIONS GUESS TIME WILL TELL SERTA SHOCK FAILED AFTER 4 DAYS', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great but loud creaky sounds', 'author': 'Cecelia Claybrook', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The chair is comfortable, only two issues. title: Dripex Ergonomic Office Chair, High Back Desk Chair, Computer Mesh Chair with Lumbar Support, Adjustable Headrest & 2D Armrest, 90¬∞-135¬∞Tilt Function, 360¬∞ Swivel Home Office Task Chair, Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good budget friendly chair with neck support for big & tall people', 'author': 'Patrick', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I rarely leave reviews, but can be a pain trying to find a decent chair with neck support at a reasonable price.Doubly so when you\'re over 6\' or 200 lbs.So if you\'re on the bigger side and on a budget, here\'s the TL;DR: I\'m 6\'2, 230-ish, and for the $100 I paid, this chair is fantastic so far.I think it would fit someone up to 6\'4" and 250+ lbs, and maybe a couple of inches and a few pounds more than that.Positives:* The seat is wide with firm cushioning. It feels like it will hold up well over time even if you\'re on the more-to-love side.* Mesh back is comfortable and doesn\'t make me sweat like the faux leather upholstered chairs tend to.* Reclining feature is adjustable and strong. I had no problems setting it to a firmness that allows me to lean my weight into it without it flexing. Time will tell how well it holds up.* Arms are comfortable, removable, and adjustable for height.* Neck support is comfortable, removable and adjustable for height and angle. It feels solid and still has a few inches of extension left at the setting I use.* Assembly is easy. It requires a single allen key (included) for all of the bolts and a phillips head screwdriver for the neck support adjustment.* No tacky "gamer" branding or obnoxious accents. It would fit in in a professional setting.Negatives:* You have to remove the neck support from the chair back to adjust it. It can take a few times of screwing and unscrewing the bolts to get it right. Don\'t install the plastic cover piece until you have it dialed in. You\'ll know what I\'m talking about when you see it.* The upholstery is basic cloth and has a somewhat rough texture.* The arms only adjust up and down, no 3D adjustment. This hasn\'t been a problem for me, but it\'s worth noting.* Lumbar support is attached by a thin sheet of springy plastic. It does the job, but I could see the plastic fatiguing over time.Overall, I\'d compare this favorably to the more expensive Ikea Markus chair that it replaced.At the price (around $100 at the time of this review), it\'s an easy 5 stars.I\'ll update this review if my opinion changes.PS: Not sponsored or compensated.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A Game-Changer for Comfort and Productivity!', 'author': 'Joseph', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the Dripex Ergonomic Chair, and it has truly transformed my distance learning experience. The sleek design and materials make it a standout piece that complements any workspace.Overall, I couldn't be happier with my purchase. The Dripex Ergonomic Chair has exceeded my expectations in terms of comfort, functionality, and style. If you're in the market for a chair that prioritizes your well-being while enhancing your workspace, look no further. Arm rests are height adjustable too so that's a plus.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Soooo comfortable!', 'author': 'Shuran Zhang', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The Ergonomic Office Chair is an excellent addition to any workspace, combining comfort with functionality. title: Office Chair Ergonomic Desk Chair, Mesh Computer Chair Home Office Desk Chairs with Lumbar Support, Adjustable Height and Flip-up Armrests, Swivel Executive Task Chair BIFMA Passed, Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exceptional Comfort and Durability For A Good Price', 'author': 'Eric Cone', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have been thoroughly impressed with the performance and comfort of this chair.The adjustable height feature allowed me to set the chair to the perfect level for my desk, ensuring that I maintain proper posture throughout the day. The movable armrests are a fantastic addition, as they provide excellent support for my forearms, reducing strain on my shoulders and neck. The armrests also pivot up and out of the way, so my cats are less prone to jumping on/off of the armrests, scratching them.The chair's durability is also remarkable. The steel frame feels sturdy and robust, and the high-quality upholstery shows no signs of wear or tear, even after several months of daily use. It's clear that this chair is built to last.But what truly sets this chair apart is its comfort. The cushioning on both the seat and backrest is plush and supportive, making long hours at my desk a breeze. The breathable mesh back keeps me cool, even during the hottest days, and I no longer find myself constantly readjusting my seating position. And the lumbar support is not too intrusive but does a great job in keeping my back aligned.Assembly was a breeze as well, thanks to the clear instructions and included tools. Overall, this chair is a good value and I would purchase again!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good back-supporting chair', 'author': 'Woo H. Choi', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This office chair was a really satisfying purchase.
