The seat cushion bottoms out too quickly, leading to discomfort and inadequate support for heavier individuals. This limitation significantly impacts the overall comfort and usability of the chair, making it unsuitable for extended periods of use.Furthermore, despite its budget-friendly price, the chair\'s build quality and durability leave much to be desired. It did not withstand regular use for an extended period and showed signs of wear and tear sooner than expected. The overall construction felt flimsy and lacking in robustness.While the low cost may be appealing, it\'s important to consider the trade-offs in terms of comfort and longevity. As the saying goes, "You get what you pay for," and the SMUG Ergonomic Mesh Office Chair is a prime example of a budget option that sacrifices comfort and durability for affordability.In conclusion, the SMUG Ergonomic Mesh Office Chair may be an economical choice, but its lack of comfort, particularly for users over 150lbs, and its subpar durability make it a less-than-ideal option for daily use. If you prioritize comfort and long-lasting support, investing in a higher-quality chair may be a better choice in the long run.Edit: After initially writing my review, their customer support team reached out to me in an effort to provide a solution to my issue, I am very pleased with the solution I received and this level of customer service is commendable. title: Mimoglad Office Chair, High Back Ergonomic Desk Chair with Adjustable Lumbar Support and Headrest, Swivel Task Chair with flip-up Armrests for Guitar Playing, 5 Years Warranty
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to install and reliable', 'author': 'Yashwanth', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Amazing chair! Looks great, feels comfortable and beyond that very reliable. I feel they used premium material to build. There is decent enough cushion to sit all day and back support as well! Good ergonomic chair out there in decent price range.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars very comfortable, great for price', 'author': 'Stephanie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This chair is great for the price. The cushion on the chair is pretty thick so it makes the chair really comfortable to sit on for long periods of time. If you‚Äôre someone who likes to sit up with you‚Äôre legs in the chair this is a good choice because of the cushion size, for reference i‚Äôm 5‚Äô8. The material is good quality, I actually spilled some matcha on the armrest cloth piece and it came off nicely, the material is easy to clean. It comes with a cover to go on the seat cushion that is really cute and soft (make sure you put the cover on before you assemble the chair because you can‚Äôt once it‚Äôs put together). I personally took the head test off in the picture because I like to see more of my desk but there‚Äôs nothing wrong with it, It‚Äôs just a personal choice. Also the headrest is adjustable. One thing that could be better is the cushions on the arm rests they‚Äôre a little thin so the arm wrests are a kind of hard hard. Overall this was a great purchase, I‚Äôd recommend this chair.(assembly took about 30 minutes and the directions were very clear and concise)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great chair, but not for the way I sit', 'author': 'Day G', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I\'ve been sitting in this chair 12 hours a day for a month now, and I finally feel like I can write an honest review about it.The chair was packaged very well, and was one of the easiest chair constructions I\'ve experienced over the years. The tools were great quality and I was able to construct it alone with no issues.Visually, the chair looks nice. The colors pop, and it doesn\'t have a "cheap" look to it, despite its plastic and mesh design.When first sitting in the chair, it\'s comfortable. The seat cushion is slightly firm, but soft enough where I don\'t feel too much fatigue using it, especially during those long sitting sessions. The mesh seat back is nice, and I don\'t feel the pressure of the back\'s frame on my shoulder blades. The headrest is a nice touch, as it has a slight give to it, making it comfortable to lean into.After a few weeks, however, I\'m noticing I\'ve had some lower back strain/problems which I didn\'t have in my previous chair. So I\'m not very comfortable anymore. It\'s also affecting my sleeping positions, making it difficult to get comfortable and fall asleep quickly.A majority of my sitting time is spent cross-legged with my back pressed firmly against the backrest to keep my spine aligned, and doing so on this chair, I think, is partly causing the problem. Because of the discomfort, I\'m constantly changing my sitting position between "proper", leaned back, cross-legged, and leaned forward. With my old chair, I could sit cross-legged the entire time with my back pressed against the backrest the entire workday and not have any issues.There\'s an adjustable lower backrest, but it has some issues. For one, it doesn\'t stay in the position you keep it in, and you\'ll need to readjust it if you squirm around in the chair or get up and leave for a while (it will fall back into its lowest position on its own). Even keeping the back rest adjusted, I still can\'t find a comfortable position for long sitting sessions.Also, there are plastic covers for the joint screws on the swivel arms. These pop out constantly, falling to the ground. There\'s nothing to lock them into place aside from light tension. I\'ve hammered them on with my hands, but it only lasts for a day or so before falling off again. I\'ve resorted to taping them on.For its price, it may not be a terrible purchase, especially if you\'re not planning on sitting for actual office-length work day in and day out. However, I\'ll likely be looking for another chair. In the meantime, I\'m trying to switch to an orthopedic seat pillow and added armrest cushions to increase the longevity of it, but I don\'t like that I have to resort to these measures on a chair 1 month old. We\'ll see if the cushions help the lower back pain.Overall, it\'s not a terrible chair. You can do much worse, especially for the price. But for anyone looking for something comfortable for long sitting hours, I don\'t believe this will be your chair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This chair is superb for long sessions at the computer!', 'author': 'Holly', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I am delighted to report that the chair is exactly as advertised. It is a very ergonomic fit and I am much happier using it to write at my computer than any prior chair. It is a lovely color, exactly what I sought and as pictured. The assembly is very clear. I'm quite poor, normally, at assembly, but I followed the guidelines and only once consulted a short you tube video from the company to get my orientation with the arms of the chair. Honestly, if you knew how unskilled I am at assembly, you would appreciate how easy this one was. This chair is so perfect and sturdy, and nicely designed, that I will likely replace two other office chairs with it over time. A really good buy and highly recommended!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great chair and great service!', 'author': 'Scott Minor', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I really love this super comfortable chair! I work between 12 to 16 hour days, 5 days a week. So it definitely gets A LOT of use! It‚Äôs really comfortable and it‚Äôs got good cushion in the seat. The headrest sits at the perfect height, and the lumbar support sticks out enough to do its job without digging into your back. One of my favorite perks is the arm rests being able to move up, they don‚Äôt move around either, they stay put when I move them up. I wiggle and move around a lot, and like to sit cross legged, so that‚Äôs extra convenient to be able to move them out of the way, but still have the armrests when I need them. It‚Äôs also nice to flip them up when I push my chair in at the end of the day. The pink color is really cute too! Both me and my son got new chairs at the same time, his is a different chair though. He likes mine better and steals it when I‚Äôm not working. I have noticed an improvement with the pinched nerves in my shoulders as well (self induced from working in front of the computer so much with bad posture).The customer service was absolutely amazing and a pleasure to work with! I reached out to activate the warranty, and asked if they had seat covers. I looked at their Amazon shop and tried to find one online, but I was hesitant to get one and it not fit. They were so nice to send me one! They were quick to respond to my emails also. They were great at communicating through the whole process and provided updates. 100% beyond pleased with my chair and the service I received. I will definitely be ordering again the next time I need a new chair, however with the quality of it, I think it‚Äôs going to be a while before that!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Brilliant color sturdy comfortable', 'author': 'Denita', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The orange color is nice. The chair was easily put together. It‚Äôs sturdy and comfortable. Definitely looks more expensive than the price. The rear lumbar thing is adjustable - perfect.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice chair, good value.', 'author': 'M. Bogue', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Easy to assemble. Comfortable and nice looking. So far so good.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Solid Chair for a Good Price', 'author': 'Walter', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I ordered this chair and easily assembled it. The instructions were clear. It was comfortable, except for the lumbar support. It stuck out a little too far for me and caused some pain after a while. Other than that, the chair was great. I ended up asking to return it and got a quick response and refund. The customer service was excellent. If you like a more aggressive lumbar support, this chair will probably work well for you.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very impressed!', 'author': 'M. Sherwood', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Extremely impressed with packaging, instructions, quality of components, adjustability and appearance.I purchased the ivory white chair. Very impressed with packaging and assembly instruction booklet. My chair came with a removable seat cover. The seat cover was not covered in the instructions which causes me to think it might be specific to the white chair. I suggest if your chair comes with a cover, and you want to use it, put it on the seat before attaching the brackets. I put the brackets on first and realized the cover couldn't be pulled over the sides and back so I ended up removing them completely, adding the cover and reattached the brackets. At this point seems it will be on permanently.The assembly process was as good as could be expected, but not as simple as it looks in the video. I have ample experience assembling furniture and even with helpful instructions it probably took a couple hours all together. The base goes together easily, but assembling the brackets seat and back took some time. If I were to do another one would be quicker. A second set of hands to hold the back and seat steady while installing the arms would also speed up the process. Do not screw down tight until all the bracket screws are in. It took me quite a bit of adjusting and several attempts to get everything to fit.The seat does go up really high so if you're short like me and have trouble finding a high enough seat to sit ergonomically with arm placement to keyboard on a standard desk you will appreciate this chair.As much as I love the chair, I'm not sure I'd want to sit on it 9 hours a day. I can tell a difference between this chair and the one my company provided through our ergo program. I noticed the padding of the two chairs looks similar on the surface, but once I sat down, could feel this chair is less supportive in the seat. I'm guessing a lower density foam. It also feels a little wobbly. The base that attaches the seat to the post is small. The commercial chair has a hard plastic base.The work chair was also 4 times the price of this chair. For the price if you're on a small budget, this is an amazing chair. I am using only a few hours per week at my personal desk so it's working great for that application.Also, in case you're wondering, it can be assembled without the head rest, however if you don't add it, there will be two visible screw holes on the back. Initially my ponytail was hitting it, but raising it a bit solved that issue. The arms are permanently attached to the brackets that hold the seat and back together, so the only way to attach the back is to install the arms, but they do raise up easily. As for the back support, seems fine. I couldn't figure out how it worked but fortunately it felt fine straight out of the box. I'm 5'3 and short waisted for reference.All in all I highly recommend for casual use.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars It's alright", 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The chair itself is cute, I like the colors offered, but overall it really is just "ok". If you sit for long periods of time, it\'s comfortable, but after less than a month it\'s already started making creaking sounds. I\'ve tried WD-40 and adjusting, but the creaks sound more like an issue with the chair itself.It sits high; I\'m not a particularly tall person, but if you\'re under 5\'4" then your feet will probably just barely brush the ground - and this is with it on the lowest possible setting. I ended up buying an ottoman for my desk to help with comfort.The arms are awkwardly short, and narrow, making it a bit uncomfortable for typing. The back is alright, but there is really not enough adjustment capabilities on this chair. You\'re either having to sit straight up, or essentially lay down. There is no in between settings if you just want to recline a bit. Ergonomically, this chair is pretty basic.Overall, I would have returned it. But the process of trying to put all the pieces back into the box it (snuggly) came in, was more of a hassle than I was willing to put in. For the price, I\'m not overly upset about it - it is what it is. But had I known, I would have bought a different one.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: NEO CHAIR Office Chair Ergonomic Desk Chair Mid Back Mesh with Lumbar Support Comfortable Cushion Swivel Adjustable Height Armrest Gaming/Computer Chairs for Home Office Desk (Black)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best Budget Chair On Amazon 10/10', 'author': 'Adrian', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've got to say, this chair is an absolute game-changer for those marathon gaming sessions. It's like a cozy cloud for your behind, making those extended hours of play feel like a breeze. What really caught my attention is the fabric on the back ‚Äì it's not just comfy, but also surprisingly stable. Unlike those solid surfaces that can make you feel like you're sticking to the chair, this fabric lets you breathe, and I'm all for that. And let's not forget about the build quality ‚Äì top-notch. You can tell this chair was crafted with care. It's sturdy and reliable, which is just what you need when you're in the heat of battle. Plus, the amazing price for this level of build quality is the cherry on top.And the convenience factor? It's a breeze to put together. The assembly process is so straightforward, they practically laid out the whole thing like a map. Sections are clearly marked, and it's a smooth experience from start to finish. So, not only do you get a chair that pampers you during gaming marathons, but you also get one that doesn't make you sweat during setup. All in all, if you're looking for a chair that treats your body right during gaming marathons, you appreciate a thoughtful design, and you value ease of assembly, this one's definitely worth a serious look.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great!', 'author': 'bartholomew', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This chair is awesome for a cheaper officer chair. It‚Äôs a little flimsy and very easy to fall off of, but super comfortable!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars good product', 'author': 'Sophie T.', 'rating': 4, 'content': "it's super cute and looks just like the pictures. the assembly was easy enough, some parts were a little harder than others to screw together because of the limited feasibility of the alan key. the seat cushion is a little stiff but it doesn't bother me. my boyfriend made a comment about it but i don't really notice it. the only thing i could complain about it the tilt. i has none. it just sits straight up with no give. my dad and boyfriend both looked at it. i've gotten used to it and usually sit criss cross on the seat anyways so it doesn't bother me too much. sometimes if i'm gaming tho i'll have to shift around a lot to get in a comfortable position. the only time the seat cushion becomes an issue too is when i'm sitting for hours on end. otherwise i really love the chair and wouldn't buy anything different", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 14, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Will update as I use', 'author': 'Dallas', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Day 1 (July 2022) - First impression is for the value it's really not a bad chair. The seat is a bit hard, but for the price it's not terrible. Quality-wise it feels good. Definitely cheap plastic but again, for the price what do you expect? I'm 5'4 and cannot touch the ground when it's at it's highest. The back of the seat is great, very supportive for what it is, follows the curvature of your back well and even makes contact if you like to lean. Casters aren't terrible, actually pretty nice and roll pretty fluidly on my tile. At a glance, this does not look like some generic cheap chair as well. It rocks a little which is nice as well. Tilting isn't too bad and has a decent range if you need it. Overall, day 1/first use I really am surprised with it. Definitely worth the money, which I paid around $60 at the time.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 15, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars STAY AWAY FROM THIS CHAIR - SUPER UNCOMFORTABLE', 'author': 'Yogendra J.', 'rating': 1, 'content': "Big Warning: The looks of this chair can be deceiving.Assembly:The assembly is NOT easy, though the site claims that you can assemble it in 15 mins, it took me more than an hour because of the flimsy screws, the pathetic quality of Allen wrench and not to mention that the instructions were not super clear as well. They have just provided pictures of how the assembly should look in each step, but it would have been really helpful if they would have given more details about each step.The packaging comes with Wheels (5) , screws (divided into A, B, C) , washer (D) and an Allen wrench. I would expect each screw (i.e A,B and C) to be supported by washer (D) for better handling, but again here the instructions do not clearly show whether each screw should have Washer or not as there are not enough Washers as screws. So, I had to decide what part of the chair I can put the screw without the Washer, pretty bad from Customer perspective.Comfort:1. After putting this chair into an assembled state, I sat on it for 30 mins and boy, what a uncomfortable Memory Foam seat this is. It looks so fabulous, but the seat is absolutely uncomfortable to sit for long hours. The main reason people order chairs these days is sitting long hours due to Work From Home, but this is definitely not your chair if you expect to sit 6-8 hours a day working. Again, depends on how heavy you are, I am 188 Pounds, but if you are super lightweight, it may be a different story for you.2. Lumbar Support: The Lumbar Support is made of hard plastic, the moment I sat on the chair, it started pressing hard on my back hurting me more than supporting me. Pretty bad design, material choice by the manufacturer.3. Arm rest - The Arm Rest is same as the Lumbar Support. Made of hard plastic, without consideration for any soft support OR wide enough to support multiple forearms, thus someone like me who is heavy, has a much bigger forearm then someone skinny. Thus, the arm rest hurts you as well.4. Stiching - The Stiching on the seat is clearly visible, and thus an unpleasant thing to look at, though it doesn't make any issues while sittingAll in All, this is bad chair for medium / heavy people and should stay away from it if you are looking for comfortable chair in these times of WFH.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 15, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Very comfy for a cheap chair, arrived ripped', 'author': 'Kyle Weber', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I like this chair, Semi comfortable, easy to assemble. Seat depth is a bit short for a tall person. Base feels like it could break if you lean too far. backrest arrived ripped but still useable. Honestly I will probably use this till it breaks and buy something a bit nicer next time.But for the price I am ok with the chair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent chair!', 'author': 'Dugger', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'When COVID broke I ended up purchasing a gaming chair that was absolutely horrible. It was flat, super uncomfortable, heavy, the arm rests were loose and the chair made constant creaking sounds that were so loud that I had to mute my mic during meetings. I finally had enough and set out looking for something more mature, better made, but not too expensive. This NEO Chair came up in my initial search, and I really like the modern look, and it has lots of positive feedback, but for $60 I assumed it was probably another junk chair. More searching showed chairs that looked identical with the same features, but for more money, so I decided I‚Äôd take the chance on the NEO chair, and I‚Äôm SO glad I did! This chair is AWESOME! It arrived in perfect shape. I was surprised at the small amount of screws that were needed for assembly, which means there‚Äôs less moving parts that can loosen over time. It literally took me 6 minutes to assemble the chair, and I agree with others that the directions could be better to show the orientation for the arm rests. When I sat in it for the first time I was amazed. The chair is super comfortable, and fits my medium build just perfectly. The padding of the chair is great. Not too soft, not too hard. The seat bottom has a small well/depression close to the seat back, which anchors me in the chair as if it was built for me. I noticed the bracket to mount the seat has slots for the bolts, so you can position the seat bottom forward or backwards slightly to accommodate the length of your thighs. While it‚Äôs only about 1/2‚Äù worth of adjustment, it‚Äôs nice to have a little adjustability. The casters glide smoothly, and the chair swivels effortlessly. I was concerned that the immovable lumbar support wouldn‚Äôt match my physique, but the mesh back is super comfortable and the lower back support is right where it needs to be. The mesh back also keeps my back from sweating, and since I‚Äôm in the seat for 8 hours a day, this is a great feature. As others have noted, the arm rests are too low to rest my elbows on when typing, but that‚Äôs a sniggle I can live with considering how much this chair does right, along with the price point. I‚Äôve only had the chair for a week now, so the longevity/ quality of the chair is yet to be determined, with my main concern being if the padding in the chair will not lose it‚Äôs cushioning over time, and that the mesh seat back wont stretch over time and lose it‚Äôs elasticity. For now, I couldn‚Äôt be happier with this chair!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful chairs', 'author': 'Deb', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My wife and I bought two of these chairs for our kitchen table where we have most of our meals.We absolutely love these chairs. They're the most comfortable chairs we've ever had. Here's why we chose these to be the chairs for around our kitchen table: Beyond the comfort, these are the selection criteria we had: (1) contemporary, clean styling in grey and white colors (2) Ergonomic comfort (3) roller / caster wheels so we have flexibility to move around while sitting in our chairs (4) height-leveling lever to easily raise or lower the height of the chair seat, reclining, etc. for whoever is using each chair (5) lumbar support (6) swivel-chair feature (7) Super comfortable seating (8) Easy assembly of the chairs. These chairs have them all ! !I wasn't sure how my wife would like an ergonomic chair in the kitchen with those features just like a quality office chair has, but we're both thrilled with these chairs for both their comfort and looks. Guests that have used these chairs here at our kitchen table also love them -- we've gotten many, many unsolicited compliments. In that some of the chair's design features are like those of a high- quality desk or office chair and not of a typical traditional chair that you'd normally find at a kitchen table, I was not sure when I ordered them whether my wife would like them as dining table chairs, and how they would look in a kitchen/dining area setting. Well, we are more than overjoyed with these at our kitchen table !! And beyond the comfort, they give our kitchen the clean, fresh, contemporary look in modern white and grey that we wanted. The table we have them paired with is a contemporary, rectangular, glass dining table, 51 inches high, and with white oak wood-grain legs. (We ordered our table separately from a different Amazon seller - (Tankgula).", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for Moderate use.', 'author': 'Jessica', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I've had this chair for 2 years and it's finally giving out. The plate is no longer straight and I need a new one. I used this chair during the worst of covid. While my hours didn't see me in this chair constantly I used it for more that work. At least 5+ hours every day including weekends but not all at once. I also admit that I'm a heavy girl. So 200 pound every day and it lasted 2 years.The back support was also well placed and appreciated. I'm a short person though roughly 5'3 so for a tall person it may not be in the best place for you. The cushion also lased thought out the 2 years. I did consider getting an extra cushion but when staying in the chair for only a moderate amount of time it was not necessary. I would definitely recommend this to people who need a chair cheap but won't be in it constantly.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars It feels great.', 'author': 'Max Tasby', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I love this desk chair / vary comfortable', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: JHK Leather Office Chair with Flip Up Arms, Executive High Back Big and Tall Desk Chairs with Ergonomic Lumbar Support, Adjustable Height,Wheels, Soft Padded, Cream
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the Cost', 'author': 'LabLover', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Chair arrived a week ahead of stated arrival date, which was a positive. Carton showed no signs of damage, and components inside were in excellent shape. Hardware was blister-packed, and the supplied Allen wrench was a bonus in assembly. Metal components are in gauges that will stand the test of time, and assembly was straight-forward, with clear and easy to follow instructions. Everything aligned, and though the claim is that the chair can be assembled in 20 minutes, plan on the better part of an hour. This isn't a negative, just a reality. Each fastener has a lock-tite type material applied, and seating the fasteners by hand will take a bit of time. All parts aligned, and assembly was straight-forward. We found that on attaching the back, loosely starting the top fasteners, and then swinging the back pad rearward made locating the second attachement holes much easier than the books recommendation of doing the lower fittings, first. The chair is attractive in color and design, wide in the seat, supportive on the back, and the padded armrests help when typing. We are book authors, so 'fit' and comfort are very important for long stretches of writing. To loosen the tilt on the back, have someone seated in the chair, and a second person to reach under and rotate the tension assembly. The tension knob is very tight, and a firm grip is needed to turn it, however, it works wonderfully. Now, we'll see how the fabric holds up. PU leather is not, of course, the same as 'hide' leather, but a manufactured leather product. Overall, we are pleased with this chair.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good looking well padded chair with easy assembly', 'author': 'hollie white', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've always had one of those gaming chairs for my desk chair - they don't last, so this time I wanted to try something different. Found this chair for 99.00 and it's a really good deal. The back isn't as high as I'm used to, but if I scooch down about a half inch - it's comfortable to lay my head back on (I'm 5'3).It's really well padded and very comfortable from the start. It's a good width that I can sit crossed-leg comfortable and wide enough for me to flip up one arm and play whatever guitar I want.This is a pretty chair - not a bright white, more of a soft cream or beige. The stitching looks to be even and strong. This is definitely a buy!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good quality', 'author': 'Neidyibarra', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Comfortable, size is good easy to assemble nothing was damage when received, only thing I didn't like is that the chair doest‚Äôt recline.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars love it', 'author': 'Tiffany L', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I needed a new office chair after my old one (16+ yrs old) died/stopped raising up. For home office use. Just showed up today; I assembled on my own (gasp, hubby is shocked-I usually make him assemble everything). Took 45 minutes with 2 cats helping me...they like the box it came in. Unlike an IKEA manual, this instruction manual came with words, numbers, clear diagrams, and super easy steps to follow. Non-crappy-Allen wrench included (can you tell I dislike IKEA? lol-shh, don't tell hubby, he's Swedish). The chair is exactly as I had hoped. Comfortable and looks nice in my little office nook. Nice cushioning. Arm rests pull up, not sure if I'll need that but whatever. Hope it lasts. I was worried it wouldn't roll easily on my carpet, was contemplating getting a plastic floor thingy--but it rolls easily. Fair price, I don't care if it was cheaper at one point. Worth it IMO.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good Value', 'author': 'DJC', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'A very sturdy and comfortable chair. Very pleased at how fast it arrived. Several days ahead of the stated eta. Very good value for the money. I liked how well the chair was packed. I liked that the assembly instructions were clear and and easy to understand pictures included. Parts were well protected for shipping. Fairly easy to assemble by myself, approximately 45 minutes from start to finish. Have been using it for 3 days now. Much superior to the chair it replaced. Would definitely consider this company again. Thank you.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent value', 'author': 'Kelly K.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I got this chair to replace a super cheap task chair in my home office. My old chair's seat had gone completely flat, and I was miserable. I wanted to upgrade but spend as little as possible. I am so pleased with this chair! It looks great - more expensive than it is. I love the flip-up armrests. Most of all, I find it very comfortable. There is plenty of padding in the seat, back, and lumbar. I especially love the high back. I'm 5'6 with a long torso, and it comes up to the base of my head, so I can rest my neck in that spot nicely. Highly recommend for chairs at this price point.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Okay chair', 'author': 'A Mitchell', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'this chair is OKAY for the price. I will be adding an extra cushion on days I work from home. I don\'t think the chair will be comfortable if you are working more than a few hours from home. It was easy to assemble. The lumbar support is non existent.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome chair', 'author': 'Imran Khan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a very easy to assemble chair as all the parts are labelled. title: ùëØùë∂ùë¥ùë¨ ùë∂ùë≠ùë≠ùë∞ùë™ùë¨ ùë™ùëØùë®ùë∞ùëπ, Ergonomic Mesh Desk Chair, High Back Computer Chair- Adjustable Headrest with Flip-Up Arms, Lumbar Support, Swivel Executive Task Chair (Modern, Black)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Versatile, Comfortable Chair with Excellent Customer Service', 'author': 'Liz Lee', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Overall:- Adjustments include: armrests, tension, reclining angle, lumbar support, height, and different angles/heights for the headrest.- Assembled alone in under an hour, back-up hardware included as a thoughtful touch.- Two right-armrests does not make a chair, but great customer service helps make that right.Rating: 4.75/5 for some small stipulations of quality.Appearance: It‚Äôs simple and attractive without too many bells and whistles, perhaps the protruding bar of the headrest feels a bit odd though that may just be my preference.Assembly: This is something that most people would be able to put together themselves within an hour or so; the necessary hardware is all laid out into a small package (a photo of which some others have included) clearly labeled with letters and designations that line up with the instructional booklet. Said instructional booklet also has photos of the corresponding parts you‚Äôll need for each step, and kindly caps-locked warnings about sections where things might get a little wonky. It‚Äôs clear and easy to read, even with small grammatical errors here and there. (And this is coming from someone not very technically inclined.)Customer Service: I can speak to firsthand experience with the customer service team. I received two right armrests in my original package, I reached out to the included email about getting me a left-armrest and they got back to me within around 24-hours. If I remember this was near the Easter weekend as well, and yet the response was still timely. They got my shipping information, reconfirmed that I did have two right armrests through photo, and then sent out a tracking number for my missing part. Aside from that, there‚Äôs still a five year warranty in play that comes with the chair, and I‚Äôm willing to believe they‚Äôll honor it based on my interaction with them thusfar.Comfort and Ergonomics: Like I mentioned in my brief bullet-points, there‚Äôs a number of different adjustments that can be made to the chair itself. They‚Äôre thoughtful and considerate. Perhaps not as expansive as everyone would need, though more than enough for my purposes. The cushion on both the armrests and the chair bottom itself is plush and comfortable. I think the material of the cushions, being leather, is a bit less breathable than the mesh back-rest, but the plushness makes up for that and it‚Äôs nothing that a blanket can‚Äôt fix. I didn‚Äôt think I‚Äôd like the headrest, being of a shorter height (a few inches over five feet) I expected that it‚Äôd be too high for me to even use. Surprisingly, it does adjust low enough that I can comfortably use it in a wide range of positions, and the transfer from angles happens naturally. I used the chair for hours on end, and I couldn‚Äôt complain about it at the end of the day, as opposed to others, so it passes my checks for comfort.Value: At the full price point, there are a few small quips that I think leave it as a four out of five for me. In one of my photos, you can see a protruding metal part, that is meant to be where one of the screws for the headrest should go, and it should be built flush into the plastic, not at a place where it might jab into my back or neck with a bit too much leaning, and a thin mesh film separate. I used a slightly longer screw (one of the spares for a different part) and it held the headrest tight, or else it would have wobbled with the intended screw. Where the headrest sits for me, I don‚Äôt anticipate it being an issue since there‚Äôs two layers of protection, though it‚Äôs not the best vouch of quality control. I tested the wheels on both wood floor and the carpet of my office. Maybe it‚Äôs because they‚Äôre new, but it moves a bit like that odd-cart in a grocery store that has a tendency to drift. Aside from that, the lumbar support feels a bit flimsy, given that it is only a piece of plastic, but it has made me more conscious of my own posture. In general, all the adjustments that you can make all have this feeling of being a bit, loosey-goosey. The armchairs flip up, and they stay, though there‚Äôs something about the motion that doesn‚Äôt quite have a full clickiness that gives me the sense they‚Äôre secure and will stay that way for long. Likewise changing your reclining angle and tilt feels a bit odd even though the lock itself seems secure. The metal and leather portions of the chair feel well-made though, and I appreciate that.Again, I think that the few quirks of my experience mean I might have considered this chair, an overall, 4.75 rather than outright 5, though there‚Äôs a lot of things that the chair and the company behind it are doing well, so I‚Äôm rounding up. So, remembering my email conversation I had with them the previous year, I figured I was out of warranty and the worst thing they could tell me was they couldn‚Äôt help me, I decided to contact them again.I was shocked when they replied to me the next and gave me great news. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A Game-Changer for Comfort and Style!', 'author': 'GnomeHome', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the Efomao Desk Office Chair, and it has truly exceeded my expectations in every way possible. I have a Secret Lab Titan XL 2020 chair, wife wanted an upgrade for hers but didn\'t think the Secret Lab chairs are worth what they charge, so she wanted to buy this one. This char is big - plenty wide enough for a large person and still be very comfortable. I\'ve included pics with measurements so you can get a feel for the size of it compared to whatever you\'ve got now. The seller offers optional upgraded wheels and a shorter lifter, and we decided to go with that. We have used the roller-blade style wheels in the past on other chairs and knew they were a solid upgrade. The shorter lifter offsets the added height of the better wheels. Wifey is only 5\'3", so I wanted to make sure the chair was low enough to remain comfortable. As seen in pics, height is about 20" at lowest and 22.5" at highest (keep in mind this is with those roller-blade wheels and shorter lifter, NOT stock out-of-the-box). The metal bracket that connects the back to the bottom is very thick steel and heavy - no concerns with durability there. It has 5-legs which is good to prevent any tipping, the legs are steel not plastic and seem well made. The main underseat bracket that the stem inserts into is also steel and seems like it will hold-up long term. Wife says the added pillow is very nice and great for additional lumbar support. She said even though it\'s not real leather, the material is nice - it does not feel cheap or plasticky. She also commented the arms are great as well - padded and they feel durable when you lift yourself out of the chair. Since the arms have a V shape bracket, they do not have any wobble and feel very solid. Seller\'s customer service is top-notch. When I reached out to them after purchase to inquire about the optional wheels & lifter, they responded very quickly and immediately shipped those items out. They were shipped from California, so I received them in just a few days, so I didn\'t have to wait long to assemble the chair. They also sent a follow-up email to make sure I received the parts and was able to assemble the chair with no issues. I would not hesitate to recommend this chair to anyone, it is a great value for the price and the great customer service is really the icing on the cake. I think we could have done without the leg rest, I don\'t think my wife will ever use that feature - they could probably save a few bucks making that an optional upgrade like the wheels & lifter. I\'d also love to see another model with a high-quality cloth like Secret Labs has instead of the imitation leather, but that\'s just my own personal preference.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Overall Satisfied', 'author': 'Maduhsun', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I saw this chair and what stood out first was the color. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exceptional Comfort and Ergonomics for the Home Office', 'author': 'Yoonsa', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I recently purchased the Home Office Chair for my teenage son, and I must say, it has been an outstanding addition to his study space. Very thick and feels high quality. Won‚Äôt make me sick of sitting after an hour like my other chair or hurt my tailbone.Highly recommend to those who need a high chair. Height is adjustable but the lowest setting is still high (about 23‚Äù from ground to top of seat cushion). As long as the height matches what you‚Äôre looking for, the features and quality are amazing.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars great chair', 'author': 'H Seldin', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Chair is very comfortable. One was the assembly of the /connection of the back to the seat. and the other was the cover plate to the head rest, covering the screws.it took some time to get the cover to snap in and lock.Assembling the rear seat to the back you will find it useful to install lower vertical screw first. This makes alignment easier. (see photo).Love the swing up armrests, chair now fits under desk properly.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars typical chair in its price range', 'author': 'Felicity', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have bought this class of chairs for a long time ($100~200 price range) and I find them extremely economical for the price. Do not be fooled, when I worked at (to not be named) office stores that sell staples, we stocked almost exactly the same chairs as our budget option, except usually for 1.5x or double the price. They are the exact same chairs, they use the same bolts and screws, and it's a huge waste of money to buy more expensive versions. Now, the higher price class (typicall skips to $400-600) is a better go to if you want a permanent chair, but even if you buy another one of these once a year, you have a new chair every year and that costs less. A more expensive one will likely last longer than that, however.It's easy to put together and exactly the same as other chairs in its class, and has the exact same steps, except this drafting chair has the little wheel at the bottom. I constantly rest my foot on the legs of the chair so I wanted something like this to be a little more comfortable; I may get some foam to put on it too.Overall, I always say with these: manage your expectations, and you won't be disappointed.The little gloves that come with it are waaaayyy too small though, and I have relatively small hands. They make good glasses cleaners though, loll", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars Good chair, headrest isn't as high as I need", 'author': 'C. Suri', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The chair is mostly easy to assemble - Aligning the arm brackets takes a little work. Quality is good & the instructions are also easy to follow.The only reason for me giving 4 stars instead of 5 is that the headrest doesn't raise as high as I need it to - I'm 6' tall & the headrest lands between my neck & the lower part of the head, even when raised (it only raises about an inch). So it doesn't support my head at all. It'll work fine if one is a couple of inches shorter.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

My desk is fairly high and the smaller version of this chair does adjust to a higher seating height.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Stylish looks! Nice lumbar support!', 'author': 'TX Girl', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I badly needed a new office chair after injuring my knee. The big thing for me is that the locking lever stays where you put it so I am not constantly putting the chair back up. I would definitely recommend this chair if you‚Äôre looking for an office chair at a reasonable price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "1.0 out of 5 stars Don't Do It", 'author': 'High Expectations', 'rating': 1, 'content': "Let this experience be a lesson to me... never, ever buy an office chair online again. As others have stated, the arms were not the same height. The back support was eh. The chair was otherwise comfy and looked great, so I was willing to put up with uneven arms and so-so back support. Also, the thought of returning it was not appealing.Fast forward to the second day I used the chair... I sat down and slowly sank down like I had sat in quicksand. The seat's hydraulic gas lift had failed. I contacted the seller who asked if I would try replacing the hydraulic. I figured I'd give it a try but once that hydraulic piece is in and has been sat on, good luck getting it out. I couldn't do it so I had no choice but to return the chair. And that's when the real fun began. Since I was unable to completely unassemble the chair, it wouldn't fit into the original box. In hindsight, I should have taken a saw to it but I digress. I took the chair to UPS and had them box it up, which cost me $27 and change. I was confident that Amazon's A to Z policy would ensure a refund of the UPS boxing costs, but I was wrong. My claim was denied and the seller refused to refund the UPS boxing costs. So... this fiasco wound up costing me $27+, and I have nothing to show for it except a few bucks added to the swear jar. And for those who are wondering, I am wayyyyy below the maximum weight limit for this chair.Simply put... don't do it. Just don't. If you receive a defective chair, returning it will not be easy and the seller will try to talk you out of it. For this item, buy local.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 7, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Get this chair', 'author': 'jwied', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Super impressed with this chair. title: OUTFINE Office Chair Executive Office Chair Desk Chair Computer Chair with Ergonomic Support Tilting Function Upholstered in Bonded Leather Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Chair - Review of Materials and Assembly', 'author': 'CP', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'First, as always YMMV, because this type of chair is made in China and anything can cause issues, but this is my review after assembly and first days of use. So, I am only reviewing the materials and assembly at this point.MATERIALS: The build of this chair is quite good. All parts are heavy cast metal. The cushions are heavily padded, firm and strong, and the leather is of good quality (altho just starting using).ASSEMBLY: This chair is similar to most others, first the base is assembled and the wheels attached. I highly recommend that you discard the included wheels and spend about $25 on AMZ to get roller-blade style wheels, much easier to move around and less damage to flooring. I really liked that they included a \'spare parts\' section to the screw packaging insert. Most all suppliers give you an extra screw and other spares, but they mix with the normal section. One thing ... this manufacturer includes a basic "L" hex wrench, but another one (SIHOO) includes a T-handle wrench that makes it so much easier to work with. As it happens, I also just bought a SIHOO chair for another work-space and had the T-handle wrench around to use (apparently they all use the same size hex screws). I was able to assemble in less than 30 minutes total. The only challenging step was attaching the back cushion. As noted in the instructions, the manner to attach the back cushion is that you lay it flat on the seat, and then attached the top screws on the back cushion. Then, you swing it up (pivoting on the top screws that you loosely attached) and then insert and attached the bottom screws on the back cushion. The issue is that the back cushion is so bulky from padding that it may not easily fit into place. The trick is that the side armrests must be very loosely attached, to allow the bottom of the back cushion to fit into place. THEN AND ONLY THEN you actually tighten all of the screws for armrests and the top screws of the back cushion. Do that, and its easy!NOTE: As this is a chair for big folks (altho nicely rated at 400lbs capacity) you may decide to buy and use one of the available heavy/max capacity lift cylinders, which AMZ has many. I had bought the one that is rated as 1000lbs, and was a 5.5 inch model (vs. 4.7 inch model). In considering to use it during the assembly, I immediately noticed that it sat in the wheel base much higher, so the resulting seat position would be about 4 inches higher, even at lowest seat position. My spidey senses cautioned me that with the seat being much higher, the amount of the lift cylinder would be much smaller in the wheel base. Thinking this thru, that would possibly result in much more torque and stress on the length of the cylinder between the base and the seat cushion base. I opted to just go with the 400lb included lift cylinder. In the end, that was the best decision as even using the included lift cylinder, I had to lower the chair to sit at correct height at my standard work desk. First time that has ever happened, actually - prolly because the seat cushion is very padded and you will sit up higher just because of that. (Can only imagine with the bigger one, would be too high even at lowest setting.)CONCLUSION: High quality build materials, relatively easy to assemble, and sits nicely. Highly recommend.[END]', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy and comfortable', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Easy to assemble, sturdy and comfortable. Well worth it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice, comfortable chair', 'author': 'valria small', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I ordered this chair to replace one that I had for about 20 years. It came promptly, and I set about to assemble it the same day which I don't usually do. The directions were straight forward, although I did get mixed up with which screws to use at the onset. The wrench that came with the hardware was a little too small, could have been a little larger and the iinset screws were a little difficult to screw at first. Also, the coaster were a bit hard to snap into the legs, I was afraid of damaging them at first. But at the end of it all, the chair was well worth all of that effort. I sat down in it and it was sooo comfortable that I fell asleep. It is a good, sturdy chair, well worth the time and the money spent.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable chair, affordable price!', 'author': 'Dana', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Purchased this chair for my home office - I work remotely so sitting majority of the work day takes a tool on my back and legs. This chair is so comfortable and offers great support! Chair rotates 360, goes up and down, and arm rests are in the perfect spot. For the price, this chair exceeded my expectations. Also, was easy to assemble and all parts needed came in the package. I would recommend purchasing this product - thank you!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars As Advertised', 'author': 'Robert Ponte', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Solid, quality materials. Very comfortable, and good-looking. It took about 15 to 20 minutes to assemble.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great chair', 'author': 'Micheal Hoffmann', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Extremely comfortable and easy to set up', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best for large people over 6ft and 200lbs.', 'author': 'Brett Hutton', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I\'m 5\'9" and 187lbs and at it\'s lowest setting, my feet just fit flat on the floor...and I have fairly long legs. Leaning back isn\'t super easy either on it\'s softest setting as I\'m not heavy enough.That said, I\'m happy with the chair, looks great, is comfortable and was easy to assemble.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable', 'author': 'Shannbannxo', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Love this chair it's so comfy and great for working at home", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Clear instructions- well built - easy to assemble', 'author': 'Steve', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I just completed assembling this chair myself. What a joy it is to have clearly written and well illustrated instructions, and a product designed to be strong and easy to assemble. Packing was superb!! Notable assembly steps: Step 8 - I mistakenly aligned the LOWER holes of the backrest with the upper holes of the armrests. It‚Äôs easy to do if you don‚Äôt pay close attention. I didn't obviously. I discovered it when I tried to do Step 10. So, for Step 8 make sure you align the UPPER holes of the backrest with the upper holes of the armrests. Hopefully this helps you avoid my mistake. It was easy to redo Step 8. This will be clear once you study the instructions. Don‚Äôt let this intimidate you.The most difficult part was step 10 - aligning the holes for securing the back rest on the lower holes of the armrest. It took some effort to get the holes aligned so the screws would go in smoothly. A second pair of hands would have simplified it. Not a big deal really.I will update my review sometime in the future. FWIW I‚Äôm 5‚Äô11‚Äù, 248lbs. My hope is, that the seat cushion doesn‚Äôt degrade over time. At the moment I‚Äôm sitting in the chair tilted back with my legs resting on the side of my bed. I wish the head rest was a little higher. At this moment I highly recommend this chair.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I Love This Chair!', 'author': 'Michelle P, Brunswick, Ohio', 'rating': 5, 'content': "So happy I ordered this chair! What a great product. It's real leather, not the fake kind! It took me less than a half hour to assemble it. I sat on the floor to do it and all worked out very well. I am a 59 year old female.They include the Allen wrench and all hardware plus a few extra pieces. I read on an earlier review to READ THE DIRECTIONS FIRST, That always works better when assembling anything. Do not totally tighten the screws for the seat and sides until you have the seat back in place and screwed in. Then you can tighten all of the chair screws.I purchased this chair not only for the great price but because of the features. I am a large woman and need something not only sturdy but comfortable as well. The seat back is adjustable so you can select which position is best for you as well as the seat height. I personally like that the chair arms run all the way down to the seat for added durability and support when getting out of the chair. I am very pleased with my purchase!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

I would recommend anyone to buy this.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars A little disappointing', 'author': 'Anthony', 'rating': 3, 'content': "The chair is good quality and easy to put together but the lumbar support causes me to sit too far forward or lean way back if I want my back to hit the backrest. I've had to put a pillow above the lumbar support to just give me back support.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great value', 'author': 'Rakesh Patel', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I use this product for office work at my desk all day. It provides amazing support and is very sturdy and high quality. I would highly recommend this chair to anyone who does office work.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Spend your hard earned money elsewhere', 'author': 'Richard', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'It shipped quickly and is easy to assemble; however, nobody looks for that when buying an office chair that advertises ergonomic comfort and lumbar support.There is NO lumbar support. In fact, it\'s positioned to destroy posture. A quick search on Google will show so many different kinds of proper lumbar support and this chair does NOT come with one. I had to find out the hard way when I kept shifting around and realized that my back felt strained after a couple hours of sitting (I work 8 hours a day at the desk, never felt this type of discomfort in any chair).The issue is that the lumbar support sits way too low (I\'m 5\' 8\'\' for reference) and forces you to slide down in your seat and lean back to get it in the proper position (right above the small on your back). However, that is also improper sitting posture and will cause issues/pain. The lumbar support is not adjustable, so I took it off completely, just to find out that there is hard plastic that your spine will touch unless the lumbar support is there.You may be wondering, "Why don\'t you just return it and buy another?" and you\'re absolutely correct. I sit for long periods at a time, all the time, so a good chair is a necessity. But it infuriates me that a company advertises keywords like "lumbar support" when in actuality, the design team did absolutely NO RESEARCH on what proper lumbar support even is.Save your time and spend your money elsewhere. Not even worth trying out. No lumbar support is better than improper lumbar support!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Bang for your Buck!', 'author': 'Karla Lucie Garcia', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was looking everywhere for the perfect chair (Amazon and IKEA) and this product really proved itself to be the best. The cushion on the seat and back support allows sitting down for long hours feel amazing. The assembly for the chair was easier than expected, came with picture instructions and video. The neck rest is my favorite feature given you can raise them up or down if needed. Would definitely recommend', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Chair', 'author': 'Octavia', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This chair is a very good product, i used to have trouble with my back hurting due to non ergonomic chairs, but since buying this chair that problem has been solved. this is a game changer literally, i play lots of video games and i am able to play hours on end with no pain.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Big and Tall 400lbs Office Chair- Adjustable Lumbar Support Heavy Duty Metal Base Quiet Rubber Wheels High Back Large Executive Computer Desk Chair, Ergonomic Design for Back Pain, Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfy for big butts and hips!', 'author': 'Anonymous V', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It took me just under an hour to assemble by myself. I‚Äôm your average female, not someone who puts things together like this very often and I have long nails - didn‚Äôt break a nail and had no trouble with instructions. You get the tool and all the bolts needed and the assembly instructions are excellent. I have wide fat hips and a fat butt and I fit so comfortably in this chair. Usually office chairs squeeze me but this one does not. I am not even close to the weight limit on this chair so it feels very sturdy. It rolls amazingly smoothly on these rubber casters. Very smooth swivel. Arm height is not adjustable though so if that‚Äôs important to you, this may not be for you. For me they are just fine because I type all day and my elbows can rest lightly on these. I am 5‚Äô7‚Äù and sitting in the chair at the lowest seat height, my feet can sit flat on the floor and my knees are bent at probably 85 degrees. I do use a foot rest to keep my feet propped up for circulation reasons so this height is great. For someone taller you could adjust the height but if you‚Äôre shorter than 5‚Äô7‚Äù you might have dangly legs. I especially love the front part of the seat being able to touch the backs of my knees, and that‚Äôs because there‚Äôs enough depth to accommodate my big bottom. Most office chairs I end up far forward because the depth isn‚Äôt made for a larger person. And the seat width is great as well, I have very wide hips and there‚Äôs no pinching. The seat back is high enough that if I let my head rest on it there is still an inch of chair back above the top of my head. I like the faux leather material (I chose the ivory color) and hope it holds up well, time will tell. I work from home 3 days a week so we will see how it goes. If I remember I will write an update after I‚Äôve used the chair for a bit.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very comfortable chair for TALL big people', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'UPDATE: I\'ve been using the chair for about 6 weeks now and it\'s great. I\'ve kind of settled into it a bit, so it\'s conforming to my body better but hasn\'t lost any support. Very comfortable for long days, no pain at all. All the bolts seem tight and nothing is showing any immediate wear. I anticipate this chair being perfect for my WFH desk job for a long time.It\'s day 1 with this chair, so I\'ll update my review later if my impressions change, but here\'s what I\'ve noticed:First: This chair is comfortable. The seat is as padded as it looks in the picture, the back holds you at a good angle and is comfy to lean back against. The chair rocks easily with just enough degrees of motion to be comfortable without making you feel like you\'ll fall backwards. It\'s cozy but not hot to sit on. Overall, it feels great.Something to note: This chair is for TALL people. I am 5\'10" and even I have to scoot back a little bit when I sit in this chair. It sits high from the floor even at the lowest setting. The good news about that is you\'ll never have to worry about sinking when the hydraulic fails someday. For most tall people, the lowest setting is still perfectly fine. I personally cannot imagine using the highest setting.The cushion at the front does its job of supporting my legs, but it also is the reason I have to scoot a little bit to get all the way in!The rubber castors are absolutely silent and roll extremely easily. It does seem like they also add to the height a little bit, so perhaps this could be changed if you didn\'t want to sit so high.Construction of the chair was mostly very simple. The one thing I\'ll note is that when they say not to screw in the bolts all the way until you get everything lined up, they mean it! If you tighten everything all the way as you go, you\'ll find the last two bolts at the bottom of the back of the chair impossible to line up. Give it some breathing room until you get all the bolts partially in.Here\'s another caveat for anyone it applies to - I love this chair, but if I could change one thing, I wish the arms were another inch further apart. The seat itself is 23" wide, but the arms are bolted close-in so they are only 22" wide. This is mostly fine, but I am a big woman with very wide hips, so my thighs press into the arms a bit. This is NOT painful - I feel fine - but I worry about eventually pushing the bolts out where the arms are attached.So I\'d recommend this chair for anyone who can comfortably sit in chairs of 22" width, and are between the heights of 5\'8" and 6\'4". The weight capacity feels correct. For reference, I am 350 pounds with my weight carried mostly in my hips. If your weight is in your stomach you\'ll be slightly more comfortable than a pear-shaped person but ultimately I think it\'s fine either way.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 31, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Office Chair - Adjustable Lumbar Support Heavy Duty Metal Base', 'author': 'Sparkle', 'rating': 4, 'content': "So this is an early review. I purchase the chair last week and was told it would come between January 11-17th; came early January 8th, so big plus.Now for the assembly part. READING IS KEY but don't be like me, i thought common sense could apply here. I end up looking for a video and couldn't find one, so I end up reading it but still missed a key point.I followed the instruction to a T and it was easy to assembly. I'm 5'6 and tiny-ish weigh about 145lbs. I am no Hercules, and I hate manual labor (for certain things) but it took me 30-35mins to assembly. BUT then i saw the key info that states i need another person assistance, but I did it without. Wasn't hard by any means necessary. The instructions provided was clear to follow and is the key in successfully putting the chair together.Please Note: it was heavy, from the box to the item itself but I needed a new chair now and now! The chair is super comfy, and I mean getting a warm hug kind of hug from the person you love the most comfy.The recline of the chair is ON POINT, baby this rocks like a good rocking chair! Startle me on a few occasion. The lumbar support is not the greatest but i think has to do with my weight and height, remember this chair is built for specific height etc. Nonetheless i still got it. BUT IT WORKS.My only faults with this product is the spring coil; its wayyyyyyyyyyyyy too LOW! If i could get a replacement to make the chair higher I would be most grateful. Its way too low at its highest point.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great deal', 'author': 'Alexander B.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very happy with the chair. Great quality and value. Installation was pretty easy for one person and it came with extra parts in case you lose or need some in the future. It also came with 2 different sets of wheels, so you can pick the one that you like. It is also pretty large and comfy. My daughter keeps climbing on it to go take a nap!!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Breaks down after use', 'author': 'Waylon', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Update:Hamaoka support reached out to me and has resolved my issue. I am very satisfied with the support from them and making this process and smooth as possible! I am no longer upset about my purchase! Thank you for the communication.First off:Chair is comfy, wide enough to fit a 6'3 260lbs man comfortably. Arm rests are supportive, however they are fixed, this can mess with your desk height. The riser on the chair I wish was higher, my knees do not sit at a 90 degree angle as this is short.After 8 months of use, this chair is falling apart to an extent. The chair leans to the right a significant amount, about 2 inches, when measured with the arm rests under my desk. It is not ergonmimic at all. This is a great chair for executives who can lounge, but the person who is sat in it for 8hrs a day, it does not support your lower, mid or upper back. Also the lever to adjust height is extremely bendable metal, as this is advertised as a heavy duty chair, it is incredibly weak and bends after daily use of the chair, which in turn causes the chair (when it a locked upright position) to recline slightly backwards. This is HORRBILE for your back and neck and you are no longer sitting up straight and in an ergonomic position.TLDR: Chair is great and comfy and big enough. Wish the riser was taller as this is advertised as big and tall, and over time the adjustment lever bends, and chair leans to the right which makes this ergonomically terrible. If you are spending this type of money on a chair, just buy a standing desk or a herman miller or some chair that has better ergonomics.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfy and sturdy', 'author': 'STEPHANIE J', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This chair was easy to put together. Could be done alone, but goes quicker with two people. It is very well padded and comfortable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Hydraulic stopped working', 'author': 'Jonas', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'The chair was great at first, and I had no issues. It is super comfortable. However, the hydraulic stop working about six months and I do not feel it was due to damage. The chair says it can hold up to 400 pounds and I do not weigh that amount. Pretty upset as I can‚Äôt get a refund or help even though, it hasn‚Äôt even been a year yet', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 2nd Office Chair', 'author': 'MJ Jackson', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I loved the first chair that I had bought about a year ago that I bought a second one. Now I have one in basement to play video games with the Hubbs and now one for my office. Easy to put together I have put both of them together by myself. This is a very comfortable chair and it definitely holds up. Once my husband's chair goes out will be buying a third one.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars 1 day only', 'author': 'ROBERT E ALLEN', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Getting the back attached to the seat is a pain in the you-know-what. Day 1 it was great. On day 2 I heard a metal-on-metal sound and the chair no longer rocked. It was pushing me forward in an awkward position that made it uncomfortable. I reached out to the company and they asked if I adjusted the knob...duh of course I did. I twisted it all the way in both directions and nothing...it is broken. The next day, I heard a snap, and the chair broke. It is now out at the curb waiting for the trash man to pick it up with the garbage. It was great for 1 day only.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Well Built Chair But had to Return', 'author': 'Burleson', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'My brother had ordered the same chair so I had a chance to sit in it prior to my chair being delivered. It seemed like a very sturdy well built chair. Wheels were great, seat was comfortable except when sitting back on the chair, my feet would not touch the floor. I needed the heavier built chair for my weight but I am short, so not very tall. Not being able to sit and not have my feet touch the floor was not an option for me. When my chair was delivered, I returned it un-opened. The company was very good at accepting my return and refunded my entire amount of purchase.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

Was also packaged very well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Hurts Tailbone after 1 hour', 'author': 'Jean Rivera-Ortiz', 'rating': 3, 'content': "The weight capacity of the chair is stated to be 450lbs. I weigh 400 lbs and have had the chair for several months without any stability issues; however, there is not enough cushioning. I can only do about 1 hour of typing before I my tailbone is filled with pain and discomfort. This chair did not cause pain in my spine like my previous new chair crom Amazon did, but the tailbone pain unbearable, and it appeared immediately after the first hour of use. There are two office chairs at my job that I have sit in for 8 hours; neither one of them causes the tailbone pain, so it is not entirely my weight causing the discomfort. I woud have returned the chair if it wasn't a hassle to ship it, but I held onto it. I have to find a chair cushion and lumbar support to sit in this chair, because using only a chair cushion rises you enough that built-in lumber support no longer aligns with spine, regardless of what height you set it. I have tried several cushions and none have helped with the tailbone pain. I am probably going to have buy cushion that $60+, meaning I should have just spent more money on a chair. The headrest on this chair is practically useless, as is mounted far too back to support your neck unless you tilt all the way back. It is a nice chair, and may possibly function well for smaller people, but unfortunately it doesn't provide enough comfort for me. 1 hour of sitting before discomfort is not ideal.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice and Sturdy!', 'author': 'NeteruPrincess', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This chair is holding a vivacious 6'4 330 pound man. Love this chair.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Slightly too firm and hard to assemble fairly good chair.', 'author': 'LouC', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'As stated the seat is a little harder then I like but it is not horribly bad. The arms swing up and fully out of the way letting me play guitar comfortably as well as push the chair all the way into the desk. title: NEO CHAIR Office Desk Computer Gaming Chair with Executive Ergonomic Lumbar Back Support Flip-up Padded Armrest Adjustable Height and Wheels for Home or Office (Black)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars comfortable and functional chair', 'author': 'Tim', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is the chair I have been looking for. It's comfortable and not expensive. It has a streamline-designed chair back, so it seems to be good for my back. When seated, I feel a little flexible, forth and back, and I like it. Height adjustment is also good. It wasn't too difficult to assemble it. And the armrests can be raised, the flip-up function is really convenient for me. When I sit down and play the guitar, I can raise one armrest so I can stay in a comfortable position for a long time. I took a picture because this function suits me. For those who need these features, this chair would be one of the best for you. It's not big but suits me. I can feel it wrapping around my waist. The quality is good compared to the price. I love the chair and highly recommend it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 15, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing!', 'author': 'Sam Sun', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This was one of the best purchases I‚Äôve made this year! My last chair was too bulky and it got really hot to use so I was in the market for a mesh chair like this. I really like that the arms go up because I like to keep my chair very high/tall and without the arms, it would not fit under my desk. It looks really neat! reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good chair for the price', 'author': 'Kathy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Took me 35 minutes to assemble as a not-so-handy person. Instructions were clear. It looks nice too, I chose the gray color, and it\'s not too intrusive. The height and tilt are easily adjustable.With 2 exceptions, the assembly was fairly easy and I am a moderately mechanical person.First assembly issue: I couldn\'t locate any "front" mark on the armrests as the instructions indicated. So you should orient the more square-looking part of each armrest towards the same direction as the "front" sticker which is on the bottom of the seat cushion.Second assembly issue: The "wrench" tool which comes in the packet of parts won\'t easily work when you\'re trying to attach the backrest to the seat cushion in Step 5. There just isn\'t enough room to turn that "wrench" to tighten the screws because the mesh of the backrest and the crossbar of the backrest both get in the way. What the manufacturer should have included was a 3/16 Allen wrench to tighten those two screws. I used my own Allen wrench tool to good effect.Those two assembly issues were fairly minor and I would have rated the "Easy To Assemble" category a 4.5 if that had been an option.All in all, this under $100 chair was a good bargain and I\'m happy with my purchase.
