Awful.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Looks Comfy But Starts to Hurt After Prolonged seating', 'author': 'Neves2k9', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'With its sleek, professional design and breathable black mesh material, the Flysky ergonomic desk chair seemed like the perfect solution for my home office setup. However, while initially comfortable, the lack of adjustable lumbar support led to back pain issues whenever I worked for longer periods of time.At first, the comfort was undeniable. The seat cushion provides a responsive yet firm padding that maintains its structure well. And the smooth, breathable mesh kept me cool even when working intensely on demanding projects for a couple hours. I appreciated the ample padding on the armrests as well - they provided a welcome spot to rest my elbows.However, right around the 2-3 hour mark of sitting is when the back pain would start to creep up. Without a back component that truly contoured to my spine‚Äôs natural S-shape, the chair forced poor posture after prolonged sitting. The integrated lumbar cushion was too thin and small to provide any real lower spinal relief either.While suitable for very short term sitting sessions, I‚Äôd hesitate to recommend the Flysky chair for anyone who needs to work from their home desk for multiple focused hours. The complete lack of back height, tilt tension, and lumbar adjustment made it increasingly uncomfortable to maintain neutral postural alignment. Any temporary relief I‚Äôd feel from initially sitting would slowly tighten into soreness and nagging lower back pain later on.For anyone seeking out an affordable, stylish chair primarily for temporary use, the Flysky model should meet expectations. But if you require seat support conducive to long work stretches without back discomfort, I suggest considering other ergonomic chairs with more customizable spinal alignment features first. This became increasingly clear each time I stood up from the Flysky chair after an extended sitting session only to be greeted by back tension and stiffness rather than comfort.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable Chair!', 'author': 'Barb', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have been thru a couple of more chairs before I found this one. I changed to this chair and it has helped my hip not ache so much as I am in my chair almost 10 hours of my day. Very Happy with my purchase!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars not as comfortable as hoped', 'author': 'Angela Tippell', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'not so easy to adjust, either goes right up or right down, you need to fiddle with itoverall comfort not great', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what was needed', 'author': 'Mommy of Petey', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was tired of having leather chairs that would start peeling eventually. Arms are very adjustable in a lot of ways, and has actual quality cushioning. Seat fabric also seems quite nice and less likely to break and fray. (It looks fine without the headrest, just treat it as a bonus.)", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Chair for the Price', 'author': 'R M', 'rating': 5, 'content': "TLDR: Great chair for the price, highly recommend a few DIY fixes when assembling however.I have used the chair for the last three months, and can say for the price it's definitely a great chair. For about $130-$160 the chair has a lot of great features. The lumbar support is really nice and easy to adjust, the headrest is really good, the recline is easy to use and locks very nicely, the backrest feels really good and has not gotten loose on me, and the arm rests have a lot adjustability. I've known others who use chairs that are around $300-$500 and they say they actually prefer this one over theirs.There are a couple of problems I've had though. The seat can get uncomfortable, so I personally use a thin firm cushion that helps me sit in the chair for hours at a time. The recline on the chair is nice, however the adjustment for the force to sit back in the chair a bit more is quite difficult to use, and is not very intuitive on which direction is for strengthening the force for sitting back more, or lightening the load of it. The arm rests do have a fair bit of adjustability, however they do feel a bit too firm, and can cause some discomfort to my elbows at times. I do think adding a little bit extra padding from factory wouldn't add to the cost of manufacturing the chair very much, and if that is the case I would personally like some more padding in the arm rests.It's quite simple to assemble compared to other chairs I've had, however there are a few DIY fixes I highly recommend when assembling it. First, the cover that goes over where the chair legs and hydraulic lift for raising and lowering the chair meets will rattle a lot when moving the chair. What I did was use the foam from shipping, and cut a shape that will go on the underside of the cover so it does not rattle anymore. Second, after a month or so, I noticed a screw that had fallen off the chair, and the chair would creek a lot. When taking a look I noticed all the screws had backed out a considerable amount, and some were almost about to fall off as well. I ended up redoing all the screws with blue Loctite, and ever since all the screws have been firmly in place on the chair.Overall, even with a few complaints, the chair is definitely pretty good, and is great when factoring in the price. I highly recommend it if you're looking for an office chair in this price point.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Gambled and I won! Rather uncomfortable unless you purchase a back cushion and a butt cushion separately (which I did). The mesh on the chair digs into your legs if you're wearing shorts, but after the butt cushion, I don't notice it. The back support is a little silly, but again, if you buy a cushion, you'll be fine.What I hate the most about this chair is that the arm rests are in a fixed position and are in no way adjustable; you can't raise or lower the height on them whatsoever. Thankfully, I have a desk that sits pretty high, so I just rest my arms on the desk when I work. But I could see this feature being extremely annoying to someone who doesn't have the kind of desk I have. I also find myself leaning back and going to rest my arms on where the arm rest should be, only to nearly fall out of my chair because the arm rest sits so low (almost on the same level as the cushion). Why in the world would a company design a chair with arm rests so low? Or with arm rests you can't adjust? Ugh. At least it reclines/goes back a little when you lean back.Assembly was pretty easy. Only prob I have is probably some setting I have screwd up, when I play wz3 the screen blurs when I turn (ps5)', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Chair comes ready to set up with everything you need right out the box ! Great leather feel and so comfortable!! Buy it !', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars This chair was poorly drilled for assembly and does not come together easily at all.', 'author': 'Rhonda J Huffman', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'My chair is still sitting in pieces on the floor, after making a new attempt each day for three days. The bottom (metal) comes together very easily, and it took me about ten minutes for all of it, if that. The top and seat of the chair are then held together by only the arms of the chair, by four screws, two on each side (I am not optimistic about the durability of these four screws holding a back on a chair as someone moves around and puts their weight against it to begin with. The next problem is that the four holes that attach the arms and thus hold the entire upper chair together are very poorly drilled. I tried putting the screws in the holes with the hand tool they provide and a drill, and they don\'t want to go in. I tried just putting the screw in the hole to see if I was getting a bad angle, but they really don\'t want to go in the hole without the arm between it. They seem to have been generally drilled very haphazardly, and if you don\'t get the exact angle, it doesn\'t go in. If you do get the right angle, and the pieces shift (which they almost always will, especially if you\'re working by yourself, as you are holding together two weighty pieces that are secured in no way, until those screws get started, then you won\'t be able to get the screw in; and you\'ll have to pull it back and find the passage again. On top of that, because the screw holes are drilled how they are, it is very easy, much easier than getting it in the socket, to get the screw to go off at an angle and just screw into the padding of the chair. I have been working on this upper for over two hours, and I\'ve gotten one screw in (loosely, so I can still move the pieces); and I\'m frankly beginning to worry that the pressure of wrestling with the chair over and over to get in the other three (or just the next one) is going to end up snapping it off on the socket.The chair shows it being able to recline and adjust a few inches, but I really see nothing on the chair that could possibly make this possible (unless their photographing the slow progress of the chair back breaking off, because it\'s only held by four screws that don\'t want to find the socket with a map and a local guide). This chair will most likely be renamed by me to be "That time I paid $50 to take something to the trash room", because without paying someone to do it, I don\'t think I will ever be able to get it together.I watched the video. It doesn\'t work. I read the reviews that said it was easy to put together, and their suggestions didn\'t work (and I\'m wondering if they were paid now). I would return it, but after having worked in an office for years and having put together numerous desk chairs, I was sure it would be no issue and threw out the box and shipping materials. I guess, it is mine now. My millstone.To grant the star I gave it, if the pieces went together, which they don\'t, it would be a nice looking chair. It would be roomy. The padding seems comfortable. But it doesn\'t. It lays on the floor in pieces.If you ever ask why a chair costs so much less than the others, there is a reason.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Cheap but you knew', 'author': 'kaylee Conner', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Cheap and affordable. Only got it yesterday.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Hbada Office Chair, Desk Chair with Flip-Up Armrests and Saddle Cushion, Ergonomic Office Chair with S-Shaped Backrest, Swivel, Mesh, for Home and Office, Beige
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very pleased', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I am a writer, and I took a full-time work from home job two years ago. I love working from home, but I have struggled to get an office set-up that is comfortable for the long hours I now spend at one desk (average of 50 hours per week for my employer and another 20 or so for my own writing). I solved most of the problems, except the chair. I\'ve tried several from the big box office supply store, but they were big and bulky and the arms interfered with my desk setup -- forcing me to sit too far back. Then I tried a couple of chairs sold by home furniture stores (because they didn\'t have arms) but they each caused a lot of aches and pains because they weren\'t really ergonomic, or meant to be used for such long hours.I was hesitant to buy something online, but I\'m glad I found this one. I don\'t write many reviews, but I really recommend this chair highly.The biggest feature for me was the ability to move the arms up or down, and work from the chair in either position -- because I move between a corner desk (where I don\'t want to use arms, for the most ergonomic position) and a laptop desk behind me (where I DO want to use arms for the most ergonomic position). This design factor primary helps to save space when the chair isn\'t in use -- but it allows me to use the same chair comfortably for both my corner desk and my laptop desk.I am using the chair on a hardwood surface, and the casters work perfectly there. I was worried it would be too slippy (a problem with the first office chair I tried), but they are perfect: easy to roll when I want to roll but immobile otherwise.The quality of the construction seems very high to me, and the chair was very easy to assemble. The pieces were carefully packed, the instructions were OK (the photo illustrations are too small to give enough detail, but the design is very intuitive so that wasn\'t a problem), the company provides an email address for support (which I didn\'t need to use, but which I appreciate having when assembly is required). The casters seem like they will be the first place the chair begins to show wear and tear. All the other parts of the chair seem like they will be sturdy and long lasting.It feels both comfortable and solid to sit in, and so far the back/hip/neck pain I was experiencing in the evenings with my old home-decor chair have resolved.I purchased the white model, which looks a little more "homey" than the all black, more corporate looking chair. I am very, very pleased with this purchase. I am actually tempted to buy a second one just to have in reserve, in case anything happens to this one! It\'s been such a long search for a chair that works!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 30, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great chair for the price', 'author': 'Melanie Sukh', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I do a lot of quilting and was looking for a chair that was comfortable and not cost prohibative. This is the one. not only does it look great, it was very easy to assemble. I'm 63 years old so no longer able to manipulate heavy items. I was able to assemble it myself easily within 20 minutes by following the simple instructions. All the parts were clearly labled and the necessary tools were included too.Pros:Very comfy - I used to have shoulder pain due to poor ergonomics, that's a thing of the past. The seat is comfy and the height is easy to adjust. Most importantly, the chair doesn't shift up or down. Also, the foldable arms are a real plus for getting in close to my work.Easy to assemble- see above.Looks great - have a distinct Star Wars vibe (I got the white and black version), which I like. Goes with just about any decor.Cons:I would have liked to have freeze-in-place wheels to stop the chair from unwanted scooting while I'm working. However, most chairs on the market don't have this feature (I looked!).Overall, I highly recommend this chair.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Budget desk chair', 'author': "jessica o'brien", 'rating': 4, 'content': 'For the price I paid, I can‚Äôt complain too much. I like the look of the chair and the pad is comfortable to sit on. My only complaint is the chair back has very little bend and it sometimes gets uncomfortable to sit in. I appreciate that the arms raise up and that it was easy to assemble. If you‚Äôre serious about your desk chair this probably isn‚Äôt the best option but for someone who doesn‚Äôt sit for 8 continuous hours it does the job.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wobbly. Otherwise would recommend.', 'author': 'Sumayyah', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I don\'t normally review products but I thought I would this one because I was heavily reliant on others\' reviews + I didn\'t see anyone else mention problems with "wobliness".People are right when they say it\'s great for the price because it does feel like an overall good quality chair in its sturdiness, look, capabilities, and functionality (smooth roll, arm chair movement, comfort of cushion) however there is a pretty big setback in my opinion with the wobbliness, especially since it\'s not something I can seem to fix with any set of tools. The steel piece that hooks into the plastic base itself comes together so there is no fixing that. I am someone who cannot stand a shaky table to chair even when i go out to eat so maybe I am more sensitive to this issue than others who are not but I thought I\'d put it out there. I have attempted to contact HBADA but it went straight to voicemail. I am seriously considering returning this item and ordering another (especially because it came in a damaged box) because if it were not for this issue I would highly recommend this purchase. I will update this post if/when I receive a new chair.**UPDATE**I requested an exchange and received a new box (that was in great condition when it arrived, unlike the original box). Assembled new chair, which was admittedly more difficult but this one was so much better! No wobbling + somehow in this short window I received an updated chair that no longer has the unsightly yellow buttons people have been complaining about quire a bit in the review section but now a white shade that actually matches the rest of the body! I am very happy with this chair. It rolls smoothly, is very comfortable, study arm rest that is a huge bonus to have the option to adjust at any height... I would highly recommend this chair to any of my friends, especially for the price. It looks and feels a lot more expensive than it is actually priced at. Thank you Amazon for the effortless exchange and thank you HBADA for the great product!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 25, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Legitimately the worst office chair I have ever purchased.', 'author': 'Katy Rucker', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'In the week that I‚Äôve had this chair assembled, there have been 3 separate instances where the legs have randomly detached from the base and I have been thrown aggressively to the ground, battling said office chair for my life as I go down.It‚Äôs a design flaw really, I‚Äôm what I can only assume was an effort to save space for painting purposes, two of the legs have to be clicked into place upon assembly. But they don‚Äôt click. So as I happily wheel around at my desk they slowly wiggle out of place until I eventually shift in just the right way, leading to my quite literal downfall.Save your tailbone the bruises and pick a different chair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars One year plus review', 'author': 'SCB', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I‚Äôve had this chair for nearly a year and a half now and while I don‚Äôt regret the purchase there are some negatives to the chair.First the good. I purchased the chair on sale but even at $149 current price tag I believe the chair is worth the price. Well constructed easy to assemble and for the most part has held up for over a year and a half of use. The chair is also largely comfortable although I have added a seat cushion as the seat bottom is very firm.The bad. Some of the plugs to cover the screw and bolt holes don‚Äôt fit well and a poorly made I wound up having to glue a few of them in place. The biggest problem I have with the chair is that it rocks From the front right corner to the rear left corner. Although it is designed to rock back-and-forth to allow you to recline some, this is an a forward and backward reclining motion but one more the chair is loose enough due to the construction that the seat will pivot between those two corners. This is due in part to the left handle also serving as the pin to lock the chair in place to keep it from reclining or rocking. To make matters worse when it rocks from corner to corner the chair pops midway through and recently a piece broke somewhere in that assembly. The chair still functions and is still very sturdy but I am going to have to break down and buy a better chair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 30, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars perfect desk chair', 'author': 'westshore', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Comfortable, movable arms, easy height adjustment, love the color, and best of all not too hard to assemble. Glad we bought it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Not as comfy as it costs', 'author': 'Charlotte', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'This chair seems like a really good deal and I have to say, I was really taken in by the aesthetic. It\'s just pretty. As pretty in person as it is in the photo. Tips back fairly well (once you figure out how to use the lever appropriately). Good size for shorter to low-average-height women. Wouldn\'t work as well for average-to-tall women and definitely wouldn\'t be as comfy for a tall man. Slips under an average height desk very easily even with the arms down. Arms come up nicely if needed, but I find they\'re actually at a good heigh for me and don\'t often put them up. Seat is a little smaller than I thought since I usually like to cross my legs in a chair, although it can still be done. If that were it, I\'d really be very happy with the chair and probably give it 4 or even 5 stars.Unfortunately, there are 3 major drawbacks that have been a big disappointment (even after just 3 months\' use):1) it seems comfy when you first sit down but it doesn\'t stay comfortable over time. I study for hours at a time and after a couple hours my butt is hurting and I need to switch chairs. My husband\'s chair (only a little more expensive than this one) stays comfortable allllll day long and I would have gotten his if it went with my decor... (I know, vanity definitely won here and I kind of regret it...).2) it makes these loud disconcerting clunking noises even with regular use. Like, I swivel a little to the side and "CLUNK!" We made sure everything was tighened and affixed appropriately but... it still happens. Definitely annoying and makes me feel like the chair is about to give out... even though it generally seems quite sturdy.3) sometimes it feels lopsided (?!). I find that if I swivel it around about 90-180 degrees it\'s better, but if I swivel it back it\'s lopsided again. Haven\'t figured out what that\'s about but it\'s really uncomfortable and annoying.Overall... if you plan to use it occasionally or even 1-2 hours a day and want something cute and low profile, go for this. If you study a LOT or work from home all day... this chair will sorely disappoint you (and if you\'re like me, you\'ll wind up stealing your husband\'s chair sometimes...)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 10, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great chair for the price - easy to assemble - perfect for short folks', 'author': 'FJ', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I rarely write reviews but I wanted to do so in this case because my experience, having two of them, contradicted many of the reviews I read. Both chairs, purchased several years apart, were easy to assemble. It\'s fairly intuitive. I would just say make sure you know which part of the seat is the front and which is the back, when you put on the arms and back of the chair. The bottom of the chair is labeled so that you will know which is which, B/F. I have seen pictures in the reviews where the back was not put on correctly limiting the seat size.I had no problem either time installing the wheels. They are installed like any wheels you might add to a rolling cart or Rubbermaid storage drawers. This time I upgraded the wheels to "Office Chair Wheels Replacement,(Set of 5) 3\'\' Rollerblade Wheels Smooth Rolling Heavy Duty Casters Safe for All Floors Including Hardwood - Universal Stem 7/16 Inch, White" by LPHY so that I could have all white wheels. No problem. I can confirm that 11mm wheels worked for me. Based on reviews I purchased both 10mm (which I couldn\'t get in white) and 11mm. I returned the 10mm. They were way too small. Beware that using rollerblade wheels will raise the height of the chair approx another inch. So if you are short like me and need a very low chair, I would advise against making that change. My feet still touch the floor with the replacement wheels on. I\'m 5\' 2". I use the chair on a hardwood and find there is a slight disadvantage to the rollerblade wheels - sometimes the chair starts to drift. It\'s not a big deal for me and I think it\'s worth it for the all white look. I doubt it would happen if I were using the chair on a carpet.If you are short, like to the point where co-workers get a but of a fright when they sit in the chair you previously used in the conference, I think you will be very happy with this chair. Looking at other chairs, I think this chair has the lowest starting height when using the wheels that come with it.The chair does rock back, although not much. Normal position is 90 degrees. I think it goes back to 120. Works for me. You can only lock it at 90 degrees. If the chair won\'t go back, pull out the level on the right side. Push it back in to lock at 90 degrees.The one problem I had with the original chair, which was black and white, was that eventually the gas lift, the thing that makes it go up and down, started to sink. I contacted the company and sent me a replacement that I received quickly. It toook me forever to get around to replacing it and when I did I didn\'t have the right tools and made the mistake of using a hammer to get the wheel base off first. I was then unable to get remove the original lift out of the chair base. Lesson learned. But I had always had my eye on the beige chair, which wasn\'t available when I made my first purchase, because it better matched my office color scheme. So I gave up on trying to replace the lift and treated myself to a new chair in the color I wanted and with all white wheels!I will just add that if you need a lot of lumbar support, this chair might not work for you. The support is just the mesh on the back of the chair. That works for me. You might need a lumbar pillow or a different chair.I also haven\'t had trouble with the cushion and I am carrying more weight that I should be, to put it mildly. Once I got the wheels off the original chair I couldn\'t use it so I had to revert to my previous office chair while waiting for the new one to come. It only took a couple of days but it make me realize how comfortable the design of this chair was for me. The seat of that chair curved up on the sides and I was uncomfortable after seating in it for any length of time. With this chair the seat is wide enough so that there is extra cushion on each side of my butt but more importanly I can sit with my legs slightly out to the side without any impediment, which is how I tend to site.I\'ve seen pictures of damanged chairs in the reviews and wondered what the hell are these people doing in these chairs. Granted I don\'t use mine all day, except during the pandemic, and I don\'t have any kids at home. I am keeping the original chair for extra part just in case.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Chair is OK but safety concern for the legs', 'author': 'NGC1990', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The 2 legs of chair are inserts, and don't co.e pre-attached. The legs are coming off and they don't snap in place permanently.The chair overall is good. Sitting cushion is good but you'll feel chair is a bit short in terms of hand support. I am medium and 5'8 and feel like chair is a bit small for me. I feels it's more like a stool.Update: Contacted the seller and they acknowledged the issue.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful and easy assembly', 'author': 'Shannon', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Just what I was looking for after a long search I am so glad I went with this chair. We will see how durable to cushioning is on it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My new favorite chair.', 'author': 'wins_lord', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is an amazing chair. It is ONE of the most comfortable chairs I have ever rested my butt on. And I‚Äôm talking out of all chairs I have seaten - my house has furnitures like Roche Bobois and Fendi, but honestly... this is an unbelievable steal for the price.It looks very elegant and flawless, as long as you‚Äôre not picky into the littlest details. I am a perfectionist and I do see some very minor flaws in the chrome finishes, but nothing major or visible unless your eyes are an inch away.It does lean back a little, but it‚Äôs not adjustable or anything. It only leans if your body weight pushes it back. I spent more than an hour comparing this chair to other similar chairs on Amazon and I think this is the best.First, the side arm rests are actually there. There are a lot of similar chairs with useless arm rests. You want padding! Second, it‚Äôs an actual all white chair, not white in front but black in the back.And if you must know, it‚Äôs not like pure pure white. It‚Äôs really hard to get a super pure white material, but it‚Äôs white enough.I‚Äôm pretty big and I fit fine in this new favorite chair of mine, but if you‚Äôre like super wide it might be somewhat tight.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 26, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for at-home desk', 'author': 'Kelley H.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this chair for my home office and I love it! Not only is it aesthetically pleasing but it functions really well. I love that it rolls smoothly, it‚Äôs super comfortable, the height is adjustable, and it hasn‚Äôt caused me any back pain. I use this chair several hours a day.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Large scratch', 'author': 'Jessica Byrdy', 'rating': 1, 'content': "The chair is beautiful and comfortable. It came in a large amazon box and as soon as I cut the tape all of the pieces fell out of the box without any kind of other packaging or protective plastic. Just a bunch of heavy jumbled parts. It's no wonder one of the armrests had a huge, deep scratch in it. Thankfully, we don't use the armrests anyway. I did reach out for replacement arm rests or partial refund - no one got back to me.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Okay-ish chair but uncomfortable back', 'author': 'Prakhar Goel', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Overall, this chair was mostly fine with one serious problem: the back isn't well supported. It looks like a solid back but it's just a metal frame with fabric and elastic in the interior of the back. When I lean back into the chair, the back just gives way (see second picture). My last chair had a continuous board in the very back so that the back padding compressed against something sturdy. This chair just seems to have an elastic band buried in there. Even worse, I can feel it when I lean back. Another minor gripe is that the chair felt a bit small but that could just be that I'm used to somewhat oversized chairs and I like to sit cross-legged in the chair sometime.Other than that, the chair was fine. It arrived on time and undamaged. The packaging was reasonable and assembly was quick. There were some minor imperfections (first and third pictures) but nothing serious. Disassembly was a bit of a PITA but that's not really the manufacturer's fault.It looks pretty nice. Too bad it doesn't feel that nice.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars BROKE DOWN UNDER HALF A YEAR', 'author': 'AmitKilo - KiloWorks', 'rating': 5, 'content': '- The part which holds the seat, made out of metal, literally bent away, making the chair totally useless, you would be able to lean back and fall.- The seat cover material just scraped down in like 3 months and literally just started to leave flakes of fake leather each time someone would sit on it- No answer from support when I tried to contact for helpBEWARE of this product', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good first impressions', 'author': 'Matt B.', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I have had plenty of office chairs. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I love this chair! Most comfortable chair ever', 'author': 'CherDe', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is the absolute best chair I‚Äôve ever owned. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Really fun buy!', 'author': 'Lisa', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I went back-and-forth on this chair. Its nice and big so more space for me to throw my laundry when im not ready to fold it :P', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars extremely comfy', 'author': 'Kara', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I‚Äôm in love with this chair. It‚Äôs extremely comfy and I can sit for long periods of time without any back pain. It‚Äôs easy to move around despite having no wheels. I have a plastic chair mat under my desk and it slides across it easily when I need to move it out of the way. I love the height of this chair as well. I am 4‚Äô11 and most chairs even at their lowest setting my feet don‚Äôt fully reach the floor comfortably. Usually my legs are leaned forward or on my toes a bit. However this chair at its lowest setting I can perfectly reach the floor and knees are at the comfiest 90 degree angle.SETUP: The chair was fairly easy to put together. Thankfully I read the reviews or I would‚Äôve been extremely frustrated. The instructions for this are literally 4 steps that make it seem super easy. It is but not because of the instructions. Another reviewer left a video review and said it‚Äôs easier to put together if you swap steps 4 and 3 so you can line up the holes on the back with the bottom easier. This is 100% true so thanks for that reviewer!!! I‚Äôll add on - you have to put the back and bottom together at kind of a weird angle to get the holes to line up and start with the back holes first! I can‚Äôt even really describe the angle but it feels really wrong. Almost like a wider angle than you think it should ever go. The back of the chair isn‚Äôt a 90 degree angle it tilts back a bit. If you can find the angle you‚Äôll get the screws in with very little issue. I put this together by myself in about 5 minutes and 4 of those minutes were figuring out the angle for the back of the chair.CONS: I only have one con really. To me, it‚Äôs not a huge deal because of the overall comfort and price of this chair. But something worth mentioning.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect even with color difference', 'author': 'Molly', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I got the blue color, and it wasn‚Äôt quite the same dusty blue but I have zero complaints. Buy it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Quite solid, not the worst for assembly', 'author': 'Matthew', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Chair foam is quite firm. Not quite what I was looking for, but perfectly serviceable. Has that new-plastic smell that I'm not fond of, but hopefully that will go away with time and use. Packaged very well for shipping. I don't care about the lack of wheels since my office area is stuck with carpet.That said, for a 4-step assembly, it was absolutely an annoying 4-step assembly. Here's what I ended up doing to put this chair together:1: remove packaging from everything, locate page of instructions.2: follow instructions as-is to put the base on; realize that the backrest section isn't lining up nicely. Remove base section. Look at prior reviews for advice.3: Struggle for a good 7 minutes or so to find the Perfect Angle to get the backrest section on. Ended up dry-fitting the front-facing two screws before managing to get the back-facing two in; screw in the back-facing two as far as possible, then remove the front-facing screws in order to get the base section wedged in underneath as per instructions.4: finally get all the screws dry-fitted and partially screwed in, so I can tighten everything up and actually use the chair.As a final note, I'm a bit disappointed that this chair uses a gas cylinder instead of something mechanical. The gas always eventually leaks out, leaving the chair to slowly deflate. I'm hoping (knock on wood) that that doesn't happen any time soon, but I'm anticipating that this chair will need to be replaced in a few years between the cushions wearing out and the cylinder giving way.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars First Impression', 'author': 'Eisblume', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I just set mine up and I think it might be love at first sit. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A very comfortable and versatile office chair. and supports my lower back well.', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "When looking for an office chair online, pictures are all you have to go on. So I looked at many different models available and also at the dimensions and the weight they could take, and in the end it led me to buy this model. While considering this one, I really liked the looks and it seemed to be very well constructed and I also liked that it offered different colors, most did not. There were others ones similar to it and even a little cheaper, but after considering for some time I decided to purchase this one. When i received it in it's box, it was heavy. Laying out the pieces and the instructions to assemble, i began to put it together. It came with the tool to tighten all the bolts and assembly went smoothly, maybe 20 minutes and i had my new office chair. It is very comfortable, sturdy and seems strong enough to last. My previous couple of chairs had the fake leather and they both continued to peel and I determined to stay away from those this time. I like the mesh backing and the seat cushion is quite comfortable. title: COLAMY Leather Executive Office Chair- High Back Home Computer Desk Chair with Padded Flip-up Arms, Adjustable Tilt Lock, Swivel Rolling Ergonomic Chair for Adult Working Study, Brown
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable and stylish', 'author': 'izabell derose', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is an excellent chair! Very comfortable and I love that arms can be pulled up and chair tucked under the desk. Some say hard to put the back rest on, I did it myself with no assistance by laying the chair on its side . Don‚Äôt tighten arm rests all the way until you can position the back rest.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good price for a nice chair', 'author': 'ED', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Good instructions and comfortable, real nice chair. We are really pleassd with the chair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars For the money it's a solid purchase, not fantastic but it works.", 'author': 'Alexander Langella', 'rating': 4, 'content': "So the chair was actually kind of difficult to put together when it came to getting the bolts into the back. It's definitely designed for 2 people to make it a bit easier, as I had to wrap my hand around both the back rest and the bottom to squeeze the two together to get the bolts in. Two bolts felt like they had stripped, but upon further twisting, they eventually locked into their final position (I'm guessing this is where some of the complaints about stripping come from, they just didn't twist far enough in...it's really surprising how deep the actual bolts go in, and how many turns it takes to finally settle them in).I will say the instructions were on a similar level to what La-Z-Boy provides, which is a nice touch. Easy to read, lots of solid details. They also came with a fair amount of extra parts, and the quality of the parts seemed decent. My only gripe is the plastic nubs to fit into the holes where the bolts go in, are not properly fitted, and most pop out on their own. It was very difficult to get them into place for the lower two sockets, and in attempting to force them into the upper holes where the moving armrest is ended up forcing me to use a small hammer, and I still couldn't get them to fit properly. Even swapping them out. I stopped trying as I ended up nicking the exterior slightly and did not feel like doing any extra exterior damage in a vain attempt. That said, they aren't really necessary. It looks fine with the holes around the movable armrest and the two bolts into the seat sealed off.The build quality is fairly decent. The exception seems to be the seat area. The sides and back of the seat have ample and adequate cushion and foam. However the center has almost nothing. I suppose this was a way to cut corners, and most large sized individuals tend to be thicker on the edges of their bums, rather than have more weight around the center, and most people will sit further back into the chair (were again, there is adequate cushioning). However once I move a little further into the center, as I tend to sit forward, that center cushion deflates really fast, and it's like sitting on a rock.The back support took some time to get used to. It's very thick foam in the lower back region, and it leans a bit backwards for what I'm used to (most of the chairs I buy are more straight backed). So it took a little time to get used to. It's not bad, but feels a bit off. I'm guessing this is designed to alleviate lower back pain, though it's a bit much, and pushes me forward, where when I lean forward into the seat, and given the angle of the seat's rear cushion, really pushes me into that center with limited cushioning. So I have to be very mindful of how I sit in this chair.I haven't had it long, so I'm not sure how well the foam will hold up. I had to replace a rather nice faux leather high back, but metal frame chair where the joint where the arm bolt is connected into the back is where some corners were cut (it's the width of the bolt itself, and of a lower grade material, not steel, so it broke with just a slight force application). This chair seems to be a bit more durable. However, it's plastic, with the only metal being the bolts and the screw holds meant to hold the thing together. So I'm not positive on longevity.The company that makes this chair is American, but its made in China. Though the quality is decent, and the thickness of the faux leather seems fairly solid, and difficult to rip or tear, though I'm not about to take a knife to it to properly test but some tugging and pulling indicates it will last awhile, even in dry weather.The rating itself is based on the price to quality. For what I paid, for what it is, it seems like a good purchase.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This Rocks', 'author': 'Sarah', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This chair was the easiest thing I have ever put together, and I did it alone, which is great since I had no one willing to help at the time!This chair is perfect for when I choose to game for a little bit of time, or a lot of time, for when I have a lot of typing to do, or even writing. The squishiness is just right, and I can lift the arms so they don't crash into my desk. I have accidentally spent close to seven hours in this chair and only struggled with my neck (because I do not look at my monitor properly, not because of this chair). Every time I use it, I am completely comfortable without feeling aches, stiffness, or numb butt/feet on the longer uses. Great buy! Worth the price, although I got it on sale at the time.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome chair', 'author': 'Sue', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is truly the most comfortable place to sit in my house! And it rocks back and forth real easily so I just put a ottoman at the bottom of it and I can lean back far enough to sleep in it if I want and it is certainly comfortable enough to sleep in! LOL it rolls really well and doesn't leave marks on the floor and I just don't think you can go wrong buying this chair or your office or for any other use that you want it for", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Well made, sturdy', 'author': 'W. Conner', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Comfortable office chair, seems sturdy. It came with extra screws (in case you lose one) and a handy hex wrench - nice touch! I would buy this chair again.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good comfortable chair', 'author': 'Chesslamb', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This chair is very comfortable. I like the appearance of it. I wanted a chair for my elderly mother to use at her computer desk that was easy to move or roll. This one does that. It was easily assembled for the most part. The only issue I had in putting it together was that it rolled too easily. I had to brace it against the box it came in while I was putting the arms on it. But that wasn't the chairs fault. The floor on which I was on while putting it together was a laminate floor that was very smooth which made the chair want to roll whenever I put the slightest pressure against it. Other than that it went together very smoothly. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great choice!', 'author': 'JamesN808', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'In looking for an office chair, I was looking for a mesh chair with a separate back support, headrest, and adjustable height armrests all at a low price (preferably near $100). Awesome chair, very comfortable", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good for the price', 'author': 'JLO', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Working from home half time and trying to find the best ergonomic set up for small space. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô3‚Äù and found the adjustable chair height good, but I believe my desk is too tall for proper ergonomics and I have to use a cushion to sit higher. I probably need to look for a new desk!! The back support is good if you sit all the way back but I tend to sit closer to front edge of chair to reach the keyboard as I am doing virtual meetings all day and typing on keyboard during most of my meetings. The support length under thigh is good although I wish the front end could be tilted up a little as it feels like it is sloping down a little and it might be due to not enough cushioning in front. The arm support is at good height for ergonomics but I tend not to use the arm rests as the height of my desk and level of arm rests don‚Äôt allow me to scoot chair in close enough due to my desk style. I do love being able to fold the arms up for storage when I‚Äôm not using it to make more space. I‚Äôm not sure if the chair is supposed to rock back or lean back but it took a lot of effort for me to make it lean back. My 6‚Äô tall husband sat in chair and says it was comfortable and he was able to rock the chair back and forth with no effort.Price was decent- I purchased during Black Friday sale.Easy to assemble, all parts included, no additional tools needed. My teenage son put it together quickly', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Found The Seat Cushion To Not Be Long Lasting', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I bought this chair November of 2022. At first, I was very happy with it, especially for the price. However, in less than 6 months it started feeling like sitting on a solid board. The rest of the chair is still nice, the back mesh is comfortable (I removed the supposed lumbar support because those never work for me anyway) and seems to fit my back just right, the arms are nothing special, but they\'re fine for my use and I mostly wanted them to flip up. But my back can\'t take sitting on a solid board, as I do working from home. Maybe that\'s what you get at this price point, and that\'s just that, I don\'t know. Maybe for more infrequent use and/or lighter people this is a fine chair and I\'m asking too much of it (if you believe what you read on the internet, you need to spend 10x as much for a top office chair).I note that the description says: After 100,000 experiments, the seat surface is durable for 10 years... And: Designed with a sturdy nylon base, this adjustable computer chair can support up to 300 lbs during 8 hours of continuous use. So, take that for what it\'s worth. "The seat surface"? Can support 300 lbs? Well, I guess. It hasn\'t broken, the seat covering seems fine. But, a 2x4 might also meet that description. I don\'t know if these claims are meant to apply to the seat cushion, but I have not found the cushion part of the seat to meet those claims.I wish I could be more positive about this chair because I really like it other than the seat being so hard, so fast. I\'d like to emphasize that I don\'t think this is a problem unique to this office chair, especially at this price. Just understand what you\'re paying and what you\'re getting. Maybe for a different use case than mine this is a good option. At any rate, that\'s the reason for my rating, I hoped I could use it more than half a year. I\'m 5\'7" 185 lbs.Update: I received a nice message from the Seller in response to my review, saying they want to help me with my experience and that it is possible to "purchase a cushion to improve your experience." I thought I should add that here, in case anyone else has the same experience and wants to try that.I would also like to add that I hope my review was clear. I did not mean to imply that I think the chair is defective or is a uniquely bad chair. It may be a fine chair for a different use case and I just wanted people to know that and temper expectations accordingly. Was my original two stars too harsh? I don\'t know, I guess that\'s for an individual to decide. Again, I used this chair working from home, 8 hours a day, plus personal use. I know it\'s common to eventually sink through seats of office chairs. Maybe if you use it less, maybe if you don\'t mind that feeling sinking throught the cushion and/or it doesn\'t bother your back, maybe it\'s a great chair. I did hope the chair would be useful to me for longer than 6 months, though, but I\'m raising the rating to three stars since the Seller reached out with an attempted solution. I appreciate the customer service. Personally, I\'ve moved on to a full mesh chair, hoping a mesh seat works better/longer for me. For what it\'s worth, had I written a review shortly after getting the chair, I may have also said 5 stars, great chair. I did think so. I just wish it lasted longer.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Supportive, light & Airy Office Chair.', 'author': 'Patricia Mace', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love this Aqua Office Chair. It fits all my needs. It was easy to put together and rolls easily on my rug or any hard surface. While I have trouble finding the lever, whenever I want to raise or lower the height, it is easy to do once your know where the lever is. (It is toward the back on the right side.) I love that the arm rests raise and lower to make getting in and out easy and you don't have to remove and store them like on my old luxury chair. Great chair", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars I Just Ordered A Second One', 'author': 'W. A. I don‚Äôt really care, but some may.I bought this for my office at home and the assembly was easy and the chair is sturdy.The chair is comfortable and the back support is heaven.Not only was I happy with it for my office, I had been looking for a new seat to practice guitar on for long amounts of time.With armrests that flip up and out of the way and adjustable height to get the guitar to sit just right on my lap, and the back support for posture, I bought a second one.So whether you‚Äôre rockin‚Äô your computer, or rockin‚Äô your Strat, this chair is awesome.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars 10x better than my old chair', 'author': 'Mika Carr', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'For the past two years I‚Äôve been sitting on a hard-as-a-rock chair at my desk so it was time for an upgrade. This chair was delivered a day earlier than expected. The instructions for installing it were easy to follow. I‚Äôm a woman and it took me about 45 minutes on my own. The allen wrench you need was included. It feels very sturdy and strong enough to hold my body weight. I haven‚Äôt sat in it yet for work but I‚Äôll update my review in a few months. I‚Äôd rate it a 4.5/5 stars. The only negative comments is that were a few scuff marks on the plastic part (see pictures with circled scuffs). The seat part is a bit small so if you have thicker legs as myself do it can get pushed against the sides of the chair since the sides curve upwards slightly so keep that in mindit can lean back pretty far into a comfortable position to lay and relax watching tv or youtube or etc.overall it depends on the person but for me its was well worth the price', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The Ultimate Gaming Throne: BestOffice Gaming Chair Delivers Comfort and Style', 'author': 'Shakti', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently upgraded my gaming setup with the BestOffice Gaming Chair in the striking blue color variant, and I must say that it has significantly enhanced my gaming experience. Yr old birthday present. He has never been happier. He loves the. footstool, but, I do not think that part is very comfortable. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô7‚Äù and to me, it just feels awkward the way it fits my legs but, that‚Äôs not to say I don‚Äôt use it when sitting in this chair. It is better than no stool, I just think it could be made to fit and be formed to legs lengths better. I want one to support my feet to. BUT, it‚Äôs a GREAT chair. 7 months later and many, many active, crazy, and excited 12 yr old boys not only gaming in it but a few occasions of it being used to sleep in for the night, and it still works, sits and looks brand new! I was a little leary on the quality and how long it would hold up for due to the price when comparing to similar chairs and most where $150 & up. But it‚Äôs been great. And if it was going to fall apart or tear up because of it being cheap quality (which. It obviously is not) believe me, my son, whom we refer to as ‚ÄúThe Destroying Monkey‚Äù (why we call him this-he doesn‚Äôt walk, it‚Äôs always jumping to smack ceilings and doorways, darts in and out, flips or flops on everything, yanks and tosses, the 1 to test ALL buttons, knobs, dials and all that moves, AND assembles and unassembles everything to see what‚Äôs inside, including the Thermostat on the wall @ 2. He can tear up even proven indestructible things, if you get the picture). He would have made it fall into pieces by now. He truly puts anything he sees, plays with, or sits on To the test of its quality and it‚Äôs limitations by throwing, tossing, using it for everything it was not intended for, flopping or laying sideways and upside down in or on it, and just being an overly curious, creative, imaginative wiggle worm and 12 yr old country boy. This is a chair I highly recommend i if you are looking for a good quality chair for a very reasonable price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 12, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars High quality gaming chair', 'author': 'Izaiah fields', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'This is one of the more expensive "gaming chairs", not the most expensive, but you can find some for about half the price. If you get it on sale, I would recommend it. Overall it is a very comfortable chair to sit in for a few hours of gaming. The reason I didn\'t give it 5 stars is that there are some areas with room for improvement: I like the footrest idea, but unless you are shorter than 5\'6", it really is not a great design. I am 6\' tall, and the footrest ends up at about mid-calf range, which is not the most comfortable, I still end up needing something to rest my feet on. The armrests could be a little wider, with a little more cushion, maybe a little more ergonomically designed for the gamer, especially if you\'re gaming with a controller. I do however like the idea of the hinge aspect of the armrests, so they move back with you when you recline. Another thing I noticed (mostly due to my height again), is the neck/head pillow height. I find when I am sitting in the chair, that pillow actually ends up at my shoulders, and I can adjust it to where I need it, but as soon as I move it falls back to it\'s normal resting place, and I have to readjust every time I sit back down, so a nice improvement would be to see multiple slots for mounting that to accommodate a wider range of gamers more comfortably. The vibrating lumbar support cushion is a nice touch, it can help a little bit if you\'re getting some tension in your lower back, but it produces quite a loud buzzing sound, so often I don\'t use it, because it\'s just too distracting. The seat cushion is my favorite part of the chair, it\'s actually very nice and easy to sit on for long periods. The seat always tends to be the problem part of a chair for me, it\'s hard to find one comfortable for me to spend any time in without soreness. The long flat cushion spreads out your weight nicely, so there are no pressure points like your tailbone or in your thighs that end up hurting due to excessive pressure on that area. So, all in all, it\'s a decent mid range gaming chair, room for improvement definitely, particularly if you\'re an above average height gamer, but mostly a good solid chair, that is worth the money if you can get it for less than full price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Falling apart in less then a year.', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My son hasn‚Äôt even had this chair a year and it‚Äôs falling apart. He weighs 75 lbs sooo‚Ä¶it‚Äôs not like it has a lot on it. All the seams where the material attaches has detached.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "1.0 out of 5 stars I'm not tall and it feels small and has sharp areas", 'author': 'Adam', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'I don\'t recommend.I\'ve previously had a gaming chair that was a bit taller than me when sitting in it, I\'m 5\'4", and if its kinda small for me it maybe really small for you. My feet do not touch the ground so its not short (my feet hang about an inch above the ground), but the structure feels somewhat small compared to another gamer chair I had before. Sitting fully upright and butt all the way back, I still have an inch of space before the seat touches the back of my calves, so the seat isn\'t that big too. Now what I do feel too wide is the arm rests, it would be nice if I could move them in more, and if I could adjust them down or up. It\'s tad bit too wide. When the footrest is inside the chair, it\'s upside down and the plastic is a little sharp, so may cut the back of your calves. The lower back-pad with vibrator is nice if using it for vibrator, but its a bit thick if not using it for vibrator, it may get annoying later. Also, the arm rests, underneath them is pretty sharp too.So basically, back-piece is a little short, seat is a little short, armrests are little wide and not adjustable, back-pad is a bit thick, and underneath the arm rests and foot rest is a bit sharp.Its not too bad, but not too good either. It was easy to install, and the wheels are tough to get in, they bit different than other wheels I seen. It is somewhat comfy seat, the back-pad with vibrator is a bit too thick though.This chair is one of the cheaper ones, but still expensive, around $100, so kind of disappointed and kind of expected. It\'s cheaper against the other chairs of its kind, but its not really cheap when you just think about the price.I\'ll probably spend $50 more and get a better chair next time. This chair is cheap compared to others like it, but its still expensive. This chair lacks customization of the features, and could work on smoothing out sharp areas of the chair that I think would make it better and probably 4/5 stars.Also, I think I\'d go with one without vibrator next time too, its nice but its very sturdy and thick, I miss regular cushion. I normally sit with legs somewhat spread apart, and its a bit uncomfortable with these side pieces towards the end of the seat. They a bit too tall and sturdy. It\'s not a bad chair, but could be a lot better. So I give this chair a 3/5.I changed my mind to 1/5, its just not comfortable anymore, the sides on the seat irritate my thighs. I wanted to see the padding, which is good but I noticed they removed all the zipper hangings probably because so many people checking and finding things wrong, so they removed all of them to make it difficult to check. The arm rest is sharp as well as the foot rest when its docked underneath the chair, the back of my calves brush against it. The massage pad I would go without one, its just too stiff and I hardly use it. It pushes you too far in the seat because too thick and I don\'t get to enjoy the headrest due to how thick the massage pad is. Sitting indian style in the chair is uncomfortable too, its just not wide enough and/or the side piece is too tall and sturdy, needs to be bent outwards more and not so pointy.Pictures are showing the sharp plastic underneath the arm rest and an arm can fit in between which is bad due to sharp plastic, the sharp plastic on the footrest, and zipper without zipper grips (they must have ripped them off, due to people inspecting the padding).I just got the chair 13 July, 2020, and already want to return it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 13, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Arrived Dirty but Beautiful Chair', 'author': 'MysticShan', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I bought this chair because I needed a new office chair for my apartment. I guess for the price one can‚Äôt complain toooo much. Pros: Looks nice. Easy to put together. Made decent, nothing falls apart. Adjusts easily. Cons: Made for a teen, I weigh about 125 pounds and I am 5‚Äô4 and my arse literally feels like it is hanging off the edge. Cushion is flimsy and thin. Doesn‚Äôt get very tall, at top height it was just at desk level. Let us just say, if you need a chair to sit in a spot just for a few minutes to look up something on Amazon, okay, but to work in? NO WAY. If you weigh more than 135-140, forget it. Teen? Yes buy. Make up mirror? Yes buy! Just sitting at a desk but never used? Yes buy. Guest chair for skinny guest to watch computer, while you look up Amazon yes buy. Want a kitchen desk chair? Yes buy! College student studying? Maybe, if you are a small man or female.Final words: This is not a chair to work in for more than an hour or your back will kill you, and you will die. Point made? If you are 150 lbs or more, buy two, one for each cheek. Get my drift? Good chair, nothing wrong with it, but ONLY useful for certain situations. 4 star for ease and looks. Really a 3 for overall performance, chair pad, and arse situation.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Not For The Office Only!', 'author': 'Roll With Soul üèçÔ∏è', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I purchased this chair to put in my storage shed so that I can work on my motorcycle. The thick plastic construction of this chair means that it should last for quite some time. The only thing I would complain about is that the wheels don‚Äôt lock, but for the price point, I can live with that! I put this chair together in less than 5 minutes and it even comes with a good Allen Wrench that I threw into my toolbox afterwards. At 6ft-250lbs., there‚Äôs no strain on the chair at all! It‚Äôs easy to raise and lower and the chair is solidly built. I highly recommend it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very Nice!!!', 'author': 'CuriousCat', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I didn't expect much of a chair at this price point, but thought I'd give it a try. title: Office Chair Computer Desk Chair PU Leather Swivel Executive Task Chair with Adjustable Height Lumbar Support Padded Flip Up Armrests Home Office Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable and supportive', 'author': 'Direwolf', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The chair requires some assembly, and if you're accustomed to flat box knock down furniture, it's easy. Not only do you get step by step instructions, they're illustrated showing the positions of the hardware. All the hardware is packed in separate bubbles, each marked with the unique ID number of the components so it's obvious what parts are needed for every step.The chair is inexpensive, and I was surprised at just how comfortable it was. The seat is well padded, and the back provides lumbar support just where it's needed. The height is adjustable with a lever operated hydraulic lift, and a large knob under the seat lets you adjust how much you can rock the seat back. The two armrests can be lifted. The seat rolls easily on 5 wheels.The only issue I had during assembly was unexpected. For shipping, a lot of the parts are stored inside the seat back. You remove those, and then zip up the chair cover. For me, that was the hardest part! There was a lot of tension on the zippers, and they aren't particularly smooth. The foldable armrests at 90¬∞ are a thoughtful addition, especially for those working in tight spaces.From a user-friendly perspective, the chair was straightforward to assemble, thanks to clear instructions. The built-in lumbar support and ergonomic design were immediately noticeable, providing comfort during prolonged periods of sitting.Performance-wise, the chair lives up to its ergonomic claims, supporting a healthy posture, which is essential for long work hours. The maximum capacity of 250lbs is also a testament to its sturdy build.When compared to other chairs in its category, this Brick Attic chair holds its own in terms of functionality and design. However, the actual user experience may vary depending on personal preferences for cushion firmness and back support.In terms of value for money, this chair seems to strike a balance between quality and cost, making it an attractive option for those seeking a blend of style, comfort, and durability without breaking the bank.The top positive aspects include its sleek design, user-friendly adjustments, and the quality of the PU leather. Nonetheless, potential improvements could be in providing more recline angles and perhaps enhancing the armrest padding for additional comfort.In summary, this chair is well-suited for anyone looking for a reliable office chair that supports good posture, offers adjustability, and has a modern aesthetic. It would be an appropriate choice for both home office users and professionals in a corporate setting.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Not sure‚Ä¶', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'The chair is comfortable, but after a short time of use is already leaning to one side. title: Home Office Chair Work Desk Chair Comfort Ergonomic Swivel Computer Chair, Breathable Mesh Desk Chair, Lumbar Support Task Chair with Wheels and Flip-up Arms and Adjustable Height
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great chair at an affordable price', 'author': 'Scott', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Started working from home recently so I needed a new office chair to replace my ancient one that until now was only used periodically. Did my research among the top reviewed options and went with this one due to the large flat seat (a lot of office chairs have curved seats, which seems good, but in reality often leads to poor posture and back pain). Another advantage this one has over other similar options is the ability to pull back the arm rests if desired, which is a nice option to have. Having color options was nice as well, I went with standard black, but folks who want their chairs to match a room or desk have that at their disposal.Item arrived in an impressively compact box and assembly was quick and easy. Instructions were straightforward, extra screws were included (not needed since everything was in perfect condition). Took maybe 20 minutes from unboxing to it being ready to use.The back of the chair is a little further back than I'm used to; while I was initially concerned about this it actually is a big plus since it encourages me to maintain a good posture as I'm working but also is comfortable when I went to lean back for a bit. Lastly we have a white cat so I had some mild concerns about my chair turning white, but several weeks in there's barely any hair on it, which is amazing considering how every other piece of furniture has that happen.Overall, extremely satisfied with this purchase several weeks in. The wide stable base provides opportunity to use plenty of different sitting positions for anyone like me that is fidgety. Compared to my old chair which left me feeling stiff after a day of working in it, I feel great at the end of the day. Highly recommended!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy and Comfy', 'author': 'Cassidy G.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Arrived quickly specially during Christmas time. The arms of the chair I think could be improved a little maybe some padding but it‚Äôs not uncomfortable. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very Sturdy', 'author': 'GetStitched', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This chair is quite sturdy. It is designed for people up to 400lbs. I installed it on my chair without any assistance but it would have been handy to have someone else there to hold one end of the cover in place while I was stretching the cover out to place the other end. The "notches" (for lack of a better word) where the zippers are, are there to clear where the arms of the chair attach to the seat of the chair. They need to be unzipped initially and zipped once you have the cover stretched over the top of the chair back and the front of the seat. There are ties near the front of the chair bottom to help take up any slack in the fabric along the sides and in front of the seat if there is any. I didn\'t really need them, as there was no slack in the fabric on my chair so I just tied them in a bow and tucked them under the cover.This chair cover does not come with covers for the arms of the chair - you will need to buy arm covers separately if you need them.This cover fit my high back "executive" office chair very nicely and restored the overall look of the chair to nice as new. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Ticova Ergonomic Office Chair - Comfortable Bliss on a Budget!', 'author': 'Isak', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Rating: ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è (5/5)As someone who spends long hours at a desk, finding the perfect office chair was a quest. Enter the Ticova Ergonomic Office Chair - a budget-friendly marvel that combines comfort and affordability like no other.Unparalleled Comfort: ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏èThe level of comfort this chair provides is simply outstanding. The breathable mesh back keeps me cool during extended work sessions, and the plush seat cushion feels like a dream.Adjustability Galore: ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏èCustomization is key, and the Ticova chair delivers in spades. Whether I'm reaching for documents or turning to grab a coffee, the chair moves with me, adding to the overall convenience.Easy Assembly: ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏èSetting up the Ticova chair was a breeze.
