Within no time, I was enjoying the comfort of my new favorite office chair.Stylish and Professional: ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏èThe Ticova chair doesn't just offer comfort; it looks good too. The sleek design and neutral color scheme add a touch of professionalism to my home office, making it a stylish addition to any workspace.In Conclusion:The Ticova Ergonomic Office Chair is a game-changer for those seeking comfort without breaking the bank. Its ergonomic features, quality build, and budget-friendly price tag make it a standout choice. Say goodbye to uncomfortable workdays and hello to affordable luxury with the Ticova chair. Your back will thank you! üí∫‚ú®", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Extremely good value for money', 'author': 'Todd', 'rating': 4, 'content': "For what I paid for the chair, and for any chair under $200, this thing is WAY higher quality than I expected. Arms are very adjustable in a lot of ways, and has actual quality cushioning. Seat fabric also seems quite nice and less likely to break and fray. Only downside is that it's really not for leaning back at all - when it's in the locked position, you really are pretty straight up. I also remove the headrest as it was pushing my neck too far forward, but I have neck problems, so don't go by me. (It looks fine without the headrest, just treat it as a bonus.)", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Chair for the Price', 'author': 'R M', 'rating': 5, 'content': "TLDR: Great chair for the price, highly recommend a few DIY fixes when assembling however.I have used the chair for the last three months, and can say for the price it's definitely a great chair. For about $130-$160 the chair has a lot of great features. The lumbar support is really nice and easy to adjust, the headrest is really good, the recline is easy to use and locks very nicely, the backrest feels really good and has not gotten loose on me, and the arm rests have a lot adjustability. I've known others who use chairs that are around $300-$500 and they say they actually prefer this one over theirs.There are a couple of problems I've had though. The seat can get uncomfortable, so I personally use a thin firm cushion that helps me sit in the chair for hours at a time. The recline on the chair is nice, however the adjustment for the force to sit back in the chair a bit more is quite difficult to use, and is not very intuitive on which direction is for strengthening the force for sitting back more, or lightening the load of it. The arm rests do have a fair bit of adjustability, however they do feel a bit too firm, and can cause some discomfort to my elbows at times. I do think adding a little bit extra padding from factory wouldn't add to the cost of manufacturing the chair very much, and if that is the case I would personally like some more padding in the arm rests.It's quite simple to assemble compared to other chairs I've had, however there are a few DIY fixes I highly recommend when assembling it. First, the cover that goes over where the chair legs and hydraulic lift for raising and lowering the chair meets will rattle a lot when moving the chair. What I did was use the foam from shipping, and cut a shape that will go on the underside of the cover so it does not rattle anymore. Second, after a month or so, I noticed a screw that had fallen off the chair, and the chair would creek a lot. When taking a look I noticed all the screws had backed out a considerable amount, and some were almost about to fall off as well. I ended up redoing all the screws with blue Loctite, and ever since all the screws have been firmly in place on the chair.Overall, even with a few complaints, the chair is definitely pretty good, and is great when factoring in the price. I highly recommend it if you're looking for an office chair in this price point.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Gambled and I won! Great chair overall, especially for this price!', 'author': 'M. Androus', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I paid $130 after a coupon I found. I heard about this from the BTOD videos. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô10Pros:- Lumbar support is aggressive, and is a piece of plastic, but I didn‚Äôt find it rough or too harsh. It forced me to sit with good posture which is what I want. I was worried about the plastic feeling too hard through the mesh but it‚Äôs fine. I was mostly worried about this but it‚Äôs great.-Mesh isn‚Äôt too rough as I‚Äôd feared. It‚Äôs perfectly fine.-Arm cushions are perfectly workable and comfortable.-Cushion is also fine, but can‚Äôt testify to long term use.At this price, I think it‚Äôs a steal. Putting it together is dead simple- it‚Äôs just a lot of the same type of screw. I did it by myself. It also seems like it will last, and doesn‚Äôt creak.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Uncomfortable seat', 'author': 'Robert Garrett', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'I\'ll start with the positives:The ergonomic back feels great, the mesh is firm enough where it doesn\'t sag too much when you lean back, but springy enough to form to your back. The lumbar support feels nice with the height and depth adjustability. The range of motion for the for the back is great, I lean back a little while working and I lean back all the way when I watch videos or talk with friends online. Putting the chair together was pretty simple, I\'ve done my fair share of assembling chairs in the office ranging from complex to easy as ever, and this one only took about 30 minutes to assemble. The price-tag is pretty reasonable, the chair usually goes for $300, but I got it on sale for only $170, so that was a plus. If I had spent that $300 and noticed the negatives, I would not be a happy camper.Now for the negatives:I would NOT recommend this chair if you are on the heavier side. The "high density foam," is overly dense, making the cushion too firm to sit comfortably for multiple hours. The first day I gave it some time for the foam to compress and get used to having weight on it, but after the 2nd and 3rd day, it was just as bad. My tailbone was hurting after only a couple hours, even with sitting as upright as I can. I had to get a separate seat cushion just so I could sit for over 4 hours on it. The headrest only fits into the back by a ball bearing and is held in my pressure, which means that over time, the headrest will become loose and slip in an out of the sockets that the ball goes into too easily - which it has already done. After leaning my head back on it for just 3 days, it is already wobbly. The seat depth itself is pretty bad, when I\'m all the way on the back of the seat with my back pressed up against the chair, the front edge of the seat only goes to halfway the length of my thighs.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Quality , and aesthetic', 'author': 'Dylin', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Was looking for a budget friendly ergo chair for my Office / Game room. It‚Äôs hard to find them with an all black build and polished base , so I seen this on YouTube and figured I‚Äôd take a shot!! Quality blew my mind, assembled in under 15 minutes , these guys even include the tools needed!! The lumbar support is perfect for me and I am 6‚Äù3 , 200 pounds!! So fits a larger guy just fine! I use this everyday for work, 8-10 hour sessions and I have 0 complaints. It does have a few cons. Arm adjustments to the cushion area does not lock, so it adjusts with light effort , drives you nuts if you move a lot. This also collects cat / dog hair super easy. Aside from that, I have 0 complaints! Worth the $120 sale price I paid 100%', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Not bad, but has a firm seat', 'author': 'Edwin Zhao', 'rating': 3, 'content': "The Ticova Ergonomic Office Chair is a mixed bag. With its adjustable lumbar support, headrest, and 3D metal armrests, it aims for a customized ergonomic experience. The 130¬∞ rocking feature adds a touch of dynamism. However, the firmness of the seat might not be everyone's cup of tea, making it a 3/5 star choice for those who prioritize a softer feel. While it offers various ergonomic features, potential buyers should consider their preferences in seat firmness before making a purchase. The assembly was okay not too hard but the instruction wasn't the most detailed.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 6‚Äô3‚Äù, 215lbs, chair works perfectly.', 'author': 'Kirsten English', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Simple review here, the chair was easy to assemble and came in perfect condition. The seat is a bit stiff, but I assume with time it will loosen. The armrests are also pretty stiff, but I may not end up using them very often since I‚Äôll rest my arms on my desk. Nothing here that would, at this point, take away from the rating.It feels very sturdy and as long as you don‚Äôt plan on body slamming into it, it should last a long time. I‚Äôm 215 lbs, so time will tell how harsh the weight is on the chair‚Äôs parts.For my height, the headrest is a bit low, but it works for the few times that I may actually be laying my head back on it (pretty seldom, I imagine).The ergonomic settings are perfectly serviceable, nothing ‚Äùluxury‚Äù but everything worked as advertised. As far as pictures, it looks exactly like it does in the ad, nothing of note to remark on.I‚Äôll update the review as time goes on, this chair was assembled on 12 January, 2024.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Should you buy this?', 'author': 'Mitchell Zoph', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Okay so quick overview and I‚Äôll go into some more details later: The chair is great if they send you one that doesn‚Äôt have problems. You get to decide if you‚Äôre willing to chance going through the headache I did.What I liked: Once assembled it is a great chair as you can see even my cats enjoy it. Shipping was extremely fast. I was able to get this at a great discount so in the end it only cost me around $125. I love the tilt feature, the headrest is nice, and being able to adjust the arms is such a nice feature. Like I said for the price I bought this at it was a steal.What I didn‚Äôt like: I‚Äôll start with the issue that I blame the company for. For one I‚Äôve ordered a total of 3 chair. 2 because the first one had many problems (the second one had some minor problems as well) I ordered a third because of course it would go on a very big sale a few days after I bought it and because of the headache I went through I decided I‚Äôm saving the money. What were the problems you ask? The first chair I ordered, the tilt feature was messed up and it wouldn‚Äôt allow me to tilt (yes I know you can lock this feature that wasn‚Äôt the issue). Secondly, I‚Äôm guessing this must just be a design flaw but both chair‚Äôs backrest had stitching coming undone at the bottom (luckily you can‚Äôt see it once assembled and I‚Äôm hoping it won‚Äôt cause problems down the road). Furthermore both chairs had alignment issues the second one more so than the first. I had to assemble the chair out of order (step 5 before step 4) and this made it way harder to put together. The first chair I did by myself, the second one I caved and asked my partner to help after I accidentally hit the chair lift and the legs smacked me in the forehead. It‚Äôs funny now but not so much when it happened. Now I blame the shipping company for the leg cover being cracked and my first chair had something stuck in the arm which made a rattling sound. I‚Äôm assuming something got in through the large hole in the corner of the box it was shipped in. Now the second came in great condition so if you have a great delivery person I wouldn‚Äôt worry about this too much. Lastly they don‚Äôt have a support system. I would have loved to just have received replacement parts, unfortunately you have to get a whole new chair. Because of this you get to go through the fun process of disassembly, trying to fit everything back in the box which was packed so tightly before it‚Äôs not an easy process, and then haul the thing to a location that allows you to return it and this thing isn‚Äôt light.Final thoughts: I did so much research on this chair before I bought it and now that it‚Äôs assembled it was worth it to me. I think that my situation probably isn‚Äôt something that will happen to everyone so I say go for it. Just know there is a chance you can end up like me.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good but the plastic back support sucks', 'author': 'Dylan R', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'No idea why they made the back support out of plastic and put no padding on it. The right side of it (where I circled) digs into my back. I would have paid more money for them to put a little foam support there.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy Assembly', 'author': 'U.S.S Demon', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Arrived in compact packaging; obviously for the price you have to put it together, at most 30 mins to put it together by yourself. Don‚Äôt tighten anything extremely tight as most of the pieces are plastic and can crack with use.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good enough for price', 'author': 'Robert Maxwell', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I bought this chair after my old one gave out, mostly because of the style and the price tag associated. The assembly itself wasn't too bad, the most trouble I had was getting the last few screws in place for the backrest, holding it in place while trying to thread the screw was slightly irritating. All in all, doesn't seem to be too bad of a chair, as a 6', 220lb man it supports me well and I can recline in it without feeling like it is going to drop me on the floor. It is fairly comfortable though the back support feels unnatural at first but I got used to it as I reclined and generally relaxed in the chair as I used my PC.Long story short: good enough for the money you pay for a stylish, somewhat comfortable chair.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 29, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Gaming Bliss: Unleashing Comfort with best office', 'author': 'Ingrid B.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently upgraded my gaming setup with a [Gaming Chair Brand] gaming chair, and the experience has been nothing short of extraordinary.From the moment I sank into its plush cushions, I knew this chair was designed with gamers in mind. Plug and play. Beautiful picture . Only prob I have is probably some setting I have screwd up, when I play wz3 the screen blurs when I turn (ps5)', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Chair comes ready to set up with everything you need right out the box ! Great leather feel and so comfortable!! Buy it !', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars This chair was poorly drilled for assembly and does not come together easily at all.', 'author': 'Rhonda J Huffman', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'My chair is still sitting in pieces on the floor, after making a new attempt each day for three days. The bottom (metal) comes together very easily, and it took me about ten minutes for all of it, if that. The top and seat of the chair are then held together by only the arms of the chair, by four screws, two on each side (I am not optimistic about the durability of these four screws holding a back on a chair as someone moves around and puts their weight against it to begin with. The next problem is that the four holes that attach the arms and thus hold the entire upper chair together are very poorly drilled. I tried putting the screws in the holes with the hand tool they provide and a drill, and they don\'t want to go in. I tried just putting the screw in the hole to see if I was getting a bad angle, but they really don\'t want to go in the hole without the arm between it. They seem to have been generally drilled very haphazardly, and if you don\'t get the exact angle, it doesn\'t go in. If you do get the right angle, and the pieces shift (which they almost always will, especially if you\'re working by yourself, as you are holding together two weighty pieces that are secured in no way, until those screws get started, then you won\'t be able to get the screw in; and you\'ll have to pull it back and find the passage again. On top of that, because the screw holes are drilled how they are, it is very easy, much easier than getting it in the socket, to get the screw to go off at an angle and just screw into the padding of the chair. I have been working on this upper for over two hours, and I\'ve gotten one screw in (loosely, so I can still move the pieces); and I\'m frankly beginning to worry that the pressure of wrestling with the chair over and over to get in the other three (or just the next one) is going to end up snapping it off on the socket.The chair shows it being able to recline and adjust a few inches, but I really see nothing on the chair that could possibly make this possible (unless their photographing the slow progress of the chair back breaking off, because it\'s only held by four screws that don\'t want to find the socket with a map and a local guide). This chair will most likely be renamed by me to be "That time I paid $50 to take something to the trash room", because without paying someone to do it, I don\'t think I will ever be able to get it together.I watched the video. It doesn\'t work. I read the reviews that said it was easy to put together, and their suggestions didn\'t work (and I\'m wondering if they were paid now). I would return it, but after having worked in an office for years and having put together numerous desk chairs, I was sure it would be no issue and threw out the box and shipping materials. I guess, it is mine now. My millstone.To grant the star I gave it, if the pieces went together, which they don\'t, it would be a nice looking chair. It would be roomy. The padding seems comfortable. But it doesn\'t. It lays on the floor in pieces.If you ever ask why a chair costs so much less than the others, there is a reason.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Cheap but you knew', 'author': 'kaylee Conner', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Cheap and affordable. It was fairly easy to put together. However it is not that comfortable. The chair does lean back when you do, but when sitting, you have to sit straight up, and the ‚Äúlumbar‚Äù support is far to low on the upper chair, it feels like your being pushed out of the chair. I‚Äôm going to get a back support for it, but otherwise Ok chair for the price if your not looking to spend a lot.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works amazingly for the price', 'author': 'Logan glenn', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love the fact that this chair is simple to put together, and after using it a couple different times it‚Äôs one of the most comfortable chairs I‚Äôve used. I would definitely recommend it if you‚Äôre on a tight budget because it is very useful and very well made.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Its good enough', 'author': 'dawnfranada', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I don't build furniture much often so for my first time assembling something myself, it was simple. The instructions were clear and straight forward, so anyone could easily put it together. It has decent support, if you are gaming for hours, it will be good enough. It's a budget gaming chair, it isn't a 5-star gaming chair. But for the price I am overall satisfied with my purchase. It also came earlier than expected!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Only pictures for instructions', 'author': 'Sheila Meyers', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This chair was easy to install, other than only pictures. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A comfy and stylish chair for my home office', 'author': 'T. I am so impressed by the quality of this chair! I can't speak for longevity since I've only had it for a week, but very heavy duty and comfortable! I can confirm this is a chair for the bigger people out there! The highest height setting puts my feet in the air sitting all the way back and I'm a plus sized 5'8 woman. The white color makes the chair look sophisticated rather than the gaming chair look. It took me only 20 mins to assemble by myself, very straightforward instructions. I've tried 4 or 5 Amazon desk chairs throughout the years and this is BY FAR the best one I've tried in every category. Only downside to the white is I can tell sitting on it with dark denim or other dark clothing may rub off or stain the white chair fabric. It even mentions this on the paperwork that comes inside of the box. But part of this chair purchase was upgrading the esthetic of my old chair so I'll take the beautiful white any day!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great so far!', 'author': 'Nicole Buckland', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I‚Äôve had this chair a few weeks now and so far I love it! Makes sitting at my desk a lot easier!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable with Variable positioning', 'author': 'Dione L Densmore', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love the functionality of this chair. (I\'m 5\'7" for reference) When I turn to watch TV I can recline back a little and fold out the foot rest to be in a more comfortable lounging position. The footrest also works as a convenient tray like surface for misc tasks or holding your dinner plate :D like I do sometimes.The chair itself is soft in cushioning but also firm enough to provide the back/hip support that many chairs do not offer. I sometimes sit for long periods of time and it provides maximum comfort during these periods. I no longer have to use additional back supports or cushions to add needed support.The chair arrived quickly after I ordered it, was very well packaged and completely free of any damage. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A Perfect Fusion of Comfort and Style - Must-Have for Gamers!', 'author': 'Brittany', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the PC Gaming Chair Desk Chair Ergonomic Office Chair, and I must say, it has significantly enhanced my gaming experience. The 360-degree swivel is another fantastic feature, enabling me to move around freely without straining my body.The chair also comes with adjustable armrests, which can be raised or lowered to match my arm's natural position. The combination of black and vibrant color accents gives it a stylish and professional look. The chair's upholstery is made of high-quality PU leather, which not only looks great but is also easy to clean and maintain.In conclusion, the PC Gaming Chair Desk Chair Ergonomic Office Chair is a superb investment for any avid gamer. I couldn't be happier with my purchase, and I highly recommend this chair to anyone seeking a perfect fusion of comfort and style for their gaming sessions.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Chair', 'author': 'Paola', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Pretty comfy, easy to build.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars EPIC GAMER ALERT', 'author': 'Skyler', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'First off I have no idea how to build things and do things and the instructions at first was super confusing had no idea what any of it meant. after awhile though it started to make sense and it was super easy to buildit is pretty comfortable but not as comfortable as it would look though its still so much better then my old chair. The seat part is a bit small so if you have thicker legs as myself do it can get pushed against the sides of the chair since the sides curve upwards slightly so keep that in mindit can lean back pretty far into a comfortable position to lay and relax watching tv or youtube or etc.overall it depends on the person but for me its was well worth the price', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The Ultimate Gaming Throne: BestOffice Gaming Chair Delivers Comfort and Style', 'author': 'Shakti', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently upgraded my gaming setup with the BestOffice Gaming Chair in the striking blue color variant, and I must say that it has significantly enhanced my gaming experience. This chair effortlessly blends ergonomic design, comfort, and a touch of racing style for an all-encompassing gaming throne.One of the standout features of this chair is the built-in footrest. It adds a whole new dimension of comfort during those intense gaming sessions. Being able to kick back and relax during breaks is a game-changer. The reclining feature, coupled with the footrest, allows me to find the perfect position for both gaming and relaxation.Ergonomics are a key factor in the BestOffice Gaming Chair's design. The lumbar support and adjustable headrest provide excellent neck and back support. The ability to customize the height and angle of the chair makes it easy to find a comfortable seating position tailored to your body.As a gamer, I appreciate the sturdy construction of this chair. It feels solid and durable, capable of withstanding hours of gaming action. The smooth-rolling casters make it easy to move around, and the 360-degree swivel allows for quick reactions in intense gaming moments.The racing-style design of the chair is a visual treat. The blue color is vibrant, and the sleek lines give it a sporty look that complements my gaming setup. It's not just functional; it's a statement piece in my gaming room.Assembly was relatively straightforward, thanks to clear instructions, and all the necessary tools were provided. I had the chair set up in no time.While the BestOffice Gaming Chair is primarily designed for gamers, it's also an excellent choice for anyone looking for a comfortable and stylish office chair. It's versatile, well-constructed, and the reclining feature makes it ideal for short breaks and relaxation during the workday.In conclusion, the BestOffice Gaming Chair with Footrest has exceeded my expectations. It combines ergonomic support, gaming-specific features, and a stylish design into one impressive package. Whether you're a dedicated gamer or in need of a comfortable office chair, this gaming chair is a top-tier choice. It's a throne that not only enhances your gaming experience but also complements your gaming room's aesthetics.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing quality or an outstanding price!', 'author': 'jennifer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought for 12. Yr old birthday present. He has never been happier. He loves the. footstool, but, I do not think that part is very comfortable. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô7‚Äù and to me, it just feels awkward the way it fits my legs but, that‚Äôs not to say I don‚Äôt use it when sitting in this chair. It is better than no stool, I just think it could be made to fit and be formed to legs lengths better. I want one to support my feet to. BUT, it‚Äôs a GREAT chair. 7 months later and many, many active, crazy, and excited 12 yr old boys not only gaming in it but a few occasions of it being used to sleep in for the night, and it still works, sits and looks brand new! I was a little leary on the quality and how long it would hold up for due to the price when comparing to similar chairs and most where $150 & up. But it‚Äôs been great. And if it was going to fall apart or tear up because of it being cheap quality (which. It obviously is not) believe me, my son, whom we refer to as ‚ÄúThe Destroying Monkey‚Äù (why we call him this-he doesn‚Äôt walk, it‚Äôs always jumping to smack ceilings and doorways, darts in and out, flips or flops on everything, yanks and tosses, the 1 to test ALL buttons, knobs, dials and all that moves, AND assembles and unassembles everything to see what‚Äôs inside, including the Thermostat on the wall @ 2. He can tear up even proven indestructible things, if you get the picture). He would have made it fall into pieces by now. He truly puts anything he sees, plays with, or sits on To the test of its quality and it‚Äôs limitations by throwing, tossing, using it for everything it was not intended for, flopping or laying sideways and upside down in or on it, and just being an overly curious, creative, imaginative wiggle worm and 12 yr old country boy. This is a chair I highly recommend i if you are looking for a good quality chair for a very reasonable price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 12, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars High quality gaming chair', 'author': 'Izaiah fields', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'This is one of the more expensive "gaming chairs", not the most expensive, but you can find some for about half the price. If you get it on sale, I would recommend it. Overall it is a very comfortable chair to sit in for a few hours of gaming. The reason I didn\'t give it 5 stars is that there are some areas with room for improvement: I like the footrest idea, but unless you are shorter than 5\'6", it really is not a great design. I am 6\' tall, and the footrest ends up at about mid-calf range, which is not the most comfortable, I still end up needing something to rest my feet on. The armrests could be a little wider, with a little more cushion, maybe a little more ergonomically designed for the gamer, especially if you\'re gaming with a controller. I do however like the idea of the hinge aspect of the armrests, so they move back with you when you recline. Another thing I noticed (mostly due to my height again), is the neck/head pillow height. I find when I am sitting in the chair, that pillow actually ends up at my shoulders, and I can adjust it to where I need it, but as soon as I move it falls back to it\'s normal resting place, and I have to readjust every time I sit back down, so a nice improvement would be to see multiple slots for mounting that to accommodate a wider range of gamers more comfortably. The vibrating lumbar support cushion is a nice touch, it can help a little bit if you\'re getting some tension in your lower back, but it produces quite a loud buzzing sound, so often I don\'t use it, because it\'s just too distracting. The seat cushion is my favorite part of the chair, it\'s actually very nice and easy to sit on for long periods. The seat always tends to be the problem part of a chair for me, it\'s hard to find one comfortable for me to spend any time in without soreness. The long flat cushion spreads out your weight nicely, so there are no pressure points like your tailbone or in your thighs that end up hurting due to excessive pressure on that area. So, all in all, it\'s a decent mid range gaming chair, room for improvement definitely, particularly if you\'re an above average height gamer, but mostly a good solid chair, that is worth the money if you can get it for less than full price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Falling apart in less then a year.', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My son hasn‚Äôt even had this chair a year and it‚Äôs falling apart. He weighs 75 lbs sooo‚Ä¶it‚Äôs not like it has a lot on it. All the seams where the material attaches has detached.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "1.0 out of 5 stars I'm not tall and it feels small and has sharp areas", 'author': 'Adam', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'I don\'t recommend.I\'ve previously had a gaming chair that was a bit taller than me when sitting in it, I\'m 5\'4", and if its kinda small for me it maybe really small for you. My feet do not touch the ground so its not short (my feet hang about an inch above the ground), but the structure feels somewhat small compared to another gamer chair I had before. Sitting fully upright and butt all the way back, I still have an inch of space before the seat touches the back of my calves, so the seat isn\'t that big too. Now what I do feel too wide is the arm rests, it would be nice if I could move them in more, and if I could adjust them down or up. It\'s tad bit too wide. When the footrest is inside the chair, it\'s upside down and the plastic is a little sharp, so may cut the back of your calves. The lower back-pad with vibrator is nice if using it for vibrator, but its a bit thick if not using it for vibrator, it may get annoying later. Also, the arm rests, underneath them is pretty sharp too.So basically, back-piece is a little short, seat is a little short, armrests are little wide and not adjustable, back-pad is a bit thick, and underneath the arm rests and foot rest is a bit sharp.Its not too bad, but not too good either. It was easy to install, and the wheels are tough to get in, they bit different than other wheels I seen. It is somewhat comfy seat, the back-pad with vibrator is a bit too thick though.This chair is one of the cheaper ones, but still expensive, around $100, so kind of disappointed and kind of expected. It\'s cheaper against the other chairs of its kind, but its not really cheap when you just think about the price.I\'ll probably spend $50 more and get a better chair next time. This chair is cheap compared to others like it, but its still expensive. This chair lacks customization of the features, and could work on smoothing out sharp areas of the chair that I think would make it better and probably 4/5 stars.Also, I think I\'d go with one without vibrator next time too, its nice but its very sturdy and thick, I miss regular cushion. I normally sit with legs somewhat spread apart, and its a bit uncomfortable with these side pieces towards the end of the seat. They a bit too tall and sturdy. It\'s not a bad chair, but could be a lot better. So I give this chair a 3/5.I changed my mind to 1/5, its just not comfortable anymore, the sides on the seat irritate my thighs. I wanted to see the padding, which is good but I noticed they removed all the zipper hangings probably because so many people checking and finding things wrong, so they removed all of them to make it difficult to check. The arm rest is sharp as well as the foot rest when its docked underneath the chair, the back of my calves brush against it. The massage pad I would go without one, its just too stiff and I hardly use it. It pushes you too far in the seat because too thick and I don\'t get to enjoy the headrest due to how thick the massage pad is. Sitting indian style in the chair is uncomfortable too, its just not wide enough and/or the side piece is too tall and sturdy, needs to be bent outwards more and not so pointy.Pictures are showing the sharp plastic underneath the arm rest and an arm can fit in between which is bad due to sharp plastic, the sharp plastic on the footrest, and zipper without zipper grips (they must have ripped them off, due to people inspecting the padding).I just got the chair 13 July, 2020, and already want to return it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 13, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Arrived Dirty but Beautiful Chair', 'author': 'MysticShan', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I bought this chair because I needed a new office chair for my apartment. Very sturdy so far, and I love the adjustable pillows for your back and neck/head. The first thing I noticed is that the separate components of the chair, while packaged individually, were dirty. I tried to clean the chair pieces as best as I could, and the photos that I am sharing show what remains of the dark spots. I am a bit disappointed by this. Additionally, the instructions were small pictures, with only a few words that did not explain much about how to assemble the chair. Obviously, I figured it out, but if you struggle with directions and require written instructions, ask a friend to help you. Overall I am pretty satisfied and I am excited to use this chair for work and gaming!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good quality!', 'author': 'Austin Whited', 'rating': 4, 'content': "solid leather/levers, spare bolts i would say it's great for the buy if you can get it while it's on sale even better! the only thing i would recommend if you aren't inclined at putting things together is looking and saving the instructions from the sale ad since they were not included with the item itself.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great choice!', 'author': 'JamesN808', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'In looking for an office chair, I was looking for a mesh chair with a separate back support, headrest, and adjustable height armrests all at a low price (preferably near $100). All predrilled screw holes were lined up perfectly. Assembly was straight forward. Once assembled, the chair seemed very solid and well built. Adjustability was good. Comfort was great. Overall, happily surprised based on price that this was an excellent purchase that should be considered if you are looking for a cost effective, well built, comfortable office chair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Value. Here's what I've found:Pros:Comfortable Seat: The chair boasts a comfortable and well-padded seat that makes long hours at the desk much more bearable. It provides adequate support for my lower back, which is a must for someone like me who spends hours working on a computer.Everything Is Adjustable: What I love most about this chair is its adjustability. You can customize it to suit your preferences. The adjustable lumbar support is fantastic; it allows me to find the perfect level of support for my lower back. The chair's height is also easily adjustable, and you can recline it to different angles. This adaptability has really helped reduce any discomfort during extended work sessions.Metal Base: The metal base is sturdy and well-constructed. I feel secure and stable while sitting in this chair, even when leaning back. It's a nice touch that adds to the chair's overall durability.Cons:The Armrests: Unfortunately, the armrests are a bit of a letdown. They feel somewhat hard and uncomfortable when you rest your arms on them for an extended period. It would be great if they were better padded or could be adjusted more comfortably.Despite the armrests' minor downside, I must say that the Marsail Office Chair Ergonomic Desk Chair has improved my work-from-home experience. It offers excellent lumbar support, allows for a range of adjustments, and boasts a sturdy metal base. If you're looking for a comfortable and customizable office chair, this one is worth considering.Overall, I'm quite satisfied with my purchase, and it has made a noticeable difference in my comfort and productivity during long work hours.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Solid feature rich chair', 'author': 'Arwood', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Only in first few days here, but seemed solid putting it together and comfortable to sit in. title: Mimoglad Home Office Chair, High Back Desk Chair, Ergonomic Mesh Computer Chair with Adjustable Lumbar Support and Thickened Seat Cushion
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great chair!', 'author': 'Erin', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have been looking for a new work chair for quite some time. I didn't want to break the bank, but I also didn't want to go too cheap. This chair is a great price for the quality! The seat cushion is nicely padded, and at 5'3 I can sit cross-legged comfortably in this chair. I also love that the arm rests can go up or down. This chair was very easy to assemble, my 8 year old was able to help me. I definitely recommend this chair if you are looking for something nice but don't want to spend hundreds of dollars. Plus the colors are SO CUTE!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Most comfortable chair ever!', 'author': 'Arlene Deutsch', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My lower back had been bothering me and I really needed a chair I could sit in for awhile and then get up without cringing! This is that chair! The lumbar support device even slides up /down so you can put it where you feel the best support for your lower back. The seat cushion is comfy and wide, back support is excellent. The coasters enable you to slide over the floor, back of chair is high; has folding arms; it swivels; and the height adjusts a few inches; this is one great chair! I can sit in this for hours and then get up and still feel good!Instructions for putting it together are clear! I put it together myself‚Ä¶ might have been a bit easier if I had a helper, but I managed to do it myself! Believe me if I could do it anyone else can. Hardest part was attaching the arms but it wasn‚Äôt all that difficult! I cannot say enuf good things about this chair. I got it in white and it even provided me with a seat cover.You will not regret getting this ergonomic chair! Looks wonderful and surprisingly the price was great! I‚Äôve been looking for this chair a long time, so glad I purchased it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Outstanding Quality, assembly is a two person job', 'author': 'R. Bush', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this chair during the Black Friday sale. Given the reasonable price, I was concerned that this chair would be a cheap pile of plastic. In reality, it\'s shockingly well made. Let\'s start from the ground up. The legs are made of metal and not plastic. The casters are the best I\'ve had on any chair. They roll smoothly and well. The seat is padded enough to be supportive. The back is substantial with very good lumbar support. The arms fold up so I can shove the chair under my computer desk so it it\'s in the way. I love this feature! The chair is truly ergonomic. The site tips you forward just slightly. The lumbar back support is in the right place and my elbows rest on the arms while I\'m typing. The height of the chair is easily adjustable with a range of nearly 5 inches. That\'s more than I\'ve seen in other chairs.Now let\'s talk about assembly. The chair came well packed and there were good assembly directions. They provided a long Allen wrench with a long handle. There were extras of every screw and washer. They included white gloves. I thought that was cool but unnecessary. Most of the screw holes aligned well. But I found installation to be a bit frustrating. Don\'t worry, there\'s an easy fix. The chair\'s arms were connected to what they call a "bracket". Each arm needed to be attached to the back of the chair first and then to the seat. It was difficult to hold things together at the right angle to insert the screws and washers. The workaround is simple.. recruit two more arms - a spouse, neighbor, kid, etc. They can hold things in the right place while you align, insert, and tighten the screws. The chair only goes together one way so it isn\'t likely that you\'d need to hire a handyman to do it for you.It took me a few hours to put the chair together (including time to look up new curse words on the Urban Dictionary website). The manufacturer provides you with an assembly video but requires that you register the product first. Sure, let\'s give lots of private information to a company I hadn\'t heard of before to register a product I didn\'t now if I was going to keep. ;) In the end, I was pleased that I was able to get the chair all screwed up (Ok, assembled). This morning I showed it off to the students who were in my 3 Zoom fitness Classes. They were all really impressed with it. If you buy yourself one, I think you\'ll like it as well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars slow shipping but great chair', 'author': 'Jeannie Wilson', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This is the SECOND chair I have ordered from this company. The 1st was the orange model with the head rest for my husbands office chair. He loved his so I ordered this pink one without the headrest for my home craft room. I spend 10+ hours at times hunched over a sewing projects. Improper back support was really becoming an issue. The lumbar support that this chair has, with the ability to adjust to my trunk length is a huge advantage for support and comfort. The padded seat and width of the seat is more then adequate. I am a smaller US size 2, and the seat width is massive for my build. The seat width can comfortably accommodate someone with a much larger derriere.Shipping was over 2 weeks to receive the chair so order with expectation of a month to get it. Other then this, the chair was quite easy to assemble. The chair itself is sturdy and quite comfortable. Color was accurate with the pictures depicted. The cost was far bellow retail in big box stores for far less quality of a chair with less choice in color selection. I recommend this chair for comfort, value, and color selection', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful, Comfortable Chair at Great Price!!', 'author': 'Redhorse', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I am very impressed with this chair and with the customer service! The chair is a beautiful mustard color that they call Jasmine which really enhances my decor. It is lightweight yet has very sturdy construction. It was easier to assemble than almost any piece of furniture I've ever bought. And the assembly instructions are very good. It's also a lot of fun to just sit in the chair and spin around in a circle. Haha. Highly recommended!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy and comfortable!', 'author': 'Charmaine Williams', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I highly recommend this chair. It was really simple to put together, I was able to assemble it within roughly 15 minutes. It‚Äôs a gorgeous chair, and the soft neutral color is what I was looking for to go with my white and gold marbled desk. It‚Äôs quiet, it makes no noise when I roll it back and forth or spin around. I‚Äôve been having back pains so the lumbar support is exactly what I‚Äôm looking for and the seat itself is firm but comfortable.It‚Äôs a win!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Chair with Exceptional Customer Service', 'author': 'Amber', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I shopped around quite a bit to find a great office chair for home. I settled on this one because of the warranty and many people had said their customer service was good. 90 Days of Free Returns and Replacements with 5 Years of Expert Assistance was exactly what I needed to see to take the plunge and purchase this chair even if I did think it a little pricey at the time.Putting the chair together was easy enough. I appreciated the allen wrench having a good handle, the parts being labeled well, and the spare parts. Instructions were easy to follow as well.My chair came with a removable cover for the seat cushion which I wasn't expecting but I was grateful for. This chair feels like it will last and is made well. The seat cushion is thick and comfortable, the back is high enough that it supports my entire back, the wheels roll well. I really like being able to move the arms out of the way when needed. I did have to contact customer service but I was pleasantly surprised that they were very responsive and communicated well to ensure I was happy. Overall, this is a great chair and the customer service is top notch!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable well made chair', 'author': 'Sherri Roberts', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I spent quite a bit of time searching for a new office chair - finally decided on this one and am very pleased. The parts are well made, it was easy to put together, everything works as expected, the color is exactly as pictured and it is very comfortable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good for my aching back', 'author': 'R.Anne.W.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have tried lots of different chairs at my work desk that will help with my lower back pain. Kneeling chairs, a dynamic stool, traditional office chairs, a standing desk, etc. I\'ve learned two things for my work day at a desk: 1) my back feels best if I change positions every 30-60 minutes (like from sitting to standing) and 2) most traditional office chairs are too big for me. I\'m 5\'4" and all the office chairs I have been given at work seem to be measured for a 6\' tall person. I can never sit all the way back with my feet touching the floor and my arms don\'t sit on the arm rests. After trying 3 different chairs recently, I almost gave up, but I saw this one and thought it might be worth a try. I am so glad I got it. I feel like this chair actually fits me. I can sit all the way back and the lumbar support is fantastic and just where I need it. The seat cushion is perfect, too, as it provides firm support without being too hard. I also love that the arms go up and down because that allows me to sit cross-legged if I want. I will also add that the chair is made from high quality materials - really nice casters, real metal legs, it\'s solid and does not feel flimsy. I\'m kind of amazed at the low price for this quality. Now I\'ve got a really great system for my workday in order to minimize back pain. I can sit in this chair in a few different ways: with my back against the back support and my feet up on a stool, sitting up straight with my feet flat on the floor or on yoga blocks (depending on how high the chair is), or sitting cross-legged. So I alternate between this chair and my standing desk throughout the day and it\'s the best set-up I have ever had. I don\'t think there is any magic office chair if you have back pain. We aren\'t really meant to sit for 8+ hours straight, but this is the best chair I\'ve found for my height.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful and comfortable chair!', 'author': 'Kimberly A.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this chair to work from home. I sometimes sit here for 10 hours, and it‚Äôs great! The seat cushion is soft but firm. It doesn‚Äôt get dirty easily, which is great, since my chair is a lovely blue color. I love that the height is adjustable. I‚Äôm 5 feet and I use the lowest setting comfortably, so it‚Äôs great for short people. The arm rest is adjustable, so you can put the arms all the way up. I love the adjustable lumbar support. You have to play around with it a little to find the most comfortable position. Since I have a short torso, I‚Äôm close to the last setting on it. You can also adjust the back so it‚Äôs stiff or moveable. I usually only use this if I‚Äôm watching something and want to relax. Putting it together was relatively easy. I had no issues with it. The instructions were very clear, and the kit even came with gloves, which definitely kept my hands from hurting while screwing everything in. The chair parts are pretty heavy though, so you might need someone to help. Overall, I love the chair! The customer service is great too! You have to send an email to activate the warranty, and they are really nice!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Office Chair Computer Desk Chair PU Leather Swivel Executive Task Chair with Adjustable Height Lumbar Support Padded Flip Up Armrests Home Office Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable and supportive', 'author': 'Direwolf', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The chair requires some assembly, and if you're accustomed to flat box knock down furniture, it's easy. Not only do you get step by step instructions, they're illustrated showing the positions of the hardware. All the hardware is packed in separate bubbles, each marked with the unique ID number of the components so it's obvious what parts are needed for every step.The chair is inexpensive, and I was surprised at just how comfortable it was. The seat is well padded, and the back provides lumbar support just where it's needed. The height is adjustable with a lever operated hydraulic lift, and a large knob under the seat lets you adjust how much you can rock the seat back. The two armrests can be lifted. The seat rolls easily on 5 wheels.The only issue I had during assembly was unexpected. For shipping, a lot of the parts are stored inside the seat back. You remove those, and then zip up the chair cover. For me, that was the hardest part! There was a lot of tension on the zippers, and they aren't particularly smooth. And also it‚Äôs worked for back pain relief too.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Reliable office chair that supports good posture, offers adjustability, and has a modern aesthetic', 'author': 'EP', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Upon unboxing the Brick Attic Office Chair, the first impression was of a chair designed with a keen eye for detail. It promised durability and an easy-to-clean surface, a must for any office environment. The touch was indeed smooth, and the chair's overall design felt modern, with its double layer padding adding a touch of elegance.Adjustability is a key feature here; the 10cm height range and 120¬∞ rocking function allow for a good deal of personalization. The foldable armrests at 90¬∞ are a thoughtful addition, especially for those working in tight spaces.From a user-friendly perspective, the chair was straightforward to assemble, thanks to clear instructions. The built-in lumbar support and ergonomic design were immediately noticeable, providing comfort during prolonged periods of sitting.Performance-wise, the chair lives up to its ergonomic claims, supporting a healthy posture, which is essential for long work hours. The maximum capacity of 250lbs is also a testament to its sturdy build.When compared to other chairs in its category, this Brick Attic chair holds its own in terms of functionality and design. However, the actual user experience may vary depending on personal preferences for cushion firmness and back support.In terms of value for money, this chair seems to strike a balance between quality and cost, making it an attractive option for those seeking a blend of style, comfort, and durability without breaking the bank.The top positive aspects include its sleek design, user-friendly adjustments, and the quality of the PU leather. Nonetheless, potential improvements could be in providing more recline angles and perhaps enhancing the armrest padding for additional comfort.In summary, this chair is well-suited for anyone looking for a reliable office chair that supports good posture, offers adjustability, and has a modern aesthetic. It would be an appropriate choice for both home office users and professionals in a corporate setting.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Not sure‚Ä¶', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'The chair is comfortable, but after a short time of use is already leaning to one side. My wife works from home, so she is on it for 8 hours a day and has had no discomfort. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Smart Looking Chair!', 'author': 'Debbie Lingle', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This office chair is well made and easy to assemble. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Chair, Great Price', 'author': 'S. It rolls, rocks and spins so nicely. You can lock it in when gaming so you can relax your body and the back will stay put. Its perfect for me. I love mine so much (the one thing I will add though‚Ä¶ it doesn‚Äôt fit all the way under my ikea desk so just beware and measure properly!!)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Almost as good as the costly chairs but a couple of compromises', 'author': 'Sim', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This is a very nice rotating office chair and does a good job. First of all the color is exactly what was expected - was actually looking for gray color and it looks good and matches the walls of the room where I have placed this.The assembly was straightforward and didn't take much time - about 15-20 mins. The instruction manual included all the relevant details. There were extra nuts and bolts also provided and that also helped immensely as I did lose one bolt at the time of installation.Once installed, the chair is reasonably comfortable and works well. You really have to look at the price here and see what this offers as compared to other more expensive chairs. Two areas where I can see some compromises here are - one, the arms of the chair are not extensible which means that they don't move up / down and cannot be adjusted. The arms also don't have any cushion and therefore when your elbows are resting on the arm, it won't provide the same level of comfort. The other limitation is that this chair doesn't have as good lumbar support as needed. Normally chairs have a component that goes from the backside and your lower back rests on this. This chair doesn't have it. I do feel that within the price, this could have been included.Other than above, the materials used to construct this chair are all good and it does work quite well. It is able to take decent amount of weight and the wheels move well on wooden floor and carpets too. So overall good chair and gets a good rating too given the value it offers for the price.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I love it!', 'author': 'Dee D', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Wow, at last there is a comfortable desk chair! title: Home Office Chair Work Desk Chair Comfort Ergonomic Swivel Computer Chair, Breathable Mesh Desk Chair, Lumbar Support Task Chair with Wheels and Flip-up Arms and Adjustable Height
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great chair at an affordable price', 'author': 'Scott', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Started working from home recently so I needed a new office chair to replace my ancient one that until now was only used periodically. Did my research among the top reviewed options and went with this one due to the large flat seat (a lot of office chairs have curved seats, which seems good, but in reality often leads to poor posture and back pain). Another advantage this one has over other similar options is the ability to pull back the arm rests if desired, which is a nice option to have. Having color options was nice as well, I went with standard black, but folks who want their chairs to match a room or desk have that at their disposal.Item arrived in an impressively compact box and assembly was quick and easy. Instructions were straightforward, extra screws were included (not needed since everything was in perfect condition). Took maybe 20 minutes from unboxing to it being ready to use.The back of the chair is a little further back than I'm used to; while I was initially concerned about this it actually is a big plus since it encourages me to maintain a good posture as I'm working but also is comfortable when I went to lean back for a bit. Lastly we have a white cat so I had some mild concerns about my chair turning white, but several weeks in there's barely any hair on it, which is amazing considering how every other piece of furniture has that happen.Overall, extremely satisfied with this purchase several weeks in. The wide stable base provides opportunity to use plenty of different sitting positions for anyone like me that is fidgety. Compared to my old chair which left me feeling stiff after a day of working in it, I feel great at the end of the day. Highly recommended!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy and Comfy', 'author': 'Cassidy G.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Arrived quickly specially during Christmas time. title: Office Chair, 21D x 18W x 35H in, Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good chair for the price', 'author': 'Kathy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Took me 35 minutes to assemble as a not-so-handy person. Instructions were clear. Connecting the backrest to the armrest are a bit tough but I worked through it.The armrests are a bit flimsy. The wheels move well against my hard wood floor/rug. The backrest is a bit further back than anticipated but nothing a cushion couldn‚Äôt fix for better posture.For this price point, it was a nice chair that will get the job done. Hope it last a decent time.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for the money', 'author': 'Dustin', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Works great, comfortable, and the wheels roll well', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars A very nice working chair', 'author': 'Christina M.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This chair is very comfortable and rolls with ease in my studio on a hard floor. It looks nice too, I chose the gray color, and it\'s not too intrusive. The height and tilt are easily adjustable.With 2 exceptions, the assembly was fairly easy and I am a moderately mechanical person.First assembly issue: I couldn\'t locate any "front" mark on the armrests as the instructions indicated. So you should orient the more square-looking part of each armrest towards the same direction as the "front" sticker which is on the bottom of the seat cushion.Second assembly issue: The "wrench" tool which comes in the packet of parts won\'t easily work when you\'re trying to attach the backrest to the seat cushion in Step 5. There just isn\'t enough room to turn that "wrench" to tighten the screws because the mesh of the backrest and the crossbar of the backrest both get in the way. What the manufacturer should have included was a 3/16 Allen wrench to tighten those two screws. I used my own Allen wrench tool to good effect.Those two assembly issues were fairly minor and I would have rated the "Easy To Assemble" category a 4.5 if that had been an option.All in all, this under $100 chair was a good bargain and I\'m happy with my purchase. Chrissy', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable and Affordable', 'author': 'Andrea LeCounte', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Looking for a comfortable desk or vanity chair, look no further. Is not very comfortable if you sit in for more than hour. It will make your tail bone hurt.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great', 'author': 'Elizabeth', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This was a gift. I was told it was quick and easy to set up and it‚Äôs comfortable!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Chair is not sturdy at all', 'author': 'Ty', 'rating': 1, 'content': "The chair serves it's purpose but doesn't feel very durable. And it doesn't roll smoothly when I'm sitting in it like the swivel part of the wheels are stiff or something.The chair only cost me about $60 so I'm not too bent out of shape about it.In hindsight, if I had to buy another chair, I'd just spend the extra $40 and get something with padded arm rests and adjustable lumbar support.Edit: 3/27/23The back right side broke while I was reclined during a video conference. I weigh 210 lbs and haven't had the chair for a full three months yet. I wouldn't reccomend for someone on the heavier side because it is very narrow.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good chair', 'author': 'ANGELA HAWKINS', 'rating': 4, 'content': "It's a great chair. But If you have big hips make sure you measure the width of them before buying it to make sure you will fit. I ordered it prematurely knowing I had big hips. I'm not a large woman, but I'm curvy and I have hips. So after putting it together and sitting in it, my hips were squeezed to the point of being very uncomfortable to where there was no way to just sit and deal with it. I still gave 5 stairs because the chair is a very good sturdy chair. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent office chair', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Sat on this for 2 weeks to get a good feel on how comfortable it is. The armrests are also adjustable, although I do wish they were positioned a bit more towards the back as I found my elbows hanging off them a bit. The one thing I couldn't test was the lumbar support as the knob on the back fell off during assembly, and the position of my backrest does not provide any. Nothing a back cushion can't fix. Customer support offered to send me a new chair but I decided to just keep this one to avoid the hassle. Assembly was easy and I assembled it myself in 20 minutes with the included instructions, no extra tools required. The chair is heavy, sturdy and was packaged well. Overall, I would recommend this chair to people looking for a reliable affordable and comfortable office chair. It's not as feature filled as a more expensive chair, but you sacrifice the features for standard comfort. The seat and back are cozy and the seat is wide and has room where I can sit inappropriately with my legs crossed, even at 270lbs. I have a bad back and had back surgery several years ago, and my previous chair was very expensive, but broke after a big move and some terrible demon cats. This chair was an emergency purchase as I couldn't have my back aching in a broken chair. My back feels great, especially with a lumbar cushion from my old chair to add a bonus level of comfort.Assembly was easy-- lining up the arm rests are always a struggle, but if you can get them in most of the way and onto the gas lift, it's a bit easier to get everything evened out. Took me about a half hour to put together on my own.If you're looking for a good budget chair for a larger person that's comfortable and easy, but lacks bells and whistles of a more expensive chair, this is a good bet.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Extremely comfortable and well made chair', 'author': 'Linda', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I needed a new office chair and ordering online can be very intimidating.
