title: Darkecho Criss Cross Chair with Wheels,Thick Padded Fabric Cross Legged Wide Chair with Pocket Spring Cushion,Comfortable Adjustable Computer Office Task Vanity Chair for Home Office,Bedroom,Beige
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars BETTER than the viral TikTok chair!!! Worth the price!! Not cheap looking at all!', 'author': 'Lauren M. Faul', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'So first of all, if you‚Äôre looking for a chair that you can comfortably sit crisscross in this is it. When researching a new office chair since I work from home, it was important to me to find a chair that had enough padding in the seat so that it wouldn‚Äôt degrade quickly and that I could genuinely sit comfortable crossing my legs and not hit any pressure points. This chair seat is so thick that I can push on it with all my weight in my hand and I don‚Äôt touch a bottom panel at all. It is all cushion. And it is so wide I am almost blown away. I am not a tiny girl and I could sit two of me on this comfortably.I‚Äôm not really sure why people are saying that it looks cheap. I got the black PU leather with the gold legs and the leather feels luxurious. It feels sturdy. The gold looks lovely and honestly the wheels move really well. I thought they were going to be cheaper and I would have to replace them right away but they glide really well for stock wheels.Also, whoever provided a negative review, because their box came with gloves, who cares? Mine had gloves and they don‚Äôt even look worn. So complaining about that is just silly.Everything arrived safe and sound no damages and well packed.Assembly was quick and simple.Basically, if you struggle with sitting in a regular office chair and you are always on 1 foot or need to cross your legs to be comfortable look no further, and just buy this chair. The ones on TikTok have a significantly flatter seat cushion and look like it would actually hurt your ankles when the padding gets flat, so spend the extra money and get this specific chair. Not to mention office chairs can get extremely expensive if they‚Äôre higher quality and this one is perfectly priced for just how good it is.I‚Äôm not kidding when I say that the pictures do it justice with just how thick and comfortable the padding is. I can‚Äôt speak to how the fabric version is particularly but just know for the leather ones that it‚Äôs plush.I‚Äôve been using it for a couple of days now and I just love it but if anything changes I will update.I only ever really write reviews for things that really surprised me or would highly recommend to friends and family so stop looking at cheaper alternatives and just get this one.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Poor Quality, Returning', 'author': 'Anna M.', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'Just received this chair, opened the box and there was gloves left in it, thought that was a little strange but accidents happen. Then proceeded to assemble the chair and in my opinion it is terrible quality. There are indents all over the back rest (cardboard material) so probably from shipping but after spending $150.00 and being brand new, I‚Äôm not to happy about this. Also the material isn‚Äôt a soft linen as described. It is more of a rough mesh material. On to the structure of the chair, it is unusually designed the chair is really large (lengthxwidth) compared to the backrest, it also dips in and curves down toward the back. Which causes you to feel like you‚Äôre leaning back or more prone to falling back. It is not leveled. Also, this requires two people to put together due to the seat being so thick, one person needs to squeeze it together to screw on the bottom of the chair. Overall, this product is not as advertised and poor quality. Will be returning. Lesson learned on purchasing a product with no reviews.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Funtional And Comfortable Office Chair', 'author': 'wendy yang', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought the white one. It was super easy to put together. Thankfully I read the reviews . It makes me a lot easier to assemble the chair. The instructions for this are literally 4 steps that make it seem super easy. This chair only took me a few minutes to put together and it is very sturdy and elegant look. I was a bit hesitant about the sheer width of the chair but having used it for a couple days now I can say that it‚Äôs quite comfortable. I love the height of this chair as well. I can sit in different ways and it is so free to get up in a different direction. That's almost impossible to do for a regular computer chair. It's very comfy to sit on, and is well worth the price. The delivery was quick and they delivered right in front of my door.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice cushy chair.', 'author': 'Lisa Rides Again', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Nice looking chair. Was easy to put together. Attaching the back took a bit of balancing, but it wasn't too difficult. To whoever commented that they left gloves in the package, those are there intentionally. They are brand new, and they are to use so you don't get lubricant on your hands when attaching the screws. There's a little lubricant on the washers. Also, the gloves make it a lot nicer using the Alan wrench. It's a nice chair, very deep and def room to cross your legs.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Best Desk Chair Ever', 'author': 'AC', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I bought this chair on a leap of faith when there were zero reviews (at the time). I was intrigued by the viral TikTok crisscross chair but doubted the quality. This chair had springs and high density foam so technically it should last. I‚Äôve had the chair two months so far and no problems. It looks luxe, sits comfortable and I love the size. I can sit in the chair with both my dogs. They love the chair even more than I do, as they are constantly jumping on and off the chair or taking naps on there. I love that my husband can WFH and cuddle with the dogs at the same time so they never have to cry for attention again. The only hiccup is that my chair came without any instructions so it was extremely hard to put together as the leg required attaching each spigot individually. It required some muscle for sure. But the trade off is that it made for a much more sturdy base compared to the usual plastic office chair bases that you just pop on. I‚Äôm confident this chair will last. I‚Äôm glad I bought this chair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Defective', 'author': 'Haley', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'The chair was impossible to put together and we realized that the mechanism that holds the legs in place (which is a very cheap and flimsy piece of plastic) was incorrectly made. The chair legs would not fit without jamming them in which almost broke the plastic had we tried any harder. This also does not seem safe. Do not buy', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars chair is sturdy and beautiful', 'author': 'Amy chen', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought this non-porous chair for my son to use on her desk while she does homework. The chair arrived on time and I opened it to use and test it out. It's sturdy and very easy to assemble, and the overall finish of the chair is nice. This is a sturdy chair that is comfortable to sit in all day long. Overall, this is a good value chair. my son loves it", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice chair!', 'author': 'meiyan jiang', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I received the chair promptly, and it looked pretty close to what the photo show. This is a great chair - super comfortable, great size, adjustability in height is spot on, quality of metal parts look really good, and the back comfort is great. The chairs were pretty easy to assemble. The instructions for assembly were easy to follow, all parts were labeled, all tools needed were included,and it took me about half hour to fully assemble it. My son loves this chair for his desk. I would recommend getting the one with wheels if you need to move around a lot.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Assembly tested my patience.. but chair seems to scratch the ADHD itch', 'author': 'Allison', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'After a couple of shipping delays due to weather, the box finally made it to my porch. I had a private unboxing for my dog, who was unimpressed, but highly anxious because I was sitting on the floor. I had assembled a similar chair back in November but had talked myself out of the wheely option, hence this purchase. I steamed into assembly with the confidence of a toddler in a superhero costume, only to be thwarted by the hellistic chamber that hold the legs. I don\'t know if the ring to hold the flanges at the end of the legs was purposely made to be infinitesimally too small to drive you into a self-doubting spiral or if it\'s just suppose to be that snug, regardless, I had to pull out my hand hammer to "assist" the final leg into it\'s groove, only to have the whole thing to collapse like the death star once I placed it in my trunk to transport it to my office. Luckily I was able to restore the delicate balance on the floor of my office and hopefully I won\'t end up on my ass by the end of the day but who doesn\'t like a little drama in the workplace?Parting words: super thick seat, pretty stinking deep, as well (i might need a pillow). DEF enough room to sit cross-legged comfortably. Rolls fairly easily, still considering rubber wheels though. Seems to be a good alternative to the expensive ADHD chairs out there. Fingers crossed it holds up!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars GET THIS ONE', 'author': 'Molly K.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I took a gamble buying this particular version because it had less than 10 reviews. I chose this one over others because it had springs in the seat instead of just foam. I‚Äôm heavier than most chair weight limits at 250+lbs, and my partner over 350 lbs. I needed something I knew would support us, and I‚Äôm very satisfied with the main chair piece. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô9‚Äù and my partner over 6‚Äô5‚Äù; we can both very comfortably sit criss-cross on this chair. It‚Äôs a couple inches wider than some others on Amazon.I did upgrade the lift/piston and base to a white, and heavier duty versions. Both support over 500 lbs. I also upgraded the wheels to rubber ones instead of plastic so it won‚Äôt scratch my floors (which I already had on my previous office chair).My complaints:I purchased the beige fabric chair and it appears more grey in person.I don‚Äôt like the chair tilt. Yes I can adjust it so it won‚Äôt tilt all the way back, but it‚Äôs cheap parts and it does tilt slightly into that locked position. I will likely try to replace this piece or configure it so it does not move or tilt the slightest. I do worry about the longevity of the connecting piece from the back to the bottom seat (you will have to assemble yourself). The back of the seat has a metal piece that curves to under the bottom of the seat, and screws in with 4 screws (Allen wrench provided). My concern is this piece bending over time, away from the seat. Another reason to prevent the chair from tilting.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: PUKAMI Criss Cross Chair with Wheels,Fabric Padded Armless Cross Legged Office Desk Chair for Home Office,Modern Swivel Height Adjustable Wide Seat Computer Task Vanity Chair (Beige)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars üëçüëç', 'author': 'amead', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'As a person who chronically sits cross-legged but is past the age of thirty, so who\'s knee\'s need a break from the ground, this is the best office chair.I work so much better on a couch or standing- basically anything but sitting at a normal desk. If you\'re thinking, she sounds like she is ND, yes I am. This allows me to work in comfortable positions to me but also sit at a desk. I was worried about the back rest being too high, or the cushion on the seat being too hard. Nope, both perfect. The seat cushion is firm but not too hard and the back rest comes just below my shoulders. Also, as a plus sized woman, I am happy to report, this is wide enough and sturdy enough to fit me comfortably. Even if you are simply a plus sized person looking for a wider office chair and aren\'t interested in the extra benefits to use neurospice people, this is a great option. I\'m 5\'8" (all in my legs) and this chair gets high enough that I can\'t touch the ground. The seat is curved but not so much that you feel you\'re sitting in a dip, and also it doesn\'t do that thing where the seat is tilted forward so you feel you may slide off. It\'s a nice almost canvas-y fabric. Not scratchy or itchy but does attract a little static.For all my praise, the shipping was a little rough and two pieces were broken on arrival; although they didn\'t affect the overall function of the chair. The instructions were like Ikea before they learned how to write instructions properly (uh... I hope this goes here? ü§î) But there isn\'t many pieces so with a little patience and attention it can be sorted. Fyi, you get 9 short screws and 4 long screws. The long screws are for attaching the back of the chair to the base. The short screws are for everything else.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I am obsessed with this chair', 'author': 'Belinda', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This chair is everything I hoped it would be. It's so comfortable and I no longer feel like I'm crammed in between two arms. I'm sitting in it right now to write this review even though I have no real reason to; it makes me that happy.Putting it together was pretty easy and took me about 20 minutes.The seat is lovely and wide! I've got some hips on me and this chair gives me plenty of space.The chair is very sturdy! It doesn't feel like it's going to go sailing across the room when I sit in it. I have it on a rug and I have to intentionally move the chair.The only negative I could see is how low the back is. It's perfect for me, as I rarely lean backwards, but I could see it being a deal breaker for others.I'll be over here sitting cross legged in my pretty new chair if anyone needs me.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Happy with my purchase!', 'author': 'Karina padilla', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I was nervous about ordering this particular Pukami chair with wheels since it only had a single rating but I was looking at the criss cross chair without wheels and just knew I would regret not getting the one with wheels so I went for it! Assembly was simple but I did need my partner to help me with putting together the two cushions and screwing them in together. I got this chair since I‚Äôll be working from home soon and wanted something comfortable that also matched my style. Hoping it will be comfortable to sit in for 8 hours a day (I will try to update later when I‚Äôve had more time using it) So far it‚Äôs very comfortable, big enough to sit criss cross, not very loud at all, and spins well. Feels good quality to me. I saw some people talking about not being able to lean back with these criss cross chairs but my partner made sure to push in the handle so that it secures that part of the chair and I‚Äôve been able to lean back comfortably without wobbling or feeling like I‚Äôm gonna fall. The only things I will mention so far is that when I‚Äôm trying to get off the chair and it‚Äôs a bit higher up, I need to make sure one of my feet is on the floor for balance because the chair will flip over due to the weight distribution, if not. Also, due to the color and fabric of the chair it is quite easy to stain (I‚Äôve had to use my tide pen on it twice so far) so just need to be careful but other than that I‚Äôm very happy with it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My wife loves this at her desk', 'author': 'Luke A Fallis', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Easy to put together, great size for her needs, looks really comfortable the way she can change her posture as much as she needs to. Would highly recommend.Only comment from her is she wishes it was a little higher in the back for support, otherwise it's everything she wanted.On a side note about the company: Amazon had accidentally sent it to an old address, and Pukami sent a new one ASAP. I really appreciated their understanding and encourage people to reach out to them if there are any order issues.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing', 'author': 'sheliny', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought this chair for my daughter who loves to sit criss cross on her chairs. This chair is large with plenty of room to sit crosses legged comfortably in it. The back rest is adjustable and it has wheels!!!! Hard to find these chairs with wheels. My husband put it together pretty quickly. The fabric looks sturdy and feels nice. Great purchase', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Everything I was looking for', 'author': 'Kristin Brandt', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was looking for a chair that would allow me to sit "criss-cross applesauce" (I\'m 5\'10" so I need it to be a pretty big chair for that). I also wanted wheels so I could position as necessary (many don\'t have wheels) and I needed it to raise to the proper height for my desk (my last chair was too short so I needed to use an extra cushion).Happily, this one meets all the requirements. It was very easy to put together and is quite comfortable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars What I was looking for, with a few things to consider...', 'author': 'Jess', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I\'d been wanting a criss-cross chair for quite a while, but it had to have wheels. Finally went with this one after using it for a few work days, here are some things to consider:I love sitting cross-legged but with such a deep seat (which I get it, that\'s the point of the chair!) it\'s harder to sit "normally" while still having any back support. I\'ve needed to use a lumbar pillow for support when I sit normally in the chair.I can\'t for the life of me figure out how to adjust the rocking feature. Not that I necessarily want it, I\'d keep it locked upright, but it\'s a feature I haven\'t figured out how to get to work.Assembly was easy, I did it myself. I did find that when connecting the back and the seat together, putting the chair over a couch or having some type of leverage really helped in aligning/tightening the screws.Overall I\'m liking the chair and would buy it again.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love it!', 'author': "Annie O'Mara", 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Hard to assemble without help but fantastic. Exactly what I wanted to be able to sit cross legged and I‚Äôm plus sized.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Use your head, not the instructions.', 'author': 'Call-sign Charlie', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The chair, once put together, feels very solid, but if you\'re a shorter person (I\'m 5\'1"), it is unlikely you\'ll ever sit back comfortably‚Äîthe seat is so deep, its front edge is right where my knees bend. Not great. But, on to the instructions‚ÄîI\'m one of those baby-step people, who dutifully lays out all the pieces, and swears allegiance to the printed directions. All seemed fine, until it was time to attach the back to the seat. In NO WORLD will the shorter screws work; the short screws are for the leg braces (5) and attaching the seat adjustment plate to the bottom of the seat (4); the four LONG screws are to attach the back to the seat. I kept thinking that, but purist that I am, I didn\'t go rogue until coming back to read other comments on Amazon about the instructions. So‚Äîgood chair, a bit too deep for the short, and an invitation to be rational when assembling it. Enjoy!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Chair is nice, instructions NOT!', 'author': 'lisa linden', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The chair was shipped late and Fedex refused to deliver it for 2 days. The assembly instructions were incorrect and we guessed at instructions, wrong hardware as well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Executive Office Chair, Leather Ergonomic Office Chair Big and Tall Home Office Desk Chairs with Adjustable Flip-Up Arms Lumbar Support Swivel Computer Chair with Rocking Function(Black)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Chair for back support', 'author': 'DCONTOP', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I like this chair. This office chair is very nice one than my precious one. I use it in my bedroom for gaming chair. Although it is made of imitation leather, but it feels very comfortable. This office chair is very easy to install. The chair has a long backrest, which supports the waist and makes it more comfortable to sit and lie down. So, it has great back support. Therefore, it's perfect for everyday use.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Decent Executive Office Chair...', 'author': 'Michael Lawrence', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The chair was fairly easy to put together except for one main issue, the bolts they supplied were the wrong ones for this as the numbers did not match up and some of them would not fit. Luckily I saved the ones from my old chair and could supplement the ones that did not work with them. It comes with the hardware and "T" alan tool needed to bolt it together, spare bolts, and covers for the bolt holes on the arms. The bolts I had issues with were those for the arms to attach to the seat and the backrest as 4 would not fit. The armrests are comfortable and at the proper height, they also can fold back out of the way. The chair has adjustable tension for reclining back and a decent amount of angle for reclining. The only concern is they are the only thing attaching the back of the chair to the seat/base of the chair which could wear out or become unstable over time. The cushions on the armrests are very comfortable. The wheelbase and main mechanism for the chair that the seat connects to are sturdy and appear durable. I had ordered a pack of the inline skate-type wheels to use instead of the ones that come with the chair which work great, so I will not be able to evaluate the included wheels for this chair. The dimensions of the back and seat are on par with big and tall chairs, and being 6\'4" and 225 lbs. I fit well in the chair. Now for the main reason I am only giving it 4 stars is something that that would be more of a personal preference for each person. I prefer the cushions to have an abundance of padding for maximum comfort as I spend many hours a day in my office chair. These cushions are ok for limited use, but I am already experiencing buttocks discomfort from multi-hour usage as they are way firmer than I am used to. Those who prefer a firmer chair for back and posture-type concerns, you will love this chair. However, if you are like me and want my chair to be more like a recliner in the way of cushion comfort it may not live up to your expectation during extended use. My last chair was a Lazy Boy Executive chair that had tons of cushion, so my views may be biased in this and that should be taken into consideration when considering my review. Overall, it is a decent Executive Office Chair except for the incorrect hardware supplied and personal preference cushion firmness issues I have covered. I was able to combat the lack of softness in the seat cushion by placing a pillow in the seat which may be an option for those that experience it being too stiff and firm for your tastes.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars easy installation', 'author': 'Michael Qin', 'rating': 5, 'content': "It's very easy to install. It has proven to be an excellent source of support during her long working hours, allowing her to customize it to her preferred seating position. Assembly was a breeze, thanks to the clear instructions provided. The chair's construction is solid, ensuring stability, as safety is our top priority.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable chair', 'author': 'S. Hennessy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Easy to get it ready! Lightweight and comfortable to sit for a long time. Leather is so easy to keep clean!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Big and Wide but not so much for Tall folks', 'author': 'Avid couch surfer', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Assembly is very straightforward with the all the hardware in separated compartments and labeled along with a set of spares for each type of screw or cover. The hardest part was attaching the back to the two side arms and I found it was easier to lay the chair on its side and press the arms to lineup the back to the screw holes. I included pictures of the assembly steps it took maybe 20 minutes to put together from start to finish. I like that the they provided spares as not all furniture and chairs come with spare parts and they provided a plastic padded T-handled hex tool for torqueing all the screws.The back of the chair is not as high as it looks in the picture. I thought I would be able to recline and rest my head against the top of the chair, but my head is above the head rest portion. If you are less than 6 feet tall then it might be fine but not for tall people. The seat is wide so if you're a little bit on the heavy side this chair has more than enough room for most. Length of the seat is proportioned to its width so it relieves pressure on your thighs when sitting, I don't like short length bottom chairs as I find it puts pressure on your hamstrings when sitting for too long.The PU leather or faux leather feels soft to the touch, you can tell right away it's not real leather, but in the price range that this chair sells for I don't expect real leather. The arms fold up but do not adjust in height so you can slide the chair under a desk or table for reduce space when not sitting in the chair. The holes for the castors on the wheels are a little loose so the wheels do have some flex/movement. Over time I don't know if the castors may widen the holes and fall out due to the loose fit.I don't usually sit too long in my desk downstairs maybe an hour at a time to do some work, write emails, or browse the web and this chair felt more comfortable than my last mesh bottom chair it replaced. I can't speak to the durability of the chair as I've only had it a few days and usually things like the gas piston or castors on the wheels that wear out first on office/desk chairs and that's typically after months or maybe a year of use. Overall the chair works as designed and is comfortable enough for my uses and I don't have any major complaints.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars comfortable and ergonomic chair', 'author': 'Bella', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'As I spent long hours working at a computer, having a comfortable and supportive chair is essential. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love my chair blanket!', 'author': 'JLLambert', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I work in an office up north (a couple hours from the Canadian border) and I would spend the first half of my day hovering over the space heater b/c it's freezing and they don't run the heat when I'm not here. The convenience factor is off the charts ‚Äì no more searching for a spare blanket or fumbling with layers of clothing. When the AC is pumping in summer, this is great because I can still wear summer clothes for when I'm outside on my walk breaks, but the office is freezing.What I love most about this is its thoughtful design. The blanket wraps around my shoulders and lap, providing just the right amount of warmth without feeling bulky or restrictive. It's like having a personal, customizable cocoon of comfort.The attachment to the chair is secure and doesn't slip or slide, allowing me to move freely without worrying about it falling off. title: Marsail Executive Office Chair with Flip-up Armrests,PU Leather Ergonomic Desk Chair Height-Adjustable Swivel Rolling Computer Desk Chair,Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the price', 'author': 'Tonya R.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This chair was fairly easy to assemble, came packaged well so that all pieces didn't mess up each other in shipping. There is only one thing wrong and that is I think that the wheels should have been bigger or bulkier for the size of the chair, because it can tip over if you are leaning back or rocking with it, if you don't have the wheels a certain way.The chair is very comfortable, I love being able to have armrest or no armrest when needed, love the option to rock or not. The height is adjustable, it is easy to wipe down and hair does not stick to it. Soft and not stiff UP Leather. Definitely happy that I bought it for my new craft/business desk. It is very comfrotable as well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars MSRP should be $20-$30 cheaper', 'author': 'Shawn C', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I have some gripes, but it\'s also a step down from the big comfy high back chair that I\'m used to. It went together with ease and everything was masked when I received it, so it\'s finishes were perfectly preserved. Not a single scratch....I was happily surprised. It feels solid and durable and provides some good lumbar support. I like the wheels and they are able to let me move around with ease, even on a thicker carpet. The tuck-away armrests are a nice touch that I\'m getting used to.The chair itself feels like it would fit a shorter person much more comfortably because the back only comes up even with my shoulders (I\'m 5\' 9"). I wish this thing had a headrest and had I paid attention to the backrest meaurements, I would\'ve never looked at it twice.I\'ve been through quite a few office chairs in my lifetime and quite a few have proven their worth in cost vs comfort, so I have a pretty good sense of what works for me. As for the $150+ price tag (I paid $109 after coupon)... it\'s more like an $80 chair with some manufacturer gouging for good measure.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to assemble and super comfy', 'author': 'Neil J', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It was a great fit for my office.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars comfy', 'author': 'Cathy', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Chair is comfy but would be better if the arm rests are adjustable to be completely ergonomic.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Moveable arms', 'author': 'Judy M', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Steal of a price. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Big Ass Chair!!', 'author': 'John B', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This chair is HUGE! and its SO comfortable!! it even has a lumbar support for your back! this is a thick boiiiii, staples and office max don't even have a chair close to this good for this price and quality, if you need a computer chair to sit in for long periods of time or even take naps in this is your chair. Well before the time they estimated. I weight 350 lbs and I am 6\'6" tall. Chair feels sturdy. Wheels roll well. I thought it was going to be too low to the floor but its a good height. I wish I had watched the assembly video before I purchased it. It shows the chairs features better than just the pictures. The back of the chair goes past my shoulders.I keep hitting my heel on the edge of the caster. My previous chair it was rounded over the wheels. On this one it angles up, so if I move my foot back without thinking, I hit it on the metal and it hurts ( at home office wearing sandal type footwear.I fit in the seat, but my last chair had open arm rests that you could lift. From the picture I thought you can lift these, but they are in place. Other large people may feel a bit squished. I feel squished.The lumbar support digs into my back. Even when you put it to the minimum I feel something pressing into my back uncomfortably.Putting the back on was not fun. The video shows laying the chair on its side, while the instructions show it from and angle that now I realize mean lay it on the floor. I didnt want to damage the material, but that method would probably have helped. I dont like that some of the bolts dont snug into their sockets. they grip and then get loose. maybe this is a feature to keep from stripping the threads or maybe they are just cheap.I will come back in a month to give an update, but as of now, I wish I had paid more and gotten a different chair design. title: BANTI Premium High-Back Office Chair, Suede Desk Chair with 3D Adjustable Armrest, Headrest, and Adjustable Height Tilt for Home Office and Executive Comfort, Brown
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars most comfortable chair ive ever owned', 'author': 'Staciamedusa', 'rating': 5, 'content': "i really love this chair. it really is the most comfortable chair I've ever had. it's not super big and bulky either, which is nice because I needed it to be able to sit under my table and sit flush against it. it does that. It leans back quite a bit. it was jarring the first time it went back on me, and i felt like i was going to fall over on my head.the only complaint i have is how long it took for the smell to leave the chair. it took almost 2 months and you can still smell it faintly. it's a really strong chemical smell that permeates throughout the room. I had to take it outside for the first couple of weeks and keep it in the garage to try and quicken the process of scent elimination.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Its good', 'author': 'David Gilmour', 'rating': 4, 'content': "It's good, solid and feels like it's made from good materials. The only other stand out thing is that the lowest height is perfect for my desk and it goes higher from there, so that could either be a good thing or a bad thing. All my other chairs max position is barely enough to get to where my desk is so I figure that may be a make or break aspect.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy, comfy, and leans back far', 'author': 'Lisa', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Don‚Äôt mind that the photos are in our dirty garage, but we really like this chair. It‚Äôs sturdy, comfy, and reclines back pretty far. It took about 30 minutes to put together, you get all the hardware you‚Äôll need. The material is soft, and looks like leather but isn‚Äôt. The back comes up really far which makes it comfy to sit in, and when you lean back it reclines so much you feel like you‚Äôre going to fall over. Has wheels so it can roll around. My dad wanted a ‚Äúfancy chair‚Äù for his garage table and has been happy with it, so much so that he‚Äôs even taken a nap in it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Magnificent chair with comfortable design and high and wide seat', 'author': 'Don Miller', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is the best-looking office chair I've ever had. The material is plush and sophisticated. The brown color perfectly complements the other wood features that I have in my office, making this a real winner.The wheels aren't too loose, so the chair stays in place while you're sitting in it but rolls around easily. This seat is a little wider than other office chairs I've had, and I think it's better if you have wide hips.It also sits a little taller than other chairs. I'm only 5'5 and to sit with feet flat on the floor, I need it at its lowest setting. Otherwise, I use footstool. However, if you're taller, I think this would be a great chair. My wife is a couple inches taller than me and has full hips, and she finds this chair comfortable.The seat is not too far back and is shaped ergonomically. It reclines easily and locks into place for when you want to lean back and think or close your eyes. The height is great, and the headrest is in a perfect spot. These types of highback chairs are a must if you work in an office all day long.I found the armrests to be a little high for me. My problem is I'm short with long arms, so it can be tricky to find a comfortable chair. I would opt for the adjustable armrests in this model, but it's still a premium chair that looks and feels great.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars RUN AND GET THIS', 'author': 'Milia', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This chair by far is the best computer chair ive had, and ever sat in. It comes up pass my neck and head so I have comfort on my neck which is a SUPER PLUS. The chair reclines and goes up and down. When I tell you I feel like a big kid in this chair and im a full adult lol. I almost went to sleep in this chair that's how comfy it is. I wish it had the piece at the bottom to put your feet up, that would set this chair off !!! It took me about 1 hour to put this together by myself. It does come with instructions dont panic , it's in the cushion package. Because I panic when I was unwrapping the screws and parts. Overall a wonderful chair. Also the chair's lowest height is still more than what I have in office.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Absolutely comfortable!!!', 'author': 'HAMZA', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Absolutely thrilled with the BANTI High Back Executive Office Chair! The padded headrest is a game-changer; it's so comfortable during long work hours. The rocking feature adds a touch of relaxation, and the adjustable height and tilt make it customizable to my needs. We definitely recommend at our house.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Much softer than expected!', 'author': 'J K', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Wow I was surprised when I opened this up. title: Big and Tall Office Chair, 450 lbs Ergonomic Office Chair for Heavy Duty with Lumbar Support & 3D Armrests, Home Office Desk Chairs with Extra Wide Seat, High Back Executive Chair,Adults,Grey
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect chair for my needs', 'author': 'Tiffany', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I am 5'5 and this chair is perfect so far for me. The lumbar support hits me in the right spot. It is a more aggressive bump compared to other chairs I've used, but I like it and the mesh fabric gives a little give to make it comfy. After sitting and working for 7+ hours at home it is still comfortable and leaves my back/shoulders/neck feeling good. The curved back is a perfect shape for shoulder and neck support. The arms that move back and forth are nice and stay in place better then i though they would since there is no lock for them. The mesh forms to the body nicely and the footrest is perfect for my height and relaxing my legs. For the price, I am happy with my purchase.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Features and comfort', 'author': 'Jackie Morgan', 'rating': 5, 'content': "It took me a long time to decide which chair I wanted. I looked at our local Staples and here on Amazon and I am very happy with my choice of this chair! This is the first chair that I've had that has a footrest. I like that the footrest matches the rest of the chair's material, unlike the other ones I've seen. The buttons on the sides that are for adjustment of the chair are also really convenient compared to the large ugly levers that most other chairs have. The headrest is nice too. When looking at the other reviews of chairs with a separate headrest, there were several that claimed to have broken easily. A really cool feature this chair has is the ability for the seat bottom to adjust in and out! I hadn't seen that before. The back has 3 different positions it will lock in and stay in place. It also lays way back so you could take a nap on it if you wanted to.One downside to this compared to others is that the lumbar isn't adjustable, but that's ok it's still comfortable. The armrests are hard but I will likely get covers for them, at least they go down enough for it to go under my desk.I am very happy with my purchase. I'm glad that I wasn't impulsive and did the research and found that there was a chair that met all my needs.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good for the money', 'author': 'Nicole H.', 'rating': 4, 'content': "It's not as tall as I like nor does it seem as tall as the description, but it is comfortable and it looks nice.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Funny story...', 'author': 'Mastiffmom', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Holy cow, this chair!I finally placed the order for this chair and next day was being poked by screws from my old chair and wishing that I hadn\'t waited so long. But it arrived a day early, thankfully. I was so impressed by the sturdiness, fit and finish of this throne when first opening the package! I needed something super strong as I have a small herd of giant dogs who don\'t mean to break everything near them but do anyway. This one looked like it would do the job.Got halfway through assembly and could not find the bolts needed for the rest of the assembly. I looked everywhere, and finally looked for a phone number on the instructions. No luck. Ah well, going to have to wait to finish the job but the chair looks really good, especially for the price of just over $100.Started putting the pcs back into bubble wrap and then into the box and lo and behold, the bolts are on a display card, clearly labeled and stuck in the bottom curve of the chair back! Whoot!Ten minutes later, even with the dogs "helping", I\'m sitting in this amazing, comfy chair and finishing my work day.One more thing - tilting it back for the first time, it seemed to get stuck in the semi-reclined position. Found out that leaning all the way back again unstuck it and now it\'s working fine.Wish I had gone with the footrest too. But this is a gem, and solid, too. Plus mesh all around so no ick this summer while working.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable, Adjustable Chair with Good Support', 'author': 'Jane O', 'rating': 5, 'content': "It's hard to buy an office chair without sitting in it, but this chair did not disappoint! The chair is very sturdy with a cushy seat. I like how the seat can be shifted forward along with the arm rests. It provides me great back support and comfort for an 8 hour workday.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars You get less then you pay for', 'author': 'Scott', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'Chair reviewFirst off, if you live in a metro area, this company uses FedEx. No matter what delivery instructions I make through Amazon or on FedEx\'s app, they are completely ignored and packages are left in an area that homeless people often piss.Now for the chair itself:I am a large man. I am 6\' 5", 400 lbs. I know that sounds like a lot but I am surprisingly well distributed if you\'re worried about my dimensions. I have sat in many office chairs from Staples and Best Buy having had worked for both at one point or another. Many of those chairs can be comfortable, even the cheapest of which, but my concern has always been the longevity. After having used this chair a week, that concern is overshadowed by the plethora of issues I have with this chair.The first problem that became apparent is the frame of the seat. The mesh envelopes a sturdy plastic frame that holds it taught and in place. This frame digs into the sides of my but and thighs. It is not immediately painful but after an 8 hour shift, it brings moderate pain like wearing boots all day that dig into your ankle. For another prospective on what size I am for this to affect me, I am large enough that I can feel that digging in my sides from maybe 10% of public chairs, but not enough that I can‚Äôt sit on a plane or even need a seatbelt extension. Then there is the leaning mechanism of the chair. The first day, I was able to get the chair back to stand completely upright but have not been able to do it since. Having a chair with back support that I did not have to lean back in was important to me. It is disappointing that I have not been able to find that in this chair because of an already weak leaning mechanism.The last major issue with the chair is the wheels. They were nearly impossible to put into place and all but one has issues with swiveling. Because of this, I find it nearly impossible to coast around. Did I mention I worked for Staples? During my year there, I put together many chairs for demos and people who paid for assembly. This is the only time I have ever had an issue with brand new office chair wheels. One more minor issue: the leg rest is useless. I paid the extra $40 for it and it barely props up my long legs and feels very wobbly.Overall, I will be looking for a replacement and this chair is going to make its way back to Amazon soon.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Well worth the price', 'author': 'Simone', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Chair was a perfect replacement for my office chair that needed an upgrade. Came shipped in a nice box and was well protected. Chair was easy to assemble and did it myself in about 30 mins. Super comfortable and nice to recline in might add a cushion to heighten comfort. Looks great and sleek in office. The only thing I wish it had was armrest that flip up and out the way just for more customization BUT they are adjustable and yo can change the height.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "3.0 out of 5 stars It's okay - not for tall people", 'author': 'Eric Bashirian', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Actually seems well made. Didn\'t come with some screws but seller rectified. Reclines and height adjustment work. Only problem is the lumbar support sits too low on me, just above my tail bone. Much too low. Can\'t be adjusted. I\'m not extremely tall, 6\'2".', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Lumbar is too high and not adjustable', 'author': 'Just a contractor', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I really like a lot of things about this chair but the lumbar support is just way too high and unadjustable. It feels like they adapted this mesh chair from one with a cushion and forgot to lower the whole back of the chair, leaving the lumbar portion hitting in the middle of your back. (I\'m 5\'9".)I did come up with a "fix"... I unscrewed the two screws holding the lumbar in place and then dropped the whole lumbar down one screw (about 2"). So now it\'s just attached in place by one screw only, instead of two. But that did help. I\'ll probably have to dunk the one screw in some loctite to keep it in place. The lumbar support could still be lower for my liking... If they could fix that issue I might buy the upgraded version.Another thing that could really help make this "perfect" is if the arm rests tilted with the back of the chair when reclining.Other than those two issues... the chair is a VAST improvement over my crappy squeaky Costco mesh chair I bought several years back. Solid 4 out of 5 stars.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Solid chair, but not for the tallest', 'author': 'Larry', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'After using the chair for a week I do like the build quality and style of it. My only gripe is being 6‚Äô9‚Äù tall I am just a little too tall for the leg rest and height of the chair. The leg rest does not extend out far enough so my legs just sag down to the floor. Also, my head is well above the top of the chair so I can‚Äôt rest my head back in any way.Other than that I recommend the chair to anyone under about 6‚Äô5‚Äù especially for the price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: edx Office Computer Desk Chair, Mid-Back Ergonomic Mesh Rolling Work Swivel Task Chairs with Wheels, Comfortable Lumbar Support, Comfy Flip-up Arms for Home, Bedroom, Study, Student, Grey
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable, stylish, affordable', 'author': 'Barbara V.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is even better than a similar, pricier chair I have. Great roomy back pocket. Very comfy seat and back. Very stable. Love that the arms can be retracted out of the way which saves room up against my desk. Super buy! Highly recommend.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love It!!', 'author': 'Caligurl254', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I‚Äôve had this chair for over a week now and have absolutely loved it!The seat itself is comfortable but I do have a seat cushion just to help protect and add extra comfort.Overall it took me 5 minutes to look over and inspect everything and 25 to actually assemble (I timed it). 30 minutes overall.Instructions were included in the seat packaging.The backrest is very comfortable. I love the back pocket as it holds my sketchbook, a book if I‚Äôm reading or my laptop if needed (my desk doubles as a nail painting area so it‚Äôs nice to have a safe spot to put my laptop).The tool that it came with was wonderfully easy to use.My 2 complaints:1. During assembly, attaching the seat to the backrest was kind of tricky. If you have an extra set of hands, assembly could probably be reduced to around 10-15 minutes. It is doable, and manageable, on your own but if you have someone to help, I highly recommend asking. If not, assembly will take closer to the 30-35 minute mark.2. The adjustable features, including height and recline options, cater to individual preferences, making it customizable to diverse user needs.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable and Stylish', 'author': 'Kayla', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The assembly was pretty easy for one person. I used my old office chair to help balance pieces during assembly and accomplished the whole task without assistance.I love that the arms flip up on this chair! When they are down, the arms are soft and padded. I have very sensitive skin and have struggled finding an office chair with comfortable or moveable arms. When I found this chair with adjustable arms, I knew I had to give it a try. I‚Äôm satisfied with the decision!I also like that the material is slick and easy to clean. At first, I was concerned the chair would become dingy quickly but no signs of wear yet! The white plastic material came scuffed but the marks come off with magic eraser.I have found myself using a small pillow for additional lumbar support.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Really Solid Chair for the Price', 'author': 'Chris', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. Got this for my wife, who often has sciatic pain and works a job that lends itself to a lot of sitting/in-front-of-computer time, and overall it has been a good purchase that I think punches above its weight price-wise. Is it a $1000+ desk chair, no. But it was (1) very easy to assemble out of the box, (2) provides pretty good back support with the adjustable mid-back support piece, (3) is easy to raise and lower, and (4) is just overall comfortable.She is around 5\'7" and I\'m 6\'0", and both of us find the height of the chairback to be appropriate (although we both prefer there to be no headrest on this sort of chair, so if you prefer to have one, be aware that this doesn\'t hit above your shoulder blades or lower neck depending on your height). We\'ve had the chair for around four months now and all of the adjustable features still work the way they\'re supposed to, and we\'re just as happy with it as when we first put it together.One con worth flagging: adjusting how easy it is to rock back and forth should take less effort than it does. The lever that controls the seat height (by pulling up or pushing down, as is the case with most desk chairs) also locks or unlocks the chair\'s rocking feature (by pulling out to unlock or pushing in to lock). That works well enough. Once you\'ve unlocked the chair so that it can rock, you can then adjust how easy it is to rock using a knob on the underside of the seat. The problem is that the knob is much, much harder to turn, and requires many more turns, than it should be. This isn\'t a huge deal for us since our preference is generally to leave the chair in its easiest-to-rock setting, but it requires a surprising amount of effort and number of turns to go from the easiest-to-rock setting to the hardest.That said, while a bit annoying that con certainly isn\'t a dealbreaker all things considered (especially the price). We\'d recommend the chair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice overall, but seat is vinyl, not cloth', 'author': 'C. M. Ryan', 'rating': 4, 'content': "It's a nice chair, however, the part you park your butt on is plastic/pu. I hate that. No breathability. I would not buy it again.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Affordable, comfortable WFH chair', 'author': 'Madi', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I needed to purchase a chair for my WFH job but didn\'t want to spend hundreds of dollars on something. I am very pleased with my purchase and a few months into using this chair for 6-7 hours a day, 5 days a week, I can say that I would recommend it to folks who need an affordable and comfortable office chair. It is not as "ergonomic" as other, more expensive chairs, but it does what it needs to! It was easy to assemble as well, which is a huge plus from me.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent office chair', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Sat on this for 2 weeks to get a good feel on how comfortable it is. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Light-weight basic office chair, good quality', 'author': 'Jacob J.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. And I've had no issues.I also love that the height is adjustable.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 12, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfy', 'author': 'Drew Orban', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Great office chair! Love the adjustable arms and it swivels flawlessly. Material has lasted up very well!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 16, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars great chair, not for big and tall.', 'author': 'J jonah', 'rating': 4, 'content': "These types of office chairs are usually copies of high tech Ur-chairs like the Aero or Cherryman. I have a cherryman eon, which this seems to be derived from. It is nowhere NEAR as sturdy as the cherryman, and isn't meant to be at 1/6 the price.I was pleasantly surprised putting this together - the spider-base that holds wheels - the weak link of office chairs, is actually METAL on this model. The casters are above average too. I usually replace them with rollerblade-type wheels, but these were good enough not to. Compared to chairs at the local officedespot, I'd say this chair represents 50-75% bargain in price.It's sits nicely, the lumbar support isn't aggressive, which I appreciate - on some chairs it feels like it's pushing me off. The only cons are - The seat could use more cushioning for long hours. Also it's just not heavy duty enough for heavy sitters. If you are under 200lbs, this chair should be on your list of chairs to consider. If you are over 250 you need a stronger chair. I'm right in the middle, and I like it fine for an hour or two, but I don't feel secure leaning way back on it. Other than that, it's worth it's price and then some.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 25, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great value Chair for the price!', 'author': 'Ira Tolley', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We absolutely love this chair. First, it looks smaller and the fact that it‚Äôs only around $100 made me think this is going to be another cheap chair. However, when I started to put it together, I noticed how wide and padded the base of the chair was. The back even has a lower lumbar support similar to those expensive office chairs, and it works extremely well.It was also very easy to put together, took me about 20 minutes with all the screws. The only thing to keep in mind is that the arms do not raise and lower in terms of height adjustment. They only lift away, so you choose to use the armrest or not. I would‚Äôve preferred ones that lifted up and down, but for the price I can‚Äôt really complain too much.If you‚Äôre looking for an inexpensive office chair that feels comfortable and offers lower lumbar support, this is a great choice. I am thoroughly satisfied.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 20, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Wont lock', 'author': 'Wander lust', 'rating': 2, 'content': "I have heavily used different office chairs in the past especially during pandemic, but I can't seem to be making this one work. I literally sat on it/ hopped/jumped on it to see if the height adjustable thing works but it just won't lock at any place until it reaches it bottom limit height. I have tried several times and even dismantled it and put it again to see if I made a mistake while assembling but nothing happened.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 1, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Fine as a temporary chair... see update', 'author': 'Jeff l.', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'Lasted just over a month before leaning back snapped the back off. updated stars to one.This would make for a fine temporary chair but, I can‚Äôt see it as a good long term choice or one for use in an office environment. As they say, ymmv. I am liking the mesh back. As hot as it has been, it‚Äôs a relief.Pro-Easy & quick assembly-Mesh back allows for a cooler back. Nice-Folding arm rests. I like being able to move the arms out of the way. I can play guitar with this chairCon-Flimsy build feel. When leaning back you feel the back frame twist and bend. It‚Äôs disconcerting. It may be fine, flexing can prevent snapping, but it does not inspire confidence.-The base of the chair‚Äôs 5 arms are screwed on. I‚Äôve never had a chair assembled like this. I‚Äôve included a -photo, judge for yourself. To me this is not a sign of long term durability.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 6, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Probably not a long term solution', 'author': 'Richard L. Yauman', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I really like the look of this chair and the mesh back is good for air circulation so that your back stays cool and it was easy to assemble but the chair does have few down points. Sitting on the chair the seat is lumpy and it is a hard lumpy, so it would be uncomfortable to use this chair for a long period without putting a cushion down. It flexes... a lot. When you move you can feel the different parts flexing in different directions, it does not give a great feeling of security. The armrests are useless. In the picture they look like they are at a good height but when the unit is put together it turns out they are fairly low so if your butt has any kind of padding they may be to low to be of use. If you have just $100 to spend it may be worthwhile but if you can afford to spend a bit more it may be worth looking at something else.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 20, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good for home office, wish it adjusted more', 'author': 'J M', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I recently started working from home and got this to use in my home office. It was easy to put together and seems very sturdy. I like that you can flip the armrests up to get them out of the way when you don‚Äôt want to use them. I do wish it had more options for adjusting. For example, when in use, the armrests are at one height only. The chair seat has a lever to raise or lower it. It also allows you to unlock the chair to allow rocking, or to lock it to prevent rocking. I do wish there was an option to allow for tilting of the seat. I suffer from a bit of sciatica and find a seat that‚Äôs sloped toward the floor helps a lot. This seat is perpendicular to the ground and isn‚Äôt adjustable. Also the back being made of mesh is nice to allow air flow and prevent excess sweating, but I wish it had a bit more lumbar support. All in all a nice chair for a home office if you‚Äôre just starting out or want something basic.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 15, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Actually really good', 'author': 'Stationary Veteran', 'rating': 4, 'content': "When you're talking about $100 office chairs you have to temper your expectations. In this day and age you can spend $1000 on a chair if you really want to, chairs with many levels of adjustment. This chair is obviously not that BUT for the price I think its very good.Other reviewers have covered the important stuff. The mesh back is breathable and quality. The components are sturdy and it was easy to assemble. The one thing that I knocked off a star for was the padding on the seat. I do think it needs more to be comfortable for 3+ hour sitting sessions. I got a gel cushion to mitigate this problem and now I really like it. Double the amount of padding in the seat (or increase it 50%) and this would be an easy 5 stars.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 12, 2023', 'is_verified': False}]

title: Ergonomic Office Chair, High Back Home Office Desk Chair with Lumbar Support, Computer Task Chair with Wheels, Swivel Adjustable Executive Chair for Home Office,Blue
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very Pleased with this', 'author': 'Rosieminnie', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I like this chair a lot. The adjustability on this chair is easy and accessible. I got this for a paralegal in my office. She is a smaller/shorter person, and this chair‚Äôs ability to adjust has been very convenient for her. I am but a few inches taller, and it works for me too. My boss has also used it and he is over 6 feet and he is sitting comfortably in the chair.The arms are flexible and versatile. I replaced all the chairs in the office, her only request was that she has a chair without arms. I could not find one that is ergonomic so this was a big compromise. She was able to move her arms out of the way.The back arch is comfortable as well as the cushion on the seat itself. It rolls smoothly and is not heavy at all. A few of us in the office have back issues, including her. It has helped out a lot. She does not need to add an extra cushion as she did with the first chair she had.Assembling the chair was not difficult and could be put together in 30 minutes. Maintenance helped us put it together, but they took the least amount of time with this particular chair.I do have some con, personally, I wouldn't say I like the color, but the paralegal has not complained. It was supposed to be gray but came out more white than anything.Overall, It is a good chair. I recommend it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 22, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars High Quality', 'author': 'Anna', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This is definitely a high quality chair. The only reason for a 4 star is the seat doesn‚Äôt really lean back unless you‚Äôre propping your feet up and putting force to hold yourself. It‚Äôs not so much a downside for me as it may be for someone else though. I really like it and it was easy to assemble, as I managed to do it 30 weeks pregnant and unable to bend. It definitely gives me the support I need on my back and hips. When it‚Äôs sitting as low as it can go, my feet perfectly touch the ground (I‚Äôm 5‚Äô3‚Äù). I highly recommend it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 15, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Super nice chair', 'author': 'LDL', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Looks great, feels super comfy.Assembly:Although very simple and took less than 30 minutes there was a typo on the 2nd step. The icon shows it requires "B" screws but the written instructions call for "A" screws. If you only go by the diagram you won\'t have enough B screws for the whole build, you should follow the written paragraphs.Besides that assembly was a breeze.Durability:Really like how sturdy the metal base is. It is solid, I can move and jostle around without any hesitation that I\'ll flip over. All pieces are well made, from the fabric to the plastic handles to seat cushion, everything is good quality and durable.Comfort:Very comfortable. Usually lumbar supports are only slightly supportive and I end up using my own cushion. This built in lumbar support is surprisingly good. It\'s wide enough to be comfortable even when turning left or right and has just the right amount of give to support without being uncomfortably stiff.The fabric is not extremely soft, but it\'s not scratchy which is the main thing. Feels very comfortable to use and is also very breathable, especially the lumbar support.I like the height of the arm rests, they\'re out of the way but there if you need to rest your arms on it. Perfect height for me.Overall this is a great chair. While it does lack the adjustment options that some other chairs have, this is one of my new favorite chairs. It\'s a simple chair that\'s solid in all areas and a perfect fit for my height and size. Also looks really nice and was a breeze to assemble.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 7, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I love this thing; BUY IT!', 'author': 'Brandi Cambric', 'rating': 5, 'content': "So first off, the box has some weight to it so be careful when lifting, especially if you have back or shoulder issues. It's not heavy that it requires 2 people, but it's heavier than expected.Now that we've covered that, let's get into the chair. It's amazing! It took a bit to get going because I wanted to be sure I had all of the parts, which I did. The instructions had only one minor misstep in Step 2; the written instructions state to use A bolts, but the diagram shows that you use B bolts, and the issue is that you use all of the B bolts in Step 1. A minor oversight but not enough to complicate putting the chair together.Also in Step 2, when you have to insert the back into the seat, ensure that you slide the right part of the back into place; you'll know you got it wrong if the spacing between the screw holes is too large since the screws used are short. You will also need to wiggle the pieces a bit to get them to line up so you can insert the screws.The arms easily fold up and out of the way and the cushion is very thick and comfortable.All of that aside, assembly is quick (less than 20 minutes total) and easy. It sits high but it very comfortable! I highly recommend this chair, especially for this who work from home and have to sit for long periods of time. Game changer!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 10, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars OK chair, but low arms make it unusable', 'author': 'Hailey', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Unfortunately, I cannot us this chair for my family because the low arms are too low for our elbows to rest when sitting straight up. For us to use them, we would have to slouch, which is not ideal. For reference, my spouse and I are about 5\' 8" and 5\' 10". The blue color seems accurate to the images, though the actual appearance isn\'t that appealing - it looks a little busy. Aside from the low arms, the position of the back and the neck don\'t seem to offer the best support. The positives are that the adjustable height is really nice and useful, the cushion is well padded, the casters roll well, the chair swivels smoothly, and it was easy to assemble.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 30, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My new favorite chair that is adjustable anywhere I want it to be', 'author': 'Daniel Walz', 'rating': 5, 'content': "First and foremost, this chair offers exceptional comfort. The high-back design provides excellent lumbar support, which is crucial for long hours of work. The padding is plush and keeps me at ease throughout the day, making it a pleasure to sit and be productive.Assembly was a breeze, and I had the chair ready for use in no time. It's always a plus when a piece of furniture comes together without a hassle. The simple instructions and quality components made the process a smooth one.What stands out for me is the chair's adjustability. Not only can I tailor the height to my liking, but the armrests are also adjustable, allowing me to find the perfect ergonomic position. It's evident that the chair has been designed with the user's comfort and well-being in mind.The sleek and professional appearance of this chair complements my home office decor. It adds a touch of sophistication, and the high-quality materials are noticeable. The sturdiness of the chair is reassuring, ensuring its durability over time.All in all, this Executive Home Office Chair checks all the boxes for what I need in a work chair. It's comfortable, easy to assemble, and highly adjustable. I particularly appreciate the lumbar support and the versatility it offers. For these reasons, it easily deserves a 5-star rating in my book.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 12, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars A better than average task chair for the price.', 'author': 'Kevin Nicholls', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I think the manufacturer is being more than a little generous in calling this an "executive" chair. But as an upgrade from a basic task chair, it\'s pretty nice for what you\'d pay.Assembly wasn\'t mysterious to me at all. The box it comes in is surprisingly good for using as a support if you\'re putting it together on your own, though the included hex wrench isn\'t great. Enough to get the job done, but if you have hex sockets, it makes the job a lot faster and easier.The chair is reasonably comfortable for a task chair. The lumbar support felt okay to me, but isn\'t adjustable, so if it hits you in a strange way, you\'re kind of stuck with it. Same goes for the armrests. Your choices there are "armrests, or no armrests". And the pneumatic cylinder isn\'t appreciably different from other cylinders in this range, besides being powder coated in white.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 13, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Back Support', 'author': 'kris m.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I ordered this product to replace my old, worn out desk chair and am so glad that I did! It is beautiful and insanely comfortable! I particularly appreciate the lumbar support as I have severe lumbar stenosis and my old chair didn't have this feature. I also sometimes like to pull my chair in super close to my desk but standard arms prevent that. The flip up arms allow me to do this. The chair rolls very well and overall is very sturdy and well-made.Like other reviewers, I had trouble making sense of the instructions. I appreciate the way they packaged the pieces and screws for easy assembly, but errors in the instruction booklet made it confusing at first. To help anyone else who sets up this chair, I've marked out the corrections that should be made. I have also marked out the additional piece that is not included with the chair.I highly recommend this desk chair especially if you are specifically looking for low back support!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 14, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars lumbar support doesn't adjust", 'author': 'Jodi', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The chair is nice from the looks point of view. Blue and white pretty executive chair. High back, swivel chair with lumbar support, however the lumbar support doesn't adjust so may be good for some and bad for others depending on your body type. Arm rests are moveable. chair rolls easily and is comfortable for long periods of time. Overall, I would recommend.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 19, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good Purchase', 'author': 'Virgo Queen', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Good chair, it is well made and the seat cushion is very comfortable. My only complaint would be that the ergonomic part that provides support for your back should be more up, around mid-back which is where more support is needed. Or they should've added a smaller one in that area, for the price that it has it should be more comfortable.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 17, 2023', 'is_verified': False}]

Hence the 5 Star rating!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Work from home surprise.', 'author': 'Alfonz M.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I\'m in a job that originally had no work from home (WFH) option. Well, COVID happened and now my job is four days telework and one day in the office. While I do enjoy this schedule, my previous WFH chair was not up to the task of supporting my fat ass. As the current schedule will continue, my ( male, 5\'10", 245 lbs.) body needed a good WFH chair that did not break my budget. After looking at several different options at my local "office supply store" the conclusion was that the mesh type of chairs are out and the costs were not realistically aligned with the quality of the seating experience. Their solution to my issue was very quick and 100% perfect as far as I\'m concerned.
