title: Darkecho Criss Cross Chair with Wheels,Thick Padded Fabric Cross Legged Wide Chair with Pocket Spring Cushion,Comfortable Adjustable Computer Office Task Vanity Chair for Home Office,Bedroom,Beige
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars BETTER than the viral TikTok chair!!! Worth the price!! Not cheap looking at all!', 'author': 'Lauren M. Faul', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'So first of all, if you‚Äôre looking for a chair that you can comfortably sit crisscross in this is it. When researching a new office chair since I work from home, it was important to me to find a chair that had enough padding in the seat so that it wouldn‚Äôt degrade quickly and that I could genuinely sit comfortable crossing my legs and not hit any pressure points. This chair seat is so thick that I can push on it with all my weight in my hand and I don‚Äôt touch a bottom panel at all. It is all cushion. And it is so wide I am almost blown away. I am not a tiny girl and I could sit two of me on this comfortably.I‚Äôm not really sure why people are saying that it looks cheap. I got the black PU leather with the gold legs and the leather feels luxurious. It feels sturdy. The gold looks lovely and honestly the wheels move really well. I thought they were going to be cheaper and I would have to replace them right away but they glide really well for stock wheels.Also, whoever provided a negative review, because their box came with gloves, who cares? Mine had gloves and they don‚Äôt even look worn. So complaining about that is just silly.Everything arrived safe and sound no damages and well packed.Assembly was quick and simple.Basically, if you struggle with sitting in a regular office chair and you are always on 1 foot or need to cross your legs to be comfortable look no further, and just buy this chair. The ones on TikTok have a significantly flatter seat cushion and look like it would actually hurt your ankles when the padding gets flat, so spend the extra money and get this specific chair. Not to mention office chairs can get extremely expensive if they‚Äôre higher quality and this one is perfectly priced for just how good it is.I‚Äôm not kidding when I say that the pictures do it justice with just how thick and comfortable the padding is. I can‚Äôt speak to how the fabric version is particularly but just know for the leather ones that it‚Äôs plush.I‚Äôve been using it for a couple of days now and I just love it but if anything changes I will update.I only ever really write reviews for things that really surprised me or would highly recommend to friends and family so stop looking at cheaper alternatives and just get this one.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Poor Quality, Returning', 'author': 'Anna M.', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'Just received this chair, opened the box and there was gloves left in it, thought that was a little strange but accidents happen. Then proceeded to assemble the chair and in my opinion it is terrible quality. There are indents all over the back rest (cardboard material) so probably from shipping but after spending $150.00 and being brand new, I‚Äôm not to happy about this. Also the material isn‚Äôt a soft linen as described. It is more of a rough mesh material. On to the structure of the chair, it is unusually designed the chair is really large (lengthxwidth) compared to the backrest, it also dips in and curves down toward the back. Which causes you to feel like you‚Äôre leaning back or more prone to falling back. It is not leveled. Also, this requires two people to put together due to the seat being so thick, one person needs to squeeze it together to screw on the bottom of the chair. Overall, this product is not as advertised and poor quality. Will be returning. Lesson learned on purchasing a product with no reviews.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Funtional And Comfortable Office Chair', 'author': 'wendy yang', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought the white one. It was super easy to put together. Thankfully I read the reviews . It makes me a lot easier to assemble the chair. The instructions for this are literally 4 steps that make it seem super easy. This chair only took me a few minutes to put together and it is very sturdy and elegant look. I was a bit hesitant about the sheer width of the chair but having used it for a couple days now I can say that it‚Äôs quite comfortable. I love the height of this chair as well. I can sit in different ways and it is so free to get up in a different direction. That's almost impossible to do for a regular computer chair. It's very comfy to sit on, and is well worth the price. The delivery was quick and they delivered right in front of my door.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice cushy chair.', 'author': 'Lisa Rides Again', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Nice looking chair. Was easy to put together. Attaching the back took a bit of balancing, but it wasn't too difficult. To whoever commented that they left gloves in the package, those are there intentionally. They are brand new, and they are to use so you don't get lubricant on your hands when attaching the screws. There's a little lubricant on the washers. Also, the gloves make it a lot nicer using the Alan wrench. It's a nice chair, very deep and def room to cross your legs.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Best Desk Chair Ever', 'author': 'AC', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I bought this chair on a leap of faith when there were zero reviews (at the time). I was intrigued by the viral TikTok crisscross chair but doubted the quality. This chair had springs and high density foam so technically it should last. I‚Äôve had the chair two months so far and no problems. It looks luxe, sits comfortable and I love the size. I can sit in the chair with both my dogs. They love the chair even more than I do, as they are constantly jumping on and off the chair or taking naps on there. I love that my husband can WFH and cuddle with the dogs at the same time so they never have to cry for attention again. The only hiccup is that my chair came without any instructions so it was extremely hard to put together as the leg required attaching each spigot individually. It required some muscle for sure. But the trade off is that it made for a much more sturdy base compared to the usual plastic office chair bases that you just pop on. I‚Äôm confident this chair will last. I‚Äôm glad I bought this chair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Defective', 'author': 'Haley', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'The chair was impossible to put together and we realized that the mechanism that holds the legs in place (which is a very cheap and flimsy piece of plastic) was incorrectly made. Do not buy', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars chair is sturdy and beautiful', 'author': 'Amy chen', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought this non-porous chair for my son to use on her desk while she does homework. This is a sturdy chair that is comfortable to sit in all day long. Overall, this is a good value chair. my son loves it", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice chair!', 'author': 'meiyan jiang', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I received the chair promptly, and it looked pretty close to what the photo show. This is a great chair - super comfortable, great size, adjustability in height is spot on, quality of metal parts look really good, and the back comfort is great. The chairs were pretty easy to assemble. The instructions for assembly were easy to follow, all parts were labeled, all tools needed were included,and it took me about half hour to fully assemble it. My son loves this chair for his desk. I would recommend getting the one with wheels if you need to move around a lot.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Assembly tested my patience.. but chair seems to scratch the ADHD itch', 'author': 'Allison', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'After a couple of shipping delays due to weather, the box finally made it to my porch. I had a private unboxing for my dog, who was unimpressed, but highly anxious because I was sitting on the floor. I had assembled a similar chair back in November but had talked myself out of the wheely option, hence this purchase. I steamed into assembly with the confidence of a toddler in a superhero costume, only to be thwarted by the hellistic chamber that hold the legs. I don\'t know if the ring to hold the flanges at the end of the legs was purposely made to be infinitesimally too small to drive you into a self-doubting spiral or if it\'s just suppose to be that snug, regardless, I had to pull out my hand hammer to "assist" the final leg into it\'s groove, only to have the whole thing to collapse like the death star once I placed it in my trunk to transport it to my office. Luckily I was able to restore the delicate balance on the floor of my office and hopefully I won\'t end up on my ass by the end of the day but who doesn\'t like a little drama in the workplace?Parting words: super thick seat, pretty stinking deep, as well (i might need a pillow). DEF enough room to sit cross-legged comfortably. Rolls fairly easily, still considering rubber wheels though. Seems to be a good alternative to the expensive ADHD chairs out there. Fingers crossed it holds up!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars GET THIS ONE', 'author': 'Molly K.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I took a gamble buying this particular version because it had less than 10 reviews. I chose this one over others because it had springs in the seat instead of just foam. I‚Äôm heavier than most chair weight limits at 250+lbs, and my partner over 350 lbs. I needed something I knew would support us, and I‚Äôm very satisfied with the main chair piece. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô9‚Äù and my partner over 6‚Äô5‚Äù; we can both very comfortably sit criss-cross on this chair. It‚Äôs a couple inches wider than some others on Amazon.I did upgrade the lift/piston and base to a white, and heavier duty versions. Both support over 500 lbs. I also upgraded the wheels to rubber ones instead of plastic so it won‚Äôt scratch my floors (which I already had on my previous office chair).My complaints:I purchased the beige fabric chair and it appears more grey in person.I don‚Äôt like the chair tilt. Yes I can adjust it so it won‚Äôt tilt all the way back, but it‚Äôs cheap parts and it does tilt slightly into that locked position. I will likely try to replace this piece or configure it so it does not move or tilt the slightest. I do worry about the longevity of the connecting piece from the back to the bottom seat (you will have to assemble yourself). The back of the seat has a metal piece that curves to under the bottom of the seat, and screws in with 4 screws (Allen wrench provided). My concern is this piece bending over time, away from the seat. Another reason to prevent the chair from tilting.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

All tools needed to complete the chair were included.I find the chair quite comfortable, but some might find it to be too firm. The back of the chair reaches to my shoulder blades (I'm 5'6 for reference), so neck and head support are lacking. The arm rests are a little too low for me to use comfortably and appear to be more decorative than functional. It can be adjusted up and down, and it does so with ease-it glides nicely in both directions. I can't attest to the quality of the wheels since my chair rests on carpet, but they appear to be of good quality.Overall, I would recommend this chair.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Pretty but...', 'author': 'Sherylncs', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Pros: Arrived quickly, easy to assemble, very pretty, sturdy, reasonable price.Cons: NOT comfortable - the seat is small so you won\'t be sitting back far, no give in the backrest so you are sitting very straight, and there is no "cushion" (the seat is very hard).Good gift for a co-worker you don\'t like or a temp employee you don\'t want to keep.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars I've purchased THREE!", 'author': 'E.Kaz', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These are such great little chairs and I've purchased two more since my original purchase for my daughter. title: Ergonomic Home Office Desk Chair Adjustable Height Computer Chairs, Grey
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Value for money', 'author': 'Mk', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the NEWBULIG Ergonomic Home Office Desk Chair in Grey, and I couldn't be happier with my decision. This chair has truly transformed my home office experience for the better.First and foremost, the ergonomic design is a game-changer. The chair provides excellent lumbar support, ensuring that I maintain proper posture throughout the day. As someone who spends long hours at the computer, this feature alone has significantly reduced the strain on my back and neck.The adjustable height feature is another highlight of this chair. Whether I'm working at my desk or taking a quick break, I can easily customize the height to suit my needs. It's incredibly convenient and ensures optimal comfort no matter the task at hand.The grey color option fits perfectly with my home office decor, adding a touch of modern elegance to the space. The fabric is of high quality and feels durable, giving me confidence that this chair will stand the test of time.Assembly was a breeze, thanks to the clear instructions provided. Within minutes, I had the chair fully assembled and ready to use. The build quality is exceptional, with sturdy construction and smooth-gliding casters that make movement effortless.Overall, the NEWBULIG Ergonomic Home Office Desk Chair has exceeded my expectations in every way. It combines comfort, style, and functionality seamlessly, making it the perfect addition to any home office. If you're in the market for a new desk chair, look no further than this fantastic product. Highly recommended!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Basic and Comfortable High Back Office Chair', 'author': 'Biggins48', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I recently picked up this high back office chair. My old one was getting pretty worn out after three and a half years, especially since I work from home and use it a lot. I usually don't spend a lot on chairs, but my last one, despite being a bit pricey, didn't last as well as I hoped. The leather started to wear out in less than two years and it wasn't as comfortable anymore.What drew me to this new chair was its reasonable price, especially for a high back model. I don't often lean back, but when I do, I like having good back and neck support.The chair was delivered in good packaging. I've added photos of it before and after opening, so you can see how well it was packed. I've put together quite a few office chairs before, so assembling this one wasn't a big deal. The instructions were clear and the screws were nicely sorted into different compartments, which made it easier. It took me about 18 minutes to put it together using the tool provided, but if you have your own allen wrench, it might be a bit quicker. Overall, the assembly was simple and straightforward.After putting it together, I noticed a few things. The chair doesn't have those little screw covers that some other chairs come with. It's not a huge issue, but those covers usually make the chair look nicer. The lumbar support isn't adjustable, but it's made of a soft mesh material that's quite comfortable. I didn't feel the need to adjust it. The neck support is really good ‚Äì it's adjustable, so you can get it just right when you lean back. That's a big plus for me. The seat cushion is also firm and covered with the same cloth material as the back. Coming from an older, well-used chair, this was a noticeable change, but I prefer a firmer seat. I'll have to wait and see how it holds up in terms of warmth and breathability.The chair feels sturdy now that it's assembled, and I could adjust it to my liking. One thing to note is that the armrests don't lift up. They're fixed, so you can't raise them to slide the chair under a desk, which might be a downside for some. But overall, considering the price, I think it's a good value. I'm happy with the chair and hope to use it for a long time.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 7, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The Perfect Blend of Comfort and Style!', 'author': 'Corey Smith', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently got my hands on the NEWBULIG Ergonomic Home Office Desk Chair, and I'm absolutely thrilled with it! This chair not only provides excellent comfort but also adds a touch of modern elegance to my home office.The adjustable height feature is a game-changer, allowing me to customize it to my liking for those long work sessions. The grey color blends seamlessly with my office decor, giving it a sleek and professional look. It's sturdy and well-built, and the ergonomic design provides excellent support.Overall, this chair has exceeded my expectations, making my workdays more enjoyable. If you're in the market for a reliable and stylish desk chair, look no further than the NEWBULIG Ergonomic Home Office Desk Chair.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars FATNASTIC office chair!', 'author': 'shai brown', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I got this for my kids\' office which is where they do their computer work as well as play Xbox. This is fantastic! It\'s ergonomic and comfortable for long writing sessions. I like that the headrest raises and lowers although it doesn\'t really "lock" in place, but that\'s a minor issue. The armrests are a great height and the back is straight and provides good lumbar support. Especially important when you have slouchy teenagers. The mesh fabric means it\'s breathable which is great for extended sitting. Would absolutely recommend, this is one of the most comfy and functional office chairs I\'ve had!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Lumbar support not very helpful, if not makes the chair more uncomfortable.', 'author': 'Bianca E.', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The chair looks exactly as the photo on the store page, however I have mine covered in a blanket with a bottom cushion as extra support for the top half of the lumbar support to make it a bit more comfortable. Without my cushion and using just the provided lumbar support on the chair, I feel like I have to lean back into the chair to make it work and the head support also is too far from my head. Because of how far leaned back I am, I end up pretty far from the desk and don't feel like I have good posture since I'm just leaning back. Other than that it is still pretty comfortable. Don't have any issues with the bottom chair cushion. 4 stars just for the fact that if you don't like to feel like leaning back in your chair you would have to find a workaround.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice chair. Easy assembly, firm support', 'author': 'Musicbookfan', 'rating': 5, 'content': "ASSEMBLY: Easy assembly for this office chair! I assembled it myself and it took my about 45 min, definitely under an hour. All the instructions were super clear. This is something to note as I've assembled plenty of these chairs and not all are as easy as this one.SUPPORT: Good lower back support and the seat of the chair is firm. Some give, enough to be comfortable, but also firm enough to provide support. There's a lumbar support, although I do add a small pillow sometimes mostly for posture. One of my young adult daughters uses this chair the most, she's had a couple lower back surgeries and says the support and comfort are very good.FEATURES: Lever for adjusting, with the words facing upward so it can be read when sitting in the chair, although leaning over to see that has to happen, too. The arm rests are padded. Neck rest is comfortable.Wheels work effortlessly, even on the low carpet we have it on.STYLE: Basic but nice looking. The color is nice too, a good change up from the usual black that most office chairs seem to be. Chair will look nice in most decor.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 17, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Basic chair. Not comfortable for long use.', 'author': 'Yuiesreview', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Overall:This chair is easy to put together. The chair was nicely packaged and compact. Instructions were easy to follow. The chair came with hardware and comes with its own allen wrench. The screws use 1 size allen wrench and are easy to tell which screws go where. The screws come with thread locker to ensure they stay tight after installing. The manufacture includes an extra set of screws which is always good to have for back up.Pros:The chair is designed with ergonomic in mind. Has a little bit of what a chair should have: mesh material, lumbar support, headrest. Seat is soft and plenty of room for me to cross my legs. Chair has rocking feature and adjustable height.Con:The chair is not comfortable for my liking. The mesh fabric is NOT taut: the back is loose and the head rest is unbearable. I can feel my neck rest on the bracing of the headrest and is very uncomfortable for long term use. The lumbar does not have enough lumbar. It does not compliment the curve of my back. Sits flat parallel to the back and does not wrap my back at all. The only thing I find comfortable in this chair is the seat bottom.Conclusion:This chair is not bad at all. Do not steer away from this chair. I am only giving my opinion on what this chair was to me. I have had many chairs over the years ranging from $10 to $800 chairs. From what I learned through my own research and what I find comfortable is very subjective to what you may like or dislike. However, this chair is a big upgrade from a dining chair or folding chair.The price of this chair is very reasonable. However, I find that chairs are an investment. The title states it is ergonomic and I don\'t feel this chair meets that. If it were me, I would save a little more to get a chair that will meet my needs as a "ergonomic chair".', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 19, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars MADE ON THE MORE FIRMER SIDE!!', 'author': 'Bobbie J', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This chair was easy and quick to put together! title: Office Chair Flip Up Arms, Executive Leather Office Chair Ergonomic Desk Chair with Lumbar Support, Adjustable Headrest, Computer Chair Home Office Desk Chair with Rocking Function
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Four layers of thickened spring makes it comfy', 'author': 'Azra', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The soft and high-quality PU leather not only adds a touch of elegance to my workspace but also makes it incredibly easy to clean. The retractable headrest and padded armrests offer additional support, making it ideal for a variety of uses, including offices, homes, conference rooms, gaming tables, and executive desks. The chair's versatility is further enhanced by its 90¬∞ flip-up armrests, a feature that not only saves space but also reduces pressure on the shoulders and neck during prolonged periods of work.The ability to adjust the seat back angle from 90¬∞ to 135¬∞, along with rocking and locking modes, allows me to customize my sitting posture according to my preferences. This level of flexibility is a game-changer for those looking to optimize their comfort throughout the day.Assembling the chair was a breeze, taking only 20-30 minutes with the comprehensive instructions and installation video provided in the package. The after-sales service is commendable, ensuring that any questions or issues are promptly addressed. Overall, this Office Chair is a fantastic investment for anyone seeking a stylish, comfortable, and versatile seating solution for their workspace. title: Vinsetto 7-Point Vibrating Massage Office Chair, High Back Executive Recliner with Lumbar Support, Footrest, Reclining Back, Adjustable Height, Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome seller!', 'author': 'Bruce - local consumer of many things', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I had a minor issue with the chair and the seller went out of their way to make it right. Comfortable chair, easy to assemble. Massage feature is definitely a plus.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Do not buy', 'author': 'Scotty Douglass', 'rating': 1, 'content': "I got this in September. By the end of November it catastrophically gave up the ghost. The up and down died and the base went wonky. The heat and vibrate still work, only you can't sit on it because the base of the seat where it attaches to the post broke loose and you will fall off. The vibrate really does not do much for your sore back, but it does make tons of noise. The heat is nice until it gets to hot and you have to turn it off, no controls. Just off and on. Now my wife is laughing at me for wasting 180 bucks. It sure is a good idea that is poorly executed. And my back still hurts.....", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 4, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect', 'author': 'DiXiE ChiC', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Well made!! Beautiful chair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Overall Good. Happy with purchase.', 'author': 'Sydney Mitchell', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I actually do really like this chair, it\'s far better than the one I had before.The back of the chair does not extend to above my head (I\'m 5\'8") as my previous gaming chair did, so I have to kind of scoot down in the chair to lean my head fully back if I want to rest it like that. The material feels nice and soft, and the cushion to the back and seat are comfortable. I do enjoy the leg rest, it feels a little bit like it wouldn\'t hold a lot of weight, but luckily it suits me fine.Massage/Heat:The massage feature is vibration. It has 5 modes: pulse, press, wave, auto, and normal. 2 Intensities (high and low). 4 massage points: neck, back, lumbar, and thigh. It has a timer for 15, 30, and 60 mins, after which it will turn off automatically. The Heat feature is a separate button to be pressed when the power is turned on. You can use it with the massage feature or solo, but to do it solo you would have to individually turn off each of the 4 massage points (they each have their own button). I\'ve used this feature often as I like the warmth without the vibration mostly.Both features are a nice little extra touch to the chair for me. I wasn\'t expecting it to be on the same level as an actual massage chair with rollers or something, so it works fine for what I was intending. The heating feature is not as hot as my heating pad, but it adds a nice warmth that I find pleasant without being too hot (which is good because there are only 2 intensity settings for the heat).One Complaint: The only thing about this feature that is annoying is the need to plug the chair in to use it. This wouldn\'t be as much of a problem if I wasn\'t accidentally rolling over the small wire with the chair and then getting worried about it getting stuck in the wheels.Stability:The chair itself feels a little unstable. I\'m not sure if this is the way it was designed or the way we put it together (though we put it together as instructed). The arms wobble from side to side, as does the base of the chair, which does bother me. I think they do that because they\'re not in a "fixed" position, that way when you use the function of reclining the chair the arms can adjust as necessary. They aren\'t as much of an issue for me. It\'s more a problem of feeling like the seat itself rocks a little too much from side to side (right to left not front to back).When I lean back sometimes the chair makes a popping sound (which I figured out is the same sound that happens when you pull the leaver underneath in order to adjust the recline of the back of the chair). I\'m not sure if that\'s functioning as intended or some screw is perhaps not fully right, or maybe poor design.The wheels occasionally feel difficult to slide around on the floor, I think because they all have to turn and align in the same direction, and they don\'t turn immediately when you go to slide away from the desk, so sometimes it feels difficult to move.When my mother (a bigger woman) sat in the chair it made it slide downwards, and this was an issue that happened each time she did it. This makes me think it\'s not meant to hold as much weight as other chairs so be careful with that.Overall for what I needed out of a chair, it\'s been nice. I spent a lot of time researching and looking for a new chair, which was difficult given the fact that I couldn\'t test them out beforehand. I wanted one with a footrest, and massage/heat, that was also soft to sit in. This one fits a lot of the qualities I was looking for, enough so that I can overlook the parts that bother me.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 6, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Seems pretty good so far....', 'author': 'Lindy Fredrick', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Arrived well packaged, assembly took 1 hour, could be quicker if I used a power tool. Left armrest seems a little loose, I'll have to look at that another day. Vibration function seems nice so far, doesn't quite hit my glutes though. The heat feature hits my lower back dead on. I expected more cushion, seems a little firm and thin. I stand 6 foot 2 inches with a 36 inch inseam and my head hits right in the middle of the headrest. The foot rest is an utter failure though, it barely reaches the middle of my calves and I feel like the weight of my legs is putting a significant strain on it ( I weigh in at 215 pounds), I'll stick with putting my feet up on my desk. The seat does not rock but you can set the level of recline and lock it into position when you find your sweet spot. All and all I wouldn't call it luxurious but for the money it's in the ball park.....durability will end up being the real test.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 12, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing desk/ recliner chair!', 'author': 'Sheila Williams', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The chair is amazing. Very comfortable and the massage part never thought it would work so good. Love the part that comes up to put your legs up. I have nerve damage in my feet. I had surgery to repair but it actually made both my feet worse. So I need to keep my feet up under the desk. Sometimes it's not as high as I need but my desk has a shelf where it can go on there to be high enough. But that doesn't matter this chair is soo comfortable I even use it as a recliner. It was very easy to put together. I was able to do it myself. I would tell anyone looking for an amazing chair. This is the chair. All you need to decide is the color. I decided to go with white and I am very glad I did. It pops in my room.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 9, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "2.0 out of 5 stars Looks nice, that's about it", 'author': 'Paul', 'rating': 2, 'content': "I just received this chair.. It is not worth the money. It does look nice.. it is firm to sit in which is nice.. But the assembly , the quality, the function is not in the price range.. This chair should sell around 100.00. The screws and/or the holes to put them in are not all cut right.. take care or they strip.. fortunately I try every screw before complete assembly.. seen this before... not all parts align properly, again fortunate just off a bit so a little force and it will fit.. there is no tension on the recline, it's either locked in place or lean back.. that is the worst design I have ever seen..maybe it's because this is the first chair I bought sight unseen. The arms wobble and the screws are as tight as I can get them. It has to be design because the left is far worse than the right. The massage is ok.. the heat..I can't tell.. I don't feel any. I believe this is the worst buy I ever had from amazon..and there were a couple of returns.. I am choosing not to return this because once I it's assembled it's too difficult to put neatly in the box again, it is were a local store I would bring it back assembled with all the boxes and packing ... but that's not a choice with amazon. I've learned an expensive lesson.. Some things on amazon are just not worth it...and the review while helpful are probably tainted.. I review products that have surpassed my expectations because those companies deserve it...I also have written a couple like this, where I would warn others not to purchase this product. Unless they want just ok... nice looking.. have to be careful sitting.. and quality is not in the price range. I do give it two stars because it is nice looking, it is a decent seat..it's just too expensive. and three to me would mean take it or leave it... I believe this is closer to leave it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Please read before you buy.', 'author': 'Kitty and Vei', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The chair was easy to assemble. The cost is WAY TOO HIGH for the quality of the chair. You‚Äôre practically paying for the features. I got this as a gift so I wish I could return it and get my money back but I can‚Äôt. If you‚Äôre looking to buy a comfortable office chair, please KEEP LOOKING ELSEWHERE. The features may seem nice but the quality and comfort is just not with this chair. You will have back problems!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 17, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable chair, easy to assemble, love the massage and heat functions', 'author': 'CAL', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The chair was easy to assemble. The directions were fine, and all the parts were good quality and easy to put together. The arms seem a little wobbly, but they don't feel like they're going to come off or anything; they just wobble a bit.The padding is comfortable but not plush. I put a very soft, fluffy throw blanket on the chair to sit on and it feels extremely comfy like that. The footrest slides out straight from under the seat, and then the padded part flips up and over. It can be a little tricky to get it out when your legs are under the desk, but it's comfortable once it's in place.The height is adjustable, of course, and what I really like is that the back can be adjusted to whatever angle you like and then locked in place. With a lot of chairs, they lean back all the way and there's no way to lock them at a slightly leaned back angle, and I love that this one does that.The vibrating massage function is really nice. The first time I turned it on I wasn't sure how much I liked it, but I tried it for a few minutes, and it really does feel good. It's very customizable, you can pick from neck, upper/lower back, and thighs or any combination of those areas. You can pick whether the massage is continuous, pulsed, in a wave, etc. The massage and heat functions are both on a timer and you can pick from 15, 30 or 60 minutes.The heat function is very nice especially as the weather gets colder. You can have the massage on with or without heat. At first I thought you couldn't have heat without massage, but you can - you turn on massage, turn on heat, and then de-select all the individual massage areas so you just get heat.As a whole the chair is really nice for working from home. It's pretty sturdy, looks and feels nice, and has a bunch of luxurious feeling options like the footrest, massage and heat, and adjustable back. The power cord for the massage/heat is kind of short and gets wound around the base of the chair if I'm not careful but I guess there's not a good way around that. All together I'm very glad I got this chair, I enjoy using it, and I'd recommend it to others.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 15, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Hard cushions', 'author': 'avtx1300', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Cushions are like sitting on a park bench.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Office Chair 500lbs Ergonomic Mesh Desk Chair for Heavy People, Heavy Duty Big and Tall Office Chair with Wide Thick Seat Cushion, 4D Armrest, Adjustable Headrest & Lumbar Support Computer Chair
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable, solid chair that rolls easily', 'author': 'S Miller', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I\'m actually lighter than the average American male adult at 180ish pounds but I\'ve managed to break at least two office chairs before just by leaning back and stretching. That\'s not a problem with this one - it\'s sturdy and stable. I can stretch out and it doesn\'t strain or tip over.The seat cushion is also quite thick. My last chair didn\'t quite have enough padding. And at 6\'1" I\'ve usually felt like my chairs have been a little bit too low. I still have to put this one at its highest setting to put my feet flat on the floor with my knees at a 90 degree angle, but it does just get there.This chair rolls a lot more smoothly than my last chair, too. I\'m always scooting around the office grabbing stuff from storage so that\'s nice.Assembly was straightforward. I timed myself and without rushing anything it took me a little under half an hour from opening the box to having it fully assembled. The instructions were adequate.There doesn\'t seem to be any way to lock the armrests in place to keep them from rotating, and they rotate easily when bumped, but it doesn\'t seem to be a big deal.It\'s really nice to have a chair that fits me properly. I\'m really hoping it\'ll hold up for several years. So for I\'m very pleased with it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy, Adjustable, and Comfortable Desk Chair', 'author': 'Bob0821', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The box arrives weighing between 60-70 pounds and is well packed. I highly recommend keeping the box intact for use during the assembly process. Assembling the back, seat, and arm rests using the box as an upright assembly table makes it a lot more manageable. The assembly itself takes about 15-30 minutes. There is a video on the website that is very handy. Also the user manual is very well written. All the tools and parts needed (along with some spares) are included and are well labeled.Once assembled, the chair looks really good. In my case, I am replacing a 40 year old leather executive high back chair where rolling the chair has been challenging and the adjustments are limited and not easily done. I like the styling on this chair and I don‚Äôt miss the styling of the previous chair (the only thing it really had going for it). The adjustments are many and easy to operate. The seat is comfortable and the mesh keeps the chair cool and comfortable even with long sittings. The height, tilt, lumbar, arm rests, and head rests have multiple adjustment positions with most accessible while sitting on the chair. Again, the user manual and video on the site are excellent to demonstrate how to operate the many adjustments.I have carpeting in my study as well as an area rug. The chair would be just fine on its own if it was sitting just on carpet. But the large area rug creates a plushness that makes the rollers a little hard to move, so I am continuing to use a glass floor mat. And it rolls incredibly smoothly.I am thrilled with this chair. In my opinion it is an excellent value.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Not for tall folks....', 'author': '6lumbar', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'My boxed appeared as a "opened box item" as the parts were all just in there and not wrapped, screws and wheels loose. The taped up look also gives it away! It is not made for tall folks, made for very wide folks but the headrest does not fit a 6\'3" person. The arms are very small and move without trying. The caster are good, but the chair is hard to keep still and floors. I would have returned this item except my old chair was given away.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars don't like the arm rests", 'author': 'Mom Alameda', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The arm rests are too easily moved, to the point of irritating. they have several options--stay straight or to the right or to the left.. there is no way to lock them in placement so I'm constantly having to move them back where its comfy for me .", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My new favorite chair', 'author': 'Aaron', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love this chair and it Ames working from home so much more comfortable. It arrived pretty quickly and while it took about 45 minutes to put it together, it was pretty easy. The instructions were pretty clear and I followed them successfully. The chair itself is very sturdy and its very heavy duty for anyone who is a little on the bigger side. I am really enjoying the additional built in headrest which makes it more supportive for my neck and back. The curve in the back gives support and the arm rests are also a nice function. I would definitely recommend for anyone wanting to feel like a comfortable executive at home.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Salutrobusto Comfortable Office Chair with Chrome and Premium Blade-Style Casters', 'author': 'BTW', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This office chair is a high-quality chair that's suitable for everyday use in the home or office. The chair is an all-black design with attractive chromed legs and premium blade-style casters. The chair back uses a breathable fabric for comfort while the chair base has a super-thick foam padding great for long hours spent in the office.The included blade-style casters make this chair easy to move around. The chair has a chromed gas lift for height adjustment and the whole chair swivels easily and smoothly. Tilt can be locked/unlocked plus you can lock in a desired amount of tilt which makes this chair perfect for reclining. The back also includes built-in adjustable lumbar support. The headrest and armrests are highly adjustable too.This chair offers more than just comfort and functionality; its chrome accents make it an attractive addition to any workspace.Assembly using the provided instructions was straightforward and I appreciated that the armrests and chair base were pre-marked for proper orientation. A pair of gloves and a high-quality handled hex wrench were provided which really allowed me to tighten all the bolts. Plus each bolt was coated in thread lock for safety.I would highly recommend this chair for its quality, comfort and adjustability.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Ergonomic Excellence: A Review of the Big and Tall Office Chair', 'author': 'Larry Mekus', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently acquired a Big and Tall Office Chair designed for heavy-duty use, and it's been a fantastic addition to our content room. Its assembly was straightforward, making it easy to put together right out of the box. The ergonomic design, particularly how it molds to your back, offers exceptional comfort, which is crucial for those long hours of work or gaming. The wide and thick seat cushion, along with the 4D armrests, adjustable headrest, and lumbar support, enhances the sitting experience, providing both comfort and support. Additionally, the chair's black color seamlessly matches the aesthetic of our content room, integrating well with the overall decor. It's not just a chair; it's a game-changer for anyone looking for comfort and durability in office seating.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing chair, adjustable in every aspect', 'author': 'JM', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love this chair!1. From the start, the assembly was easy with clear instructions and the screws and bolts clearly marked and packaged. The tools required were included and it even included gloves for assembly, not that I needed them.2. What strikes me most about the chair is its sturdiness, it is very sturdy.3. I am very impressed with all the adjustable features it has from the headrest, tension on the back, lumbar support, the recline and the swivel arms.4. The seat cushion is very comfortable. I enjoy sitting in this chair.5. The wheels on this chair are the best I have had on a chair. It moves effortlessly where my other chairs' wheels lock up if they are in the wrong direction or they just aren't as smooth.The one thing I might caution of is the initial height of this chair seems a bit taller than others potentially. This does not bother me because I am 6' but for shorter people, they may not find it as accommodating.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Damaged', 'author': 'kerin', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'It‚Äôs feels as cheap as I expected and that‚Äôs ok I understand what I bought but there is now to message the seller about the item being damaged in the box. I found the broken piece towards the end of assembling it and would rather not tear it back down and wait 2 more weeks for a replacement.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Made for short people', 'author': 'Gimpy', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'I am 6‚Äô4‚Äù tall. title: Hbada Office Chair with 2D Adjustable Lumbar Support, Ergonomic Office Chair with Adjustable Headrest and Armrest, 145¬∞ Stepless Tilt Function, Thick Seat Cushion, Black(No Footrest)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Ultimate Comfort and Support! Hbada Office Chair Delivers Excellence.', 'author': 'lynn', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I recently invested in the Hbada Office Chair, and it has proven to be a game-changer for my work environment. The 2D adjustable lumbar support ensures that my lower back receives the personalized care it needs, reducing fatigue during extended work sessions. The adjustable headrest and armrest further contribute to the ergonomic design, allowing me to tailor the chair to my unique preferences. The 145¬∞ stepless tilt function adds a new dimension to my seating experience, promoting flexibility and dynamic movement throughout the day.One standout feature is the thick seat cushion, providing a plush and supportive foundation that significantly enhances comfort. Even during lengthy periods of desk work, I find myself experiencing less discomfort and strain. The chair\'s sleek black aesthetic not only adds a touch of sophistication to my workspace but also seamlessly integrates with my existing office decor.While the Hbada Office Chair doesn\'t come with a footrest, its overall quality and functionality overshadow this minor absence. The chair\'s durability and thoughtful design make it a top-tier choice for those prioritizing comfort and style in their office furniture. I wholeheartedly recommend the Hbada Office Chair to anyone in search of a reliable, comfortable, and aesthetically pleasing seating solution for their workspace."', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love it as my first ergonomic chair', 'author': 'Zheng Zhang', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Finally got my first ergonomic chair and have been thoroughly impressed with its comfort and functionality. It took around half an hour for me to assemble it alone. Sitting for long hours, I often struggled with back and waist discomfort. The support it provides to my back and waist is exceptional, allowing me to maintain a comfortable posture throughout the day.One of my favorite features is the adjustable armrests. Being able to customize their height has been a game changer for aligning my arms and shoulders properly, reducing strain and improving my overall sitting experience.Although I don't frequently use the neck support, I appreciate its inclusion. It's nice to have the option for extra support when needed, adding to the chair's versatility and my comfort.Overall, this ergonomic chair is a fantastic investment for anyone who spends a lot of time seated at a desk. It not only alleviates physical discomfort but also enhances productivity by allowing for a more comfortable and focused work environment.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Additional Review Item with proposed fix, 5 months since last review.', 'author': 'cguglomo', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I like the chair but I think the designers were more interested in a competitive look for the chair than providing a good seated swivel chairPros:1. The chair is comfortable.2. It can be raised up to a level that fits the desk top working surface3. The arms can be raised or lowered.4. The arms have three swivel locations. Pointed in at the front. Straight at the front. Pointed out at the front.5. The chair support has 5 legs6. Assembly tools were provided.7. Cloth seat and back covers are non sticky after several hours in the chair.Cons:1. The chair is medium hard to assemble. I did it in about 1/2 hour.2. The support legs have a chrome plated cover that is plastic. Does nothing be enhance the look of the chair. This will appeal to some buyers but it is worthless to increase the usefulness of the chair. I did not install it and threw it in the garbage.3. The chair legs have very small wheels. I find it hard to move around my desk area.4. There is a foot rest that slides out to support your feet when extended for a nap. I removed it from the chair and put it in the garbage. It has terrible fitment and slides out when you don\'t want it to. It needs to have tighter slide bearings that will keep it in place when not wanted.5. There is a cover piece of plastic that serves no other use than to cover up some of the mechanism of the lumbar support. I threw it in the garbage. There was another plastic piece that when I pushed it home two of the feet broke off. I threw it in the garbage.6. The lumbar support is not adjustable. It keeps you from resting your full back against the chair back. I find it acceptable given the cost of the chair but needs to be redesigned to lessen the bulge or be made adjustable.7. The designers could have eliminated some of the fluff and lowered the cost of the chair without changing the function of the chair. Steve Jobs would hate this chair.Comments to the designer. Eliminate all of the fluff, fix the lumbar support, fix the leg support slide bearings, get rid of the useless plastic covers, and lower the cost to less than $200. It should outsell the competition.This chair was designed and manufactured in China. Even so, the cost and the function of the chair for the way I use it is acceptable. I give it a 7 out of 10. Chair Arrived on 5 April 2023. This review was written on June 8 2023. So after 2months of constant use, I think it is a pretty good chair stripped down like I use it. I looked at many chairs. This is the one I selected hoping I would not have to send it back to Amazon.November 3, 2023: Repair of the Height Adjustment Cylinder.Starting in Late September 2023, the chair height adjustment cylinder started failing by lowering the chair to it lowest position. I am 6-foot and it is not comfortable at that position. I went to the local auto parts store and purchased two each stainless steel 1.5" diameter band clamps. I extended the chair to maximum height and installed the two band clamps back to back as show in the attached picture. This fixed the seat at its maximum height. There is a rubber gasket like material that got chewed up and fell on the floor. After a few days, I vacuumed it up and the pieces have not returned. It took longer to buy the band clamps than it did to fix them on the chair. The cost was less than $10.00. I hope the works for others like me that are obese in their old age.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent office chair', 'author': 'Yan Lu', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Excellent office chair for my home office. Arrived fast. It's comfortable and easy to assemble. The instructions were easy to follow and all the components appeared to be well made. The chair is comfortable so far. It moves well. Good purchase.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for my back', 'author': 'Latisa Arterberry', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The Hbada Ergonomic Office Chair with 2D Adjustable Lumbar Support has completely transformed my work-from-home experience. Its exceptional comfort and customizable features have made long hours at my desk significantly more manageable.The 2D adjustable lumbar support provides unparalleled relief for my lower back, allowing me to maintain a healthy posture throughout the day. The chair's ergonomic design perfectly contours to my body, ensuring optimal comfort and minimizing any discomfort or strain, even during extended work sessions.Furthermore, the overall build quality and material selection are top-notch, contributing to a sturdy and durable construction. The breathable mesh back promotes excellent airflow, preventing any buildup of heat or discomfort during warmer days. The smooth and effortless adjustability of the seat height and armrests further enhance the overall customization options, making it easy to tailor the chair to my specific needs.Assembly was straightforward and hassle-free, requiring minimal time and effort. The sleek and modern design seamlessly integrates into my home office, adding a touch of sophistication to the workspace.In conclusion, the Hbada Ergonomic Office Chair with 2D Adjustable Lumbar Support has exceeded my expectations in terms of comfort, durability, and design. It is a valuable investment for anyone seeking a high-quality office chair that prioritizes both functionality and aesthetic appeal. Highly recommended for anyone looking to enhance their workspace ergonomics", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Not great', 'author': 'Nikhil', 'rating': 1, 'content': "Updating my review, though it appears looks sturdy, the motion function adjustable feature stopped working in less than 2months. I wouldn't recommend.This ergonomic office chair stands out with its customizable comfort adjustments with right healthy posture through its design. Definitely feels like high quality material combined with breathable mesh fabric ensures prolonged comfort, while the multiple adjustable features, from headrest to recline, cater to individual preferences with in my family, pairs perfectly with the chair's durable construction, definitely a worthy investment for healthy posture.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Affordable and supportive!', 'author': 'Dwight Palma', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was hesitant about purchasing this Hbada Office Chair as it‚Äôs less than what I normally pay but was convinced to give it a shot and I am so happy that I took the chance. This chair is not only comfortable but supportive and so far seems durable. I‚Äôll take it further and say that it‚Äôs even more comfortable than my previous office chair which was more expensive. The multi-dimension headrest and the tilt are my top 2 favorite features as it provides extra comfort when sitting longer than usual. The material feels sturdy which gives me confidence in its longevity. On my previous chair, I had an add-on lumbar support pillow which I thought I was going to use for this new chair but the incorporated lumbar support it provides is much better. Working from home requires me to sit most of the time (8+ hours) and after a week of use, my lower back & hip pain are almost non-existent. Overall, I highly recommend this due to its comfort, support, durability, and price point.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "2.0 out of 5 stars CRAP don't buy it", 'author': 'JB', 'rating': 2, 'content': "I am in the return window however I can't return it because I don't have the box it came in.Update; the chair creeks and snaps, not clear as to why but it annoying. 5 to 3 starsThe positive reviewers were right on. Very easy to assemble, lumbar is in fact very good. Day one for me so its early rating. I'll come back here in a month", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars This chair is for tall people', 'author': 'Melissa R.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I\'m 5\'1" and let me say the bottom cushion extends out to behind my knees. I have to have the chair at its lowest level for my feet to be fully planted on the ground. However, the large cushion does come in handy when I want to sit cross legged in the chair. The cushion also is a bit more firm than I\'d like but that\'s not a huge problem. I do like the back support, it has really helped with my lower back and sciatica pain. It rolls nicely and also has nice head support. I do like that it\'s very customizable to your body. The foot rest is a nice add on but I don\'t use it too often. Overall, decent chair for the price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars comfortable', 'author': 'Chenxin Fang', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The chair is super comfortable! The seat has a large size. I could easily put my whole thigh on the chair ( I have tried the ergonomic chairs from ikea and those unfortunately has such small seat that I could only place half of my thigh on the chair and is really uncomfortable to seat for a long time) the design of the chair is also really stylish and fits my desk super well. The assembly process is also straightforward. Overall would recommend.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Serta Executive Office Chair Ergonomic Computer Upholstered Layered Body Pillows, Contoured Lumbar Zone, Microfiber, Black Base, Fabric, Grey/Silver
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very comfortable chair for a home office', 'author': 'red3', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The set up of the chair was very easy and the tool was provided. The quality of the materials is very good for this price, which makes the purchase a very good deal. Many executive chairs are just too big for our home office, but this chair is adequately sized and provides good comfort that can be adjusted three ways. The gray fabric material is modern and looks elegant in our home office.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Very Comfy But Shorter Than Expected', 'author': 'Dustin', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I ordered this chair to replace the one I have had for nearly a decade. As such, my rating was determined by comparing these two chairs to each other. I loved my last chair. It was extremely comfy (until the cushion gave out after so many years) and extremely sturdy (the armrests were actually metal).Let me start with what I like about this new Serta chair. It is very very comfy. Possibly more so than my previous chair. I am also very happy that I was able to find a chair like this that wasn't made with leather.Unfortunately, it seems to be difficult to find chairs made with real metal. The arms on this Serta chair do seem to be made with a very sturdy plastic. Time will tell if they hold up. I do a lot of gaming and I tend to squirm and sit in every-changing which often puts pressure on the armrests. The old chair withstood a lot of abuse and has held up great. Hopefully this chair will do the same.The real reason I took away a star, however, is simply because of the size. The back rest is a lot smaller than I expected. Now that may be my fault for not paying attention to the dimensions, but honestly, I figured my old chair was a pretty standard size for office chairs. Its to soon to tell how this will affect me over longer periods of time, but again, time will tell.At the end of the day, I needed a new chair that was good looking and comfy and this chair is both of those things. The price seems reasonable for office chairs so overall, I am happy. Hopefully this helps others in making their decision.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 9, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect', 'author': 'SSC', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Super comfortable chair. Easy to put together. I really like the fabric of the chair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Poor material', 'author': 'Carly A', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'In less than a year the seat cushion is absolutely flat leaving you sitting on the hard seat bottom. The arm cushions also do not go all the way back so many times you end up leaving your elbow into the metal. It‚Äôs not ergonomic as the only thing adjustable is the height.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Nice chair, but quality could improve.....', 'author': 'tech expert', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I just received this chair today. I think it is a great value for the money, and the size and shape are perfect. Being a short male, I like the seat cushion depth and tapered seat back. However, the quality could be better. Two items of concern: the arm sides are spray painted silver plastic, and mine have numerous small scratches in the paint. Secondly, when bolting the right side arm rest to the seat cushion, the side arm had a defective bolt hole (with excessive molded plastic in the bolt hole), that required that I drill out the excessive plastic to create a clear path for the attachment screw. This indicated poor quality control at the generic Chinese chair factory.....This is not what I expect from a Serta brand product....Not a problem for me, but for the average Mom or student assembling this chair, it would be a major impediment.....', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Super comfortable, sturdy, well made.', 'author': 'Neuronut', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Used on my office, excellent comfort and stability, easy to assemble. Only concern is: material looks likely to fray and look worn relatively soon, on arms. But I'd still order it again, many times over.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Basic with design flaws', 'author': 'Will Rosenthal', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'Well, it looks nice and its fairly easy to put together but its got some flaws that are just non-starters for me.#1 Its a really light tan. I\'d go so far as to say its closer to off-white/cream. Its so light that I imagine it will be hard to keep looking clean. The armrests especially because of body oils especially.#2 the supports for the armrests are so far forward that I find it hard to open my legs. No "manspreading" possible.#3 the "tilt control" is really just a "tilt lock"--it doesn\'t allow you to lock it a set angle. If you lock it in you\'re set at the default flat tilt; if you unlock you\'re just rocking back and forth.#4 it has some stability issues. It doesnt take much lean back or to the side before 1-2 wheels lift off the ground.#5 not sure what the pillow-looking thing is at the top, but its way too low to serve as a headrest--unless you\'re child-sized or you slouch a lot.#6 minor setup issue: the thread-lock compound they put on the screws was so thick that it made it hard to screw them in--seemed like it was mis-threaded until you got 75% of the way in, then it was excessively loose.There are a couple pros:#1 the armrests seem really sturdy.#2 the fabric is really comfortable--soft without being slick like microfiberUpdate October 10, 2019:Its getting pretty close to dropping down to 1 star.After daily use for 1 month the previously identified problems have not improved and new problems have arisen.Chair is pretty unstable in common situations. Its tipped on me 3 times now just leaning to the side to pick up a fallen object. And by "tipped" I mean dumped me to the floor.I thought there was at least two tilt angles you could lock it into, but there\'s really only "straight flat" or "rocks back and forth". The chair is not designed to lock the angle to anything but parallel to the floor.The control to raise the seat is entirely too far back and down. In order to raise the seat you have to lift yourself off the seat. That makes the handle too far away to grab without leaning back (or sideways) precariously.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 12, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very comfy!', 'author': 'Sari', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'As someone who is 5\'2". I was hesitant to order this chair. However, I am glad I did, as it is comfortable and supportive. When using it to talk to people in my office, I am able to adjust the height perfectly in order for my feet to rest on the ground with my knees at the right angle. I do need booster pillow when working at my computer, but that is because of the height of the table, not due to the chair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Small work chair for little people', 'author': 'richard', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Its OK for work environment, office. If for home use don\'t fall asleep in it, because if you do you and neck falls back behind you. You will wake up looking at the floor with a neck 4 feet long. PAINFUL!! I going to order the "BIG BOY CHAIR" next time.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Bad Gas Cylinder', 'author': 'Megan L Fullerton', 'rating': 1, 'content': "I love the chair, except that it was delivered with a bad gas lift cylinder. This results in my chair losing height randomly. Sometimes all at once, sometimes in little jerking motions and sometimes very very slowly over an hour. I can not make it through a single work meeting without having to randomly wrestle my chair on camera. The end result, either way, is me having to readjust my height every hour at least within the first month.I reached out for support and was told to contact some other offshoot of Serta support which so far has still not gotten back to me a month later. Very disappointed to spend this much on a chair and now be so at the end of my rope I'm going to go buy a pipe wrench and a new cylinder, an additional $50 to have a chair that works as advertised.Edit: After several months of use I've noticed the base of the chair was drilled off center (can be seen in the picture) and leans slightly to one side. Sitting slightly off for so long has caused me other problems and I doubt I'll be buying from Serta again.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Executive Office Chair, Leather Ergonomic Office Chair Big and Tall Home Office Desk Chairs with Adjustable Flip-Up Arms Lumbar Support Swivel Computer Chair with Rocking Function(Black)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Chair for back support', 'author': 'DCONTOP', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I like this chair. This office chair is very nice one than my precious one. I use it in my bedroom for gaming chair. Although it is made of imitation leather, but it feels very comfortable. This office chair is very easy to install. The chair has a long backrest, which supports the waist and makes it more comfortable to sit and lie down. So, it has great back support. Therefore, it's perfect for everyday use.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Decent Executive Office Chair...', 'author': 'Michael Lawrence', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The chair was fairly easy to put together except for one main issue, the bolts they supplied were the wrong ones for this as the numbers did not match up and some of them would not fit. Luckily I saved the ones from my old chair and could supplement the ones that did not work with them. It comes with the hardware and "T" alan tool needed to bolt it together, spare bolts, and covers for the bolt holes on the arms. The bolts I had issues with were those for the arms to attach to the seat and the backrest as 4 would not fit. The armrests are comfortable and at the proper height, they also can fold back out of the way. The chair has adjustable tension for reclining back and a decent amount of angle for reclining. The only concern is they are the only thing attaching the back of the chair to the seat/base of the chair which could wear out or become unstable over time. The cushions on the armrests are very comfortable. The wheelbase and main mechanism for the chair that the seat connects to are sturdy and appear durable. I had ordered a pack of the inline skate-type wheels to use instead of the ones that come with the chair which work great, so I will not be able to evaluate the included wheels for this chair. The dimensions of the back and seat are on par with big and tall chairs, and being 6\'4" and 225 lbs. I fit well in the chair. Now for the main reason I am only giving it 4 stars is something that that would be more of a personal preference for each person. I prefer the cushions to have an abundance of padding for maximum comfort as I spend many hours a day in my office chair. These cushions are ok for limited use, but I am already experiencing buttocks discomfort from multi-hour usage as they are way firmer than I am used to. Those who prefer a firmer chair for back and posture-type concerns, you will love this chair. However, if you are like me and want my chair to be more like a recliner in the way of cushion comfort it may not live up to your expectation during extended use. My last chair was a Lazy Boy Executive chair that had tons of cushion, so my views may be biased in this and that should be taken into consideration when considering my review. Overall, it is a decent Executive Office Chair except for the incorrect hardware supplied and personal preference cushion firmness issues I have covered. I was able to combat the lack of softness in the seat cushion by placing a pillow in the seat which may be an option for those that experience it being too stiff and firm for your tastes.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars easy installation', 'author': 'Michael Qin', 'rating': 5, 'content': "It's very easy to install. I installed it alone. It's not heavy, it's relatively light, and it's quite comfortable to sit on.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars supportive and stable', 'author': 'Jeff Yin', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The chair was purchased as a gift for my wife, who has recently been confirmed to be pregnant. It has proven to be an excellent source of support during her long working hours, allowing her to customize it to her preferred seating position. Assembly was a breeze, thanks to the clear instructions provided. The chair's construction is solid, ensuring stability, as safety is our top priority.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable chair', 'author': 'S. Hennessy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Easy to get it ready! Lightweight and comfortable to sit for a long time. Leather is so easy to keep clean!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Big and Wide but not so much for Tall folks', 'author': 'Avid couch surfer', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Assembly is very straightforward with the all the hardware in separated compartments and labeled along with a set of spares for each type of screw or cover. The hardest part was attaching the back to the two side arms and I found it was easier to lay the chair on its side and press the arms to lineup the back to the screw holes. I included pictures of the assembly steps it took maybe 20 minutes to put together from start to finish. I like that the they provided spares as not all furniture and chairs come with spare parts and they provided a plastic padded T-handled hex tool for torqueing all the screws.The back of the chair is not as high as it looks in the picture. I thought I would be able to recline and rest my head against the top of the chair, but my head is above the head rest portion. If you are less than 6 feet tall then it might be fine but not for tall people. The seat is wide so if you're a little bit on the heavy side this chair has more than enough room for most. Length of the seat is proportioned to its width so it relieves pressure on your thighs when sitting, I don't like short length bottom chairs as I find it puts pressure on your hamstrings when sitting for too long.The PU leather or faux leather feels soft to the touch, you can tell right away it's not real leather, but in the price range that this chair sells for I don't expect real leather. The arms fold up but do not adjust in height so you can slide the chair under a desk or table for reduce space when not sitting in the chair. The holes for the castors on the wheels are a little loose so the wheels do have some flex/movement. Over time I don't know if the castors may widen the holes and fall out due to the loose fit.I don't usually sit too long in my desk downstairs maybe an hour at a time to do some work, write emails, or browse the web and this chair felt more comfortable than my last mesh bottom chair it replaced. I can't speak to the durability of the chair as I've only had it a few days and usually things like the gas piston or castors on the wheels that wear out first on office/desk chairs and that's typically after months or maybe a year of use. Overall the chair works as designed and is comfortable enough for my uses and I don't have any major complaints.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars comfortable and ergonomic chair', 'author': 'Bella', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'As I spent long hours working at a computer, having a comfortable and supportive chair is essential. The adjustable lumbar supports allow me to customize the chair to fit my needs. In addition, the chair well-padded and provides ample support.When I received the chair, took me less than 20 minutes to put together. Very easy to setup.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable', 'author': 'Lucky', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I feel very comfortable to sit on, easy to install, really nice.good good!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable', 'author': 'Liyan Y.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Extremely comfortable to sit in, the seat has a substantial weight, and the leather quality feels quite nice. Satisfied with it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable and good quality!', 'author': 'Robert Hendricks', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love how fast it was to assemble this chair. Took less than 20 minutes and I was relaxing comfortably in my home office. The raising arms are nice when you want to push the chair in close to the desk. The overall fit and finish were extremely good and the price won‚Äôt break the bank!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Big and Tall Office Chair for Heavy People, High Back Extra Wide Heavy Duty Executive Office Chair Comfortable for Home Office, Large Computer Desk Chair with Adjustable Lumbar Support Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Extremely comfortable', 'author': 'A User', 'rating': 5, 'content': "So I wasn't sure if I wanted to take a chance on this chair, as it only had a handful of reviews when I did. However, it was one of the few I found that had all the features I wanted - a spring pack seat, PU caster wheels included, metal base frame, and adjustable lumbar - at a price below a thousand dollars, so I decided to do so.All I can say is WOW! It was super easy to put together - the screw holes actually are exposed / outward from the chair unlike most other office chairs I've assembled, making it a quick, less than half hour job to get it all together. It slides around effortlessly on my floors, and the height is perfect. I'm a short guy - 5'4 - and a lot of executive / heavy chairs are too tall for me even at their lowest setting. This one goes way down if you want it to, meaning I can have my legs up and crossed if I wanna be up high, or flat on the floor if I don't.It's also alleviated back pain I was having within the first day of sitting in it, so it definitely gets a thumbs up from me.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very comfortable', 'author': 'Syfe Fireshard', 'rating': 5, 'content': "took a little bit of doing to set up but in the end this chair is very comfortable, I've no regrets", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Looses cushioning quickly', 'author': 'Lucy Renau', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'Chair was initially comfortable.
