Also The height could go up more.Overall the chair is ok, but not worth the price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Quality and comfort is through the roof', 'author': 'Drea Janae', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'So I bought this product and I think it was only one review on it but but I took a gamble and I must say it was definitely worth every single penny. Since I built this chair I have not gotten out of it it is everything and more the quality the comfort it‚Äôs low enough to where I can easily access my desk. Honestly, I am very grateful for this chair and I know that may sound dramatic, but I was using the kitchen chair and my back was killing me and this chair is heaven I feel like a judge OK. It‚Äôs giving.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Ergonomic Mesh Office Chair High Back Desk Chair for Big and Tall People Adjustable Headrest with 2D Armrest Lumbar Support and PU Wheels Swivel Tilt Function Black (Black with Nylon Base)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Lumbar saver!', 'author': 'Nicolake', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I‚Äôll start by saying this chair is way more comfortable than it looks. We recently moved into a new house so for the first time ever I was going to be able to have my own office space and needed an office chair. I came across this one and decided I‚Äôd give it a shot. Out of the box it was easy enough to assemble, but the best part was when I actually sat in it to do some work from home. I was very surprised how comfortable it was, and even more surprised after an hour or so the level of comfort I was able to maintain.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Not perfect', 'author': 'Jai Sri Astrology', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The chair is lightweight and made almost entirely of plastic, except for the support base and seat mount, bolts and screws. Assembly was easy and took less than 40 minutes. The upholstery is soft faux leather for the seat and arm rests. The chair backing is a stretched black mesh material. The mesh fabric had a small area that was defective, as shown in my picture. All of the parts arrived wrapped in protective plastic and/or foam. So this was not a result of shipping; it occurred before leaving the factory. The remaining upholstery is decent-looking. Overall, the chair is stable; it rolls very easily, and the arms fold back and out of the way. The tension tilt knob on the bottom of the chair has a very narrow range and grants you maybe an additional inch and a half of tilt. The height adjustment lever is on the right side, underneath the seat. At the lowest level, the seat of the chair is approximately 14" from the floor. At its maximum height, it\'s approximately 19.5" from the floor. The seat is fairly comfortable, a bit firm, and, in my opinion, somewhat narrow. It is just a little over 20" across at its widest; the same measurement applies to the space measured between the arm rests when in the folded-down position. This is a very economical, lightweight, light-duty, easy-to-move, plastic office chair. The lower-back support is actually quite good.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 17, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great gaming chair', 'author': 'Diane', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great gaming chairVery comfortable a little bit of work to put it together as the instructions aren‚Äôt the best but you will figure it out sturdy love the arm rest raises up on both sides as well as the head rest adjust heights to your liking', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice office chair', 'author': 'Karen Lyons', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I got this chair to replace my old office chair. It was easy to assemble and even included some additional hardware if needed. The arm rests have 2 positions so you can lift them up or you can keep them down. The lumbar support is nice and the seat is soft and comfortable when sitting for long periods of time. It rolls on my floor very easily and the wheels are spaced so it isn\'t tipsy. I did take the head rest off because it threw my head too far forward. I\'m 5\' 7" tall and 135 lbs and the chair fits me fine. If you are a big and tall person there is room for your comfort too. Satisfied with my new chair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 4, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Decent, inexpensive, but definitely a "get-what-you-pay-for" office chair', 'author': 'TTU Red Raider', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Cutting to the chase, as small business owners, we have burned through dozens of office chairs---expensive, cheap, and everything in between. That said, this particular ECCONITURE chair worked well for occasional use, but may not be the best suited for long-term use.The above notwithstanding, given this ECCONITURE chair's overall plastic construction, its lack of any real leather surfaces, and its lack of any lumbar adjustments, this chair offers a decent value at its current price point of below $110, but is obviously best suited for occasional use, rather than a daily one.All in all, even given that this ECCONITURE chair is not particularly well suited and/or constructed for regular and/or daily use, it may still suffice for your occasional needs, particularly given its current price point.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 28, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Helps my back', 'author': 'EC', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great fit for me. Easy to assemble. Looks good. Moves well .', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 8, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Standard installation, good support, soft & comfortable arms & seat', 'author': 'Preston', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Standard installation, good support:Having owned several similar office chairs, I was very impressed with the level of lower back support this chair provides. It's probably not going to change your life, but considering the price this is a high quality chair. The installation of the chair was also pretty standard - the directions walk you through all the steps and it took about half an hour to complete.Soft & comfortable arms & seat:What did really stand out though compared to other similar chairs was how soft and comfortable the seat cushion and arm rests are. Other comparable chairs can sometimes be a bit too firm in my opinion - the seats can sometimes be too rigid and uncomfortable and the armrests can be hard and painful to rest your elbows on - this chair however is made with a very soft and comfortable faux leather on the seat and arm rests. The material is very soft and comfy and the texture is smooth and cooling, which is great if you're used to sitting for longer periods of time.Overall, this is a great chair and I would recommend.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 26, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Too expensive for lack of adjustments', 'author': 'j-amey', 'rating': 3, 'content': "This is a nice enough chair, but it's way too expensive for what it is. You can get chairs with higher quality construction and more adjustment options for the same price. If this were about half the price it is, it would get one more star.It‚Äôs definitely for taller people. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô8‚Äù, and I don‚Äôt think anyone shorter would find the lumbar, arm rest height, and headrest would work for them.Pros: - Nice lumbar support - Head rest with tilt options - Adjustable seat height - Can move arm rests out of the way (one at a time or simultaneously) - Wheels glide easily and smoothly - Easy swivel - Decent instructionsCons: - Can't lock the tilt of the chair into position (only locks straight up) - Lumbar height isn't adjustable - Lumbar pressure isn't adjustable - Arm rest height isn't adjustable", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 3, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Decent Comfortability; Low Adjustability', 'author': 'Ian Sowell', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The comfort is okay in terms of mesh support chairs, but the adjustability has room to be desired.The seat is comfortable enough for it to not be a problem to sit for long periods of time. The lumbar and back itself is okay, not really the best for support.The adjustability for the arms and back are a bit lacking, you can't adjust the position of the arm rests or adjust the height of the lumbar support.I would recommend this only if you are looking for a cheap chair with passable comfort.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 19, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Not sure if it is truly for big and tall people', 'author': 'MsBathnBody', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'At first glance this chair looks amazing! My husband weighs 300 lbs. and fits in it with ease. The mesh back, lumbar support, and headrest are all extremely comfortable; however, the seat starts out comfortable but with his weight it compresses quickly and over the course of the day becomes hard. It so far does bounce back to comfortable again quickly after standing up though! It was easy to assemble with the given tools. We‚Äôre not sure how long it will hold up as it feels a bit loose with his weight on it (and all screws are tight). We just are not sure if it should be advertised as for big and tall people, and plan to update the review with another month of use.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 15, 2023', 'is_verified': False}]

title: Yaheetech Faux Leather Executive Office Chair High Back Managerial Swivel Chair Computer Desk Chair w/Integrated Headrest, Padded Arms Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable and supportive', 'author': 'Ryan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This office chair is very comfortable and as well a great support. Perfect combination for the long hours I spend in front of the computer. Comfortable is always great but not always the best on your body for marathon computer days. That‚Äôs why this chair is great. I have never had an office chair that reclines and I just love that feature. Again not necessarily the best idea for keeping the body healthy and happy. Using it as a trea when i finish a milestone or need a quick frustration brake. The chair is also not bulky like some other comfortable chairs. It‚Äôs sleek but still manages to feel like a big poofy chair. The materials are all good quality. The fabric of the chair feels good against the skin and doesn‚Äôt stick when you sweat a little bit. All around a great chair for the price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Its very comfortable and ergonomic.', 'author': 'Ronin Tuono', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Took an hour to assemble and I took a half a star because you kind of need someone to hold the back piece in while you screw in the handles to it. Almost impossible to do alone. The rest of the chair assembly is SUPER easy to do. It nice and comfortable., I am literally sitting in it right now as I type this. Its not fancy and even though it says it will support 300 lbs, I have high doubts that it would for long. It Feels like a 95 dollar office chair. not super polished or smooth and sturdy, just kind of cheap and loose. Not saying its bad. I have had 350 dollar chairs that were horrible , But I have had better at about 135-150 price point. It will do its job for its price without frills and I cant fault that. If this chair lasts me 2-3 years I will consider it a great deal. ( I am kind of hard on them)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing quality', 'author': 'Humbly Periwinkle', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We love our new leather swivel chair. It is sturdy, strong and very comfortable seat. It is very easy to assemble. It took me like less than 30 minutes I think to assemble it. It comes with a complete tools to assemble this chair. I like to recommend this chair. This is perfect for office chair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Looks executive', 'author': 'Drew Stockton', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I like this chair and it is very comfortable. It has nice padding and you can adjust the lean back recline with the tension knob easily. It is faux leather but I think it should take a lot of wear and tear before it starts to peel. Being a high back chair I did expect the back to rise higher than it did. I would classify it more as a mid-back but maybe that's because a have a long upper torso. My head sits at the top end of the head piece. Even though the back of my head and neck are well supported the top of my head hangs off the chair. It does have metal legs, the height adjustment works easily and doesn't let you sink down. Overall, a good office chair.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Large and comfortable, easy to install', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Large and comfortable, easy to install', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to put together', 'author': 'RSP', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This chair is very easy to put together. Really good quality and nice leather material as well. Very comfortable to sit on', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': False}]

title: Vinsetto 7-Point Vibrating Massage Office Chair, High Back Executive Recliner with Lumbar Support, Footrest, Reclining Back, Adjustable Height, Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome seller!', 'author': 'Bruce - local consumer of many things', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I had a minor issue with the chair and the seller went out of their way to make it right. Comfortable chair, easy to assemble. Massage feature is definitely a plus.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Do not buy', 'author': 'Scotty Douglass', 'rating': 1, 'content': "I got this in September. By the end of November it catastrophically gave up the ghost. The up and down died and the base went wonky. The heat and vibrate still work, only you can't sit on it because the base of the seat where it attaches to the post broke loose and you will fall off. The vibrate really does not do much for your sore back, but it does make tons of noise. The heat is nice until it gets to hot and you have to turn it off, no controls. Just off and on. Now my wife is laughing at me for wasting 180 bucks. It sure is a good idea that is poorly executed. And my back still hurts.....", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 4, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect', 'author': 'DiXiE ChiC', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Well made!! Beautiful chair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Overall Good. Happy with purchase.', 'author': 'Sydney Mitchell', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I actually do really like this chair, it\'s far better than the one I had before.The back of the chair does not extend to above my head (I\'m 5\'8") as my previous gaming chair did, so I have to kind of scoot down in the chair to lean my head fully back if I want to rest it like that. The material feels nice and soft, and the cushion to the back and seat are comfortable. I do enjoy the leg rest, it feels a little bit like it wouldn\'t hold a lot of weight, but luckily it suits me fine.Massage/Heat:The massage feature is vibration. It has 5 modes: pulse, press, wave, auto, and normal. 2 Intensities (high and low). 4 massage points: neck, back, lumbar, and thigh. It has a timer for 15, 30, and 60 mins, after which it will turn off automatically. The Heat feature is a separate button to be pressed when the power is turned on. You can use it with the massage feature or solo, but to do it solo you would have to individually turn off each of the 4 massage points (they each have their own button). I\'ve used this feature often as I like the warmth without the vibration mostly.Both features are a nice little extra touch to the chair for me. I wasn\'t expecting it to be on the same level as an actual massage chair with rollers or something, so it works fine for what I was intending. The heating feature is not as hot as my heating pad, but it adds a nice warmth that I find pleasant without being too hot (which is good because there are only 2 intensity settings for the heat).One Complaint: The only thing about this feature that is annoying is the need to plug the chair in to use it. This wouldn\'t be as much of a problem if I wasn\'t accidentally rolling over the small wire with the chair and then getting worried about it getting stuck in the wheels.Stability:The chair itself feels a little unstable. I\'m not sure if this is the way it was designed or the way we put it together (though we put it together as instructed). The arms wobble from side to side, as does the base of the chair, which does bother me. I think they do that because they\'re not in a "fixed" position, that way when you use the function of reclining the chair the arms can adjust as necessary. They aren\'t as much of an issue for me. It\'s more a problem of feeling like the seat itself rocks a little too much from side to side (right to left not front to back).When I lean back sometimes the chair makes a popping sound (which I figured out is the same sound that happens when you pull the leaver underneath in order to adjust the recline of the back of the chair). I\'m not sure if that\'s functioning as intended or some screw is perhaps not fully right, or maybe poor design.The wheels occasionally feel difficult to slide around on the floor, I think because they all have to turn and align in the same direction, and they don\'t turn immediately when you go to slide away from the desk, so sometimes it feels difficult to move.When my mother (a bigger woman) sat in the chair it made it slide downwards, and this was an issue that happened each time she did it. This makes me think it\'s not meant to hold as much weight as other chairs so be careful with that.Overall for what I needed out of a chair, it\'s been nice. I spent a lot of time researching and looking for a new chair, which was difficult given the fact that I couldn\'t test them out beforehand. I wanted one with a footrest, and massage/heat, that was also soft to sit in. This one fits a lot of the qualities I was looking for, enough so that I can overlook the parts that bother me.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 6, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Seems pretty good so far....', 'author': 'Lindy Fredrick', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Arrived well packaged, assembly took 1 hour, could be quicker if I used a power tool. Left armrest seems a little loose, I'll have to look at that another day. Vibration function seems nice so far, doesn't quite hit my glutes though. The heat feature hits my lower back dead on. I expected more cushion, seems a little firm and thin. I stand 6 foot 2 inches with a 36 inch inseam and my head hits right in the middle of the headrest. The foot rest is an utter failure though, it barely reaches the middle of my calves and I feel like the weight of my legs is putting a significant strain on it ( I weigh in at 215 pounds), I'll stick with putting my feet up on my desk. The seat does not rock but you can set the level of recline and lock it into position when you find your sweet spot. All and all I wouldn't call it luxurious but for the money it's in the ball park.....durability will end up being the real test.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 12, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing desk/ recliner chair!', 'author': 'Sheila Williams', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The chair is amazing. Very comfortable and the massage part never thought it would work so good. Love the part that comes up to put your legs up. I have nerve damage in my feet. I had surgery to repair but it actually made both my feet worse. So I need to keep my feet up under the desk. Sometimes it's not as high as I need but my desk has a shelf where it can go on there to be high enough. But that doesn't matter this chair is soo comfortable I even use it as a recliner. It was very easy to put together. I was able to do it myself. I would tell anyone looking for an amazing chair. This is the chair. All you need to decide is the color. I decided to go with white and I am very glad I did. It pops in my room.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 9, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "2.0 out of 5 stars Looks nice, that's about it", 'author': 'Paul', 'rating': 2, 'content': "I just received this chair.. It is not worth the money. It does look nice.. it is firm to sit in which is nice.. But the assembly , the quality, the function is not in the price range.. This chair should sell around 100.00. The screws and/or the holes to put them in are not all cut right.. take care or they strip.. fortunately I try every screw before complete assembly.. seen this before... not all parts align properly, again fortunate just off a bit so a little force and it will fit.. there is no tension on the recline, it's either locked in place or lean back.. that is the worst design I have ever seen..maybe it's because this is the first chair I bought sight unseen. The arms wobble and the screws are as tight as I can get them. It has to be design because the left is far worse than the right. The massage is ok.. the heat..I can't tell.. I don't feel any. I believe this is the worst buy I ever had from amazon..and there were a couple of returns.. I am choosing not to return this because once I it's assembled it's too difficult to put neatly in the box again, it is were a local store I would bring it back assembled with all the boxes and packing ... but that's not a choice with amazon. I've learned an expensive lesson.. Some things on amazon are just not worth it...and the review while helpful are probably tainted.. I review products that have surpassed my expectations because those companies deserve it...I also have written a couple like this, where I would warn others not to purchase this product. Unless they want just ok... nice looking.. have to be careful sitting.. and quality is not in the price range. I do give it two stars because it is nice looking, it is a decent seat..it's just too expensive. and three to me would mean take it or leave it... I believe this is closer to leave it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Please read before you buy.', 'author': 'Kitty and Vei', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The chair was easy to assemble. The cost is WAY TOO HIGH for the quality of the chair. You‚Äôre practically paying for the features. I got this as a gift so I wish I could return it and get my money back but I can‚Äôt. If you‚Äôre looking to buy a comfortable office chair, please KEEP LOOKING ELSEWHERE. The features may seem nice but the quality and comfort is just not with this chair. You will have back problems!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 17, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable chair, easy to assemble, love the massage and heat functions', 'author': 'CAL', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The chair was easy to assemble. The directions were fine, and all the parts were good quality and easy to put together. The arms seem a little wobbly, but they don't feel like they're going to come off or anything; they just wobble a bit.The padding is comfortable but not plush. I put a very soft, fluffy throw blanket on the chair to sit on and it feels extremely comfy like that. The footrest slides out straight from under the seat, and then the padded part flips up and over. It can be a little tricky to get it out when your legs are under the desk, but it's comfortable once it's in place.The height is adjustable, of course, and what I really like is that the back can be adjusted to whatever angle you like and then locked in place. With a lot of chairs, they lean back all the way and there's no way to lock them at a slightly leaned back angle, and I love that this one does that.The vibrating massage function is really nice. The first time I turned it on I wasn't sure how much I liked it, but I tried it for a few minutes, and it really does feel good. It's very customizable, you can pick from neck, upper/lower back, and thighs or any combination of those areas. You can pick whether the massage is continuous, pulsed, in a wave, etc. The massage and heat functions are both on a timer and you can pick from 15, 30 or 60 minutes.The heat function is very nice especially as the weather gets colder. You can have the massage on with or without heat. At first I thought you couldn't have heat without massage, but you can - you turn on massage, turn on heat, and then de-select all the individual massage areas so you just get heat.As a whole the chair is really nice for working from home. It's pretty sturdy, looks and feels nice, and has a bunch of luxurious feeling options like the footrest, massage and heat, and adjustable back. The power cord for the massage/heat is kind of short and gets wound around the base of the chair if I'm not careful but I guess there's not a good way around that. All together I'm very glad I got this chair, I enjoy using it, and I'd recommend it to others.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 15, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Hard cushions', 'author': 'avtx1300', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Cushions are like sitting on a park bench.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Office Chair Ergonomic Desk Mesh Computer Chair with Lumbar Support Folding Armrest Swivel Chair with Wheel Small Study Chair for Home Office Work
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Movable arm rests are awesome', 'author': 'Iysha', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Movable arm rests allows this chair to fit in a smaller space. My daughter loves it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great chair for the price', 'author': 'Michael', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I ordered the lime green which is one of my wife's favorite colors and she loves it.As a bigger guy (225lbs) it feels like it flexes a bit when I sit in it but my wife and kids didn't have the same feeling.Everything went together well except one of the arms wasn't quite molded right so I had to modify it a bit so it would come all the way down (reason for being dropped to 4 stars), not enough of an issue to return by all means.Great quality chair overall and I'd recommend it for anyone looking for a unique color.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Pop of color and comfort', 'author': 'Allodoxaphobia', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Chair in the vibrant blue color and I couldn't be happier with my purchase. Not only is the color stunning, but the chair itself is extremely comfortable and has all the features I was looking for in an office chair.One of the best things about this chair is its ergonomic design. As someone who spends long hours at my desk, having a chair that supports my back and promotes good posture is essential. I have noticed a significant improvement in my back pain since using this chair. The mesh material also allows for good air circulation, keeping me cool and comfortable throughout the day.I was pleasantly surprised to find that my 8-year-old son also loves this chair. He often uses it to do his homework or play on the computer, and he appreciates the adjustable height and width. This feature allows the chair to grow with him, making it a long-term investment.Another great aspect of this chair is how easy it was to assemble. It only took me 30 minutes to put together, and I didn't even need the manual.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable for the price! Super easy to assemble.', 'author': 'Adrenaline', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This Ergonomic Office Chair came with the screws, an Allen wrench, and an easy to follow instruction diagram. It took me less than 19 minutes to assemble. The back is a breathable nylon mesh which allows airflow and keeps you cool. The seat cushion is also covered in the same breathable nylon mesh. The arm rests rotate up out of the way if you need to roll closer to the desk or push the chair in all the way when not sitting in it. The chair rotates smoothly and easily. It rolls on the wheels with no issues. The height adjustment arm under the seat is a little short or it could be that my arm is a little short. Hahaha! But it works well with no issues. Most of the chair parts are plastic except for the air piston and adjustment arm assembly, which are metal. According to the listing it has been SGS Lab tested to have no loss of serviceability after 120,000 cycles of rotation with 270 lbs. on it. Sounds like it should last a while. It's a fair deal for the price at the time of $59.99. I will update the review down the road if there are any issues. Right now, I am happy with it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 15, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Stylish and Chic Office Chair', 'author': 'KE', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Overall, this is an attractive office chair that feels sturdyPros:+ Easy to assemble (took around 15 mins for someone alone)+ Bright orange color, looks really nice+ Components feel sturdy+ Easy to clean plastic componentsCons:- Wheels were very difficult to seat properly. Have assembled many, many office chairs and have never had this issue before- One of the threaded inserts for one of the armrests had a defect, making it impossible to get the bolt fully screwed in. The other side went in very smoothly, so the contrast was stark- Back mesh has give, but the back itself is quite rigid. Would not be a comfortable chair for people who lean back by default (poor lumbar support). I perch on chairs, so that isn't a problem for me- White plastic components scuff very easily", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 22, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Very firm, but will take your shape', 'author': 'J. Smith', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I read some reviews of this chair being uncomfortable, and I see why people feel that way. The cushion is a very firm latex material, so if you are looking for plush, this isn't your chair.It's not like sitting on a concrete bench or aluminum bleacher seat, and the latex slowly conforms around you. The mesh back and arms that fold up are nice features. Otherwise, it is a typical office chair.Are you getting a perfect chair? No. It is more than serviceable though. It is missing those final touches you would see on a higher end chair.Things like plastic flashing around areas where parts were pulled out of the mold, screw holes not in perfect alignment are my main complaints. When you assemble the chair, keep all the bolts loose until they are all installed, and then tighten.With all that said, it is a very sturdy, firm chair that does what a chair should do. I spend 8 plus hours in it daily, and it has shown zero indications of weakness. Being 220lbs at 6' with a boney backside, I can say I really like this chair.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars ‚ÄúYellow‚Äù Chair', 'author': 'C.L.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Fortunately, I did not buy this for the color, because this is definitely not yellow. The orange color (think basketball orange) is still nice, just very different than pictured.This went together very smoothly! My 12 year old assembled it himself (with supervision to make sure he followed all the instructions) & had no difficulties. It did not take long to put together.Quality-wise, this is exactly what I expected for this price range. It‚Äôs better than a super cheap chair, it isn‚Äôt as comfortable as an expensive chair. But I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs uncomfortable at all.I really love that the arms can be raised up or pushed down, that‚Äôs so convenient. This chair also can be lowered a lot lower than other chairs I‚Äôve had, which is great for kids. My son is using this as his chair &, so far, it‚Äôs holding up great!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 9, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Pretty decent chair for the price!', 'author': 'ace.skinner', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This chair was easy to assemble, constructed of pretty decent materials. The legs, arms and frames feel solid and sturdy. The top half of the chair does have a little sway on the piston but not a lot. The cushion is thick but compresses easily and may be a bit uncomfortable for bigger individuals. However this is a great deal!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 22, 2023', 'is_verified': False}]

title: Serta Executive Office Chair Ergonomic Computer Upholstered Layered Body Pillows, Contoured Lumbar Zone, Microfiber, Black Base, Fabric, Grey/Silver
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very comfortable chair for a home office', 'author': 'red3', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The set up of the chair was very easy and the tool was provided. The quality of the materials is very good for this price, which makes the purchase a very good deal. Many executive chairs are just too big for our home office, but this chair is adequately sized and provides good comfort that can be adjusted three ways. The gray fabric material is modern and looks elegant in our home office.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Very Comfy But Shorter Than Expected', 'author': 'Dustin', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I ordered this chair to replace the one I have had for nearly a decade. As such, my rating was determined by comparing these two chairs to each other. I loved my last chair. It was extremely comfy (until the cushion gave out after so many years) and extremely sturdy (the armrests were actually metal).Let me start with what I like about this new Serta chair. It is very very comfy. Possibly more so than my previous chair. I am also very happy that I was able to find a chair like this that wasn't made with leather.Unfortunately, it seems to be difficult to find chairs made with real metal. The arms on this Serta chair do seem to be made with a very sturdy plastic. Time will tell if they hold up. I do a lot of gaming and I tend to squirm and sit in every-changing which often puts pressure on the armrests. The old chair withstood a lot of abuse and has held up great. Hopefully this chair will do the same.The real reason I took away a star, however, is simply because of the size. The back rest is a lot smaller than I expected. Now that may be my fault for not paying attention to the dimensions, but honestly, I figured my old chair was a pretty standard size for office chairs. Its to soon to tell how this will affect me over longer periods of time, but again, time will tell.At the end of the day, I needed a new chair that was good looking and comfy and this chair is both of those things. The price seems reasonable for office chairs so overall, I am happy. Hopefully this helps others in making their decision.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 9, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect', 'author': 'SSC', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Super comfortable chair. Easy to put together. I really like the fabric of the chair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Poor material', 'author': 'Carly A', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'In less than a year the seat cushion is absolutely flat leaving you sitting on the hard seat bottom. The arm cushions also do not go all the way back so many times you end up leaving your elbow into the metal. It‚Äôs not ergonomic as the only thing adjustable is the height.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Nice chair, but quality could improve.....', 'author': 'tech expert', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I just received this chair today. I think it is a great value for the money, and the size and shape are perfect. Being a short male, I like the seat cushion depth and tapered seat back. However, the quality could be better. Two items of concern: the arm sides are spray painted silver plastic, and mine have numerous small scratches in the paint. Secondly, when bolting the right side arm rest to the seat cushion, the side arm had a defective bolt hole (with excessive molded plastic in the bolt hole), that required that I drill out the excessive plastic to create a clear path for the attachment screw. This indicated poor quality control at the generic Chinese chair factory.....This is not what I expect from a Serta brand product....Not a problem for me, but for the average Mom or student assembling this chair, it would be a major impediment.....', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Super comfortable, sturdy, well made.', 'author': 'Neuronut', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Used on my office, excellent comfort and stability, easy to assemble. Only concern is: material looks likely to fray and look worn relatively soon, on arms. But I'd still order it again, many times over.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Basic with design flaws', 'author': 'Will Rosenthal', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'Well, it looks nice and its fairly easy to put together but its got some flaws that are just non-starters for me.#1 Its a really light tan. I\'d go so far as to say its closer to off-white/cream. Its so light that I imagine it will be hard to keep looking clean. The armrests especially because of body oils especially.#2 the supports for the armrests are so far forward that I find it hard to open my legs. No "manspreading" possible.#3 the "tilt control" is really just a "tilt lock"--it doesn\'t allow you to lock it a set angle. If you lock it in you\'re set at the default flat tilt; if you unlock you\'re just rocking back and forth.#4 it has some stability issues. It doesnt take much lean back or to the side before 1-2 wheels lift off the ground.#5 not sure what the pillow-looking thing is at the top, but its way too low to serve as a headrest--unless you\'re child-sized or you slouch a lot.#6 minor setup issue: the thread-lock compound they put on the screws was so thick that it made it hard to screw them in--seemed like it was mis-threaded until you got 75% of the way in, then it was excessively loose.There are a couple pros:#1 the armrests seem really sturdy.#2 the fabric is really comfortable--soft without being slick like microfiberUpdate October 10, 2019:Its getting pretty close to dropping down to 1 star.After daily use for 1 month the previously identified problems have not improved and new problems have arisen.Chair is pretty unstable in common situations. Its tipped on me 3 times now just leaning to the side to pick up a fallen object. And by "tipped" I mean dumped me to the floor.I thought there was at least two tilt angles you could lock it into, but there\'s really only "straight flat" or "rocks back and forth". The chair is not designed to lock the angle to anything but parallel to the floor.The control to raise the seat is entirely too far back and down. In order to raise the seat you have to lift yourself off the seat. That makes the handle too far away to grab without leaning back (or sideways) precariously.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 12, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very comfy!', 'author': 'Sari', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'As someone who is 5\'2". I was hesitant to order this chair. However, I am glad I did, as it is comfortable and supportive. When using it to talk to people in my office, I am able to adjust the height perfectly in order for my feet to rest on the ground with my knees at the right angle. I do need booster pillow when working at my computer, but that is because of the height of the table, not due to the chair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Small work chair for little people', 'author': 'richard', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Its OK for work environment, office. If for home use don\'t fall asleep in it, because if you do you and neck falls back behind you. You will wake up looking at the floor with a neck 4 feet long. PAINFUL!! I going to order the "BIG BOY CHAIR" next time.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Bad Gas Cylinder', 'author': 'Megan L Fullerton', 'rating': 1, 'content': "I love the chair, except that it was delivered with a bad gas lift cylinder. This results in my chair losing height randomly. Sometimes all at once, sometimes in little jerking motions and sometimes very very slowly over an hour. I can not make it through a single work meeting without having to randomly wrestle my chair on camera. The end result, either way, is me having to readjust my height every hour at least within the first month.I reached out for support and was told to contact some other offshoot of Serta support which so far has still not gotten back to me a month later. Very disappointed to spend this much on a chair and now be so at the end of my rope I'm going to go buy a pipe wrench and a new cylinder, an additional $50 to have a chair that works as advertised.Edit: After several months of use I've noticed the base of the chair was drilled off center (can be seen in the picture) and leans slightly to one side. Sitting slightly off for so long has caused me other problems and I doubt I'll be buying from Serta again.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Serta Executive Office Chair Ergonomic Computer Upholstered Layered Body Pillows, Contoured Lumbar Zone, Base, Fabric, Black/Grey
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cheaply made, plastic, uncomfortable seat - only made for tall people!', 'author': 'Jaye', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'UPDATE: 3/11/18I bought this chair 9/1/18. I had my doubts about it at first, but have raised my initial 3 star rating to a 5 star! Read my last update below for more info, but I am still using the chair to get around the house some of the time although I am beginning to walk a few steps here and there again since my severe injury back in November. I really thought that the wheels were going to give out since they aren\'t designed for how I\'ve been using the chair, but they are still fine! It\'s still very comfortable, and I\'ve had no problems with it.If you spend a lot of time in the chair, I\'d recommend after a few months going back and tightening the screws that hold the arms to the base and the back. I did that last month and they had loosened a bit from when I first put it together. I\'m keeping the allen wrench that came with the chair in my office close at hand so I can keep checking their tightness every couple of months or so. VERY happy with this, so well worth the money!UPDATE: 1/31/18 I\'ve now had this chair for nearly 5 months. I decided to keep it since I could not find one I liked better, and needed a chair ASAP. I\'m significantly more impressed with it now than I was when I first received it! My initial review was three stars, I\'ve now increased that to four stars.Over two months ago, I tore a ligament in my foot. Major issues with getting around! I ended up grabbing my office chair here, and using it to sit in, using my good foot to push myself around the house. I\'ve been doing this for two months, and it has been so extraordinarily helpful! I am a bit concerned that the wheels might be starting to give out, but then again the amount of wear and tear I\'ve put on them in the past two months is significantly more than one would normally rolling office chair around.I have adapted to the shape of the chair, and find it so much more comfortable now than I did at first. I love how soft the back is, I\'ve adjusted to the seat being harder and tilted a bit. The padding on the arms is an extra bonus. I would bring this up to five stars if I weren\'t so concerned still about how the arms attached to the seat and the back. Still concerned about longevity.-------------------------------------I received this chair yesterday (9/7/17). It was not nearly as easy to put together as the listing makes it seem, it would be much easier with two people. Finally have it together and using it.First off, most of the parts are plastic. Very poor quality. Not sure if I will keep this or send it back at this point. I purchased this because my very old previous desk chair fell apart recently, resulting in a frightening neck injury. The arms are held onto the seat by 2 screws each, and the back is only held onto the arms by another 2 screws on each side. The back does not directly attach to the seat at all. I\'m feeling very concerned about it breaking like my old one did (although that one had been used for several years first!).I\'m also very disappointed that the seat doesn\'t go any lower. I\'m a 5\'3" woman with short legs. I can\'t come close to touching the floor with my feet, even with this on the lowest setting. Seems ridiculous to me; I know many women who are much shorter than I am! Dangling my feet in the air like a child is not conducive to working at my desk or feeling remotely comfortable.There is also a lack of comfort in this chair. With padded upholstery, I expected to have a bit of a cushy feel in the seat, and it is quite hard. The fabric itself is soft, but you definitely don\'t sink down into the seat at all. I also greatly dislike how the front of the seat slopes downward, which is really uncomfortable in any seated position. Makes me feel like I\'m going to slide off of the chair, and if it were slick like leather instead of microfiber, I probably would! The seat is also not as large as I expected it to be based on the measurements given; plenty large enough for sitting regularly with feet on the floor (which I can\'t do with this), but I\'d wanted to be able to sit in it cross legged and it\'s definitely not wide enough for that.One more note: you cannot tilt back at all in this chair as most office chairs do. You can only sit up straight and swivel.About the only two positive things I can think of about this chair are that the fabric is super soft, I love that the arms are padded - the arms on my old chair were wood over metal and were very hard and uncomfortable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 8, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars At Last, THE perfect exec Office Chair! Completes my Office in comfort, design, & style!', 'author': 'Zeus My Rescue Red Nose Pittie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is THE perfect office chair. Executive meets stylish, gorgeous lines, design, excellent comfort, quality, MY Ultimate Dream Chair come true.I had two cervical surgeries a year ago, so recovering from spinal fusion is a loooongg process. This provides abundant support, and is comfortable, sturdy, and wheels glide effortlessly where you want the chair to roll. It is a beautiful color, and makes any office area Pop.No assembly, no issues, the arms are upholstered, too, and must say, I feel so good in this cozy chair. BTW I like reviews when the purchaser includes details about their height, weight, size for furniture pieces as there is, in my opinion, no OSFA (one size fits all) in executive office chairs. I spend hours a day in mine so I need to be completely comfortable all day long, day in, day out. This Serta? I believe the Serta Fairies took my measurements in my sleep, and custom designed this wonderful piece especially for me. I am a tall female, fit, 5\'9", legs for days, with long arms and the armrests are essential for me.I am in my 40\'s but an accident left me with severe, debilitating neck, lower back & thoracic injuries. I could not find an office chair that looked this good, that "fit" me. Then there is the comfort factor. This is THE best investment and I had a $900 chair that was inferior to this gem. I got rid of that one and this is perfect. This is really soothing my neck surgery residuals. For anyone with spinal problems, health issues, this may be helpful to you. My friend stayed here two weeks, said it helped calm her carpal tunnel syndrome nerve pain. She recovered from her left hand carpal tunnel surgery, and will be having her right hand surgery soon.The price is really low for the features, support, design, quality and am delighted after a long, frustrating year of trying out exec chairs, I found my perfect fit. I have it paired w my Hooker Grandover enormous two piece home office desk and my Serta is stunning accent at "Command Central".Hope you find some helpful information in my review. Best!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 27, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Decent Chair, But it has One Unique Setback', 'author': 'Penny', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I decided to wait a year until reviewing this product so I could give an accurate testament to it!On a budget, this is a pretty okay chair to go with! It's still held together after a year, so no complaints there. I wasn't expecting any kind of support on the cushion, so comfort is pretty okay too. I haven't had any pain issues on my back or otherwise since using it! I think my favorite feature of this chair are the soft armrests. They are very nice, and sit at just the right level, even if they aren't adjustable :>Okay now for the cons :'DAfter maybe three or so months, the chair started squeaking quite a bit. So just be aware that if you have a roomie or s/o who hates squeaky sounds, then maybe go with a different chair (luckily my s/o is totally fine with the noise haha). Its just the sort of thing that happens with cheaper chairs, which is alright if you're on that budget.Secondly, although the microfiber covering feels really nice you need to beware if you live in an area with dry air (like Southern California, for example). I didn't realize it at first, but if you live in a dry climate and have a carpet floor this chair becomes.... scary. Why? Because if you touch any metal surface when you stand to get up out of your chair, you will get a BIG electric shock. I'm 100% serious on this--and it really startled me when it started happening! Sometimes the shocks would get so big, I could actually see light coming from my fingertip. It can be a little painful if you don't remember to discharge the electricity somehow (i.e. I touch the wall to get rid of the static buildup after standing up). I wear socks all the time, so this also factors into the static buildup. I have metal parts in my desk that I use this chair with, so unfortunately shocks are frequent for me. Just something I gotta live with until I get a new chair or a cover I guess!That being said, I'm still fine with purchasing this chair. I really needed it at the time, so I appreciate the price it was going for.tl;dr- the major setback this chair has is static buildup it makes due to the microfiber cloth its made of", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 3, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Executive Chair', 'author': 'michiko', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Just received our Serta microfiber exec chair. Delivery from Amazon was super fast. Assembly was a snap - follow the directions and it took me less than 30 minutes. The great part is that all the tools needed to put it together are included. The chair is VERY COMFORTABLE with great padding on the seat and back. The chair height is adjustable with a gas cylinder lift. The chair arms are also well padded. The microfiber material is very soft to the touch unlike the hard leather covering we had on our chair before.The seat provides good support to the thighs. I'm 5 feet 7 inches and it is perfect for me; however, I feel that a bigger person over 6 feet may find this seat to be too small and would be better off looking for a seat that is larger.On the minus side:1. I would like to have with this chair would have been a bit more height on the back rest for head support.2. Chair does not tilt back.Over all, however, the construction, comfort and most of all, the great price from Amazon make up for the shortcomings noted. I'm not sure about the long term; but it is so much better than the chair we have been using. We spend a lot of time on our desk computer and this chair is just a perfect fit.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 12, 2013', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars A little too tall, and barely reclines (without modification)', 'author': 'Michael J. Cohen', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Needed a sturdier chair for my home office, and I personally like the feel of microfiber vs. leather (or fake leather). The chair has very stiff cushioning (which I like for prolonged periods of sitting) and the arm rests are at a reasonable height and width for me (I\'m 6\', 220lbs). The chair offers a decently ergonomic experience albeit it\'s a touch on the tall side even when fully lowered. My 5\'4" wife said it would be uncomfortable for her to sit in for very long since her legs dangle a bit. Not too much of a problem for me, but the real issue with this chair is that it leans back only a fraction of what it should.The reason for this is two metal tabs that make contact with the back side of the hinge mechanism. There\'s only about a 1/4" gap in there which doesn\'t allow for very much tilt at all, making the chair somewhat uncomfortable to lean back in. It\'s not even as good as an airline seat IMHO.Ideally, you\'d want your center of mass to be able to rotate to behind the hinge point so that the chair can stay reclined without you having to push back with your feet, and this is not the case in the original, stock form. The fix is to take an oscillating tool with a bi-metal blade (or maybe you could use a jig saw, not sure) and chop those tabs off by another 1/4". Now the chair leans back a proper amount, and there\'s still no risk of it tipping over (for me, at least). Obviously, this will void the warranty, so do it at your own risk. If you remove anything more than 1/4", it might induce a tipping over backwards hazard (especially if you\'re larger than me) so you have been warned.I have no idea why they thought the extremely minimal amount of tilt was a good thing, or maybe it has to do with how far back the base is mounted to the seat, since it seems like the tilt mechanism is a standard part used in many different chairs. It remains to be seen if the chair holds up over time, but for now, after modification, it\'s quite comfy and I\'m looking forward to using it for a long while.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful Office Chair', 'author': 'casey coil', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought for my child that sits in it everyday to play games with his friends. It‚Äôs comfortable and sturdy.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Okay chair. Used to be so much better.', 'author': 'M. Wolf', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'I had a chair like this ~10 years ago. Back then, it was also made by Serta, and it was like sitting on a cloud, on that awesome microfiber upholstery. Though... No longer.Several years back that chair was great. It felt like I was sitting on a Serta mattress. Sure, it had a problem with the lifter/cylinder, where it would not keep the height of the chair and would slowly deflate. But, I had already owned the chair for like 3 - 4 years already at that point, and I feel I got good use out of it. I tried replacing the cylinder, but it was nigh impossible to remove the cylinder from the wheel base, so in the trash it went.Little over a year ago, I bought this chair again, because I really loved how comfortable it was. But, something changed in the seat design that seriously reduced how comfy it is. It feels hard, and prolonged periods of sitting are not recommended in this chair.It then also reminded me, of the forward portion of the arm rest that attaches to the seat, how it would dig into my thighs. I\'m not a super big guy, sure I\'m 6\'2", and 235lbs, but it did make me remember how the arm rests weren\'t in the greatest positions for thick thighs.Fast forward to a couple of weeks ago... cylinder appears to leaking again, or just not staying where it\'s supposed to be. If I sit in the chair, I can expect the chair to slowly descend again... guess that part of the chair never got addressed either.Very sad... as I really used to think highly of this chair, and even with the thigh-issue, I thought it was still a super comfy chair... But, considering that the cylinder/lifter issue now seems like it\'s just a thing for this chair, and the fact that the upholstery just isn\'t the same anymore... very sad.I don\'t recommend getting this chair if you work from home, or sit in your office chair a lot. It used to be very comfortable, the seat... but with all these other chronic issues, I just can\'t recommend this chair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Serta office chair', 'author': 'Nancy White', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love it. Read reviews that it was difficult to put together. It was easy. Went together easy. Very comfortable', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars It's a good - but not great - office chair.", 'author': 'Aidin McLaurin', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Assembly took about 25 minutes.I\'m 6ft1, the chair is pretty comfortable, but the top of my shoulders sit above the "headrest pillow."The back rest is attached via arm rest, so no removing the armrest if you are a larger person or wanted to use this for a console gameroom chair.The seat can lock in at upright position or lean back a little bit, but not as far as I would hope.No lumbar support, definitely going to have to buy an attachment pillow for that.Overall - good, but not great. Chairs can get insanely expensive so it\'s nice to have a very viable option in this price range.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice but firm.', 'author': 'Ray Paquette', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I like the chair, My only complaint is that the seat is too firm for my taste. I hope it will soften up down the road. It would of been nice to have a darker grey color.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Glad I got it for my chair', 'author': 'H.H.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'fit perfect, no really perfect, I never get to say that. Comfortable, looks nice, went chair on quickly. Down the road would get again.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars What a Piece of Junk!!', 'author': 'Lynn', 'rating': 1, 'content': "This is a piece of mal-fitting junk. I measured the subject chair before I place my order and selected the correct size based on the instructions in the Amazon ad. I cannot get the cover to fit the chair, in fact if anything it is about 1/2 the size needed. There are zero instructions in how to install it on your chair, there are just 2 or 3 zippers and no information about what to do with cover regarding the back of the chair, the seat of the chair, etc. It's going back!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 9, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fits chair very well', 'author': 'Mancha', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have had this office chair for many months now. The fabric is very durable, breathable, looks nice (black, like original chair color), and fits well. It was easy to install, too. I was really surprised; though I was going to get a sloppy cover that hung off the chair like an oversized dust cover. Not so!I do not like the throw anything away that still has use, and this chair is in great shape; the surface was just peeling off. This cover not only saved money, it saved resources.Now, I just need to order the armrest covers...', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 30, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars great, easy to use cover', 'author': 'Jenny', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The chair cover is easy to install and is very well made (zippers work well, Velcro attached completely, seams are straight). We had a faux leather chair when we adopted our cats (kittens at the time), and their play was recorded for posterity via scratches and gashes. They have learned to behave much better, but the chair, sadly, did not get better on its own. This cover makes it look new again. I love that it feels sturdy, and also that it is machine washable. The sizing chart was spot on.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Overall Good.', 'author': 'Nick', 'rating': 4, 'content': "For whatever reason, the velcro on one of the sides that attaches the cover to the seat of the chair was completely worn down. I just ended up using a safety pin to hold it together (it settled on the bottom anyway and isn't noticeable), but I'm still knocking off a star for it. Other than that it fits the chair well.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 27, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice!', 'author': 'Phil Oregon', 'rating': 5, 'content': "well after I had a good laugh trying to figure out WHAT it was, cause I got it in a plain wrapper with no identification markings inside I finally pulled out the two smaller things at the bottom of the bag. It was the armchair cover! the smaller things were the tip-offs. The armrest covers that I ordered at the same time. I referred back to the pictures here and put it all on. The eyesore I had before is no more! Looks presentable now and I'm pretty happy. The only thing is that the top corners are designed for a truly square back top and ours are rounded. Oh well, for about $20 I'm impressed. Some of these things cost 3 times as much with few stars. I had to wait a while for mine because it came from China they didn't have black in stock.Worth the wait and it was worth it to get a well made, durable appearing product. Tired of spending an arm and a leg for faux leather and have it start peeling after a couple of years then replacing just for esthetic reasons. Chair is perfectly sound.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 29, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars edit: lasted 7 months b4 zipoers broke. Very adaptable, fits my very old, odd chair!', 'author': 'RebelLemming', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Edit: 8/09/19 lasted 7 months before both zippers broke. Very disappointing. I used this on a old-old office chair with torn, faded, ugly blue upholstery. The chair is heavy & odd in that the arms are set further back than generally seen. I was worried at first that sz small wasn't going to fit even though I measured carefully. But because of the stretchable fabric and well designed placement of the velcro it fits perfect! Very adaptable! I was able to tuck the arm placement fabric up so it can't be seen (because of my chairs odd' offset arms, not because of the cover). Now my chair matches my room and it looks terrific, which means I won't need to buy a new chair!!! Thank you so much for your excellent product, I appreciate your ingenuity in designing these covers!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Gives your damaged office chair new life', 'author': 'Patrick C. Miller', 'rating': 4, 'content': "My wife let me pick out a nice office chair as a birthday present. Unfortunately, our cat decided that the top of the chair could double as a scratching post. I didn't want to get rid of the chair because it was fairly new and really comfortable. The Trycooling chair cover helped solve the problem. It was easy to install and covers up the unsightly claw marks. The reason I took off a star is because the cover doesn't fit quite right. The fabric won't stay tucked between the seat cushions, which makes it look more like a cover rather than a part of the chair itself. Still, if you have a damaged office chair and want to get more use out of it by hiding the damaged portion, the Trycooling chair cover is relatively inexpensive and easy solution.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good cover, doesn‚Äôt really lay flush on the inside corner', 'author': 'amz_usr_123', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'We got this cover to help provide some protection from a cat that has been climbing our office chairs and scratching up the artificial leather trim on the chair. This cover is thick enough to limit how much damage she can do to the chair itself. There aren‚Äôt any instructions as others have pointed out, but it was pretty easy. I recommend putting on the back and base fabric, then closing the Velcro for the base, followed by the zipper for the back of the chair. That should minimize the strain put on the zipper when you put the seat portion on the chair. Our chair is rounded on the corners so we did have a little bit of excess fabric there, but with the elasticity of the material it was minimal where I think only I would notice it. I gave it 4 stars because I‚Äôm not a fan of the canopy effect where the back of the chair meets the seat. That noticeably sticks out. I don‚Äôt know how their pictures seem to show it flush with the chair. Luckily you don‚Äôt feel it when you‚Äôre sitting. It is only a visual thing for me.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Glad I was able to save my chair, fits nicely and easy to put on.', 'author': 'Alison', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I had a small tear on the seating surface and made the mistake of using leather repair tape to cover the tear. This tape ended up yanking the top layer off. I was going to buy another chair but I am glad to come across this cover. My chair is a one piece L shape type so my concern was if it will fit at all. Well just a look at the picture and judge for it yourself. Comfortable and well fitted. Such a great buy.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 10, 2022', 'is_verified': True}]
