reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love It', 'author': 'D mason', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love my chair, easy to assemble and just what I wanted.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Ergonomic Office Chair Cheap Desk Chair Mesh Computer Chair with Lumbar Support Arms Modern Cute Swivel Rolling Task Mid Back Executive Chair for Women Men Adults Girls,Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Requires some elbow grease, but all worth it!', 'author': 'Amber Dee', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The chair was an absolute step up to the wooden stools provided to me by my dorm. It is a fast, easy, affordable and reliable option for better support and comfort. The box provided came with all parts, the necessary screws and connectors, and the required Allen key to assemble, which was a big relief since I didn\'t need to go out and buy one.My particular order came with a missing screw, but since it was only one missing, the spare provided was able to cover for it. Sometimes, the parts would not fit cleanly into the holes to screw them into, and it would be difficult trying to wrestle the sturdy pieces into their supposed places to let the screws hold them into place. I do not know if this is because the parts warped due to temperature changes, or other factors. My roommate has purchased the same chair, and indeed, our parts seemed to fit differently (hers required more strength to bend into place, mine didn\'t fit snugly into some places, etc.) Despite this, I was still able to assemble my chair perfectly given a little time and patience (and energy).Overall, I am very satisfied with my chair. It fell under the perfect price point for a college student like me and offers a great amount of comfort and support. My current experience with this chair far outweighs the "bad" points I have listed, as even then, I am still able to use the chair despite all that.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 11, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars One of the best chairs for the money', 'author': 'T. Pico', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'For almost 20 years I worked in the commercial furniture industry for some of the largest manufacturers who had many many styles and designs of ergonomic chairs. The fancy chairs with the high prices. And yet, I spent $35 plus $10 shipping for a really decent chair. All standard features; gas lift, tilt tension, tilt lock. Seat is not too deep (great for me with shorter legs). The mesh back is pretty good, supportive but not too much so. Chair is mostly plastic (aren\'t they all) but the back frame is nicely designed for strength and supports the mesh nicely.Enough of my in-depth review . . . the chair is great (for the price). Assembly was easy (but I have experience).I weigh 178 lbs and I\'m 5\'8" tall and it works quite well for me.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 11, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars a really good cheap chair', 'author': 'M. Webb', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'normally i dislike things made of abs or plastics in general. but this is a clever use to make a strong lightweight supportive chair at a fair price. assembly is almost self explanatory but in any case less than 10 minutes. all the tools needed are included.i have a bad back along with nerve damage. chairs are very important even at the low end. this is a perfect part-time home office chair or study chair for teenagers. the seat is firm the lumbar support is real and the design of the seat means that bigger butts than mine can stand or sit without hitting the armrests.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Better than it has any righ tto be', 'author': 'Seth', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I\'m 5\' 3" with a 27" inseam, and I need a chair with shallow depth so that I can sit the way god intended, with my knees bent at a 45 degree angle. I\'m also 140lbs, about half the weight of your mom, so results may vary. We bought this chair along with another model from a different manufacturer for about the same price. Let\'s begin with the price - for this price, you shouldn\'t expect much. The other chair delivered on that expectation - flimsy, cheap materials, and plastic base. THIS chair exceeds all expectations. The base is very thick plastic, the seat fabric is in the same style as a breathable moisture wicking fabric. ALL bolts came with a compound on them in the appearance of a thread locking compound, and if it actually is thread locking compound this that would be an amazing inclusion at even double the price range of this chair. The back is a breathable mesh. The chair is relatively solid, with little flex in the back support. The chair looks fine, it would not appear out of place next to more expensive chairs. My only complaint is that the bottom cushion is relatively thin and uncomfortable - but it\'s not a deal breaker. As expected for the price, the center podium does not provide a 100% flex free experience, but the amount of wobble present is negligible. The ergonomics are good, much better than any other cheap chair I\'ve been in, and yes, my knees enjoy a full sitting range of motion now. This is a solid win. We are buying another.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 16, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Actual chair looks better than the picture.', 'author': 'Deborah D. MacArthur', 'rating': 3, 'content': "The chair was well packaged but easy to unpack. The diagrams make putting it together very easy. I assembled it while talking on the phone and had no problems at all. It is comfortable, I rolls easily even on carpet. The back has good lumbar support. The seat is well cushioned and I like the fabric. The armrests are a little thin and under-padded but not enough to be a problem. Excellent value for the price.EDIT: I came back to buy another of these chairs. Mine has a mesh back with a shell design at the lower back and was $44.99 The chair pictured here has a solid black band across the mesh back and is a little more expensive. This pictured chair is not the chair I purchased and reviewed. No matter how many times I click on my previous order it takes me to this chair instead. I am not pleased by the switch. Even though this chair is similar I would rather see the chair listed as unavailable than have this passed off as the same chair. I changed my review from 5 stars for my chair to 3 stars because I don't care for the look of this new version and I don't like the forced swap.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 3, 2016', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exceptional value', 'author': 'Laurence', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My review reflects the amazing price of this chair. My wife and I were sitting on old, busted, broken down chairs in our home office and were miserable. I got two of these as a band aid until we figured out a long term solution. Ends up these chairs are great! I\'m 6\'2" and 230 lbs and it\'s big enough, although I can see how some might not agree, as it\'s on the smaller side. The back is lower but reaches the bottom of my shoulder blades so I feel like I have plenty of lower back support, and the mesh keeps you cool. The seat padding is a little thin so I wouldn\'t recommend this for your 8 hour a day work office, but evening home office setting is perfect. It would also make a great second office chair for a visitor, as it\'s small and easily tucked away. Why am I giving five stars then? Because it\'s $45!! I\'ve sat in $200 chairs less comfortable than this. Now we both have good looking, reasonably comfortable chairs and it came in under $100 for both with free shipping.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 26, 2016', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable and VERY EASY to Assemble', 'author': 'Inge Rush', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I just purchased this chair and it arrived yesterday. It is very comfortable and functions as expected. It meets my needs perfectly.I wanted to take a moment to speak about the assembly process because I was concerned after reading so many comments complaining about the complexity in performing this task. I was able to assemble this chair in a matter of 15 minutes! Here are some tricks to consider:1. There is a link to an assembly demonstration on the Amazon page. Look at how the gentlemen is performing the task and follow it exactly and you will have quick results as well2. I followed the instructions including using the packaging box as a work platform. I think this is key because it allows you to position the back and seat on a level surface while assembling the arms, etc.3. I have a ratchet type screwdriver that works with "drill" bits. I found the bit that corresponded to the allen wrench provided in the screw packet and used that in lieu of the wrench. I think this made the process much easier.Bottom line: easy assembly and a great chair for the price!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "1.0 out of 5 stars Wasn't unbearable, until it broke just over a month in.", 'author': 'Cody', 'rating': 1, 'content': "Received this chair just over a month ago, and already need to order a different one. I will list both pros and cons, though the cons thoroughly obviate the pros.Pros:Assembly was very easy, and even though I mounted the seat backwards and had to take it apart, it still took my less than 45 minutes to finish putting it together.The base seems sturdy enough, though I replaced the wheels with stationary feet to prevent our mischievous toddler twins from using it as a convenient step stool to reach things.The air cylinder is very strong, and the aforementioned troublemakers found that it will lift either of them up with ease (30+ lbs).The arms and overall frame are quite sturdy, and the seat is comfortable enough to sit in for 2 or so hours.Cons:The base is not attached to the chair permanently, so if you intend to pick this chair up often, you will probably run into issues with it falling apart.The back of the chair is rather uncomfortable, with that darn little clamshell shaped plastic chunk pushing the the mesh into your spine.The mesh itself is not very durable, and within a month already started to wear/tear on the arms.The seat is impossible to clean, for instance, if a small person left their leaky milk cup on the seat, you will not be able to clean it due to the mesh over the top.The arm rests are incredibly narrow, so if you plan on sitting like a prude, you'll fit right in.Last but not least, the fiberboard junk that the bottom of the seat consists of, ripped free of the mounting bracket after just one month, rendering this chair useless.Overall, due to my experience, I have to recommend avoiding this chair, and shelling out a little more money for something better made.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 28, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars F√°cil de armar!', 'author': 'Rosa M.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Muy buena y c√≥moda, f√°cil de armar', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Meh', 'author': 'Jennifer', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Firstly, the good points. This chair has really great lower back support, and the majority of the stars in the review can be attributed to this feature. The mesh back is also nice during the hot days, as it doesn't block the flow of air from the fan. The assembly was fairly straight foward, with mostly clear instructions and no need for extra tools, although I do think they could've put in there to avoid tightening the screws on the arms fully until the seat was also screwed in. It's not hard to figure out after the fact, since you quickly come to the realization the seat won't fit without a little give from the arms, but it's annoying to have to go back and loosen something you just thought you finished. Still, assembly only took me about 20 minutes and that was with me pacing myself, which isn't bad at all.Not good, but not horrible feature: the seat. It's really firm and I don't think it's ergonomic at all, unlike the back. On one hand, that's good because it means it won't flatten out like some of the more cushy seats tend to do over time, but, on the other hand, it means it's not that comfortable to begin with. Also, the meshy lining over the seat feels pretty rough on the skin and leaves imprints, which also isn't that comfortable.The bad: the armrests. I'm a petite woman who finds most desk chair armrests to be too high and, this, unfortunately, went all the way to the other side of the problem and is too low. I found myself hunching over to use the armrests all the time, which is a killer on the upper back and shoulders and is bad for posture. I can't imagine how it must be for taller people to sit in this chair. I considered returning the chair simply because of the armrest issue, but ultimately decided to keep it because the thought of disassembling it and dragging the box to return it was worse than the thought of keeping it. What I ended up doing was buying a pair of chair armrest pads that velcro on, and that made up for the little bit of height the arms needed, but it did turn this $50 purchase to a $70 purchase, so not as cheap as I thought at first.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 18, 2017', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Flash Furniture Porter High Back Mesh Ergonomic Swivel Office Chair with Lumbar Support, Flip-Up Arms, Tilt Lock/Tilt Tension, Height Adjustable, Purple/Black Frame
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent choice', 'author': 'Sheila Alonso', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was looking for a white computer chair to replace the one I had for a few years. There were a lot of choices but somehow this one caught my eye! so very glad It did, it was not the most expensive but for the price this chair looks expensive and is beautiful! Just love it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Has to be put together so some may need help', 'author': 'farmgirl007', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Looks nice and is deep seated so not for short person. Fairly comfortable. I use a pillow to support my back. Not easy to roll on carpet when in it but love that the arms lift up!Great value!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars Works well with a few add-on's...", 'author': 'eShopper Guy', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Overall this chair is comfortable and offers decent support. The seat pad is not super squishy but is supportive and I like that it's contoured, it's not just a flat surface. Lower back support is good. Easy to put together. The two reasons I decided to try this chair is because it came in various colors (I got the blue) and had arm rests that you can lift up and out of the way if you want to move in close to the desk. I have not had any issues sliding off the seat like others have mentioned. It has a nice range of height adjustment. It does recline and also has a recline lock and tension adjustment. Not sure why others have said it doesn't recline?? Maybe the put the base on backwards??However it's not perfect but with a couple of add-on's it's very close. I added rollerblade style wheels which I ordered on Amazon to prevent any floor scratching issues on my wood laminate flooring. Also the fabric is a little itchy for lack of a better term. But the only place it bothered me was on my elbows. I often rest the point of my elbows on the arm rest and the fabric is very irritating over time. So I ordered arm chair pads on Amazon which should solve that issue. Even with the add on's it's still a good price. I guess very few chairs will be perfect but for the price this is a good chair. If it can hold up and last for at least a few years then it will have been worth it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 14, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very comfortable', 'author': 'devoted reader', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I would give this 5 stars but for the fact that the first time I used it the back would not recline when pulling the height handle out. It did work first time I sat in it, but when I actually started using it the handle no longer release the back. No help from the online customer service, in fact, there doesn‚Äôt seem to be online customer service even though (unless I‚Äôve misunderstood) it is advertised and there is a link. So, not a 5 star review. EDIT: The manufacturer messaged me and asked me to respond via Amazon messages, but I couldn‚Äôt figure out how to. In the meantime, my husband showed me that the chair does indeed rock back, I‚Äôm just too small and lightweight to make it happen! So I‚Äôve gone back and updated to a 5 star review because it‚Äôs a great price and a very nice chair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great chair', 'author': 'HP', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Great chair to sit on for hours. I'm petite and it's not too big. Love that the arm rest goes up and down. Wish the back of the chair can tilt, but it can't. The padding is comfortable, but the mesh is not soft on your skin. Only took 1 person to assemble in 1 hour if you read the reviews - there's some good tips to save you headache when building. Wish it had more lumbar support.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars IMPORTANT ‚ÄºÔ∏è', 'author': 'Betzy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I am writing this review because I read some else‚Äôs review that changed my mind and find it quite amusing‚ÄºÔ∏èI read many reviews before purchasing and only found a few that didn‚Äôt like the chair. I ordered and proceeded to put it together. I sat in it and was not happy‚ÄºÔ∏èI felt like I was sliding out of it. Not comfortable and did not recline. THEN my mind recalled someone else said that and someone else replied saying ‚Äúmaybe you put the seat on BACKWARDS! I immediately got out pictures of it AND the instructions and, sure enough, I had it on backwards‚ÄºÔ∏èüòÇ it was easy to put together (even twice) and I‚Äôm 89 years old and did it ALONE‚ÄºÔ∏èIf I can do it, anyone can and NOW, I LOVE IT‚ÄºÔ∏è', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars I wish to know before I bought it', 'author': 'Danna Adiya', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I've been using this chair for 3 months now. there are a few things I want to mention about this chair.1. Easy to assemble. It only took 20 min. The picture and instructions were pretty easy to understand.2. It looks cute after assembling. (I got a white one, it is so cute)3. The arm rester is comfortable4. The seat cushion is not as comfortable and soft as I expected. After I seat around 30min, my butt hurts so bad. So I walk or stand up a little bit.5. After u assemble it, have a cute chair for maybe one or two days. After that, use the cover!! Because mine got a stain within a week. I tried to remove it, but no luck. I wish I used a cushion cover earlier.6. THIS IS IMPORTANT. The seat tilt doesn't work. I have to push with force to tilt it just a little bit (I know it has a tilt lock and it was unlocked). I'm 60kg so I don't think it is because I'm light either.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars The chair does tilt/ rock back', 'author': 'anna moses', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The lever under the seat that controls the height also controls the tilting motion. You have to push it in or out to release or lock the tilting motion. The instructions aren‚Äôt very clear. It feels comfortable day one and the blue color is deep and bright', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice for the money.', 'author': 'Scott Stevens', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I ahve been using the chair for about 3 weeks and so for so good. I did not have any problems with assembly.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars The seat is Not ergonomic', 'author': 'Nazanine', 'rating': 3, 'content': "This is a beautiful chair but if you're looking for an ergonomic seat cushion, it is too soft of a foam. I tried twice and neither time worked.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

There are other chairs out there.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Cheaply made', 'author': 'Patti', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'I have had the chair for 7 months and the metal on the bottom of the chair has broke in pieces and now it just wobbles and is very uncomfortable and unsafe. title: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Executive High Back Computer Desk Chair, Adjustable Lumbar Support, Padded Flip-Up Arms, Leather Chair Swivel Rolling Chair with Upgraded Caster Wheels
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome!', 'author': 'Stephanie pifalo', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love this chair, leather is soft perfect size and just feels solid. I was super skeptical because there‚Äôs so many chairs on Amazon but this one is perfect.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Stylish', 'author': 'Elena', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Let me tell you, this big and tall office chair is a total game-changer for anyone spending long hours at the desk. First off, the ergonomic design is like a hug for your back ‚Äì the adjustable lumbar support is a lifesaver. The padded flip-up arms are a nice touch, giving you the flexibility to switch up your sitting style. The leather upholstery feels premium and is a breeze to clean. I'm a big fan of the swivel and rolling action; it's like I'm gliding through my workday. And those upgraded caster wheels are a silent superhero ‚Äì no more annoying squeaks or clunks. As a tall person, finding a chair that fits is usually a struggle, but this one is a winner. It's not just a chair; it's my office sanctuary. Highly recommend for anyone in need of comfort and style while grinding away at the computer.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Super comfy', 'author': 'Christine', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Super comfy chair, the foam allows for comfort when I sit for long hours.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice Looking Gaming Chair w/ Foot Rest', 'author': 'Shannon Lee', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The chair is very nice looking, I mean it's super impressive. The seat reclines and locks into whatever desired place for comfort. It also has a footrest, not sure how much I'll be using it, but also a nice feature.I dreaded building the chair but am happy and relieved to say it was very easy to put together. It only required one allen wrench (included) and all the screws were already attached in their required spots, just unscrew attach and re-screw, so no trying to decipher which is which and where they go. The instructions were super easy to follow, all pics! I sat down with the box and my tv show on and had it done in an hour. I enjoyed myself and felt quite accomplished.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Armless Swivel Mesh Office Chair Height Adjustable with Lumber Support for Small Spaces, Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to assemble, comfortable, adjustable', 'author': 'Elsabae', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This took me less than 25 mintues from opening the box to sitting down. The only tool you need is the included allen wrench and the instructions are really clear. They even include extra hardware although you\'d have to be an even bigger clutz than me - unlikely - to lose bolts this big.The chair is comfortable. The mesh back is very supportive and the height adjusts easily. (I\'m only 4\'10" and the range is adequate for me!) The seat is memory foam. I am accustomed to a polyfill seat so the firmer seat is taking a little getting use to. But it is comfortable.The wheels roll very easily. I live in an old house with uneven floors so I may have to actually jam something in them to make them roll less easily! I keep rolling down the room....If you like a chair without arms, this is a good one. And the price beats others I have seen.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Assembly required', 'author': 'Peter Riley Osborne', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This chair is perfect for the craft room. It was simple to assemble and came with all the necessary tools. It even came with some extra bolts labeled as extra parts. The chair has a lift so you can adjust up/down to be the height you need. I love the mesh back because it is breathable. The seat cushion is on the firmer side, but is comfortable. It feels quite sturdy, like it will hold up for quite awhile, and rolls really smoothly too.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Super easy to assemble', 'author': 'Gypsy Sanz', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Nice chair that is a cross between a basic chair, office chair and ergonomic chair.Basic Chair: Decent size, basic seat and basic functions (wheels and height adjustment).Office Chair: Black fabric on padded seat, black mesh on back rest, nice sturdy black plastic parts and frame.Ergonomic Chair: Back rest is mesh and ergonomically curved; unfortunately, it is not adjustable.The chair is super simple, easy and fast to assemble. Directions are clear, even though I did not really used them...assembling is pretty intuitive. It took me about 10 minutes to open the box and get all the pieces unwrapped (nice packing), and about 15 minutes to put the chair together. The legs easily slide in pre-cut/designed grooves on the base. The wheels pop pretty easy with some wiggling and push required. Pneumatic column slides in, seat slides into column. The biggest job is to tighten the hex screws to secure seat and back rest together.The size is pretty compact, which I like.I would recommend this chair for the simplicity and space saving while maintaining a classy professional look. I have a home office and this chair is perfect for clients coming to my home office.The price value is excellent in my opinion.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice little chair', 'author': 'P. M. Green', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'With the emphasis on the "little".....but still very useable even if you\'re tall and have long legs. Very easy to assemble but be careful when attaching the spokes to the base as the hard plastic is pretty sharp underneath and you could easily slice your finger. You may have to give one or two of the spoke a light tap to get it into place but, other than that, it goes together easily. I do have to admit that I put a very well padded cushion designed for chairs like this which made it much more comfortable and stretched my legs out. I\'m using the chair to fit more comfortably into the leg area of a vintage library table that I use for a desk.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The The Great Value', 'author': 'J160', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a very attractive modern looking chair. It is a great value for the price. The chair assemble easily in less than ten minutes. The only tool necessary was an Allen wrench that is included. The hydraulic seat lift works easily and smoothly. The seat is a very nice cushy foam for people like me that have a boney butt. It is a nice neutral design. I highly recommend this for a budget conscious home office.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars An excellent, comfortable chair', 'author': 'P Papagiannakis', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I must admit that when I saw the parts I frowned...I was surprisingly wrong!!!The build was much simpler than I thought. The legs attached very easy, just twist on. Install the casters, Install 7 bolts with lock thread on them already, then the up/down mechanism, one cover so you don't see the bolts and I think it was less than 15 minutes...The char was ready for the last test. And, the second surprise, it is VERY comfortable!I also prejudged base on the looks.... The quality is definitely there also!An excellent chair that is comfortable and easy to put together.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars nice chair for the cost', 'author': 'Monkeyskin', 'rating': 4, 'content': "If you're in search of an inexpensive office type chair, look no further. It is nicely made and doesn't feel or look cheap. I put it together in about five minutes. I wouldn't work in it all day, as I prefer chairs with arms, but it surely gets the job done. I have it in my home office by a secondary workstation and it is perfect for my needs.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice chair, easy to assemble', 'author': 'R', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was looking for a basic chair for my son\'s room to sit at a desk and do schoolwork, draw, play, whatever. This turned out to be the perfect chair. Simple and "bare bones" but just what I needed. It came with all the parts needed for assembly, most of it just clicks together, there were only 7 screws, and it came with it\'s own hex wrench.It only took about 15 minutes to put together, it comes with everything needed, no extra tools necessary. It\'s comfortable and would work well for an adult as well (no arms, but that\'s personal preference if you want arms or not.) Very happy with the chair, exactly what I needed.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Decent Basic Office Chair - Not for all day work', 'author': 'Durbania', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This is a basic task office chair. The chair does go up and down higher and lower than expected, which is nice, because I am short. There is no lumbar support adjustment, but where the back sits was a good spot for my back.I work from home, and after about 2 1/2 to 3 hours of sitting in this chair, it started to hurt my butt. So it‚Äôs not a chair you would need to sit eight hours a day in, but it works very well for one or two hours at a time.It was very easy to put the chair together and did not take long at all.I wish the cushion was something I could sit in all day for work, instead, this will go in my husband‚Äòs office, where he only sits for an hour or two at a time.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Surprisingly sturdy and comfortable!', 'author': 'Jason H.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love this task chair! It's perfect for me because I'm always rolling across the room from one desk to the other. A real busy office, and it's great in that it doesn't have arms to get in the way. I am always working on PCs, lifting them up and taking them apart and don't want chair arms in my way. This chair is perfect for that!It's also surprisingly comfortable especially for the price.Decent chair, incredible value!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': False}]

title: Ergonomic Office Chair, Executive Desk Chair with Flip-up Armrest, Lumbar Support, Computer Task Chair with Adjustable Headrest, Mesh Seat, Metal Base, Silence Wheels for Home Office Hotel
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars As depicted', 'author': 'keegan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Took a chance on a product with no reviews or ratings. Since I\'m one of the first to order this model I felt like I should write a review.It seems to be exactly as depicted. Putting together wasn\'t bad. Just took me a minute to figure out that I wasn\'t missing a piece to attach the back to the seat.Support seems great. I was looking for a chair to be able to comfortably lean back while coding and sitting on the computer for school. This definitely seems like it will work great.Not the best for writing on the desk. But that seems to be the trade off I went for when going for something more comfortable to lean back in. The seat is made to keep you from slipping forward when leaning back. Not the best for when looking down at the desk. Kind of have to sit on the edge for that.I\'m 5\'7" and when I lean back it definitely fits my back and neck nicely.It looks really nice and all the functions seem to be there. Lean back and lock and seat tilts. The head rest is comfortable. The armrests could stand to go a little lower, but they\'re fine and soft.Time will tell if the durability and reliability is there. It seems solid for a mostly plastic build. The chair base and mechanics seem to all be of metal. Except the flip-up armrests.***upate***chair still works just fine after about a month. The only thing I dislike are is the fact that when you recline the chair, the armrests recline with it. So, your leaning back, and the armrests are tilted upward. Everything else is just fine though.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 11, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very comfortable chair', 'author': 'Shemal Bodawala', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This ergonomic chair design is very comfortable for long desk hours. It has great adjustability and is very sturdy. The neck and lumbar support is very good. Has strong mesh that handles the weight well. The chair can be adjusted to one‚Äôs comfort and personal preferences.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good product', 'author': 'Javier', 'rating': 4, 'content': "It's very comfortable", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great chair for guitarists', 'author': 'meechomarcho', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have been looking for a good, ergonomic desk chair with armrests that swing up and out of the way. I am studying music and spend hours at a workstation (computer desk for musicians) with a guitar in my lap. This chair is perfect - when I'm playing guitar, I swing the arms up, otherwise they are down in the normal desk chair position. The chair was a breeze to assemble thanks to good packaging and instructions - with all of the tools necessary included. They thoughtfully included an extra bolt in each size just in case one gets lost or damaged during assembly. I am 6' and 185 lb - the chair fits me perfectly.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Chair is comfy, head rest is flimsy', 'author': 'Armando', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. Overall a good chair, the mesh is very nice looking. Two things that can improve is the head rest, and the chair does not sit stay in a 90 degree angle.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Disappointed with defective part & overall comfort', 'author': 'Private', 'rating': 2, 'content': "I was so excited about this chair I purchased during Amazon Prime Days, but sadly it was a huge disappointment!!!Pros:‚Ä¢ Good wide-sized seat‚Ä¢ Adjustable arms‚Ä¢ Comfortable on butt and back (for most part).‚Ä¢ Lumbar support is nice‚Ä¢ Decent material‚Ä¢ Easy assemble, except for trying to make defective pieces fitCons:‚Ä¢ Headrest looks awesome with it's built-in hanger; however, the one that came with my chair was defective and screw holes don't line up to attach it to chair...this was the biggest disappointment of all!‚Ä¢ There is only one adjustment for the height and it doesn't go as high as most chairs.‚Ä¢ The chair rocks too easily. For those who like a seat to stay in a place and only swivel to left or right, this isn't the chair for you!‚Ä¢ This chair back has one setting. For people with short legs, who like to have their chair back to move forward more so their legs are more comfortable...this isn't the chair for you!***Will try to post pic of defect soon, if it hasn't already gone out with the trash. ***", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very comfortable and very sturdy office chair', 'author': 'Parrish R.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "When this chair was delivered I was surprised at the size of the box and the weight. The shipping weight is a little over 44lbs. The box is very heavy duty and everything was packed well. Each component is individually wrapped in bubble wrap and everything was in perfect condition. The primary support mechanism (the part under the seat that controls everything) is very well built and is much thicker steel than what my old office chair (a big box office store name brand chair). The chair is absolutely much sturdier and well built than my old chair. The weight difference alone is significant.The chair assembles easily, although the instructions aren't entirely clear on how a few things go together. Such as how to mount the main support bracket to the seat bottom. Each piece has an arrow sticker- you just need to make sure the arrows are both pointing in the same direction. But the instructions don't mention that. I was able to get it fully assembled in about 20 minutes. They do provide an M5 Allen wrench. However, this wrench is very low quality steel and stripped out about 4 bolts in to the assembly. So just grab your own tools from the start. They give you one extra bolt of each size and all of them have blue threadlocker applied.The chair is very comfortable and supportive. If anything I wish there was a way to adjust the lumbar support. My old executive style office chair had no lumbar support at all so I'm just not used to it. This chair leans back much further than my old chair. Even so, I had no concern about flipping backwards due to the large caster base. The casters have a slight rubber feel, not just hard plastic. This is nice but it means it doesn't roll as easy as my old chair. Which, honestly, is a good thing as my old chair would often roll away from my desk far too easily.I also like that the arm wrests can fold up and out of the way. This let's me fully push the chair up under my desk when I'm not using it and not have the arm wrests hit the keyboard tray.It then includes a bracket mounted on the chair back that you can hang your jacket or other items on. That's handier than you might think.Overall I am very happy with this chair. Especially with how well built it is. I'm not concerned about the support mechanism cracking or bending like other chairs I've owned have done.I really have no real negatives other than with the Allen wrench that was provided (which is really a non-issue). The lumbar support might be too much for some, if it was adjustable that would just make it overall better.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very comfortable chair!', 'author': 'Michael Foudy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This chair was pretty easy to put together, instructions were straightforward and I‚Äôm liking it very much.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 19, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': "2.0 out of 5 stars Doesn't work for a 5'11 man. Might work for a smaller person", 'author': 'Dylan Bright', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'Head rest and lumbar support do not line up well with my body. I don\'t normally require a "big and tall" chair but this is too small for me.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Not very comfy', 'author': 'Todd Mullins', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'The back is not straight up , when you sit , you get the best back support but leaning back makes you slouch . I ended up giving the chair to my coworker and she‚Äôs not crazy about it either .', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

I ended up giving it to my little toddler son for when he gets an upgrade to a bigger desk. The padding on the seat is a bit thin, but the fabric surface feels very soft and smooth to the touch. The color pattern is tranquil and serene. But the adjustment latches are a-lacking. There is only a height adjuster for the chair to go up or down. The tilt-back function is totally absent with this chair; so that's a big bummer for me. I simply won't use a chair without the tilt function. So this is the biggest disappointment. Another gripe I have against this chair is the size and support. So it's got a very short seating platform to hold the thighs, I constantly have to find small step stools to rest my foot on to relieve my thighs. Also the back support is lacking since the chair's back rim is very short in height. Anyway, overall, this is not really an office chair that an adult can sit for a long while at the office. I'm having some very mixed feelings about this chair. But I do want to fully support these innovators for putting new stuff on the Amazon platform. If you're looking for a super nice and comfortable office chair, look elsewhere. If you're looking for a color theme and don't mind lack-luster in features, then this can be your choice.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 15, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very Satisfied', 'author': 'Stephen Krouse', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love the style, comfort and ease to assemble.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to assemble. Gives plenty of support when sitting all the way back in the chair without raising the altitude of the room.I chose the gray which is just kind of gentle and blends with everything.It wheels out of the way easily and tucks under the desk without taking up a lot of room.I\'m happy - was a good choice to order.It also looks a little more stylish than your average office chair from the office supply store. title: Ergonomic Computer Desk Chairs - Mesh Home Office Desk Chairs with Lumbar Support & 3D Adjustable Armrests (High Back)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good chair', 'author': 'Heather A.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I personally love this chair ‚Äì so far at least! It was easy to put together, seems really sturdy (especially given the price), and is comfortable. I work from home so having a good chair to sit on for 7+ hours a day is very important. This chair lived up to that need and seems to be a really good purchase. I do love that the chair is firm, but not too hard and the back is mesh so you don‚Äôt get too hot. It does also have a head rest, and leans back for added comfort. The arm rests to move so you can adjust as needed, and you can also higher or lower the chair. Overall, I would recommend this to someone looking for a good chair at a good price. If you are using it on carpet ‚Äì I do recommend a mat as it is hard to move on carpet but you would have that with any chair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Pleasantly surprised!', 'author': 'April', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Actually very surprised by how high quality this chair is! I was in desperate need of a new office chair as my previous didn‚Äôt provide sufficient back support. I work from home most days and my old chair was really started taking a toll on my back. I searched high and low for a solid office chair that wouldn‚Äôt break the bank. I decided on this one based on all the great reviews and I‚Äôm so glad I did! This chair is solid, breathable, provides wonderful lumbar support, and you can adjust many parts of the chair to meet your exact needs. Good posture is much easier to maintain in this chair! I put this together on my own, it took me around 20 minutes. Not tough at all, the directions were easy to understand. Very happy with this purchase!!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Ergonomic Office Chair Review: Comfortable, Breathable, and Adjustable, Perfect for Desk work', 'author': 'Dinesh', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've been using this ergonomic office chair with mesh and lumbar support for a few months now, and I'm absolutely loving it. It's so comfortable and supportive, and it's made a huge difference in my back pain.The mesh back is really breathable, so I don't get hot and sweaty when I'm sitting in it for long periods of time. The lumbar support is also adjustable, so I can find the perfect position for my back.The chair is also very adjustable in general. I can adjust the height, seat depth, armrests, and tilt. This makes it perfect for people of all sizes.Overall, I'm really happy with this chair. It's comfortable, supportive, and adjustable. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for an ergonomic office chair.Here are some of the pros and cons of this chair:Pros:Comfortable and supportiveBreathable mesh backAdjustable lumbar supportAdjustable height, seat depth, armrests, and tiltDurable constructionCons:Some assembly requiredNot as stylish as some other office chairsOverall, I think this is a great office chair for the price. It's comfortable, supportive, and adjustable, and it's made of durable materials. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for an affordable and ergonomic office chair.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars good chair need a few upgrades', 'author': 'Hawie82', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Chair is very nice, feels good and easy to install. I wish the attaching the arms was by a single screw with a knob and easy to adjust but instead are 3 bolts on each side. the other issue i didnt realize the back doesnt move back or forth to adjust the length for your legs and make the seat a little deeper. Other than that no complaints and easy to put together.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Most comfortable office chair!', 'author': 'Kathy Kane', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a great chair, it is forcing me to sit correctly and is comfortable to sit in for long hours. Very sturdy yet lightweight. Love that the arms are adjustable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The best office chair I have ever had', 'author': 'Regan/Matt Kashner', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This chair is fantastic! Love the way it feels and the options you have for adjustment. Especially the tension knob. It works really well to tighten so you can just the right level of tension to you can lean back and the chair will hold you there and then come right back up when you back up straight. As soon as I put it together (which is so easy and only take 15 minutes) my wife came and tried it. 48 seconds later I am back on amazon buying the exact same chair for her now. The only thing I wish was that it came in a white or black/white option. *NOTE* when you get to the step to install the arms look on the bottom of the arm pieces between the screw holes and you will see the L and R so you dont put them on the wrong side and have to redo like did. Love it though, very happy with purchase, and will recommend to people for sure.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great price point and delivers on quality', 'author': 'PBG', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I spent a great deal of time researching chairs that were affordable but would also deliver on the quality I was looking for, especially with regard to lumbar support, as I sit at my desk for long hours during the day and have recurring low back pain. I recently got this chair and feel an immediate relief with the support it delivers to to the lower back. Everyone's back is different, but this chair contours to my back nicely and I love that the lumbar support is adjustable. Some of the chairs I was looking at had fixed lumbar support, which was a no-go for me personally.Additionally, the chair has other nice customizable features. I am around six feet tall and was able to lift the headrest up to good point so when I lean back my head hits it squarely. The tilt and lock features work smooth and easily as does the arm-rest maneuverability. Assembly was also pretty easy and clearly delineated in the instructions.Overall I am quite pleased and find that this chair delivers substantially on what was advertised, especially given the price point.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very Comfortable and Somewhat Easy To Build', 'author': 'Anthony V. Jr', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The chair is very comfortable and has lots of cool features that make it worth the price. The chair is high-quality and doesn't feel cheap at all there is one part that covers the intersection of the legs that is just a piece of cheapish plastic but the rest of the chair is either some sort of metal or high-quality plastic. While building, I found that it came with one extra of each type of fastener just in case you lost one. Also when connecting the arms to the seat part of the chair it will be hard without setting the seat upside down in a way that the arms can hang down to screw them in, the same thing when connecting the back of the chair to the seat part. I luckily had a stool to rest the seat down on to be able to put it together.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great chair', 'author': 'Nada', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very comfortable, firm cushion', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Not a bad chair at all with a small caveat.', 'author': 'Curtis Newbrough', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Not a bad chair though it is really not designed for someone as tall as me (6'3). The headrest even fully extended is still too low for my head. It is pretty comfortable and make sure if you're a bigger person to place the arms out as far as you can mounting wise for room to sit.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

I did not find this to be a problem for me, but others may prefer a chair that they can fine tune the position of the arm rests.I did not see any noticeable problems with the stitching, but time will tell how long it will last.If you are looking for a cost effective poly urethane leather office chair, this may be the one for you.Enjoy!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very comfortable', 'author': 'Alia', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This chair is great and very comfortable. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very comfortable for bigger people', 'author': 'Lee', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I'm over 350 pounds and this chair is wide and you can lift the arms. Morrow', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It was a gift', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Smart and sturdyÔºÅ', 'author': 'Xiaoxian', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The chair looks so smart and when sitting on itÔºå it feels comfortable and sturdyÔºÅ Good quality and worth of the moneyÔºÅHighly recommend to get oneÔºÅ', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Most comfortable chair', 'author': 'XUE LANG', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This chair is very comfortable, price is reasonable, easy to assemble. Love it. The best chair to work from home.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars How is this big and tall chair?', 'author': 'Jasmine Barrett', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'My wife and i are not even big and tall people but we bought the chair for its advertised width and durability‚Ä¶i just put it together and the armrests are so narrow it cuts into your sides uncomfortably with no room for adjustments width wise. the more you adjust them up and down the more they cut into your sides', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Definitely sturdy!', 'author': 'Avid reader', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Nice chair. Assembly was pretty easy- all picture instructions. Would have been nice to have some blow ups of a couple of things but I really had no problems.The chair itself is quite heavy. 2 people who weigh over 300lbs sat in it & fit fine, without feeling squished. I have very wide hips and did feel some minor discomfort from the hard plastic risers of the arms pressing against them.The arms are adjustable, though not QUITE as adjustable as described. The move up & down several inches & forward (towards your hands) or backwards (towards your elbows) a couple of inches. They are supposed to move inward or outwards but I was unable to find any way to do this. They also "rotate", which just means that you can angle them inwards or outwards a bit. This particular action foes not require the touch of a button and basically happens every time you put your arms on them. I have a feeling yhat someone with mobility issues, or who outs pressure on those arms getting up, will lose their balance due to the sudden, unintentional movement of those arm rests rotating. Inwould prefer them to lock into place.The lumbar support was fine for me & I did not attempt to adjust it. The pneumatic tube is plenty strong enough to raise/lower the chair with my weight in it.I recommend you refer back to the item listing on Amazon for any information on features or adjustments because you won\'t find it in the box.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 26, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very comfy', 'author': 'Dave', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Extremely comfortable and very durable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars very comfortable', 'author': 'Vasu', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'received this chair in good packaging .. its very comfortable. back support is really good .. I spend more than 8 hrs daily on office chair for my regular work.. overall i am satisfied.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to build. Looks good. Comfortable to use.', 'author': 'BayouBrit', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I\'m a mechanical engineer, but assembling items from kits isn\'t really my thing, because I get frustrated about how most things could be so much better! However, this is well thought out: A hex key is the only tool you\'ll need and that comes in the box. The instructions are really easy to follow and everything lines up nicely, so you won‚Äôt be cursing as you pinch your finger!The built chair is roomy and comfortable (I\'m 6\'1" and 168lbs). It feels solid, sturdy and stable ‚Äì there are no annoying little rocking movements or irritating squeaks. Otherwise it is comfortable to sit in and use. I like how easy it is to adjust the lumbar support, though I\'m not sure it will get much adjustment - everyone who has tried the chair likes it as it is.Oddly, my 5\'9" daughter, who is in her late teens and cannot weigh more than 120lbs soaking wet, has fallen in love with this and "borrowed" it. Probably permanently. So much for "big and tall"!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': False}]

title: Serta Executive Office Adjustable Ergonomic Computer Chair with Layered Body Pillows, Waterfall Seat Edge, Bonded Leather, High-Back, Ivory White
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wow, Love this chair!!!', 'author': 'Lyza Covello', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This chair is awesome. I just switched from ordinary cheap chair to this now that I'll work from home all the time. The cushion is amazing. So comfortable, firm but pillow like. It looks beautiful. The back is very comfortable as well to recline/stretch. The padded arms are great. The lift works well and stays at the height you set it! My only comment is my 11 yr old put this together for me. He got the arms backwards a few times and in setup it scratched easily and got a small rip on the side. It does seem to rip easily and scratch so be careful with that.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 28, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Super comfortable', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love this chair. Easy to put together, great color and super comfy', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable, but arms didn‚Äôt assemble easily', 'author': 'JB', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I‚Äôve had this chair for about 3 weeks now. This chair is very comfortable for an 8 hour workday. I‚Äôm short and was afraid the support would not be in the right places for my body, but it actually is fine. My only complaint is that the assembly was not as easy as directions stated. Arms were difficult to assemble as holes didn‚Äôt quite line up and it took 2 ppl to hold and get the screws in. The tilt feature also doesn‚Äôt tilt back quite as easy as I expected even after adjusting the tension, but it‚Äôs okay. My goal was really comfort, which this chair meets my goal. I‚Äôll see how it holds up a year from now.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Definitely not a $300 chair', 'author': 'TEN TECH AERO', 'rating': 1, 'content': "Where to begin, the list is long: from the badly aligned screw holes and poor choice of hardware length to the horrible posture once assembled and not-so-great comfort, it leaves a lot to be desired. It looks good though, not spectacular and probably won't look good for long, but for now it does.30 minutes to assemble a simple chair like this (it is nearly identical to the $150 gaming chairs from Staples, I assembled 12 in our office) is 3x what it should take, thanks to the bad design and bad manufacturing job: very few threads engaged, screw heads directly resting on thin plastic interface (washers are too expensive I guess!), nonsensical armrest groove which means the majority of the screw is unsupported, ... This chair is an accident waiting to happen, I give it 3 months before one of the fasteners pops.I would have returned this chair if it wasn't for the hassle to pack it back in, that's how we all get tricked into keeping subpar stuff like this. Never again will I consider Serta as a vendor.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A couple months of use in', 'author': 'Sabrina', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Was easy to assemble, has been comfortable and sturdy. I keep it at the lowest height because it works best for me (5'5); however, it does not have a head rest area so if you are expecting a high back/if you're tall, it may not be the chair for you. It is comfortable, but I can see it getting worn in. It is a couple months into every day use so that's not unexpected though. Color has stayed a light cream, and it is easy to wipe off. No peeling or cracking yet, and the material is relatively soft so my thighs do not stick in shorts.Overall, I'm happy with the purchase! Some reviews had me nervous so I thought I'd add mine to help anyone else on the fence.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 2, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "2.0 out of 5 stars Good build quality but didn't live up to my expectations", 'author': 'Dmytro Petrenko', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'for a 6.1 foot tall person, the chair is very low. back height is low. If your height is 5.7 or below, then this chair is most likely suitable for you. The material is dense, I can not say that the chair is very soft. it can be described as "whipped/tight". I was looking for an easy chair for myself, and judging by the pictures, I thought that it would be something like this. in general, I was dissatisfied with the purchase, as this chair is not justified by my expectations, although the quality of the materials and assembly of the chair is very high quality. if you are not a tall person and are looking for a tight chair - maybe this will suit you! Also, the chair does not have a tilt adjustment. I didn\'t expect this either. i.e. you can either lock it at 90 degrees or let it go. but fixing the back, let\'s say at the level of 100 or 105 degrees, will not work for you. the seat will recline further, up to a full 130-135 degrees', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 18, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So uncomfortable to sit on', 'author': 'bestdad36', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'it looks like its compfy but its not good for your back, neck or anythingvery uncomfortable', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 23, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Poorly engineered assembly for an otherwise excellent chair', 'author': 'C.Miller', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Overall construction quality high, but assembly-design was very marginal. Two persons (4-Hands) REQUIRED for assembly to have help in aligning final components under compression and screw initiation. Was a 2-day, 8-hour struggle to overcome fine-threaded and too short machine screws without centering shoulders (plus upholstery fabric obstructing holes into the screw T-Nut recepticles), which required perfectly straight alignment with components being held rigidly by partner to get screw engagement estbalished in their T-Nuts. The L-shaped allen wrench (provided) was impossible to keep straight alignment while turning during initiation of thread engagement. Had to use my own T-handled wrench and replacement of several screws with self-threading tapered anchor screws that did not require perfect straight alignment to engage. Caster wheels were mediocre and hard surfaced making rolling on hard surface, or plush carpet noisy and stiff. I chose to replace them with set of 2" dual wheel ‚Äî Omyoffice Heavy-Duty Chair Wheels Support 2200lbs, Mute Polyurethane-Rubber Chair Casters for Hardwood Floors and Carpet ‚Äî (See separate Review). After 4- unsuccessful hours attempting to get the final components together (with a helper) I filed for return of chair. But after an overnight rest, I used separately purchased different hardware screws, and took another 4-hours to complete assembly rather than spending that time trying to dissasemble and fit all the pieces back into the orignal packaging. Per Instructions, before returning the chair, I contacted the designated 3rd partry service company for potential assistance or replacement parts. They could not identify the chair in their support system and said they had no available parts. An it was obvious the representative was not at all familiar with the chair assembly process. So that operation was of no help, at all. The chair was marked "Made in China", it was sold under the Serta brand, and the service company was obviously Canadian (True Innovations). Amazon quickly authorized Return & Refund, but As described above, I opted to make it work after so many hours trying to get it satisfactorily assembled. [Note: Other reviewers had similar difficulty described with assembly and alignment issues, and I found that after I got it together the chair had an excessive degree of noise due (I suspect) to the fact that the assembly was not fully tightened, which I observed initially until I finally got everything together and fully maximum-torqued after everything assembled. The swapping of the casters made the effort worth the keeping of the chair! (Note: I am a highly experienced mechanic, DIYer, and engineer with many years of experience. So I cannot highly recommend the chair for home assembly and 3rd-Party Customer Support).', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 9, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars DOES NOT RECLINE!!!', 'author': 'Allthingsglitz', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'The Ivory Model is actually Cream colored. That‚Äôs not a problem for me.However, this chair DOES NOT RECLINE.That is a huge problem considering it is advertised as a reclining chair.The aesthetics are up to par, with a couple minor scratches.The padding is more than adequate‚Ä¶ for me.Oddly, the lowest seating position is too tall for a 5‚Äô1‚Äù individual.I have never encountered an office chair with this problem.The headrest reaches the middle point of my head.Not a problem for me.The biggest frustration is definitely the arm + backrest assembly.It‚Äôs almost like they tried to skimp on screws and sent the wrong ones.You literally need 4 arms to assembly this area.You might, like I, be forced to opt to only use 2 screws for the arm/backrest assembly.This was after I had to search my home for some longer screws that would fit.The short ones provided‚Ä¶are too SHORT.Assembly requires super human strength,(jk, a very strong man.)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful but not ergonomic', 'author': 'Carla', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'It doesn‚Äôt have lumbar support at all. Also, arms are not adjustable. Just nice looking but not ergonomic at all.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: KERDOM Office Chair, Ergonomic Desk Chair, Breathable Mesh Computer Chair, Comfy Swivel Task Chair with Flip-up Armrests and Adjustable Height
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A haven of comfort and productivity', 'author': 'Naomi Ngeth', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The Adjustable Drafting Chair has transformed my home office into a haven of comfort and productivity. From its customizable features to its sleek design, this chair has proven to be an exceptional addition to my workspace.Tailored Comfort with Adjustable Footrest:The highlight of this drafting chair is its adjustable footrest, allowing me to find the perfect height for maximum comfort. Whether I'm working on a project or attending virtual meetings, the ability to customize the footrest height ensures that my feet are well-supported, contributing to an overall ergonomic experience. I enjoy putting me feet up.Ergonomic Excellence:The chair's ergonomic design is a game-changer for those long work sessions. It provides excellent support for my back, hips, hands, and feet, with a focus on appropriate waist support. The easily adjustable seat height caters to different needs, ensuring that I maintain a comfortable and healthy posture throughout the day.Breathable Bliss with Mesh Material:Both the backrest and cushion of the drafting chair are crafted from breathable mesh. This not only adds a modern aesthetic to my home office but also ensures steady, well-shaped, and elastic support. Even during extended periods of sitting, the breathable mesh material keeps me cool and comfortable.Versatile Design for Any Space:The simple and beautiful design of the chair effortlessly complements various decoration styles. Whether placed in a home office, study room, or living space, it adds a touch of modern sophistication. Its versatility makes it suitable for a range of settings, from standing desks to conference rooms.Effortless Assembly and Customer Support:Installing the Adjustable Drafting Chair was a breeze, thanks to the detailed installation video provided in the manual and online. The user-friendly assembly process allowed me to set up the chair quickly and efficiently. Any questions or concerns were promptly addressed by the responsive customer support team.In conclusion, the Adjustable Drafting Chair has become an essential piece in my home office setup. Its customizable features, ergonomic design, and modern aesthetics make it a standout choice for anyone seeking comfort and style in their workspace. If you're on the lookout for a chair that seamlessly combines functionality and elegance, look no further than this drafting chair.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars perfect!', 'author': 'Misho', 'rating': 5, 'content': "set up was easy, light chair comfortable and looks sturdy. Matches the adjustable hight desk I got too, I work online long hours and needed a versatile comfortable chair like this one. This added foot rest is perfect to keep your the back straight. Orange color is nice, had a mesh cushion and know you can't have your skin in direct contact with this scratchy mesh material but overall it's comfortable. Thanks to another reviewer that mentioned not to wear shorts if you plan to sit on it for long hours. Orange color with the white was nice, not too bright and not the rusty hue which I am not a fan of. Fun color and looks modern and expensive.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Affordable Comfort for Remote Work', 'author': 'm1tommy', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Affordable drafting chair for height-adjustable desks - surprisingly decent lumbar support; assembly instructions were easy to follow and the item was packaged well. I love the selection of colors (my office is 25% business, the other 75% is for crafting, and most of that color-scheme is white and aqua). The seat fabric is also easy-care, just wipe to keep clean.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for my needs', 'author': 'gw', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was a bit nervous ordering this chair thinking it might be too tall for sitting at a normal desk. I\'m 6 ft tall. However it is low enough for normal desk work, and can be raised for drafting work or used as a stool with wheels. My desktop is 32" from the floor. At the lowest setting the chair seat is 22" from the floor. At its highest the seat is 29" from the floor. The adjustable foot ring is a nice feature for whichever height you use the most. As a guitar player, I really like the ability to raise the arms up and out of the way when playing, something that I couldn\'t do with my previous office chair, which was a hassle. I find the chair comfortable and easy to roll - and I\'m using it on carpet. Note that while the seat is padded, the arm rests are not. I typically have my hands on the desk or keyboard so the arm rests really have no impact on me. The arms are nice to have but I don\'t really use them. This chair was pretty easy to put together, I really liked the way they packaged the parts - each was in its own bubble on a piece of cardboard so you don\'t have to sort through a mixed bag and match them up to the instruction sheet. No missing parts, and they even included spare parts - some extra screws and caps - in their own bubble on the parts sheet. Nice touch. This is a functional chair that works for me, and the price was right.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect Value Priced Ergonomic Chair', 'author': 'RetroMom', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The chair is stylish, comfortable and lightweight. The components are largely plastic and probably not the most high end but the design and engineering is great. It's a fine chair for the price level and well scaled for my room.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Quality Chair', 'author': 'Yi Liang', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is my second purchase. Great price as well. Durable and comfortable. Easy to assemble. I purchased my first one 2 years ago and its still operable and in good shape. No peeling or cracking.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Super comfortable and well made', 'author': 'Laura Gontz', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This was easy to build. Adjusts to different heights easily. The footrest is at a nice height and comfortable for me. I am 5\' 4" tall. I also got the mint color which is stylish and goes well in my room. This is very home office worthy.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Comfy, supportive, and beautiful color but damaged', 'author': 'Randy', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'The back has a rip in it right out of the box. This is very disappointing and the reason for only three stars. I would have given five stars because it was so easy to put together and the instructions were super easy to follow. The color is spot on and beautiful. The seat is firm and comfortable to me. The back support is great, and it easily adjusts the support needed. It adjusts height easily. I will reach out to the company but probably won‚Äôt return it due to time constraints and inconvenience.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best Chair Support after Hip Surgery', 'author': 'C. Behnken', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I absolutely love this chair! After my hip surgery in 2021, I had trouble sitting in my kitchen and office chairs for extended periods of time. Even after actually sitting got easier, if I spent time working on my computer or at my desk for over an hour, I noticed that my hip would ache for days afterward. I thought it was because I was working out too much to compensate for sitting. My sister told me about getting this chair for her husband after he had his hip replaced and said it was a game-changer for him, so I thought I'd give it a try. I now move it from my office desk to the kitchen table so I can sit comfortably and have no residual aches and stiffness afterwards. I can't believe what a change it made in my life! I highly recommend the Kerdom ergonomic desk chair to anyone who sits!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Customer Service is responsive and first rate.', 'author': 'Melvin S Friedman', 'rating': 5, 'content': "First, let me state that this chair is very comfortable and perfect for my work needs. This review, however, is not about the chair per se; it is to acknowledge the prompt and valuable help given to me by the company's customer service department. I bought this chair a little over a year ago and had no basic problems with it until quite recently, when the mechanism for raising and lowering the seat failed. I like a high perch when I work at my desk, and I suddenly found my seat sinking all the way down shortly after I raised it. My weight is well below the load-bearing limit of the chair, so I knew that there had to be a fault in the piston or the locking mechanism. I was aware that I was just outside the one-year warrantee period and that I could not expect to return the chair or claim replacement parts. But I'm relatively handy and I enjoy tinkering with things if they need fine-tuning or fixing, so I contacted Kerdom and asked if someone might help me to repair the chair on my own. I knew it was a crapshoot and that Kerdom had no formal obligation to help me other than reinforcing customer goodwill. Nonetheless, I got a very quick response to my inquiry from customer service and, within a few days, an email saying that they would send me a new part to replace the deflective one. Again, they did not have to do this and I was already planning a clunky but functional workaround if they decided not to pitch in and help. Generally speaking, I have had few products purchased on Amazon fail on me. But I've read enough reviews here to realize that even the best of products sometimes slip through quality control and go out with defective parts. I haven't yet gotten out my tools to replace the old elevating mechanism with the new one, but I'm pretty confident, given the relative rarity of product failures I've experienced, that the re-fitted chair will work fine. (Should it not, I will certainly revisit this review.) But I would be remiss if I did not recognize, before all else, the support given me by Kerdom's customer service personnel, who went beyond what they were obliged to do to help me restore my desk chair to full functionality.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]
