The only thing I didn't take into account was how the cushion of the chair lifts up when leaning back. It is a bit uncomfortable if I want to lean back my whole bottom body has to shoot upwards. Other then that, great chair.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars dirties easily but super comfortable and easy to put together', 'author': 'Gigi', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This chair is super comfortable, way more comfortable than most. The seat is really cushion-ey and the service from Hbada is excellent. It was easy to put together and it works well. The only thing I don't like about it is the material because it can stain and you can't wipe it down like you can fake leather. Turns easy and the wheels are smooth.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Exceedingly difficult assembly costs this chair 2 stars', 'author': 'milleron', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I've assembled several office chairs in my time, but I've never found it as difficult as this one.The screw holes in the seat DO line up with the holes in the chair back. However it requires such great force to get the two pieces into alignment that I might go so far as to advise against this purchase unless you have a stout adult to assist you -- one person to force the seat into alignment and the other to fasten the screws. I did assemble it by myself, but the effort was so strenuous that I soaked two shirts with perspiration. I was exhausted after getting it together.You will also need a hefty rubber mallet to pound in the casters. I don't think there's a way to insert them without strong pounding. Even with a rubber mallet, cover the base with scrap cardboard before striking it. Be prepared to pound hard; if you strike it hard enough from above with the wheels on the floor and ALIGNED PROPERLY, you can get the caster to seat fully with a single wallop.The screws come with Lock-Tite preapplied to lessen the chance of anything coming loose. That's a nice touch, and suggests that quality was important to the manufacturer.The cardboard carton was the very cheap Chinese crap that tears easily. It was punctured in a couple of places during shipping, but the product was not damaged.Assembly was easy except for attaching the seat to the back. Seating the casters was challenging, but that's to be expected with every assembly-required office chair.After assembly, the chair is pretty comfortable, but I procured an auxiliary cushion to place on the seat simply because I've found that necessary with all the office chairs I've used. Some people will find the arms too close together, but they're OK for me, and they do rotate up and out of the way. Other than that, they're not adjustable -- one height must fit all. The webbing on the back seems strong and well assembled; if it comes loose or stretches with use, I'll try to remember to edit this review.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 22, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect Chair for a Guitarist', 'author': 'Jale', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. Ok so I used to have a GT Racing gaming chair and it really wasn‚Äôt that comfortable which was sad considering I spent about $200+ on it. I started looking for a new chair and this one came up. I play guitar so having a comfortable chair with cushion and back support and arm rest that move out of the way was a must. I could not be happier with the chair. It took about 15 min to put it together and it was very easy to understand the instructions. To me it doesn‚Äôt feel cheap it very well built. I‚Äôll probably never buy another gaming chair. This one is perfect and looks great.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars VERY Disappointed... 2 months after purchase', 'author': 'Jennifer A Freeman', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'I was really excited about this chair, given the reviews and the higher price compared to similar chairs (which I mistook for meaning higher quality), but after having this chair/using it every day for over 2 months I am very unhappy with my purchase. As far as looks, this chair looks very sleek in my office and fits well under my desk (which I also bought on amazon). Also, I like how high the back is on the chair (I am 5\'10"), and the lever to raise the seat works well. Unfortunately, those are the only three positive things I have to say about this chair.First off, the "butt" part of the chair where you sit down wore down extremely fast, literally within weeks (but was very padded at all to begin with). Because of the lack of support (especially towards the back of the seat), it causes a lot of lower back/tail bone pain, and I have had to supplement by sitting on a towel/pillow which shouldn\'t be the case after spending almost 150$ on a chair so recently. I think it\'s important to mention- I have no history of back problems so this is a serious cause for concern.Next, one of the biggest selling points of this chair is that the flip-up arms. Unfortunately, if you actually use this feature to store your chair under your desk at the end of the day, you will notice the poor construction of the arms and that the joints of the arms wear down very quickly. After 2 months of use, the right arm is extremely loose, won\'t stay upright, and there is no way to tighten it.Next, the chair claims to offer ergonomic back support, but the mesh on the back of the seat is not tightly attached and has way too much give, so the plastic "back supports" in the back do not actually create any support.Overall, very disappointed in this chair, and am now starting to believe that there are a lot of fake positive reviews on this page.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 13, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Lumbar support just for show, but for the price, it's pretty great", 'author': 'Avi Greengart', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Biggest positive: durability and tremendous value. My son bought himself one of these for college and two years later it\'s still holding up, so when my daughter needed a chair, it seemed like a no brainer to get her one, too. This is a basic task chair, not a pricey ergonomic wonder. I have a Steelcase Leap that\'s now 12 years old, cost $1000 when new, and saved my back. It\'s worth every penny. But for a student using it 1 - 3 hours per day, something like that is overkill; this chair is perfect for 1/10th the cost.Biggest surprise: Hbada designed the chair for very easy construction. The instructions are minimal but everything is well labeled and mostly created in such a way that the only way to screw it together is the correct one. With a power tool it took me less than 10 minutes to assemble, but you can use the included hex driver if you don\'t have a drill and the right bit and it should still be fairly quick.Biggest negative: the lumber support looks good but it\'s just for show -- it doesn\'t provide any meaningful support. If you have serious back problems, well, you need a more expensive chair.Size note: Fits most people, not great for extremes, especially people above 6\' with long legs. My son is 5\' 11" and it fits him perfectly at the higher settings. My daughter is 5\' 4", and at its lowest position her feet are flat on the floor without shoes on. If you\'re under 5\' 2" you\'ll need a foot rest, and if you\'re significantly above 6\', this probably won\'t work for you.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 13, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Not very comfortable', 'author': 'Paul K', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'I was looking specifically for a chair with flip-up arms so that it would fit under my new corner desk for storage and allow me to get close when working. I hoped that the Hbada Ergonomic Desk Chair would be the solution, but it is not.After reading a review on budget office chairs I purchased an Alera 22.8in Manager\'s Chair. However, the side-mounted arms did not give me the storage flexibility I was seeking. My wife took possession of that chair and she is very happy with it. It is EXTREMELY more comfortable and stable than the Hbada for about the same price.My biggest complaint with the Hbada is the positioning of the flip-up arms. As you can see in the photos, the way they are assembled to the chair back has the forward ends angled inward. This causes the tips to have only 16-3/8" of clearance. When I tried to sit with the arms in the lowered position, one of the arms caught the front pocket of my pants and caused a small tear. When I sit completely against the chair back, it doesn\'t necessarily interfere with movement, but I still feel somewhat "restrained" by the arms being so close. I\'ve never previously felt this with any other chair with side arms.Also, it doesn\'t feel very stable. I can rock from side to side about 1 inch from where the chair base sits on the gas cylinder. I have never previously felt this on any other lift chair.The chair cushion is OK, but not very thick. The Alerea chair cushion is more than twice as thick and much more comfortable. I haven\'t yet put enough hours sitting on it to see how it holds up.Overall, I am very disappointed with the design and quality of this chair. I would recommend looking for an alternative. I would return it, but I already threw away the shipping box.I am actively looking for a different chair with flip-up arms. Again, if you don\'t need this feature, check out the Alera 22.8in Manager\'s Chair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy and comfortable! Highly Recommend!!', 'author': 'Sujana Oruganti', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I recently bought the Hbada Office Chair Ergonomic Desk Chair, and overall, I am extremely pleased with its performance. This chair has proven to be a valuable addition to my office setup, providing comfort and functionality that have significantly enhanced my daily work experience.One of the chair's standout features is its sturdiness. The build quality is excellent, giving me confidence in its durability and stability during long hours of use. This aspect is crucial for anyone looking for a long-term office chair investment.The ergonomic design of the chair also deserves praise. The adjustable lumbar support and tilt function allow for a customized seating experience, catering to the unique needs of my posture and sitting preferences. This has been a game-changer in terms of comfort during prolonged periods of sitting.The breathable mesh on the chair is another positive, ensuring that I remain cool and comfortable, even during extended work sessions. This feature is particularly appreciated during warmer days when traditional chairs can become uncomfortably warm.However, there is a minor drawback that I noticed after purchasing: the armrest height is not adjustable. This is likely due to the flip-up design of the armrests, which is a feature I enjoy for its space-saving benefits. Unfortunately, I overlooked this detail when making my purchase. Despite this, the armrests are comfortable and well-positioned for my use.In conclusion, except for the non-adjustable armrest height, this Hbada office chair meets all my expectations for an ergonomic desk chair. It's sturdy, comfortable, and has a range of adjustable features that contribute to an optimal seating experience. I would definitely recommend this chair to anyone in need of a reliable and comfortable office chair. The overall functionality and quality make it a worthwhile purchase.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Decently solid chair but not the most comfortable', 'author': 'JohnT', 'rating': 4, 'content': '** 6 month review at bottom **Have had the chair for a week so far with 8+ hour uses each day. Not the best but not the worse chair I‚Äôve had. Overall, I like the chair. Can‚Äôt complain too much at this price point. I was more concerned that the materials will feel cheap, like the plastic but it‚Äôs pretty sturdy. It‚Äôs decently comfortable if you sit properly.-=-=-=-=-=-=-Here is an in-depth review:‚Äî Seat cushion (2/5 stars):The seat cushion isn‚Äôt great ‚Äî unless you sit properly at all times, any weird sitting position will be uncomfortable (i.e if you sit on your legs). If you happen to seat near the middle or front end of the chair and you usually have tailbone pain, you‚Äôll likely get it with this chair. After receiving the chair, within an hour of use, the foam is already dented and does not fully return to its original form. After a few days, I can feel the unevenness on the seat, even after several hours of not using it. Pretty sure it‚Äôs permanent now. I‚Äôve purchased a seat cushion to combat this issue. For comparison, I‚Äôm 150lb, 5‚Äô10‚Äù. The seat cushion is about 1.5" thick, you can easily feel the base plate.‚Äî Arms (4/5 stars):It was solid and worked perfectly when I first used it. However, due to the arm mechanism, the nut holding the arm in place can get loose if you move the arm up and down often. I found this happen more with one side than the other. Took the arm off and tighten the nut but that only fixed the issue temporarily. After moving the arm a few times, the nut got loose again causing the arm to just fall down and wobble.IF YOU ARE HAVING THIS ISSUE ‚Äî here‚Äôs a fix I\'ve found to worked for me. Go to your local hardware store and find a pack of flat washers and locking washers (washers with uneven/bent ends). The flat washer should be no larger than 7/8‚Äù (outer diameter). Internal diameter of the washer should be 3/8‚Äù. Remove the arm from the chair and remove the nut. Keep the existing flat washer in place and place a locking washer on top and a new flat washer after. Place the nut back and hand tighten snug. The order should be Flat Washer > Locking Washer > Flat Washer > Hex Nut on the arm‚Äôs through-bolt. I‚Äôm able to move the arm repeatedly now without it ever getting loose or wobbly.The manufacturer is however aware of this issue and is fixing it as far as I know. So please contact them if you are having this issue if you find that my fix isn‚Äôt working.Once my issue was fixed, I‚Äôve find that the arm is pretty solid. The mechanism that allows the arm to rotate is limited by the plastic used to make the chair (if you disassemble the arm, you‚Äôll see what I mean). The plastic is pretty solid, but I wouldn‚Äôt put my entire weight on the arm. Who knows, maybe it‚Äôs capable of supporting it but I don‚Äôt want to risk it.‚Äî Mesh Back / Lumbar Support (4/5 stars):There‚Äôs not much to complain about for me. It‚Äôs comfortable when you have your back against it. But I didn‚Äôt notice anything that stood out to me. The lumbar support is pretty non-existent, I don‚Äôt even feel it. So if you really need lumbar support, this might not be the best chair for you.‚Äî Hydraulic Cylinder (5/5 stars):So far (within a week of use), I haven‚Äôt had any issue with it. The chair will very slightly compress when you sit on it, but nothing significant. But I know that I‚Äôll likely won‚Äôt see any issue until later down the line. So I‚Äôll try to update this after more use.‚Äî Customer Support (5/5 stars):Prior to fixing the arm myself, I contacted them about it and they were pretty fast at responding (within a few hours). Pretty professional and was diligent in making sure my issue was resolved by offering a couple of solutions. So if you do happen to have any issue with your chair, I wouldn‚Äôt hesitate contacting them to see how they will help.Would I recommend this or purchase it again at this price point ($139.99)? Yes.________________________6 Month Review (over 1000 hrs of use):With the arm fixed I proposed above, it‚Äôs been flawless. No issues with it at all, no wiggle and not lose. That was one the biggest things I feared. Most chairs I bought, it ended up wiggling a lot after a while and couldn‚Äôt hold itself up anymore. So glad this one hasn‚Äôt had this issue yet.Hydraulic cylinder still works great. No squeaks either when reclining back and forth or swiveling.Still happy with this chair! Would still recommend it.________________________8 Month Update:Typical usage. Chair is starting to creek and make a bit of noise when you rock back and forth. The back mesh is a bit loose now but nothing too bad. Hydraulics still performing as before.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 23, 2020', 'is_verified': True}]

title: FLEXISPOT OC3B Executive Ergonomic Office Chair Height Adjustable Mesh Computer Chair with Adjustable Headrest Armrest Lumbar Support Home Office Desk Chair Gray
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Does exactly what I expected and is surprisingly sturdy.', 'author': 'Zodwraith', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I don't get what people are complaining about with the instructions, it says the screws are in the headrest, and they were, in fact, in the headrest. Sure, assembly isn't as easy and putting two Legos together, but if you seriously had issues assembling this maybe you shouldn't be assembling furniture. The bolts DO NOT go into slots, but they pass THROUGH slots so you can adjust the depth of the bottom cushion slightly. Anyone with shorter legs should appreciate that.The only thing I found slightly wonky is that the headrest itself must remain inserted into it's bracket before you attach the bottom half hanger that clamps it to the chairback. If you try to slide it up and down before it's mounted it will push the locking tabs out of the tube, but if you're even basically mechanically inclined you can easily put them back in in seconds.As for the chair itself my biggest concern was the stability of the armrests as these pillar mount style ones are notorious for being wobbly. Thankfully, these ones aren't and I'm assuming it's due to the very stout mounting system that wraps under the bottom. There's a slight amount of movement due to the adjustable height but nowhere near enough that it's distracting. I've seen none better and many that were FAR worse. Height comes up well above where I would want it so I can only assume anyone complaining about the low armrests either don't know how to raise them or they're extraordinarily tall which neither is the chair's fault. (I will never understand why people that are very tall or overweight magically expect all seating to accommodate them.)The mesh is nice and cool and the adjustable lumbar makes it easy to put it exactly where you need it for your height. As someone that's always replaced the wheels on my office chairs even the wheels were of a higher quality than average so these just might stay.Considering high back mesh chairs have always started out at $200 this chair ended up being nicer than I hoped, let alone expected. It's brand new though so if I encounter any problems I'll update this review later. I know how difficult it can be to find a chair that's decent quality and comfortable.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Ergonomic and comfy', 'author': 'Jums', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Been looking for the perfect chair for my flexispot desk. I didn't know they made chairs as well. The chair came in quick, easy to assemble alone, the caster wheels are smooth like butter. I love the adjustable headrest along with the arm rests. Easy to adjust up and down. The mesh is breathable and feels durable and premium. Can never go wrong with flexispot products. I'm a fan!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great chair, but the design has changed and manufacturer has not updated the manual', 'author': 'BC', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Chair is very comfortable and helps keep me from slouching.What I like:-Easy to assemble (with caveats below)-As stated, comfortable and ergonomic-Great value-Can lock at various inclined positionsWhat I dislike:-The undocumented design changes (see pics)Manual states to attach the mechanism to the seat back using 3 bolts through 3 holes. But the 3 holes are now slots and this is not entirely obvious at first. See attached pics. I show how the actual mechanism looks different from the manual, and how to align the slots.In addition, for the hanger, the manual says to remove 2 screws from the headrest. Those 2 screws are actually on the hanger, which also serves as the mount for the headrest. This also means you cannot mount the headrest without mounting the hanger. Based on other review I read here and elsewhere, this appears to be a recent change to address the difficulty in figuring out how to attach the hanger.Overall I am pleased but I feel like they could have taken the time to update the manual. I initially reached out to their support because I thought they shipped the wrong mechanism.Still, good chair. And a welcome upgrade from my old one.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The Perfect Chair', 'author': 'A P', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This chair is the best, buy it. I came from a Staples Hyken chair and chose the Ticova prior to this. It was made of metal and looked sturdy. It was horrible. Felt very uncomfortable and would squeak constantly. This is made of plastic and is very quiet, and very comfortable. The mesh is soft and conforms very well to the body. Recommended 100%.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy, supportive, and stays cool', 'author': 'bhjctj', 'rating': 3, 'content': "PROS: 1) Easy to assemble, sturdy, ergonomic support. Some reviews have noted the distance between the lumbar support and the mesh back as being too great, but the mesh itself has offered me great support, so I've not really had to fiddle with this. 2) I bought this because the seat and back are both mesh, hoping it would be cooler with more airflow -- and it is; wooden seats and cushioned seats I've used have made me noticeably hotter as the day went on. This chair doesn't have that issue. Exactly why I bought it.CON: 1) Not much of a negative, but because the seat is mesh and can't sit up higher than the edges of the frame the mesh is attached to, the seat frame can sometimes feel a bit more present pressing against the outsides of your thighs. (A cushion extends above the seat frame sides and doesn't exhibit this.) It's not bad, but occasionally I notice it. Not enough to drop my rating to a 4 star.UPDATE: Several months later, the seat wobbles side to side in the base. Feels unsteady. Will update again if it becomes a bigger problem.UPDATE 2: 2.5 years later, the ring in the base where the piston sits has cracked, causing the seat to wobble significantly more from side to side, like to the point where you wonder if you'll fall over in the middle of using it. This is because the housing where the piston rests is plastic. The stated seat weight capacity was not exceeded. I'm throwing out this chair and purchasing a different chair that is of more sturdy construction, and with actual lumbar support.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 17, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for Students or WFM', 'author': 'Santiago Gudino-Rosales', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'As a student, I spend a lot of time sitting at my desk. Prior to this chair, I was using a regular, basic chair, and I was surely paying the price for it. My neck and back would hurt pretty frequently from the long hours sitting in a poorly designed chair.I can definitely say, however, that after a month of using this chair, investing an ergonomic chair like this one makes all the difference! My neck and back muscles feel so much better supported with the adjustable rests on this chair; and the mesh, lightweight design makes it easy and comfortable to sit on this chair while I get work done for multi hour-long stretches as time. This is a must need for any student or any one that works from home.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This is a comfortable chair', 'author': 'Michael Dufour', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a. Comfortable chair with good support you can sit in it all day with out getting hot.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Cheap material splits FAR too soon (LOWERED rating ... horrible warranty service!)', 'author': 'Rex', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'Great chair ... BUT ... only for nine months. I used it daily from early April to the end of December, when a small tear of just 1/4" appeared. I didn\'t even have anything in my pockets. It just started to rip. Within a day, it went from 1/4" to the 3" you see here. I might be able to repair it or replace the fabric, but I can\'t recommend the chair to anyone with such a weak choice of material made by the manufacturer.Other than the material, I like the chair. It has excellent ergonomics, and it breathes well to avoid any kind of uncomfortable heat buildup.I recommend to the manufactuer to use a stronger material for the chair. I really expected to get at least two years out of this chair ... nine months isn\'t good enough.UPDATE: Just received an email response from the company about filing a request under the two-year warranty: They told me that they\'d like to send me $20 to cover it! Are they kidding?! $20?! ... The chair costs $200 now. This chair is useless in this condition because the rip will continue front-to-back, and I\'ll just fall right through. Their warranty service is TERRIBLE! They should offer to repair it, replace it, or give me a full refund. If they don\'t, I\'ll need to file a complaint with Amazon ... then the FTC if that doesn\'t work. Then if all else fails, I would have to SUE them for basic warranty service. Personally, I think everyone should STOP purchasing this chair until they decide to HONOR their warranty!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Overall Very Good Chair', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The chair\'s adjustable back makes it able to become a desk recliner. I fell asleep in this chair more than once in the first month of owning it. It\'s very comfortable. Although, the headrest height adjuster wore out. I don\'t think that was my fault, but I\'m not seeking compensation. The adjustable height on the chair itself works great for me (6\'1") - my feet can rest flat on the ground with my knees at right angles. The arm rests are sturdy and the height adjustment for them help my shoulders a lot. The mesh seat and back are breathable but firm. I\'m glad I got this mesh chair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Not for tall people', 'author': 'JoshCroce', 'rating': 4, 'content': '- easy assembly- good features- some of the screws felt easy to strip- not for tall people. (Headrest digs into shoulders at highest setting.)- headrest not easily removable. Two screws.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: COMHOMA Ergonomic Office Chair Adjustable Dynamic Lumbar Support Big and Tall 330lbs Capacity Executive Mesh Chair with Footrest Computer Desk Chair Recliner Swivel Tilt Function by GTRacing
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good overall design but with little customization and a very large fixed lumbar curve', 'author': 'Carl Lacy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'For the right person, this chair is superb. It fits my 5\'5" spouse perfectly, and she loves it, but I\'m 6\'1" and it doesn\'t work so well for me. When it doesn\'t work there is very little that can be adjusted. Here\'s my breakdown of the components.SEAT - The seat spans an impressive 20 inches, although the lumbar mechanism restricts you from using all of its space. It affords reasonable but not exceptional cushioning. The pneumatic lift works great. For me, I would like it to lift at least 1/2 to 3/4 inches higher, but for my spouse, it\'s just right.BACK - My spouse loves the lumbar support, it fits her body perfectly, and she finds it very comfortable. I feel the large lumbar support curve doesn\'t work for me. It\'s very large and can\'t really be adjusted. Although the product says, "adjustable lumbar support," the only modification I can make is by loosening or tightening the springs. I can\'t remove it or move it up or down. For me, it pushes my spine too far forward.For me, the inability to tilt the chair and lean backward with it comes across as a flaw. However, my spouse doesn\'t use that feature in a chair and doesn\'t mind its absence.ARMS - The armrests are quite comfortable. However, the arms cannot be adjusted inwardly or outwardly, nor can they be moved up or down. I can only move the armrests upward out of the way if I don\'t want to use them.HEAD - The head adjustment is very good. It can move up or down several inches, and the position of the headrest does create an effective cushion when leaning into it. Here, it fits me perfectly on the top setting, but my spouse would like it to move a bit lower than its lowest setting.WHEELS - The wheels work very well, they glide with a bit of effort, which is great.INSTALLATION It\'s a standard chair installation, just take note that the screws are all marked with the same "M6" for some reason, so you have to differentiate them by their length.I should mention that I used a chair with a similar design for 17 years, so if this fits and proves equally durable, it would be a great value.I\'m giving it 5 stars because it works for the right person. I\'ve debated downgrading it because it\'s not adjustable for different-sized people, but I see that where it does work, it works quite well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great Chair, BUT', 'author': 'Dee', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Chair overall is great, but the arm rest don't lock. They swivel in and out at the slightest touch. Huge inconvenience since the rest of the chair is basically perfect.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for sitting long hours!!', 'author': 'Starlight', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I spend approximately 12 hours per day sitting at my desk and this chair has been my savior! It is super comfortable and has great lumbar support. It was easy to assemble and the instructions were clear and easy to follow. Great office chair and a really great value!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2024', 'is_verified': False}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Stands the test of time', 'author': 'Dud', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have had this chair for over a year now and it has held up to quite a bit of abuse. So I had to go back and forth.Overall I would say it is the closest experience lying down on a bed and hopefully, the fabric won‚Äôt tear down and will last long.Edit: I ordered 2nd one for myself, they revised the instructions and it's now more clear! Thanks for hearing me out Noblewell.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Worth the Price!', 'author': 'Thunder777', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I feel that the chair is ergonomic enough. The only negative side is the headrest. It is dropping to the bottom, even if you try to slide it up. Otherwise, the chair seems to meet the price that you pay for it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars As advertised, a solid basic chair lacking advanced adjustments.', 'author': 'A. Pull', 'rating': 5, 'content': "If you are looking for the two functions pictured in the photo attached to this review, this is NOT the chair you want. These two knobs exist on OTHER chairs, (NOT the Noblewell chair I am reviewing) and they are very, very nice to have. However, they are luxuries. If you can survive without those two adjustments, then you should consider this Noblewell office chair.This chair is good for sitting up straight with. It's reasonably sturdy, and has held up for a month's use approximately with no signs of giving up the ghost. It also reclines, and has a headrest, so if you can nap in a reclining office chair it might help you with some Z's.What it WON'T do is win you any envy, or a raise. It's just a chair with a brand that sounds like a Chinese guy took a cool-sounding word in Chinese and ran it through Google translate. In fact, that is most likely where this brand name came from. Rest assured that it is the same chair being sold by 5-10 other oddly-named corporations based in China.Back to functionality though. This chair will not allow you to adjust the angle of recline and lock it into place. You have two options: kingly posture or springy recliner. That is unfortunate for me, because I'm not kingly and sometimes I don't feel like napping. However, it very clearly advertises that it is lacking said feature, so how could I dock it points for not having a feature it professes not to have? If you want that feature, you will need to pay extra to get a better chair. Your call. If you want kingly posture + napping, this is the chair for you.I do like that the arms are height-adjustable, unlike chairs from 1918.Would I buy it again? For the price, I don't think I'd find anything better. However, I do like my office chair at home better, and I probably paid less for that one 8-10 years ago than I did for this one. That one will lock in at any angle of reclining, and also has an angle-adjustable seat (as shown in the picture). However, thanks to inflation, and the ever-increasing race to the lowest possible quality in a bid to raise profit margins, such chairs apparently cannot be had anymore except at great cost from premium brands. Maybe I'll just work from home more.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 20, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My New Go-To Chair', 'author': 'bd', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I ended up buying 2 more of these because they fit so well at practically any desk, all for a great price. I wanted something that didn‚Äôt look too much like ugly office furniture, and this is definitely it. The mesh makes it look a bit more modern and geometric back shape is cool. I needed a chair that fits under a 27.5‚Äù desk while still being able to lift up high enough so I could sit in it comfortably. The seat is 22‚Äù tall at full extension.I did find that it was easier to attach the backrest by setting the chair upside down on a stool. Then it was easier to line up the bolts to connect it. I ended up leaving the headrest off and found that it makes it feel less obtrusive in our space, but it‚Äôs there if I want to add it on later. I‚Äôve been sitting in it every day for over 4 months and haven‚Äôt noticed any wear, tear, or degradation issues, so I can confidently say it is a very durable chair at a great price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars loved the chair, but its fragile.', 'author': 'ed wright', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'loved everything about this chair for months and months but now the gas piston is already sinking and my headrest broke off all during normal everyday use, and the company does not sell replacement parts on their website so im having to order 3rd party parts and hoping they are compatible to fix its shortcomings. if you want a durable chair, this one might not be the best fit. that being said i do love the seat cushion and the backrest spring, its really smooth and satisfying to rock in, its the main reason i bought the chair because a friend of mine had the same one.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Chair or torture device?', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 1, 'content': "At first I was excited to find a well priced ergonomic chair with all the features. It was average difficulty to build and seemed to be made well. But as soon as I sat in the chair, I knew something was off. Pain shot up my back right from where the so called 'lumbar support' was located. I tried moving to every possible position, and all it did was move the pain elsewhere in my back. I tried wrapping the 'lumbar support' in a towel, I tried using a cushion, a lumbar pillow....anything. Nothing helped. It was like knives poking into my spine. I wouldn't recommend this chair unless you are planning on payback to your worst enemy. In which case the physical torture this so called 'ergonomic' chair will cause is the perfect payback.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Solid chair, excellent value, good customer service', 'author': 'john', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I was looking for a good, ergonomically-sound chair at a reasonable price, and this chair checks pretty much all the boxes. Back is mesh, but solid and supportive; I've sat in cheap mesh chairs that poke you in places, and this doesn't. The seat is a firm but not hard cushion. Arm and head rests are all adjustable. I initially received a chair with a slightly dinged back; I don't blame quality control for not noticing, it wasn't evident until I tried to attach the headrest and couldn't because part of the back was damaged. Best guess is a previous buyer broke a little piece off and then returned it. Anyway, long story short I contacted the seller and they immediately sent me a replacement back, and all was well.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Weak Caster Base!! Plastic Split for one Wheel! Revised!!', 'author': 'John R. Eppler', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Plastic for wheel mount on the base is insufficient. Fracture makes chairs unsafe!! Not very comfortable!!I was contacted by the supplier to resolve the broken base issue. I bought a metal replacement base before they offered to make things right. After, I received and installed the replacement base, the supplier has offered to reimburse me for the cost of the metal base. They are making good on their offer to make me satisfied with their product. This effort goes a long way to make me happy. Thank you!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great chair needs better Allen wrench & back/front seat distinction!', 'author': 'WaterWoman70', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I‚Äôm an itinerant therapist for a local school district. The ‚Äúteacher chairs‚Äù provided in this district are known to cause pain & agony and do not adjust to the various desk or table heights encountered throughout the district. Consequently I‚Äôm trying to prevent further injury (eg: carpal tunnel corrective surgery of both wrists) in making sure the chair I use offers appropriate support and the ability to adjust to whatever sort of desk or table I use in the paperwork required in my profession. This chair is wonderful, but I wish they‚Äôd provided a better Allen wrench & that the seat of this chair indicated back & front on the underside of the chair! If you seek good support doing your job‚Äôs data entry (aka: paperwork), get this chair!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 3, 2022', 'is_verified': True}]

title: CLATINA Classic Executive Mesh Chair,Big and Tall Office Chair 400lbs,Heavy Duty Ergonomic Mesh Chair with Adjustable Armrests, Ergonomic Chair with Thickened seat Cushion,for Home Office(1 Pack)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great chair!', 'author': 'W Stanley', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great chair. I was going for an automotive theme for my office so I was looking for a chair with good reviews, decent price and had a decent weight limit. This chair checked all the boxes. Great support and feels solid.-Update after 4 months.-Still holding strong. It gets used 8-9 hours per day. I weigh 240ish lbs. All functions still work nothing has broken or torn. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Super nice & comfy!', 'author': 'Debbie Whittington', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We\'ve only had this a few days but so far it\'s awesome. So far it looks like a very good buy!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent quality of the COLAMY Big and Tall Office Chair', 'author': 'Moven', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The COLAMY Big and Tall Office Chair is an excellent choice for a comfortable and sturdy office chair. The oversized design, unique appearance, and body-hugging style of the chair make it perfect for big and tall people like me.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Comprehensive Review Of This Great Chair.', 'author': 'Pfostttt', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I have had this chair for about 8 months now, and it has been one of the best office chairs i‚Äôve had, at least so far. I‚Äôve owned this chair for going on nine months, and so far it has held up in every way, unlike my last chair which started off great, then hit the fan.I‚Äôll be doing pro‚Äôs and cons and explain my overall rating down below, but some details I would like to provide first:I did a lot of research before i purchased this chair. One of my primary complaints about all the office chairs i‚Äôve ever had are:1. The seating isn‚Äôt comfortable for long periods of time.2. The seating isn‚Äôt wide enough for someone like me who is 6‚Äô3 and has a stomach.3. After a while, every time I lean back, they all start tilting to the right, no matter what I do.I don‚Äôt purchase things for myself often, so I wanted to make sure that I was spending my money on something that was quality made, and would last more then a year (unlike my last chair). Plus, as a young homeowner who doesn‚Äôt have a lot of extra cash, $200-300 is a fairly large purchase for me.Let me preface this by saying that I spend a lot of time in my chair. When I purchased this, I worked fully remote full time (40H/Week), and now I am on a hybrid schedule, so I still spend at least (24h/Week) in my chair. My home office is also my music room, man cave and where I go to work on my personal projects, so a lot of time is spent in there.I want to start off with the things I DON‚ÄôT like about this chair first, and then i‚Äôll move into the Pros.THE CONS:1. The Arms don‚Äôt adjust, they are what keeps the backrest and base (of the chair) together. This probably isn‚Äôt a huge issue for most people, but as someone who plays guitar/bass, it would be nice to have the option to lower the arms, so my guitar isn‚Äôt hitting them.2. When it arrived, it had that god awful chemical smell that fake leather gets. The smell went away after about 3 weeks, but it was bad at first.3. It is comfortable, but after about 6 hours, my back will start to ache a bit, this is probably more of a ‚Äúme‚Äù problem than the chair, but figured id mention it.4. The wheels are kinda crap, not a huge deal, but if you have one chair for multiple desk/workstations, I would recommend upgrading the wheels when you purchase it. Again, not a huge deal, but worth mentioning.5. It is a very large chair, it doesn‚Äôt fit under my desk unless I lower it. If you have a small office or your office is in a tight space, this may not work well for you.THE PRO‚ÄôS:1. The seat itself is very comfortable. It feels similar to like sitting on the couch rather than a desk chair, which I love.2. The seat is also wide enough to fit me comfortably, the arms aren‚Äôt rubbing against my sides or anything like that, which again, huge win.3. It is STURDY. This chair is built very well, I feel comfortable leaning all they way back on it, which I can‚Äôt say for most chairs. If you plop into your seat every time, this may not be the case, but if you take care of it, it will last a long time.4. So far, it doesn‚Äôt have that annoying right lean problem that all my other chairs have had, so thats another win in my book.5. The height adjustment is perfect, especially for a tall person. Like I mentioned before, i‚Äôm 6‚Äô3, and this chair at its tallest setting is perfect for me. If I lean back, my feet even come off the ground (slightly). Most chairs I sit in, this is not the case. Other than the arms not being adjustable, the terrible wheels and the awful smell that ultimately went away, this chair does its job and does it well. I hope this review helps you, and if I have any updates in the future, I will post those below with a date on them.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very comfortable and easy to put together', 'author': 'E. Expect good long term performance.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "1.0 out of 5 stars Don't waste your time or money on this chair from this company", 'author': 'Joey Lowe', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'This is my first negative review of any company or purchase through Amazon, and I\'ve been buying stuff through them for years. It took a lot to upset me, and this product and company crossed that line. The chair is advertised as a Big & Tall chair with a 400lb. Capacity. I\'m 6.4", and I weigh 220lbs.The chair came packaged reasonably well, albeit the delivery date was delayed twice. Assembly was straightforward and easy. That\'s about all I can say positively about this chair. The chair is uncomfortable. When you sit in the chair, it feels as if you are about to be slung forward, so you have to use your feet to brace yourself against the floor. This is with the spring tensioner all the way off. Likewise, the seat is not oversized. If anything, it\'s smaller than a normal seat. I know because I measured and compared it to other chairs in my office. The metal base of the chair is also smaller than the seat. Why does this matter? If you lean too much in one direction or the other, like to reach for a desk drawer or mail on your desktop, the chair tips in that direction. When you attempt to lean back in the chair, the tilt stops in a very unusual position that is extremely uncomfortable. I think if I had to sum it up, if you want to get an isometric exercise in, then this chair is the chair to get, because your legs and low back will be aching by the end of an hour if you can last that long.But wait, there\'s more. Remember, I mentioned that assembly was straightforward and easy? I failed to mention the bolts don\'t stay put. The bolts back out and fall to the floor. I sincerely feel like this chair is a gimmick chair that was destined for a comedy show and somehow managed to arrive at my office. Lastly, this isn\'t a product that an unhappy purchaser can click return or refund on. Nope, you have to go to the company\'s customer support website. Regardless of how many times you call their support number, you will get an answering machine. Not voice mail, but an old-fashioned answering machine that sometimes says the machine is full and can\'t accept more messages. The same applies to email. Send them an email or complete their customer service form, and it must just go off into space because you never receive confirmation or do you ever receive a reply. There is no customer service. I did my due diligence and looked this company up online and discovered it is a one-bay warehouse at the back of a dilapidated industrial park with a for sale sign on the door.So do yourself a favor and spend your money elsewhere because I can guarantee you won\'t be happy with your experience with this product. Oh and if you are questioning whether or not I just got a lemon, I\'ll admit, I bought 2 of these chairs and both have the same issues. As for Amazon, I\'ll never buy office furniture through them again.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable, robust design. Meets expectations.', 'author': 'Bram Britcher', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I believe the 400 lb capacity spec. Nylon patch screws to resist loosening. Nice assembly tool and extra HW provided.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars good office chair', 'author': 'Carlton  Whidby', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This chair was purchased to replaced the old one in my husband‚Äôs office which was peeling off. I sat in the chair for hours and no back discomfort at all.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Wow, really for a big and tall person...', 'author': 'RSinAZ', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I really didn\'t need a chair for a big and tall person but I was sick of the gas lift going out. So, I ordered this chair hoping that the higher weight rating (400lbs) would take care of the gas lift problem. I\'m about 5\' 10" and about 245lbs. However, at the lowest setting with my boots on, my feet just touch the floor. And at that, my back isn\'t firmly enough against the chair-back to get the proper back support. I\'ll have to use a lumbar pillow but that\'s not that big of a deal. The seat of the chair is also much wider than a standard office chair but that\'s OK. I think it\'ll just take some getting-used-to. Leaning back is also almost impossible for me because it is very stiff. Again, I believe it\'s because this chair is made for a person much heavier and taller than I am.I\'m not blaming the chair because it\'s obviously built for a big and tall person. In fact, I would recommend this chair if you are bigger and taller than I am. On the plus side, I\'ll never have to worry about the gas lift going bad because the only way I can use this chair is to have it bottomed-out on the lowest possible setting for height. The only other thing: How well will the bonded "leather" hold up? (I hate that the word "leather" is used in descriptions when it is a man-made material). At least, in the description for this chair, they describe it as "faux leather" (kudos for the honesty). In any case, I\'ll update my review when I see it starting to wear through to the inner-liner.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Not a bad chair. title: Big and Tall Office Chair 500lbs-Heavy Duty Ergonomic Computer Chair with Extra Wide Seat, High Back Executive Large Desk Chair with Tilt Rock, Adjustable Lumbar Support-Brown
reviews: [{'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars A Throne Fit for a King: The Colossal Comfort of COLAMY's Big and Tall Office Chair", 'author': 'CyH', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'As someone who\'s 5\'10" and 248lbs, having had three operations on a very sensitive part of my body in the past five months, finding the right chair isn\'t just a matter of comfort‚Äîit\'s a necessity! Enter the COLAMY Big and Tall Office Chair, a game-changer in every sense.First off, the size and build of this chair are a dream come true. The dimensions (33.66"D x 33.46"W x 49"H) offer ample space, and it\'s not just about width; the depth ensures that even a taller individual can sit back comfortably without feeling cramped.The extra-wide seat is a standout feature. It\'s not just wide; it\'s smartly designed. At my height I can comfortably fold my legs on the chair. You can feel the thoughtful engineering that went into creating a seat that supports without confining, ideal for those with a bit more to love!Now, let\'s talk comfort. After my surgeries, I was cautious about any chair, but the thick seat cushioning on this COLAMY chair is like sitting on a cloud. It\'s firm enough to offer support yet soft enough to avoid any of my sensitive pressure points‚Äîa delicate balance achieved perfectly.The high back and adjustable lumbar support are like the cherry on top. The ergonomic design ensures that my back is supported correctly, crucial for long hours at the desk. The tilt rock function adds that extra bit of customizable comfort, allowing me to find the perfect angle for my needs.The chair\'s durability is evident from the moment you sit in it. It\'s built to hold up to 500lbs, and you can feel the sturdiness. There\'s a sense of security in knowing that this chair won\'t buckle under pressure.In conclusion, the COLAMY Big and Tall Office Chair is an absolute winner. It\'s not just a chair; it\'s a fortress of comfort and support. Whether you\'re tall, carrying extra weight, or have medical considerations like me, this chair doesn\'t just meet the needs‚Äîit exceeds them. Highly recommend!P.S. The sleek black design is just the icing on the cake, stylish enough for any office setting! Parts were exact with a spares compartment included, plus the instructions were easy to follow.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great chair', 'author': 'Mary', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I ordered this chair for my big and tall husband. He loves it. It is comfortable to sit in for long periods. He also loves all the adjustability it has. We had a friend put it together and carry it up to his office. Because it is so sturdy, it is very heavy. We could not have done it without help. It‚Äôs easy to do - just very heavy!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Strong and easy to put together', 'author': 'GMA 11', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Chair is comfortable and nice to look at. It did take about one hour to put together but it was easy to understand the directions. My husband loves it', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Colamy Chair is a very good chair', 'author': 'Robert Mercier', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I have a lot to say about this Colamy big and tall chair. It feels very heavy duty, every part feels like a quality piece of furniture. The box showed up and was very large and very heavy. The UPS driver was not looking forward to bringing it to the third floor. When you're sitting in it, it really feels like a couch as far as comfort. It's very spacious and comfortable in every way. The seat is spacious and thick, the inflatable lumbar support is fabulous, and the wide arms are very comfortable. I'm disabled. and feel that not only is this chair great for big and tall. (500# capacity) but also easy to climb in and out of. If you needed a chair that you could climb from a wheelchair into, I feel that you will be happy with the size and sturdiness of this chair. With all the pros of this chair and not finding any cons, why didn't I give this chai 5 stars? I'll answer that for you. This chair is worth 5 stars, the best one I have found in my 62 years. But this one had a cut in the seat and don't see how it got there. The box was in good shape and wasn't cut in any way. Must of happened before it was boxed from manufacturing. There is no way I can get this anywhere even if I could box it back up to send it back, a piece of black duct tape will have to suffice and I hope the cut doesn't expand and get larger. I hope this review was helpful to you. I used a picture from the web so you would know exactly what chair I was talking about because I couldn't take a picture atm. This chair is worth the money and I would defiantly purchase it again and request the tear not to be there LOL.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars wide enough for my giant booty and hips, but chair does not lean backwards easily', 'author': 'Crystal Collins', 'rating': 5, 'content': "i'll be fully honest, i am an extremely large (morbidly obese) person. i was looking for a chair that hopefully wouldn't break on me within the first few months of having it AND fit my budget, and it might possibly be this chair. i just got it though so we will see. i am EXTREMELY large in both the booty and hips area and i was able to sit comfortably in this chair. it is just slightly tight around my big thighs but that's kind of to be expected with just how bottom-heavy i am, i doubt i would be able to actually find a chair wide enough unless it didn't have arm rests, which i wanted arm rests lol. it's very padded on both the seat and the back, which, speaking of the back, it IS indeed VERY stiff and difficult to lean back in. a foot rest will solve this issue, which is really a non-issue because i rarely lean back, but keep that in mind if you are looking for a reclining chair. i'm around 5 foot 8 and this chair is not too short for me. love it so far.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Off gassing is crazy', 'author': 'Vincent', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Not a bad chair, my issues are twofold:1. The assembly instructions were non-existent, meaning either not provided or missing. It wasn\'t so difficult that I couldn\'t figure out how to assemble it without instructions but it was annoying to not have them.Aside from that it is a comfortable chair. I\'ll try to update at the 6 month mark if anything changes.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Buy It!', 'author': 'Brianne S.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This chair is amazing! Super easy to put together and so comfortable. I'm 5'8, 260# and this chair fits like a dream! Very thick cushions. Soft, bit very sturdy. I love this chair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Excellent quality super comfort', 'author': 'John Odenath', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This chair is extremely well made. title: JHK Ergonomic High Back Office Chair with Headrest, Lumbar Support, Movable Armrests, Swivel Mesh Office Chair with 300 lbs Capacity Adjustable Height for Home Office, Executive, Blue (WY-5283-BU)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfy, sturdy, but headrest could use some tweaking.', 'author': 'Steven', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Purchased this chair for 3 big reasons.. 1. Rated for 300lbs, and I am a big guy. 2. Ergonomic & mesh. 3. It was on sale for $65.Received the chair this morning, and got it setup. Putting it together was rather straight-forward, and the corkscrew style allen wrench was a blessing. The chair is comfortable, and a lot more adjustable than I thought. The arms raise up and down, they also swivel, and go back and forth for more forearm/elbow rests. The only major complaint is that the headrest only swivels, it doesn\'t raise. I am 5\'11, and while this chair is comfy, the headrest should either be adjusted to about 2" higher, or should be made adjustable. This would take the chair immediately to a 5 star rating in my book.One other note.. and this is minor, but if you have poor posture while sitting, you may feel like you are going to slide out of the chair. It is definitely meant for your rear to be placed directly against the back of the chair, and not slouching. This is actually a nice hidden benefit, as I work from a desk all day, so it helps keep my posture correct.Edit: Head rest does adjust! I just didn\'t notice it.. changed from 4 stars to 5 stars!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars It is not just a stylist!', 'author': 'Long Nguyen', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Took a chance on this, and it‚Äôs a great chair! I am very happy to find this one! The chair was packed very well and the box arrived in great condition. Also, do not buy the ‚Äúprofessional installation.‚Äù Assembly was straightforward, all parts were included and even the tool was of decent quality. The chair looks great and is comfortable for a person who appreciates mesh chair with mesh sitting area.Sitting in it now, using it as my work from home office chair. Game changer when it comes to helping my back adjust to sitting all day. Has a good array of features, very comfortable, and the price on sale was fantastic. Adjustable height for the seat, armrest, lumbar support, and headrest, plus the tilt back, make this all mesh chair very comfortable for me. It works well for weeks now.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 17, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Long Lasting Office Chair', 'author': 'Andreea', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This chair is a wonderful alternative to the cushions of the past and it outlasts those chairs by years! I would have given it 5 stars but the seat is a little too narrow.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Few months later update', 'author': 'Michelle', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I really like this chair, its by far one of the comfiest chairs I've boughten on amazon and I use it as a desk chair and a gaming chair. I had those usual expensive gaming chairs but they ended up always hurting my tailbone, then I switched to this chair and I've never had those problems again, I don't recline my chair so my posture is always straight and I'm always comfortable. I really like the seat and how much airflow the chair has. Overall I really recommend this chair as its been almost a year and it still feels brand new, also Its so easy to assemble if you read the instructions correctly, it took me less than 2 hours. I recommend getting this chair if you're looking for something comfy :) .", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Chair-building for dummies', 'author': 'jan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great product for a reasonable price. I was very proud of myself for being able to assemble this with no help from anyone! There were a couple of points at which I wondered which way a part fit, but it was pretty well labeled, and very well thought out in terms of directions, packaging of bolts, and I am quite pleased with the result!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Easily broken plastic frame with modestly comfortable mesh', 'author': 'Just a guy', 'rating': 1, 'content': "The chair *was* comfortable overall. The mesh seating and backing allow airflow to keep you cool as well. The adjustable armrests aren't quite what is advertised and do not turn along an axis that, for some reason, they advertise in the pictures. Still, realistically that ill-conceived illustrated position does not affect the overall quality much, and it is nice to have the option of adjusting their positioning.The plastic is inferior quality and not durable in the slightest. For instance, I am 6'6 and weigh 210 pounds (which is well below the recommended weight limit of the chair) and have only had this chair for about 2-3 weeks. During that time, the upper backing of the chair snapped in half completely, as shown in the attached picture. I would have to assume either faulty product design or manufacturing error.The ergonomic design is... probably fine? I found myself constantly leaning forward in the chair before it broke in half, so it was hard to tell; the natural angle of the chair does not lend itself to be very easy to judge its ergonomic features at a computer.Unless getting a sharp piece of plastic jammed into your back is your thing, I recommend avoiding this chair. It is not very comfortable to sit in broken, after all. Of note, I attempted to contact the seller and inform them of the product deficiency, however, there is no such option of communicating problems with the product to the seller, hence I left this review.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 14, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Arm rest are too short', 'author': 'Tiffany Gilsbach', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'The chair looks great, and was easy to assemble. Honestly, the instructions and the materials to assemble were organized better than any other product I\'ve ever ordered.I have 2 issues.1. The arm rest do not raise high enough to support my arms. The arms are at least 2-3" below the reach of my elbow. I am 5\'9, and my neck and shoulders are burning from the lack of arm support. I am outside the timeframe to be able to return the chair, so now I need find arm risers to help make this chair work.2. The dial under the chair that manages the tension of the chair recline doesn\'t work. It didn\'t matter how much I turned it, in either direction, the tension in the recline was the same looseness. I simply just locked the back into one place, but I would like to be able to unlock it and have the tension be high so I can recline without feeling like I am going to fly out of the back of the chair.This chair is great for shorter people, or people with shorter torsos.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Super supportive', 'author': 'K Dinan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This chair is just what we were looking for. My son spends a lot of time at his desk and wanted a supportive chair. This one absolutely delivers in that regard. It rolls easily and has many ways to adjust to get the exact support you are needing. It was a bit time consuming to assemble but we got it done with little issue.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars A fair review', 'author': 'Tom Darippa', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This chair lasted almost a year of everyday heavy use. Now it won't lock upright, the back stays in locked position and I have to yank it back into place, it makes a very loud click noise. This would indicate the internal lock mechanism is possibly broken. This chair was the most comfortable chair I have ever owned however, for the price it's been nice!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good chair for tailbone issues', 'author': 'Teresa', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This is a very comfortable chair. I was afraid the mesh bottom would be too firm but it is not. It does not make you sweat as it does allow air to flow through. I enjoy the reclining feature. I do wish the lumbar support was adjustable. I couldn't tell by the photos whether it was or not and some of the reviews said it was so I took a chance. It is not adjustable. The entire seat back reclines but the lumbar support itself does not adjust for depth. I wish it did because it does not come forward quite enough to fully support my lumbar but it may be fine for everybody else. I have a fairly pronounced arch in my back and have had lower back surgery so I need more support than most people might. I also have a very long tailbone that has been been giving me a lot of problems when I sit for the last few years. This chair angles down in the back and if I scoot back as far as possible, I am able to sit without having my tailbone touch the chair with a lot of pressure which has been a big relief and one of the goals I was hoping to accomplish. I did assemble it per the instructions but after sitting in it I decided to turn the armrests backwards as they were too far forward for me when installed as instructed. Putting them on backwards solved that problem and now they are perfect. The wheels also roll smoothly. I would have given five stars if the lumbar support was adjustable. Today is the first day I have used it and am very happy as I am much more comfortable than I was in my old chair.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 9, 2022', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Big and Tall Office Chair 500lbs, Ergonomic Computer Desk Chair for Heavy People with 4D Adjustable Armrest and Lumbar Support, Heavy Duty Metal Base Mesh Chair with Wide Seat for Home Office
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The best office chair I have ever purchased!', 'author': 'Tamara Salyers', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this chair because the first office chair after the first office chair, I bought a few weeks ago off of Amazon just didn‚Äôt work for me. Do not buy.', 'author': 'Shoop-T', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'I just had to write in. The chair was easy to assemble and seems to be sturdy, but man, the back rest is terribly designed. The massager juts out in the lower back area and so it‚Äôs like you are reclining onto two hard plastic pieces. They also said I can remove the massager with a screwdriver, which frankly seems like BS ‚Äî the massager is built into the one-piece back, right behind the mesh covering ‚Äî I would need a 1 inch screwdriver to even reach those screws. They sent me a return label, but it would be such a hassle to disassemble, box up and get to UPS, that I decided to hang onto it and maybe use a screwdriver through the mesh (ripping small holes) to remove the massager.My back hurts, my legs go numb when sitting in the chair. It‚Äôs terrible.I would hands down recommend you buy another chair ‚Äî or at least one without this awful massager option.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 6, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfort', 'author': 'Taken2', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this for my grandson who is homeschooling. I would buy this again.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars VERY COMFORTABLE', 'author': 'woman of Yah', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'For my overall review, I gave it a 4 star because the chair did not come with instructions on how to assemble it.
